review: I have been a Calm subscriber for perhaps a year and a half now. I love using the sleep stories, especially to help me back to sleep after a middle of the night waking. I have two main sources of frustration & it all relates to the kids‚Äô stories. It seems like 75% of what is being released at this point is geared toward kids. I can see how it would be a great resource for parents, but for those users that don‚Äôt use sleep stories for their children it‚Äôs a lot of useless content. I also find it annoying that there is no apparent way to filter out kids stories, whether browsing thought the ‚Äúall sleep stories‚Äù page or in the recommended stories areas. I also occasionally find it difficult to differentiate which stories are geared towards kids unless I listen to part of the story. I love using calm, but it‚Äôs getting more difficult to justify the continued expense when it‚Äôs no longer catering to my demographic. Perhaps a separate calm kids app would be helpful.
title: Love it, but‚Ä¶

review: I have the paid version, and particularly like the sleep stories. They work so well, I usually fall asleep before the story ends. Problem is, I might wake up again a few hours later and want to pick up the story where I left off. But instead, I see the ‚ÄúStill Awake?‚Äù pop-up window suggesting other stories I might try, or maybe a meditation, and a pop-up asking if I‚Äôd like to rate that session, keep track of streaks and stats, etc. No, I‚Äôd really just like to find the sleep story I was listening to, but it has vanished from my screen. Now I‚Äôve got to sit up in bed, grab my reading glasses, X out of the intrusive pop-ups, and scroll through to re-find the sleep story that was snatched away from me....leaving me not at all calm, but instead, annoyed and anxious, and now unable to fall back to sleep. Can you please provide a way to turn off these very unhelpful ‚Äúhelpful suggestions‚Äù and gamification features? For me, they are defeating the entire purpose of this app, to CALMLY fall asleep.
title: Fewer Intrusive Pop-Ups, Please

review:
My name is dalyshia green and this is my rate and let me start off my the first step of loginng in I had a hard time loging I‚Äôm cuz I did not sleep at that time when I woke up
On a Saturday night at 3am I could not sleep so I got on my iPhone and was playing a game and I saw this add and the rateings and I SAD ü§© this app really works so I downloaded  it  and I tryed to log in but it did not work so I used my zoom and it worked so I can do things and now imma talk about is great for people who can‚Äôt sleep witch is page and me talking 2 so this is a great app for people who can‚Äôt sleep first off the muisc that when you first log in I feel asleep and I woke up the next morning and ITS GREAT!!üòáüòá and I showed it to my family members that can‚Äôt sleep and it worked they said  and this is the ending of my rate ps Dalyshia green made on June 3th hope y‚Äôall have an great sleep and day üëã
title: Great and great for people who can‚Äôt sleep but hard to log in

review: This is the best meditation app I‚Äôve tried. I use it 1‚Äì2 times a day. Great mix of content and teachers for different moods, goals, and time commitments. While the sleep meditations work for me, I find the sleep stories with celebrity narration too distracting and gimmicky to fall asleep to, but I know others users for whom this is their favorite feature. Calm offers a series of sequential programs for mindfulness skill-building: ‚Äú7 Days of ______,‚Äù where the next day‚Äôs content unlocks with the completion of the previous day‚Äôs. As a paying user, I wish there were a way to override this. I once exited a minute early, when the wrap-up was nearly over, because I had to leave, and the app made me redo that day to access the next meditation. Similarly, I just updated versions and lost three days‚Äô progress in a program. I think the only way to catch up is to let them play out with the volume off, which is a waste of time and energy.
title: Helps with sleep & stress [attn devs]

review: I‚Äôve heard about Calm for a while now & remember seeing commercials but never thought to give it a try until recently and all I can say is WOW! Wish I got this months ago! With the virus lockdown I‚Äôve recently started to experience anxiety and panic attacks that I haven‚Äôt had since college (15 yrs ago). I tried my usual solo breathing & meditation techniques but they‚Äôre just not As effective as it used to be. I then started looking for meditation apps and thought I‚Äôd give this a try. SO glad I did! They have several categories from anxiety & stress relief to sleep aid sessions. All so very soothing, relaxing and 100% effective-I‚Äôm hooked! Also, I used to listen to gentle water or instrumental sounds to help me fall asleep but this app works so much better & faster. Definitely worth every penny and an absolute must to help with your mental health during this stressful & depressing pandemic. I am so grateful for Calm! :)
title: A game changer! So grateful for this App!!

review: I‚Äôm rarely the type to review an app and I‚Äôm even less likely to purchase the full version of an app ‚Äî in the case of this app, I‚Äôve done both which should really be a testament to how much I truly appreciate this app and all its features. After long bout with insomnia and unable to ‚Äúshut down‚Äù my brain at night I downloaded this app and used the free features for a couple of weeks. The sleep stories lulled me to sleep and I was able to meditate after some intense anxiety. I finally purchased the full version and am so glad I did. No matter my mood or my goal (sleep, focus, or lessen anxiety) it has something for me and there‚Äôs so much content I never feel like it‚Äôs not worth it. I love the voice overs and guided meditations don‚Äôt feel forced. I‚Äôm brand new to this and I can see myself feeling better the more I use it. I look forward to it every night. A huge thanks to the makers of this app.
title: One of the best

review: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off for a few days now, but each time I use it, I‚Äôve always had a positive experience with it. I‚Äôve only utilized the features that weren‚Äôt locked behind a paywall, but so far, I will say that this experience has been beneficial to ease my mind of stress and anxiety. It‚Äôs often stated that meditation helps reduce anxiety, and I can definitely agree with that statement. When you have racing thoughts and/or negative thoughts in general, a moment to relax, slow things down, and focus on yourself may be just what you need. One thing that I want to mention, but couldn‚Äôt fit it anywhere else, is that when I opened the app, there was calming music in the background that would fade when you closed out of it. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll pay for a subscription, but what I‚Äôve experienced so far is worth it for relaxation and decompressing after a long day.
title: Good, even without a subscription!

review: I‚Äôve been a subscriber for over a year and have used the app almost daily during most of that time concurrent with my own journaling practice in Day One. I always loved opening the app and seeing the reminder to take a deep breath, and then feeling like I was somewhere else, somewhere calm. It made it easier to focus and meditate. But now all of that is gone, the ‚Äúplace‚Äù I went is gone, and the app is just another cluttered, stressful place of mental noise. Calm has added fragmented journaling options, which I guess is nice for any who wish them, but I will not trust my thoughts to their app, because that is essentially what it would be. Unlike Day One, they have no export feature or backups, and these recent events have not exactly made me trust them. A lot of materials are gone as well, though I can‚Äôt be sure of what all of it was. My arthritic thumbs don‚Äôt appreciate the new side-swiping menus for the sleep stories either. I wish I had not updated the app. I don‚Äôt know if I will keep my subscription; most of what is left is Tamara, Tamara, and Tamara.
title: Hate new layout & Tamara‚Äôs Voice

review: I can‚Äôt say enough about how healing this app is. I began practicing meditation with it following a concussion, and it did help. Then after, I kept with the practice prior to sleep, as I often stayed awake with racing thoughts. The Sleep Stories and meditations offered knocked me out every time. Still later, I really began practicing meditation during the day with the Daily Calms and other sessions. These have probably been the most valuable to my daily life. Much of the exhaustion I was experiencing that I thought was due to lack of sleep I believe now was due more to stress. Repeated practice of mindfulness has increased my calm, my awareness, my clarity, and my happiness. The guided lessons are akin to cognitive behavioral therapy, very poignant and always kind. There is no wrong way to practice this. There is no failing. There is no order that must be followed or schedule adhered to. There is only the benefit of the more you use it, the better you feel.
title: Invaluable

review: I struggled with horrible PTSD symptoms for years now. It was difficult to apply mindfulness to my everyday routine until I found this app. It has greatly reduced my physical and mental symptoms by allowing me to become aware, ride the waves and let go of emotion. I‚Äôm not going to say it‚Äôs a cure because there is no such thing. I view it as a tool to maintain your mental fitness like a treadmill and exercise helps maintain your physical fitness. Gradually over time your mind becomes stronger and more capable but mindfulness like physical exercise should become part of your routine so you can keep optimum mental fitness. Also, I was on medication and no longer require it yet it doesn‚Äôt mean anyone should stop taking their medication. I suggest to start doing mindfulness and as you progress there may be a reduction to your prescription and eventually you may be able to come off of them. Hope this is helpful! God bless!
title: This is worth it!

review:
First a confession - I have no use for meditation. 
But it only took 10‚Äô of exploring this app and I LOVE it!   I found the sleep stories and the soundscapes. Oh wow!!!!! So relaxing - totally unwound my day in about 5‚Äô. 
    There are so many different approaches to calm in this app with music and learnings and stories and soundscapes and motivational talks and‚Ä¶.something for everyone! 
   I do have a developer request: would you consider adding a schedule into the music/soundscapes?  I‚Äôd love to set the timer to turn it off in an hour and then have it automatically come back on between 2 and 4 am for example. Until then, I‚Äôll just keep the app hit the timer again when I wake up too many hours before the alarm. 
   Thanks for a creative and varied approach to Calm ‚Äî all in one great app to fit the mood of the moment ‚Äî sweet sighs & deep breaths üíïüòäüíï
title: Immediately fell in love with this app!!

review: Love this app so much. It is so great that they have a meditation for such specific topics like emotions, stress, anxiety, etc. I‚Äôve also learned some good wisdom through the content for specific situations like grief etc. that got me unstuck a few times. Reached a point once using this app where I felt complete peace for a few days, which is unheard of from me, who has a lot of inner noise. Just one small critique though, the new Main Menu‚Äôs UX is quite anxiety inducing, it‚Äôs too much info at once. I find the layout a little ironic since one of the use cases are to get a quick meditation for anxiety. You get greeted with so much info on the first page alone, that I stopped using the main menu and just search or stumble around. The previous layout was so much clearer and better organized. I get that there is more content, but maybe there is a cleaner and more intuitive way. Please consider.
title: Great content (home page overwhelming)

review: Thanks for this fantastic app. I got this to aid in sleep while on international travel. That was ok but then I browsed the rest of the app and got interested in the meditation. Health providers have encouraged me for years to do this but I always assumed my mind was not disciplined enough for the practice. Enter Jeff Warren‚Äôs 30 Day course. I was hooked from my first ‚Äúsit‚Äù. Bringing your mind back to your focus without judgment and with compassion towards yourself is such a simple but powerful concept. I completed that course and have done others on managing pain and self esteem, as well as daily guides. I have even just used the timed meditation feature and ventured out on my own. I am a metrics kind of gal and I can report a data backed improvement in my resting heart rate. I wear a ring tracker and my sleep and RHR scores are improved.  Sorry to run on and on....this is a fantastic app for me and I hope you try it. Anyone can meditate.
title: Just what I needed

review: i love this app so much. i was not someone who meditated or anything at all, i took a stress management class in college and we learned how to meditate. after that class, i felt i was having a hard time without any guided meditations, as i have ADD, and GAD, and have a hard time keeping my thoughts straight. i found this app, used the free version for a bit, and loved it so much that i decided to try the full version. i am currently on year two of using this app and i could not be more thankful for it. i have learned so much about myself. the ONLY thing i was thinking about today, was how cool, and probably impossible, it would be to be able to get it as an app on my Roku TV, and listen to my sleep stories and meditate through there. i‚Äôm sure apple TV has it, and i love listening to david attenborough on Our Planet, but it‚Äôd be awesome to be able to listen to the meditations on a TV!
title: has helped me in all aspects of life

review: Mind you, you can‚Äôt unlock all the features right away, or unless you pay or happen to have a ton of time on your hands, but this app was my favorite download of the year. You can meditate, listen to calming sessions, or music, and even choose your own scenes/background, which not only have accompanied sound, but also videos of corresponding scenes of nature and whatnot. My favorites are Pouring Rain, Tropical Beach, Passing Clouds, Coastline at Sunset, Foggy Steam, Thunderstorm, Evening Crickets, and Summer Meadow. They even have ones like; Fireplace, Zen Ocean, Falling Raindrops, Rhythmic Waves, Woodland Lake, Plains of Wheat, Mystic Fountain and Mountain Lake. I know there‚Äôs more but I suggest checking out this seriously cool App! Along with the Sleep Stories, relaxing music, focus training, and meditation for beginners, stress, relationships, sleep, emotions, and so on...this App is what you need at the end of any type of day, what we all need is a little Calm!
title: What a great and useful App!

review: I have always had trouble with anxiety and sometimes that affects my sleep. I normally listen to nature podcasts, or music before I go to bed. Calm is all of that and more, not to mention MUCH better quality. There is a good selection of white noise, nature sounds, music, piano, guitar, and songs, that are all great for falling asleep, or just for calming down. You can even have them play for as long as you want. There are meditations and breathing exercises that are worth listening to. There are also sleep stories that are good for kids that struggle falling asleep. This app is for all kinds of people, I think anyone would be able to find something on this app that helps them in one way or another. They even have sounds for babies and pets! It is so, so, easy to navigate and it has truly helped me have a peaceful nights sleep.
title: Good app, I highly suggest!

review:
I love the scenery the ambience and the feel of the audio selections, especially through a speaker; because my phone speaker quality is a little lacking. The music is perfect to fall asleep to as well. I was meditating today using my favorite option, the timed meditation and afterwards had accidentally set a second as well, when it went off again I had an idea! What if you added a feature which allowed a loop? So that you could have an additional warning bell for those who meditate for hours at a time. I would personally really appreciate this option because I sometimes need an external reminder to come back to my body, 
(But it would be sad if this comes out as a feature only for Premium users because your monthly price is a little steep for me and I would really only use this feature)
title: Great App, Suggestions?

review: I got this last Christmas Eve. Used it for a while... I decided to try it again before canceling my subscription. Reminded me how great the daily calm is. I love Tamara‚Äôs voice and it‚Äôs a wonderful way to start your day. And then I discovered the Master classes. Don‚Äôt know if I overlooked these when I first got the app or if it‚Äôs been added. Listened to Elizabeth Gilbert‚Äôs and was blown away. Just fantastic. Honestly either one of these is worth the price of admission. And to have both?! Plus other features I haven‚Äôt explored yet. Honestly I‚Äôm glad there is a subscription fee because it made me revisit this amazing tool. I am using it every day again and it really is making a positive impact on my mood and overall feeling of happiness. Worth every penny. If you are ready to be good to yourself give it a try. Thanks so much to everyone who created this app and is participating. You have my sincere gratitude and love
title: Fantastic app!!!

review: I love the idea of the app but I can‚Äôt afford it. I have trouble falling asleep when my boyfriend is out of town so I was looking into the app and the sleep stories and calming noises sounded awesome but I personally can‚Äôt afford a yearly subscription for unlimited access. If there were even 5-10 options for every single thing, the app would probably have more downloads. Or, a monthly $2-$5 subscription rather than it‚Äôs all coming out at once. It would save $10 a year minimum. And up to almost $50 a year. The app might even make more money and be able to reach poor teens who can‚Äôt afford stuff like myself. I have one subscription (that isn‚Äôt a bill). I can afford 2 $75+ subscriptions a year. I just wish is was more available to a majority of teens and young people or even busy parents who can‚Äôt afford stuff for themselves. A cheaper option might be great. Or do a 30second add before each story to make money and the upgrade includes no ads. Just some ideas from a poor teen that can barely pay bills and eat spaghettios twice a week...
title: More free options

review: As we all know, stress is a major contributing factor to many health related ailments. I love this app because it provides me with invaluable tools for managing and lowering my stress levels.  The Breathing exercises contained within were game changers for me.  Of course I‚Äôve known about breathing exercises before, but this was different.  Immediately while doing my first breathing exercise, my sustained breaths felt like I was chanting a mantra as they drew in and out of my body slowly; steadily; rhythmically.  Set to a chorus of Himalayan sounding bowls, one can still hear the gentle yet haunting tune long after the session is over. In fact, I can, in a moment of solitude, draw upon the soundtrack within my mind and have a breathing session anytime and anywhere I desire.  All thanks to Calm.  If you don‚Äôt already have the app, get it!  Your mind, body and soul will thank you for it.
title: Life Saver 4 Sure!!

review:
I formerly rated this app as a 5, and the app itself is great. I have been a subscriber for YEARS and up until now I‚Äôve been ok with the price increases because I use this app more than any other, HOWEVER now that they‚Äôve taken away family share, I will reconsider. I am not CALM about being charged more for less. Apparently leadership at Calm has lost sight of their original core values and succumbed to the ilk of Silicon Valley greed.  I will begin my review of other options and likely not renew. 

Sadly, here was my last review‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been a Calm customer for several years and I love it! My Calm app is with me throughout the day. I start my day with the Daily Meditation (and days that I don‚Äôt, I find I‚Äôm not as positive and prepared to face challenges), I listen to the music options while I work, and often end my day with a Sleep Story. As an entrepreneur, working to get a start up business off the ground, its important for me to find ways to keep myself grounded, and some days, my Calm app is the only thing helping me do that.
title: Changing my review‚Ä¶

review:
‚Ä¢allow a que: when i fall asleep, it‚Äôd be nice to align a que to automatically go from a sleep meditation practice, to a sleep story, to music without having to exit my trance to open my phone and do it myself.
‚Ä¢add things to listen to during workouts: it would be awesome to have a breathing regimen to listen to with some upbeat simple background music. i would love to hear this calming voice guide me through breathing while i‚Äôm working out- maybe allow it to play over music we have playing in other apps if possible. simple upbeat ‚Äúelevator‚Äù music would even be great.

otherwise- this app grounds me, centers me, and makes me calm. i can actually appreciate the meditation programs, and don‚Äôt find them to be corny or tenuous. 100% worth the money for full access for a YEAR!! i love it, thank you creators for helping with my negative mindset. and i LOVE the voice, i hope you never change her!
title: ‚ô° SUGGESTIONS ‚ô°

review:
I bought this because I‚Äôm terrible at meditation and mindfulness.  I needed something to keep me focused on my meditation.  

Initially, I struggled a bit with the voice of the person guiding the session, but once I got used to hearing her, it was much easier.  Other people and other stories and classes sounded different. 

I use the daily calm almost every day. the lessons in the meditation so often are reinforcing what I‚Äôm learning and hearing in another part of my life.  Very useful quotes at the end to remind me what the lesson was about.  Often I will screenshot the quote and picture and share it with friends.  

I love the variety of sounds I can select and how there is a visual with each.  

I recently listened to the Breaking Bad Habits addiction class and really felt as though I was at a seminar for psychologists and neuroscientists.  It was amazing what I learned.  I have a daughter who is a neuroscience and psych major in college. I had to share it with her.  

I‚Äôve also been stepping through the various meditations on self care, relationships, etc and those also have been enormously helpful.  

Sometimes my daughter can‚Äôt sleep so she listens to the stories on there.  I love that there are classics mixed in with new ones I had never heard of. 

Best $60 bucks I‚Äôve ever spent on an app like this.  Thank you, Calm.
title: Way more helpful than expected - especially Masterclass

review:
I do love my Calm.  I don‚Äôt go to sleep without it.  I also use it when I take a nap.
But I would like to suggest when new ones are done that you leave out the word ‚Äúbed‚Äù.  There are many of us that sleep in a chair/recliner.  I haven‚Äôt slept in a bed in over 10 years and can‚Äôt because of arthritis in my spine.  I‚Äôve mentioned this to people and found so many people can‚Äôt sleep in bed for various reasons.  Many of your stories don‚Äôt use the word bed but still say things like snuggle under the covers and that works.
I don‚Äôt mean to be negative because I love your stories and I have my favorites and my favorite people to read them.  They are a blessing for those who have trouble sleeping like me.  Any time I wake in the night I put one on to help me back to sleep and it works.  It‚Äôs truly wonderful except for the word bed.
Thank you so much.
title: Suggestions

review: ‚ÄúA resource to help people‚Äù that‚Äôs what I thought CALM was. And so, reluctant to seek emotional help because it‚Äôs such a personal issue, I turned to this app. And because I don‚Äôt have the means to purchase the app I have no access to their help. There is such a refreshing trend of prioritizing mental health in this age. But that‚Äôs half of the battle to actually helping people. I‚Äôm sure this app has good intentions but there will be no change in the epidemic of mental health issues so long as help is unattainable for ALL people who need it, not just those that can pay. If I had the means, I‚Äôd pay for a therapist. But those who lack the means to meet with someone are also left behind in such an accessible app that has such capability to make a difference. So my review: I feel very hungry for the help that this app offers and I feel truly left behind. I am sorry for the many others who I‚Äôm sure have come here searching for help, as I did, only to find help (once more) unattainable. Do we care about actually helping people? Or do we care only about hooking people?
title: Are we helping people or hooking people?

review: This app has changed my life. Her voice is so incredibly soothing and beautiful, there‚Äôs different time settings 2 mins 5 mins 10 minutes. My life is so insanely stressful and hectic the only thing keeping me sane are her breathing techniques. What I also love is she doesn‚Äôt talk about wacko weird topics, she gives beautiful life messages that you can carry with you through he day. I clicked the increase focus and it REALLY helped me stop the distractions that we‚Äôre wasting my time. I‚Äôve had the app since Feb 9, today is March 3 and I have done over 4 hours of total meditation.  I want to keep this app forever and worth every single penny I recommend this for EVERYONE to improve the quality of their life and to be able to decrease some of their stress. My body is at ease every time I finish a session whether it be 2 Mins or 20 mins
title: I NEVER WRITE REVIEWS BUT made sure to come and write a review on this one

review:
I purchased the premium app a few months ago and was able to use it a few times. The wi-fi at my house is satellite, so sometimes stories will not load or the app freezes. I had to get a new phone recently due to my old one getting hot, the screen dying, and eventually die altogether.

So, with my NEW phone, I download the app and within 2 minutes of it loading and scrolling through stories my phone feels super hot to touch. I paid for the year, so wanted to be able to use the app. Though, I don‚Äôt relish the idea of ruining  my phone in the process. I never noticed previously when my case was on the phone, but it hurt my hand how hot it became. So, can only imagine after running sounds or a story for a while what could happen over time. 

I love your UI, the content is great, the heavy load and CPU performance could certainly use work. I‚Äôd be equally happy with less fancy animations and graphics if it meant it was faster and didn‚Äôt run the risk of destroying my processor.
title: Data and Graphics Heavy

review:
I love this app so much, and cannot begin to tell you how much it has helped me. An addition that I would love to see is the ability to go back to a daily calm that one has missed. I tend to meditate at night before bed, but if that doesn't happen before midnight, or I miss my 24hr window, I lose that Daily Calm. Then I feel terrible that I've missed it for that day. For example, yesterday's was about Practice... I'm a classical musician, and practice is a necessary evil, however I didn't get to meditate until it was too late, and it was no longer accessible. 

Also, why not make the daily calm a part of a larger accessible archive for subscribers, so that one may focus on a particular issue that needs work or focus, vs just a small selection of a few daily calms. For the steep cost of the subscription, that would really make me very very happy. Thank you for considering my ideas.
title: Love it

review:
Never before believed in meditation.  Downloaded Calm because I just wanted the nature sounds but ended up trying the 7 day free course.  Amazing.  Purchased a subscription right away.

I can‚Äôt believe that I need this app.  Expensive for my budget but it‚Äôs helped me so much on problems I never knew I had.  I‚Äôm a digitally addicted recent father and it helped me through the previously mind-numbing chore of taking care of a 1yo.  I was doing a good job but that didn‚Äôt mean I wasn‚Äôt screaming inside my head from boredom.  It helped me be present rather than distracted because apparently I‚Äôm distracted by everything.  Did not know this.  Helped me not get upset over stupid things at work.  Lessons my anxiety a little bit.  

Feature request, auto shut off.  I‚Äôve fallen asleep sometimes if at night and my phone died because app still running and my phone is my alarm.
title: Can‚Äôt Believe It‚Äôs Worth It

review:
I debated getting the subscription, but I am glad I did.  As a retiree, there is little that I am anxious about, but I am having trouble losing weight. I had hoped there would be more in this app to help me with that. There are 5 minute movement sessions that get me active in the morning, but I wish there were more to address the psychological aspects via meditation.

That said, I am finding more and more to appreciate in this app. I have an active brain that won‚Äôt often settle down when it should. The sleep stories are excellent for bedtime, with gentle voices, well-chosen words, and a length that are perfect to lull one into dreamland.

I believe this is an excellent app for emotional recovery from this pandemic and world events. So many people seem to have had problems adjusting to the isolation and sudden life-style changes. The frustration and anger might be eased with daily meditations as included here.
title: One thing (and star) lacking

review:
Several years ago a therapist recommended Calm to me, as a person living with anxiety and mood disorders. I was skeptical but it changed my life, and helped me through a period of intense trauma.

However, the app has gotten bloated with content and absolutely unusable. It would be so simple to let users re-order meditations so their favorites are shown first, or select what is shown on the home screen and bottom buttons (for example, I never use music, but I loved the breathe bubble, which I have no choice but to keep hidden in the settings menu).

Without the option for customization, the app is counterproductive. I chose Calm over competitiors because of its soothing simplicity. Now it feels like I‚Äôm being controlled, and being sold someone else‚Äôs idea of ‚Äúmindfulness.‚Äù If your goal is to make mental health the new physical health or whatever your slogan is, try to remember the most important principle of mental health professionals everywhere: I, not you, am the expert on me. Your job is to work with me, not tell me what you think I need.
title: Bloated, not the Calm I loved years ago

review: This app is amazing and helps me fall asleep very quickly, the voices are amazing and so is the scenery, pictures and music this app gives. I use the sleep story a lot at night and I really think you guys should unlock premium stories for a couple days because I am so use to hearing ‚ÄúThe Waterfall,‚Äù ‚ÄúBlue and Gold,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Secret Lagoon.‚Äù I am 100% not saying they are bad stories because they are amazing. I just wish I could choose from different stories every once in a while instead of hearing the same stories over and over again each night. I also wanted to speak about the pricing, it is a little too over priced, mind you, I‚Äôm only 15 and there would be no way I could ever pay that price without a card of some sort. I overall love the app, from the start the story to finish, this is absolutely one of the best sleep story and meditation app I have ever downloaded. 4 Stars since the pricing and locked stories.
title: Great but one minor change...

review: I absolutely love this app. I have OCD and constantly struggle with anxiety. I‚Äôve learned to deal with it better during the day, but at night, since I‚Äôm laying still, I have time to stop and think. Which turns into worrying and panic attacks. I usually take sleeping medicine for it, but then I started using the bedtime story part of the app, and it helped me to relax and fall asleep without having to take medication. Only thing is the pricing. I‚Äôm a college student and a part time nanny, and the pricing to unlock the full app is insane. I would love to continue to use the app since it‚Äôs helped me so much, but I only have to option of 3 stories to listen to, and it‚Äôs starting to drive me crazy I‚Äôve heard them so much. Even though I love this app, I‚Äôm not using it anymore, and will probably delete it. If they could lower their prices to where more people have the option to use the full app, I think it could really flourish.
title: Great app, but pricing is too much.

review: App Review (Calm App)- Braxton A. So, for the past week I have been using the clam app to reduce my anxiety. I liked the fact every time I went into the app that they asked how I was doing. Within this app they have many mediation options to calm anxiety. The first day there is a 3-minute mediation, the second day it is 5 minutes, the third day it is 10 minutes, and the time increases by 5 every day until on the seventh day the time is 30 minutes. This app is a good app to treat generalized anxiety disorder. Generalized anxiety disorder is an excessive form of anxiety and can be followed by uncountable physical symptoms like muscle tension, restlessness being easily fatigued, difficulty concentrating, etc. This app is a great way to reduce anxiety because the mediation that occurs throughout the seven days helped me feel more relaxed and I did not have as much tension as I normally do.
title: App Review Braxton.A

review:
In 2017 I started feeling guided to meditate for the first time. I sat down on the floor & started a 20 minute session. Let‚Äôs just say I didn‚Äôt even make it to 4 minutes. It felt like forever. I felt lost when it came to meditation. But eventually I came across the Calm app. 

I did the free meditations & loved them. But I also wanted to do just my own meditations. Just focusing on my breathing. So I started with one minute, then the next day two minutes, then the next three, then four, then five. & kept building up each day until I got to fifteen minutes & that‚Äôs how long I meditate now. 

The Calm app‚Äôs timer is so soothing. It‚Äôs not loud. It doesn‚Äôt make me jump when I hear it (I have anxiety). It‚Äôs perfect. 

In February of 2019 I decided that I was going to do a 30 day meditation challenge (15 mins per day). & being able to see my ‚Äústreak‚Äù encouraged me so much. I did it! Which was so huge for me. 

But now I‚Äôm here in August & I‚Äôm currently on a 30 challenge but I want to go further. I want to go all the way until Jan. 1st, 2020 & then start building up to 30 minutes a day. 

I do not use be Calm subscriptions as I just do not have the money for it right now. But the free things that Calm offers? Incredible. 

Thank you, Calm, for your app! Also thank you for responding when I tag you in my insta stories! 

5 stars. Amazing. Thank you!
title: Amazing.

review: Migraine, fibromyalgia, genetic anxiety...all contributors to my struggles with falling asleep. I don‚Äôt remember the first place I saw Calm advertised but it popped into my head about three weeks ago and has already done wonders. Right now I‚Äôm mainly using the Music category and selecting either Sleep which are very gentle music compositions or Soundscapes which are different sounds from nature. There is so much to choose from depending on your needs.....sleep, energy, meditation, putting a child to sleep, yoga background sounds.....I‚Äôve only scratched the surface. What I have used has helped me focus on the sound instead of my pain or what I‚Äôm concerned about. I set it for 30 minutes and I fall to sleep before it‚Äôs over. Before this I was lying awake for 2-3 hours and sometimes more.....like all night long. I highly recommend this app to anyone who wants a little more peace in their life.
title: Many insomnia triggers!

review:
As someone that suffers from depression and anxiety, this app has worked wonders for me. I‚Äôd never given serious consideration to meditation, I always had it on my to do list, occasionally trying on my own for a few minutes.

This app changed all that. After the first 12 minute meditation/lesson in anxiety at the end of a hectic and stressful day, the negative feelings melted right away. It also has soothing music for sleeping for when I‚Äôm suffering from insomnia, or even bedtime stories. Which makes me feel 6 years old saying, but feeling 6 for a little before bed is surprisingly awesome!

It is pricey for an app subscription at $60 a year... but in my humble opinion, it‚Äôs well worth it if you suffer from anxiety like myself. That‚Äôs only $5 a month for some piece of mind. Have one less beer a month or save some other way, because this will be some of the best $60 you ever spent.
title: Well worth it

review:
Still love the app but wish they would add more sleep stories. Not meditations, not sleep music, but sleep stories. That is what helps me the most. I've emailed them twice to request more stories. The response has been that stories are added every week. But this is not true. It rotates between additions of sleep music, meditations and stories. So in truth, about one to two a month are added. 
If you have as big a problem as I do sleeping then the repitition of the same stories over and over becomes less effective. 
I've looked everywhere else for more stories but Calm is still the best for stories. I just wish they focused as much on the stories as they do on meditation. 

I have serious trouble sleeping, and the Calm sleep stories are a big help for me. I can listen to them and focus on the reader and my mind won't wander off like it always does to a million other things. Before I know it I'm asleepüòä
title: Love the sleep stories- Updated

developerResponse: {'id': 21407217, 'body': 'So sorry for the trouble you\'ve experienced! Please try leaving the app open on the loading screen, as this should allow the app to fully load. Upon subsequent app launches, the app should then load normally without any delay on the "take a deep breath" screen. If you are experiencing issues on an older version of the iOS app, please update to the latest version, then follow the steps above if you experience any loading issues.', 'modified': '2021-03-02T20:32:20Z'}
review: I‚Äôve never written a review in my life, probably because I‚Äôve never been so disappointed about a product that I love so much (should be loved). It‚Äôs been a week plus since the latest update came out, that‚Äôs ample time to fix or go back one update to where a higher volume of your customers had access. Yes, in the past there was the occasional issue (once a month, if that), but nothing like this where the screen is stuck on ‚Äútake a deep breath.‚Äù I like so many have been a subscriber for several years and have used Calm religiously every night (it allowed to get off of sleep-aid medication), but now I am having to find other means to fall asleep. If you don‚Äôt hurry up and fix the app, you may be losing another longtime customer who has praised you and promoted you several times over!!
title: Disappointed

review:
I get premium content through Kaiser insurance (which has been the best part of their mental health services, but that‚Äôs a different review....). 

I am so incredibly grateful for it because I‚Äôve been using it for the past two months and it took me out a depressive episode. 

Jeff Warren‚Äôs content keeps me around. It‚Äôs because of his 30 day course that I‚Äôve finally established a meditation practice after years of sincere attempts. His approach is very human and relatable; I find sessions with his recordings much more fruitful since he sandwiches the nuggets of clarity between quiet moments. I‚Äôm able to ease into the session, instead of being urged into quietness then being lectured by Tamara..maybe that works for other people but it‚Äôs inaccessible to me. 

I also use the children‚Äôs meditations with my five year old daughter and the sleep stories when she‚Äôs having a hard time sleeping. I‚Äôm glad to share this experience and skill with her. I was fortunate to have an elementary school teacher show me how powerful meditation and journaling was at an early age, but didn‚Äôt have a way to reintroduce it into my adult life AND share it with my daughter till now. 

I used Insight Timer for awhile but was overwhelmed by the features and endless options. I like that this is more curated and it‚Äôs lucky Jeff Warren‚Äôs content is so appealing to me.
title: thank you Kaiser

review: Calm is such an incredible app. There is always something new to explore and all the features are really cool. The simple and East to use format is perfect for people with anxiety who get overwhelmed. Even though there are tons of choices, Calm makes it easy to narrow down the choices and help you find exactly what you are looking for. Calm customizes your recommendations based on how you are feeling that day and what you want to get out of the app. It has stuff for the whole family including a kids section.  You do have to pay $70 a year for premium, however that‚Äôs only a little less than $6 per month. My family compared it to being less than Netflix. The price is totally worth it for all the features it comes with. I would definitely recommend  this app to anyone with anxiety or anyone who just needs to make time in their day for mindfulness.
title: Best app ever!!!

review: I have been using this app to fall asleep when I need a reliable source of comforting white noise for a few years now. It‚Äôs not something that I use all the time but it‚Äôs something I come back to on those occasions when I can‚Äôt sleep. Recently, when I needed my song that helps me fall asleep every once in a while, I went into the app to find it LOCKED for the first time EVER. When I clicked on it to try and play the song, (water falling by Kip Mazuy in ‚Äúnature melodies‚Äù) a pop up comes up talking about a 7 day free trial and then a monthly payment after that. Unacceptable. You can‚Äôt just take something that has been free for years and then all of a sudden make it into a paid service. I know it‚Äôs a small issue but I am livid about this. I literally cannot believe this. You have taken my only reliable song that puts me to sleep when melatonin won‚Äôt do the trick. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm supposed to do now when I can‚Äôt sleep and need to. You people behind the app probably don‚Äôt care though. Obviously all you care about is your GD money.
title: Are you kidding me???

developerResponse:
{'id': 5634445, 'body': "Hey Cat, thanks for writing in. Sorry to hear you haven't heard a response yet. I'll try to address some questions in the meantime.

When in a meditation session, you can tap the far left control button to open Sound Settings. Here you can control how loud the scene is relative to the narrator. Swipe the slider to the left to lower scene sounds. Another option is to go into More -> Scenes and download a scene that has no sound, such as Silent Earth. 

As for your concerns on accessibility, could you please let us know which parts of the app you had the most trouble with? 

Take care,
Josh", 'modified': '2018-10-23T21:06:10Z'}
review:
I believe this is a great APP except that they‚Äôve make no effort to respond to 3 concerns in emails via their support tickets 

The first one that I made some time ago was that I found it extremely difficult in the middle of the night to see the icons or read anything without glasses. I asked if they could make them little bit larger for  those of us who cannot see well at night without reading glasses. They never responded, in fact with in a few weeks they made the reading icons even more difficult to read.

Being a neuroscientist I recommended this app to my patients. Many of them complained of this difficulty and so I once again wrote a support ticket. They Never responded.
They also changed the voice of the Female narrator for the meditations and put a background noise which is constant. This may be easy for some people to hear her voice without difficulty But I find it impossible. Background sound rushing water perhaps like Niagara Falls. Very difficult to concentrate and hear her voice clearly.  I am a 20+ year veteran meditator and find this new sound agitating 
I explained it was difficult and asked if they would turn the volume down. The Never responded and made no change.

An App is only as good as the support. Which seems to be absent.  Too bad it is otherwise a good idea.
title: Poor support

review: Who knew an app could be a life changer for me. I practice my daily calm in the mornings before anything else. The act of meditation has had a profound effect on me so much so that people have asked what I‚Äôve changed. I am less reactive, more thoughtful, and kinder to myself. I appreciate the new additions to the app in the daily section, I love the sleep stories, sound scapes and guided the meditations are wonderful. One thing I would love to see brought to the platform are more options for advancing my meditation practice- something like a little less guidance and longer than 10-12 minutes. Something else that would be amazing is if the app would interface with Alexa so I didn‚Äôt have to have my phone next to me all night. Even with my requests, I give it five stars. Thank you for guiding me towards awareness and inner peace.
title: Life Changing

review: I received a year‚Äôs subscription to Calm nearly 2 years ago, & am still enjoying the app. It became an oasis of serenity in a tumultuous world. There is a good selection of meditations, sleep stories, music, & more. The sleep stories work wonders! If I had one complaint, it would be that the selection of different people leading the meditations has declined. While I very much enjoy Tamara, I did appreciate the number of choices you offered in the past. One last note, it‚Äôs difficult to judge an app by comments of those who only use the free offerings of a paid app. Of course your choices will be limited. In order to pay to produce all the content & bring in more voices, they have to charge a fee. All the other good meditation apps do it as well. It‚Äôs just a fact that not everything on the internet can be free.
title: Excellent Mental Health App

review:
I have horrible sleep problems. I worked nights for a while and have always been a ‚Äúnight owl.‚Äù However, I have just moved in with my 94 yo grandfather and he feels put out if I‚Äôm up late and sleep in.( I am medically retired). 
I‚Äôve seen your ads and decided to try the app. When I pulled it up, there was NO PRICE ADVERTISED AT THE POINT OF DOWNLOAD. However there was a NOTATION that said ‚ÄúIn app purchases.‚Äù Which is extremely misleading!! 
And when you‚Äôre taken to the sign up page, it gives you a date to cancel prior to being charged, however doesn‚Äôt specify HOW to cancel at the point of sale. This would also be helpful so the customer can record that info in order to make a cancellation easier, if that‚Äôs what they choose to do.  
I would love to try the app but I don‚Äôt want to be in a position where I have to search for a way to cancel before being charged. Also, it states that I can cancel at any time. Does that mean that I will receive a prorated refund for the time that I don‚Äôt use??
title: Disappointed that the price was not clearly stated at time of download..

review:
Has some lovely calming images and sounds, and the unlocked bedtime story to which I listened had a a soothing voice. There many unlocked sessions I would like to hear and wish the owners would at least give a sample of the voice and then allow me to purchase the episode to own it, rather than requiring  a pricey (for me) yearly  subscription, for which the product is forever gone when it runs out. I know subscriptions are becoming the way of the world, but still I resist!  I do believe people should be paid for their work; I‚Äôd just like to be able to actually purchase a product; I would rate five stars if they would allow this. 

‚ÄúCalm‚Äù has a nice daily feature (one of the few push notifications I allow on my phone) which reminds me to stay in the moment, breathe, etc.   The app has some generous free offerings and I thank thank the developers for sharing these!
title: Wish I could buy some episodes

review: The Calm app is revolutionary. It combines a range of real human voices and storytelling techniques with cutting edge sonic therapy using music and incredibly immersive ambient soundscapes that truly shine when you pair them with good noise canceling headphones by Bose or similar brands. I was diagnosed with Level 1 bipolar disorder as an adult and needed very expensive medical care that fortunately was largely covered by my wonderful health care provider, Kaiser Permanente- who also provided me access to the Calm app. Since listening regularly to morning meditations by Tamara Levitt and her colleagues, along with outdoor exercise, a ketogenic diet, and limited medication, my mental clarity not only has returned to ‚Äúnormal‚Äù but actually has become optimized to a state I never experienced before. It‚Äôs like that great Bradley Cooper movie, Limitless. Except it‚Äôs better because this is real.
title: Sonic therapy for improved mental health focus and wellness

review: I was very skeptical about meditation before I actually started meditating. After trying everything I possibly could including exercising three hours straight like a maniac after work to try to manage my stress, I was recommended this app for guided meditation. I thought, why not give it a try? I am very grateful I did because meditation has been life changing in the way I view myself and the world. I‚Äôve managed my stress much better and I now handle difficult situations in a more calm and coherent manner. It helped me grow and adapt as a person. There are so many great features within this app that I also love like breathing exercises and stories from successful people on their journey.  Whether you are struggling or not, I think this app would be beneficial and helpful in your life and I highly recommend it.
title: Life Changing

review: I never write reviews, but I have to share my positive experience and how life changing this app is. I was having issues with sleeping, which I have never encountered before. I would be exhausted and fall asleep at 7pm and wake up at 330am, unable to fall back to sleep. I went to the doctor for blood tests to see if i had any other physical issues that may be triggering the change in my sleep pattern and all tests came back negative. My doctor recommended to practice better sleep hygiene. I started using this app in the morning to meditate (10 min) and then use the sleep induced relaxation before bed. For 2 weeks now I have been able to get a full night sleep and feel more calm during the day. It takes practice and a willing to change, but this is the tool to use if you are ready and willing and want more calm and sleep in your daily life!
title: found calm and sleep!!!

review: I downloaded this app because I felt it would help me sleep better at night and avoid my everlasting thoughts. The first night using the app was cool. I have only used it twice since downloading it. Today, I check my mail and it says it was renewed for $84 for a year!!! I know in my mind that I don‚Äôt select the subscription for $79. Who has that kind of money to spend on an app? Especially during an pandemic. People are out of work & can definitely use $84 for food & survival items. I think I was well taken advantage of because it was automatically set for 1 year subscription. Instead of asking if I would like to subscribe for another week, 1 month or 2 months, it was automatically set for one year. This app shows they‚Äôre just for the money. You can tell from the limited stories and soundscapes that they have. For $80 I should have more than just 12 soundscapes to help with my sleep. So now i'm forced to use the app for a year with limited soundscapes and honestly I didn‚Äôt even care for the app.
title: Definitely Taken Advantage Of

review:
I have been using Calm for over a year now and although I have fallen off the wagon a few times, I always gravitate back. It‚Äôs so helpful and sincerely helps guide you to a better state, so peacefully! Tamara is amazing and so soothing. She is like this little angle on your shoulder telling you it‚Äôs ok to just be, to find acceptance in everything. 

I have always been hesitant to start a meditation practice. Seemed so yuppie! But it really isn‚Äôt, it‚Äôs so much more than just sitting in silence and chanting to yourself or needing to be like a monk! It‚Äôs a short moment to practice awareness/mindfulness and learn to be present. To help guide you back to what is important in life. In the busyness of our current world, this app is genuinely ‚Äúthe calm within the storm.‚Äù It teaches better emotional intelligence as well. Struggling with PTSD and seeing many therapists that had good intentions but never really helped, I knew I had to ignite the change from within. This app along with Gratitude 365 did just that for me! It works! 

The Master Classes are also a favorite of mine; I wish they would post more! But I adore listening to the podcast like lessons; so helpful! 

I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough! It is worth every penny and then some! Better than a copay for a therapist! Do yourself a favor and commit to it and I promise you won‚Äôt be disappointed!
title: Love ‚ù§Ô∏è

developerResponse: {'id': 32911018, 'body': 'Hi there, sounds like you are having trouble accessing the content. Please reach out to support at support@calm.com and we‚Äôd be happy to guide you to it.', 'modified': '2022-11-01T14:30:18Z'}
review:
I have had this subscription for 2 years.  We use it daily.  My kids love the sleep stories and the soundscapes for white noise.  I use the soundscapes every day too. 
But beware!  My credit card # was stolen and when it tried to auto renew, it couldn‚Äôt.  I had to go and do it with the new card number.  I have the charge that has cleared my card and I can access on my phone, but content is locked on both iPads.  You can‚Äôt call, you can only email.  Got a generic and unhelpful response but I followed instructions.  Content still locked.  Emailed again, generic response about how to renew.  Not helpful.  Deleted app and reinstalled, logged out and back in.  Content still locked.  I emailed again and asked for someone to call.  Got a message that they don‚Äôt have call support - only email. I dismally had to dispute the charge on my card when I couldn‚Äôt get any help after days of trying. 
Come on Calm.  Your app is too good for you to have such low rate, crappy support.
title: Terrible support

review: I absolutely love, needed and highly recommend this app! Whether it's for small daily breathing exercises, soothing sounds for bedtime or meditation, this app helps guide you along a path of self recovery and starts the moment you click download. I have to say it has helped me with daily living. The bedtime stories and soothing sounds alone sold me but I love the daily calm meditations. I have been healing daily and recommend everyone try it. My daughter loves it to help her sleep and the guided meditation. She now is a very enlightened, leveled out ten year old and the meditation helps now with her hormonal and menstrual transition.  I have to say everyone can benefit highly from it. The free demo is great to get your feet started and see how it helps before if you feel some doubt, but I doubt you will have any after you try it! Your soul will thank you! Calm yourself and Calm your soul.
title: Calm yourself and Calm your soul.

review: My wife and I have listened to CALM for well over 2 years. Cannot express how easy it is to fall asleep listening to this app. When she first started the app at night my thought was ‚ÄúYeah right‚Äù I‚Äôm going to listen to silly music and drift into dream land. After the first week I was sold. There are many Calm stories we have started off in listening in bed and sometimes takes several tries to stay awake to hear the end of it. Our recent story is with Keith Morrison that took 4 times to get to the end. The storyline is about Goldie Locks and how portage goes missing and a bed is slept in - this is a story where I wanted to laugh many times during his reading yet I didn‚Äôt want to wake up my wife. This is one of my favorite stories to date. He applies his investigation methods to the story as he does on Dateline - this is great!
title: A calmer sleep

review: I don‚Äôt usual leave reviews on apps but this one I couldn‚Äôt help. I need something to distract my mind and help me fall asleep or else I‚Äôm thinking about the day and things going on. Looking through the App Store I noticed this app had been downloaded in the past and I did not remember why it was deleted from my phone. Downloaded again and I remember why I deleted it‚Ä¶for a ‚Äúfree‚Äù app there is nothing free in the app itself. If you want to play anything you have to buy a subscription of 70$ a year. I don‚Äôt think it should even be labeled free in the App Store if you can‚Äôt even use it in the slightest. I was given the impression that even if there are in app purchases they at least have a lot of unlocked things to play, and then you pay more if it really benefits you and you‚Äôre interested in all the other things. That is usually how apps labeled free work. I would like to have a peaceful night sleep but I need to find something else. I don‚Äôt think I should have to pay so much just so I can sleep a little better.
title: Horrible and Misleading App

review: Amazing app. I use sleep stories every single night and my toddler uses the kids sleep stories at nap time. It‚Äôs so relaxing! I am actually excited to jump into bed at night because I get to listen to a story! I also use the ten minute daily calm meditations all the time! There is so much value in this one app- sleep stories, daily journaling, meditation, breathing exercises, and more! My one suggestion is to add more emotions to the daily check-ins. Most of the time I‚Äôm feeling an emotion and it‚Äôs not one of the choices. So I just have to pick one and make it work. For example, there‚Äôs no ‚Äúfrustrated,‚Äù ‚Äúguilty,‚Äù ‚Äúoverwhelmed,‚Äù ‚Äúsurprised,‚Äù ‚Äúshocked,‚Äù or ‚Äúcurious,‚Äù etc. I wish there were more emotion choices to better describe how I‚Äôm feeling. Otherwise, everything else is perfect! I love this app and I tell everyone I can about it. I would gladly pay $100/year for this app.
title: Amazing but one suggestion

review: I suffer from PTSD and nights are the worst, especially if it‚Äôs been a rough day.  My mind brings up trauma, worries and my anxiety gets my heart racing.  I used to end up putting on a podcast which helps but I stay awake to listen to the information.  I love this app bc there‚Äôs many options and genres of things to listen too, they all have calming voices and is interesting enough to keep my mind occupied but not keep me awake.  Then when I wake from a nightmare, I immediately push the start over button and I am usually able to get back to sleep before the anxiety wakes me up.  I like to listen to the master classes over and over again.  I change the actual topic every month or so but I find comfort in routine.  And I LOVE to learn!  Plus I can download my favs so I can still use it when I have no internet.
title: Life changing

review: I‚Äôve had the free trial for 2 days now, and as a person who has clinically suffered from anxiety and depression most of my life, I already feel so grounded and balanced. Amidst the COVID-19 crisis & being in the epicenter of it all, I‚Äôve never experienced as much physical and mental relief as I have these past couple of days, simply by listening to the guided meditations, playing the soothing nature sounds while I quickly grocery shop, or falling asleep to the stories.  I would LOVE and HOPE to see more options available to us. I turn to this app any time I feel the need for balance and restoration of inner peace, and believe many of us can benefit from what is has to offer, especially right now. Thank you Calm for restoring my calm üôèüèΩ I hope to see some efforts from your successful company to help make this more widely available.
title: Amazing!

review: I downloaded this app a few weeks ago during a particularly stressful stretch at work, and I have done at least one meditation every day since.  After working my way through all of the free meditations (a huge variety based on your needs - anxiety, focus, self esteem, etc.), this had become a part of my daily routine, so I went for the subscription.  And WOW, it‚Äôs so much more than just meditation - the daily calm each morning, the sleep stories before bed (so cozy, and come on, who doesn‚Äôt want Matthew McConaughey to read you a bedtime story??), the guided stretches, the breathing...all of it is so well thought out and relaxing.  It helps so much with stress from life and work, and has really improved my overall quality of life.  Definitely recommend, especially for those with stressful jobs or anxiety looking to improve their wellbeing.
title: Incredibly impactful

review:
I have been using this app a little ver two years, and I love it! I use it for nights when I can‚Äôt fall asleep. I mean, who doesn‚Äôt have good memories of story time at night , being read a story by mom or dad, and falling asleep while they were reading?!üíï
Also if I wake up to use the restroom, and can‚Äôt fall back to sleep I use it again!  Al l 
Stories have a time on them, and iPhone shuts off when story is over. I also use the music app to! More recently, I have tried the soundscapes. My favorite is the light rain at night. You can even hear a few crickets and night creatures, very relaxing.
I live in the city, and two doors down from me, they are building a home. I discovered that by put this soundscape on high volume, it blocks out the noises of the cat, and the hammering.   I just love this app!
title: Works wonderfully!üí§üåô

review:
It seems that the creators of calm made every effort to complicate the use of the app to a point that they succeeded to increase my level of stress. They do not understand that an app should be simple, intuitive and uncomplicated . Everything seems counter- intuitive . Where do you stop the sound within the app . Til now I could not find how to stop the sound unless I quit the app .  
The app does not recognize that I paid for my subscription and keep on trying to sell me the product. It does not know  that  I am good to go and can use it . No , no no no , how can they figure out a way to torture you so they  will not let you get away that easy. You have to use a number of steps supposedly giving you choices , but they miss the point of simplifying its operation and   for me they succeeded to create a new level of stress I did not had before using the app. 
So for now, this app is a a good source of frustration and agitation . I hope the developers read these reviews and do something about it.
title: The opposite of what a stress reduction app should be

review: Wow! Just wow I have never written an app review but this app is amazing! If you like soothing things like candles and mood lighting you‚Äôll love this!  I‚Äôve had it for 6 days and I‚Äôve used it for 6 days straight! ( the app likes to make you feel good about this and hey I love it!) I am not the type that can typically stick to something for more than a day or two but this app is something that makes you want to come back for more! The sleep stories are amazing and made me have vivid expressive dreams (of fields with lavender because of the lavender story of course!) The music portion is perfect for trying to focus in the office! And the guided meditation for beginners, is something I know will have transformative power over my life! There is a reason Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk meditate, it‚Äôs very effective! Overall download this app and pay full price for it, ya worth every penny!!
title: New Year, New Me at its finest!

review: Best investment in my health I‚Äôve ever made. I am growing with Calm as it continues to evolve expanding its offerings for short guided meditations from morning . Jeff‚Äôs daily trip and Jays wisdom. After years I am using this in my life and starting to live my life from a conscious rather than default to the fears. Ego etc. and I can truly now say thanks to Calm I have a practice and feel calm more of the time. So impressed im going to try the yoga. Best of all through Dr Lopez‚Äôs practices to relate differently with migraines I am having significant improvement. This for me is a solution. To live differently. I can‚Äôt say enough of how I appreciate the calm team. I came here for help with sleep through the fabulous sleep stories. And can happily say as much as I love the train rides. I am loving my own journey even more now. Be well many blessings of peace and love
title: Life changing

review:
As soon as I experienced the mind - body connection 
These short guided meditations create , I became addicted!
Now I have to have my meditation time upon awakening in the AM with Tamara‚Äôs ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù and in the evening with ‚ÄúDeep Sleep Release‚Äù.  In between or when I just want more of what is offered , I go for it and am rarely disappointed.  Tamara is so present it is like having your own personal ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù Trainer right beside you with full attention on your betterment. I have practiced qigong for years and this is a wonderful quick pick me up selection of meditations when I‚Äôm too lazy to do a more physical meditation.  PLUS,  Tamara really helps you understand why you focus on the breath more than I have learned from others. I also love her tasteful selection of quotes and allegories to take into my day. 

  I‚Äôm a creative person and I think Tamara particularly understands the energy of creative people and resonates with that energy more than other guided meditation facilitators I have tried. 
  Thank you so much Tamara for having created a meaningful, healing  app to help us all be more mindful and connected to ourselves in a world that is filled with distractions constantly pulling us away from our ability to be centered and connected and mindful throughout the day.
title: Happily addicted to these short powerful meditations

review:
I am enjoying this app so much. It really helps me focus on the breath and not on things which cause anxiety and stress. I also love the sleep stories. Works so well that I have never heard the end of a story. I had rated it 4.5 because I was struggling with the cost and whether or not to pay for the full version. Since then I have decided that the benefits were worth the cost and paying the one time fee helped me not dwell on the cost every month. I have recommended it to many friends. 
   (I wrote this review a while ago and it still holds true. The only addition I would make is that to newcomers it may be a bit tricky to navigate the site and find exactly what you‚Äôre looking for, but they continue to make improvements and the improvements have been helpful.)
title: Recently upped to lifetime

review:
I‚Äôve NEVER written a review for an app, but this app seriously has changed my life. I use to have such bad anxiety that I lost all my self confidence, my ability to remain calm in the face of stress, and it began even affecting me physically. I began using Calm (alongside other mental health resources) and it has taught me so much.

       They have SO many selections; sleep stories, mediations for multiple scenarios, meditation to understand emotions, music, and the best one is that they do a new 10 minute meditation every day with a awesome little life lesson/lesson on mindfulness at the end. They're also so good about talking you through meditation, how to do it, to understand it‚Äôs ok to mess up. Its so comforting, I listen every night before bed or when im anxious, it helps SO much. My mentality, emotions, and reactions to stressors has changed SO much since using it. I REALLY recommend it!
title: Has Changed My Life!

developerResponse: {'id': 8455771, 'body': "Hi there, I'm sorry to hear you've had trouble with the app. Please reach out to support@calm.com for assistance; we are typically able to respond to all inquiries within one business day!", 'modified': '2019-04-30T23:00:09Z'}
review:
Ok, many flaws and hard to navigate and very poor support. By the time one spends trying to figure out what‚Äôs going on, how to retrieve some part of program, you have spent tooooo much time on your device. This is suppose to be ? Calming.

Have received help on the glitches and now working well. I do like this app and it does help center oneself, calm oneself and with mindfulness accept one‚Äôs daily life with understanding. Continuing to work with this program. Thanks

I love the Calm App. Wished I had started mindfulness meditation years ago but happy I found it now. There are so many areas of this app that have helped me attain, I guess a better understanding of who I am and a loving kindness towards myself and others. It is not easy and many times difficult but this app has helped in my daily life, my attitude and judgements toward self and others. I thank you.
title: Review of Calm.

review:
This app is absolutely amazing, nothing with this app is annoying, for me it‚Äôs great to have the German language too. 
I love the background music with different themes, and the fact that you can set up a timer for that. I leave the night mode playing for 2 hours before sleeping and it‚Äôs such a nice sleep. I wish the App Developers read my comment and add another feature to this fantastic app: PLEASE PLEASE think about an alarm clock, or maybe another option to add different times with different background music too. In this case users can have different background music during the day/night. 
I lOVE to wake up with the background music mornings. I always wake up earlier in the morning to set a sound for couple of hours and then sleep again with it, it‚Äôs such a fantastic sleep and I have more energy in the morning.
title: Best app ever

review: I have never written an app review before but I had to for Calm because I am so in love with this app. Not only is Calm super user friendly but I love every single thing this app has to offer. I love the daily meditations and how you can favorite any session you do so you can go back and do it again. I also love how it tracks everything for you. Most importantly though is how much this app has truly changed my life. I have bettered myself in all aspects of my life from focus in school to finding peace in a very fast paced stressful job. Anxiety has always been a major issue for me (and trust me I have tried many other methods of managing stress from therapy to medications etc) but nothing has done half as much for me as meditating regularly with this app. I really hope this app never changes because I love it so much and it is worth every penny!!
title: Life Changing

review: This app has changed my life for the better. I knew nothing about mindfulness or meditation before this app. I mainly got the app for the sleep stories because I have issues sleeping at night and listening to audiobooks was helping. Only the type of audiobook would influence my sleep, so if it was scary or intense I‚Äôd have nightmares. I slept peacefully with the calm sleep stories. I had the app 2 years before I started using the meditation aspect of it. I can‚Äôt believe it took me so long! Jeff Warren is AMAZING!!! He guides you through meditation in a welcoming and relaxing way. I can‚Äôt imagine my life without him or meditation anymore. It‚Äôs made my life so much less stressful. The wisdom and guidance in the Daily Jay sessions is such a positive way to start the day. I know it‚Äôs pricy but get the app. Your mental health is worth it!!
title: Changed my life

review:
Most apps allow you to enroll in a series of related guided meditations without the friction to resume the series and pick up where you left off.  This app adds so much friction to my daily use. When I have 15 minutes to meditate, I don‚Äôt want to navigate through numerous menus to find the mediation series I was using. In the calm app‚Äîand the web interface too for that matter‚ÄîI have navigate past new meditations and a lot of other noise before I can find the meditation series I want to use, or the favorites I‚Äôve already selected.

There should be an option on the Home Screen that will allow me to immediately pick up where I left off in a meditation series. Instead of an option to share calm with others on my Home Screen, I should see a thumbnail to navigate to my favorites. There too much friction in using this app, and I really dislike the interface.  The content is great, the format is terrible. Please improve the app.
title: Entire App Feels Like an Advertisement

review: I was first exposed to meditation at 17 when I started doing yoga ... My first teacher, who I loved, would have us meditate for about 5-7 minutes at the end of class, telling us to ‚Äúlet our thoughts wash over us like water‚Äù. The yoga stuck, the meditation didn‚Äôt ... But at 31, battling depression, anxiety and perfectionism as so many of us do, I was ready to seek a solution from within. Thank God for CALM. It surprised me with a new drive to meditate everyday, sometimes even twice. There is a session for whatever you are feeling, whether you‚Äôre in tears, in a panic or feeling enlightened and like all is right with the world. Tamara and John constantly remind you to be gentle, kind and patient with yourself, and honestly, who doesn‚Äôt need to hear that? I am so so happy to be meditating and have Calm as a force for self care in my life. Try it out and subscribe stat!
title: A new positive force in my life

review: I got this app to help me fall asleep, and all it does is frustrate me. I really wish I hadn‚Äôt paid for a full year‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt want to listen to 45 minutes of a sleep story when I‚Äôm going to sleep. I only need 15. After that, the story wakes me up. I don‚Äôt understand why this app has made sleep timers so difficult. You can set a timer to make the app go to sleep after a certain amount of time just playing the background sound, but it will still play the whole story. The only way to actually get a sleep timer is to play a story from a playlist, but I haven‚Äôt had that work consistently. Also, why can‚Äôt the app keep track of where I left off in a story or playlist? If you navigate away, it has no idea where you were. Which is extremely annoying for the playlists because if you want to use the timer, you have to restart them, otherwise they are treated as a single story with no sleep timer. I really thought this app would be better designed for sleep‚Ä¶ very disappointing.
title: Frustrating‚Ä¶

review: Okay, I have a lot of trouble sleeping due to anxiety and stress. This helps, BUT out of everything I have looked at, there‚Äôs only four free things to listen to for sleep. I have favorited all of the free things and in total there‚Äôs four. I cannot afford the subscription either, so my counselor recommended headspace also so I also have that. But that‚Äôs not the point. There‚Äôs so many things that cost money, and I get it, you guys should have some things that need to be paid for but I don‚Äôt understand why there‚Äôs literally only four things that‚Äôs free and why subscriptions cost so much. Please cut it down a bit or something, many people have the same issues as me and can‚Äôt listen to a lot of things either because there‚Äôs so much things that need subscriptions and they might not have that kind of money. I have read other reviews and I see that other people agree with me.
title: Fix this

review:
I used to rave about Calm to my family and friends a while back, telling them how helpful it was for insomnia, meditation and relaxing. My personal favorite sleep story is ‚ÄúThe Waterfall‚Äù. (I still don‚Äôt know the ending because it always put me to sleep within 5 minutes!)

Another thing I loved about Calm was the number of features available for free. Although I couldn‚Äôt afford the annual fee, the free items were VERY helpful to me. Now, I‚Äôm greatly disappointed that most of those free features are now paid features, including ‚ÄúThe Waterfall‚Äù. 

It would be great if Calm at least offered a monthly payment option. The subject of mindful meditation, mental health, etc. is no longer taboo and on the rise and people of all incomes need resources available to them. I don‚Äôt fault Calm for charging for most of their features, but with the app ranking at #1, they should make more features available for people who cannot afford to pay a fee.
title: Awesome app, however... üòï

review:
This year has been a crazy one for everyone. My anxiety and stress had been on an all time high, so when I got the notification from American Express that we could try the app for free I thought, what do I have to lose? 

Meditation has now become my go to, I‚Äôve made it the central part of my morning routine with the 10 min ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù meditation to begin my day. Throughout the day, if I feel myself beginning to get tense and stressed, I know it‚Äôs my queue to go ground myself again with the app. The guidance is excellent for beginners, like myself, and really helps you zone in. 

This app has made me more mindful, it allows me to slow down and ground myself before I react. Overall I would recommend instilling a daily meditation practice to anyone. You truly do feel the difference, just be patient and give yourself grace, but stick to it!
title: 2020 Godsend

review: I‚Äôve stuck with this meditation app for a month now which is longer than any other app I‚Äôve tried. There‚Äôs so many options and I love the snippets of teaching within the sessions that give you something to think about throughout the day. My only critique is that I wish there was a packet or more sessions or even more examples within the sessions given that focus on dealing with chronic/persistent illness. Many of the examples I just don‚Äôt relate to. (Break ups, job loss, etc). I think this would even be a good advertisement opportunity considering the vast population of chronically ill people. There‚Äôs a nuance to this type of illness that desperately needs attention. That is, it‚Äôs chronic. It doesn‚Äôt go away. It doesn‚Äôt even change in some circumstances. It‚Äôs a constant trigger. Would love to hear some of the experts at Calm speak to this particular issue. Thank you for considering!
title: Best meditation app, just one thing...

review:
I‚Äôm not one for writing reviews, this is my first because I always think to myself if an app does its job then it‚Äôll speak for itself. However, Calm does it job and more. I have trouble sleeping on various occasions, particularly when I‚Äôm sick, being sick gives me a strange anxiety causing me to stay up later and later. I tried the free version starting off with the ‚ÄúSleep Stories‚Äù (Blue Gold to be exact) hoping that it would help reduce my anxiety and get me to sleep peacefully.
