It‚Äôs done exactly that, I‚Äôve used it for the past 4 nights and upgraded to premium in order to listen to more stories as I Calmly get whisked away to a better nights sleep. 

I can only imagine what the other functions of the app do and how they may help, but I‚Äôm more than pleased and genuinely looking forward to exploring the rest of the app. Thank you !
title: You won‚Äôt regret it.

review: I downloaded this app as the free version and didn‚Äôt really do much on it, but one day I kinda jumped into it and thought that it was kinda cool. So I bought the monthly subscription and life‚Äôs kinda gotten in the way and I sort of forgot about it. Well today is Martin Luther King Jr. Day and today was the first day I listened to a daily calm. It was about contribution and how you can be inspired. She talked about how you contribute without even noticing it such as helping a friend through a hard time. Well, it just so happens that I helped a friend through a rough night tonight and I just kind of felt like it really spoke to me and i felt touched. I am looking forward to doing this everyday from here on out and I cannot wait to see what daily calms are headed my way. Thank you guys for creating such a peaceful, uplifting, and thoughtful app. (Sorry this is so long lol)
title: All I can say is wow

review:
I‚Äôve been a lifetime member for nearly three years. The daily‚Äôs, courses, breathing, and sleep stories are top notch. The app was indelible to developing a wellness routine for me, and got me into meditation. However, for sometime myself and other users have asked for a way to queue tracks, or create playlist- a relatively simple feature, yet am told by support they‚Äôre doing other things. As a result I have been using Hoomband for sleep tracks for the better half of a year, with this I can be guaranteed there will be something playing to help me drift back to sleep- and it would be too disruptive to get on the Calm app and pick something else. 

Other suggestions like new background scenes, or breathing exercises understandably take time. 

All in all the app is still 5 stars.
title: Great but listen to feedback

review: I love the Calm app!  I recommend getting the premium content.  Calm is a tool for dealing with the challenges of life.  There is more awareness on anxiety, depression, and negative feelings.  I am hopeful for the future because this will improve people‚Äôs lives.  I gifted the app to my friends and family who also enjoy it - beautiful, inspirational meditations, music, masterclasses, teachings, body exercises, sleep stories and music and so much more!  I wish my family and I had Calm for difficult times in our lives.  I am comforted knowing we have Calm now for difficult times in the future.  I am excited to see the upcoming new content which is frequently updated and improved.  Thank you to everyone at Calm - you all inspire and help me!  You changed and improved life for my family, friends, and me!  And for many other people in the world!
title: üíï

review: I have been using this app for a little over two weeks now and I think it works great for anxiety or stress. The large collection of soft noises and music allows me to have a second to myself to pay attention and breathe. It also helps me to fall asleep faster. I recommend this app to everyone. In psychology class, we learned how using breathing exercises, like the ones in this app, allows our flight or fight response to simmer down and bring our anxiety levels down. Our body‚Äôs sympathetic system spikes when we run into danger. When we feel anxiety our body does the same. Calm music helps to increase our parasympathetic response which allows us to calm down. This app does just this. There are so many options and you are bound to find an exercise for you!
title: Helps Me Calm Down

review: I had been having a very bad day, I had not fallen asleep until 12 the past night, had a stressful day of online learning wrapping up the trimester, and overall VERY angry. I had remembered that I had the app calm and decided to try it out. I clicked on their ‚Äúsoundscapes‚Äù option and played one of their river options. I immediately relaxed and the quality of the sound - it‚Äôs amazing! It‚Äôs like I was really there! I definitely recommend this app for all sorts of things. The paying option is expensive, but I share it with someone else. The sleep stories had helped me relax and fall asleep, and I personally do not like mindfulness. Had not worked for me before and and did not think it would. I had used it and it was very well done. Incredibly calming. Seriously, use this app. It‚Äôs good.
title: Stress free

review: I believe this app is more or less saving my life. I have suffered from depression multiple times over the last nine years and I was unsure what was causing it. I believe I was overworking my brain and not giving it enough rest or stillness. The comment is allowing me to practice meditation in a way that I am never tried before. And I am not a newbie to meditation with my Indian culture and Hindu upbringing in America, I have learned a lot about pranayama. But this calm app offered something different, which has been amazing at allowing my mind to rest. My depression experiences has likely cost me over $500,000 in opportunity cost. I am excited for the opportunity to remain mentally stable for years to come so that I do not jump into an elevated state that could lead to a depression.
title: Calm app is currently saving my life

review: I get really bad anxiety and a friend told me to try out this app. So I downloaded it and by the looks of it, it looked pretty good. So I left it at that and didn‚Äôt dig deeper til I needed it. A few days later I was going on a trip to Colorado with my swim team. We were away from home and I got really anxious. I decided to hop onto this app. I opened thinking about the vast choices I get to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù me down, but then was struck by everything being locked. I didn‚Äôt know I had to pay to be at peace with myself. I do prioritize my mental health, but having to pay $70 a year for it is kinda of ridiculous, especially for someone who works seasonal. There was an anxiety one that my friend said was good for this situation. But of course it was locked. Now Ik why people are still stressed, cause they have to pay to be calm. Instead of getting upset right away, I clicked on an unlocked one and let it play. What are you supposed to do when you finish the unlocked ones??
title: Locked!!

review:
Every day I am grateful for each person that makes Calm app possible. Calm helps me stay on the path of mindfulness, compassion, and growth. I have been using it for a solid year now and consider it to be one of my best investments of time, and money. 
I use Daily guided meditations to start my day, to get inspired and motivated, and to take a pause after work, and bedtime stories with my kids in the evening. 
I have been looking for quite sometime for the Teacher to guide me on my personal journey of growth. I found that and more in Tamara, Jeff, Jay and Mel! Thank you, my friends!
With each meditation practice I become better at using awareness to help me regain balance when strong emotions threaten to take over me. It improved the quality of my life and helps me be a better person. Thank you, Calm!!!!
title: Life changing

review: I used this app for a while a few years ago.  It wasn't super useful to me, even then a lot was behind a paywall, but I like the guided breathing exercise. I stopped using it and deleted the app at some point. When I downloaded it again recently, a lot had changed. The front page is now almost entirely paid content and the breathing exercise I used to use has been moved and was pretty hard to find. Also, you used to be able to adjust the breath pattern more, but now you have to have a subscription for anything other than 4 seconds inhale, 6 seconds exhale. There is very little content in this app that isn‚Äôt behind a $70/year subscription and they don‚Äôt even let you read descriptions or listen to previews of a lot of things, like the sleep stories, so you know what you‚Äôd be paying for. Used to be good for the breathing exercises, but now that they‚Äôre harder to access (not what I wanna deal with when I‚Äôm stressed), it‚Äôs completely useless to me.
title: Wasn‚Äôt great to begin with, much worse now

review: I‚Äôm a teenager and I have really enjoyed using Calm. I like to listen to the meditation music, it just puts my heart at peace :). I exercise a lot and I love listening to the calming music as I stretch or do yoga. I really appreciate this app and all the helpful resources they have available! I‚Äôd like to better my self care, so I started one of the self-care series. One of my friends has some bad anxiety and I‚Äôve recommended this app to her. They have very short sessions which is very helpful if you ever feel out of it or something. You can just take a short break and open this app and feel at peace with yourself and everything around you :). As for as I know the music, stories, meditations, etc. are all available for download so that you can listen offline. I hope you enjoy Calm as much as I do! üíñüòÑ
title: Calm üíñ

review:
We used headspace to sleep for years and it‚Äôs great but we‚Äôve really been enjoying calms sleep stories collection. We recently started turning off Wi-Fi & putting our phones on airplane modes at night and love that we can download the sleep stories to listen to without internet. 

However, at first the app would sometimes crash a couple times after about 30 seconds of listening on offline mode but would start working flawlessly after a couple starts. Sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt crash at all. Just recently it started crashing every night non-stop. This happens on both mine and my wife‚Äôs phone. Fresh installs, fresh reboot of phone, doesn‚Äôt make a difference. 

Please fix this so we can go to bed without having to restart a bunch in offline mode! No issue in regular mode.
title: Great app, but please fix offline downloads!

review: I‚Äôve had the Premium version of this app for only a week now, but I have been loving the wide selection of meditations (and meditation series!) that are available. I‚Äôve found that because I‚Äôve invested in the subscription, it‚Äôs been a bigger motivation for me to be consistent with a daily meditation routine (the series options have also motivated me to keep going). The background scene and it‚Äôs accompanying calming noises also adds an element of relaxation to the experience, which I very much enjoy. I haven‚Äôt tried the sleep stories yet, but my partner and his family love them. The only thing I would like to see changed is allowing us the ability to select more than one emotion for the check-ins and I‚Äôd also appreciate a larger emotion selection. However, this app is wonderful and I highly recommend it.
title: Lives up to the name

review: I have used the Calm app for three or four years now and recommend it to all my friends. More information is constantly being added. The bedtime stories, which I listen to nearly every night, have such a wide variety to choose from. My 9 year-old granddaughter does the same choosing her stories from the kids section. Both she and I also use the app to meditate. They have a special kid section for that as well and they offer everything from body scans to categories where they give lots of instructions and directions and also categories where they speak very little. It also has visuals to help you breathe deeply. I know this is a subscription app and we all want things that are free, but remember usually you get what you pay for and that is certainly true in this case.
title: It has everything.

review:
This app changed my life on an everyday basis. I finally learned what it really means to meditate and it‚Äôs been helping me ever since. HOWEVER...if you need help or have a question, you are only offered bot responses. Anything outside of basic ‚Äúhow to‚Äù and you hit the impenetrable wall that most tech companies create...no human to talk to...a big contrast to the way you would expect a wellness app to operate. 
My biggest issue is that your courses do not translate across devices so when you move from Apple TV to my iPad - The iPad doesn‚Äôt know that you‚Äôve already started the course and wants to start you from the beginning again. Also, it would be great to be able to buy some of the music that they offer‚Ä¶ But no one to talk to or ask about any of this!

 If you want people to be happy and calm you have to give them support!
title: Amazing app - Bad support!!

review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for about 2 years. It beats all other apps in this category no doubt. 
I am a person that suffers from chronic generalized anxiety along with depression. The anxiety can be crippling at times. Of  course I take meds so I can function, however no more taking a pill to fall asleep (and stay asleep)! That is a priceless asset that means so much to me. There are also times through the day when I use one of the many tools offered by Calm to lower my stress & anxiety level so that I can focus.
I love this app!!! The sleep meditations & stories allow me to drift off & I am having less nightmares. For the app developers, narrators & writers (and everyone responsible for making Calm what it is) - Thank you so very much. I appreciate the positive changes in my life that you all have made possible with your creativity & skills.
title: Simply Put- Awesome Experience

review: When I first downloaded this app, I was so excited to try out mediating in a new way! But when I found out how many limits there were until you unlocked the premium version, I was quite disappointed. There are different categories like mediation, sleep, and music, but you can do only up to three or none of the options given inside each category. Even when you can do one of the mediation/sleep/etc. options, it only lets you do one ‚Äúday‚Äù or ‚Äúchapter‚Äù. At first I was fine with only a few options given, thinking I could do all the chapters of each selection, but they don‚Äôt let you unless you pay. I do get why they would need the money from putting so much effort into this beautiful app, but they have to at least make it somewhat enjoyable without having to pay for basically everything that is offered. So unless I‚Äôm able to complete all the days in each option inside the categories, I think the app would be pretty decent.
title: Useful, but too limited

review: I had been feeling really stressed with school and one of my mom‚Äôs friend recommended this app. It was like magic. There is a monthly subscription fee, but you don‚Äôt have to subscribe to have the app. I haven‚Äôt subscribed and I still use the app. I personally love listening to the scenes in the background and if you go to the ‚Äúscenes‚Äù tab in the app, you can make it so the scene‚Äôs sound plays even if you aren‚Äôt in the app. The sounds are just so calming. You can also do a feelings check in which I try to do every morning. It has a bunch of emojis to choose from to relate to how you are feeling and you can write more about it. Once you do this, you can also see your history to see how you were feeling another day. I really enjoy this app and I highly recommend it.
title: Amazing

review:
I recently got a free trial for a year through work, which includes paid content. I‚Äôve read the reviews from people with free trials, and I doubt I‚Äôd buy it, seeing just what they‚Äôre seeing. Here‚Äôs what I like about it so far: The ‚ÄúHow to Meditate‚Äù series by Jeff Warren, the  ‚ÄúRadical Self Care‚Äù series by Lama Rod Owens, a few of the Sleep Stories,‚Ä¶

Here‚Äôs where I‚Äôd suggest improvements: I just had to look up the names and titles of these, which I‚Äôd bookmarked as favorites so I could find them. The organization could use some improvement. I‚Äôd suggest sorting things by what you want to DO (e.g., movement, meditation [by type]), etc. 

Also, I recently lost a loved one. When I searched for ‚Äúgrief‚Äù, ‚Äúgrieving‚Äù, ‚Äúloss‚Äù, etc,. It returned exactly two meditations, both by the same person. I think there‚Äôs a real need for more in-depth topics, based on the other reviews I‚Äôve read.  And if you can‚Äôt make this app free, I‚Äôd suggest creating a ‚Äúfree-will donation‚Äù feature for those with means to help people who can‚Äôt afford this app but who also really need something like this. I‚Äôd be willing to contribute a few bucks to help a struggling student or senior, or anyone. 

Just some thoughts off the top of my head. Thanks.
title: Has potential‚Ä¶Includes suggestions

review: So I‚Äôm a teen and I use this app before school. It helps clear my mind with the meditation. When I was younger (around 11) I would listen to the sleep stories for kids and it‚Äôd help me fall asleep peacefully. Now I listen to the music, there are some remixes from popular artists such as Shawn Mendes, Camila Cabello, Sam Smith, Sabrina Carpenter and more. I can also do daily check ins and I‚Äôve noticed my mood improve, I‚Äôm also more aware of my surroundings and my friends have noticed as well. I highly recommend this app. The only downside is having to pay for unlimited access, the content may be amazing it‚Äôs just expensive however it is worth it. I think getting this app should help you find your center and help you be more thoughtful about how you‚Äôre feeling, and how it‚Äôs impacting you.
title: Amazing app

review:
This is a fantastic app. It costs a lot for an app, and I expected to quit after the free trial. But it was too good and useful. There are lots of different guided mindfulness meditations, which I‚Äôve actually been using regularly. It‚Äôs really helped me work short meditation practices into my day at different times (and for different purposes: from focus to calm to sleep). I‚Äôve also listened to some of the sleep music and sleep stories to help wind-down and get a good nights sleep when I‚Äôm hyped up over a stressful day.

Request: One thing I‚Äôm really hoping they will add soon is a separate set of guided meditations (or at least one longer one) for actual mind-body physical healing (after injury, surgery, or from illness). I would also benefit from guided meditations on coping with & living with chronic pain. Please consider adding these!
title: Fantastic app (w/ a recommendation)

review: I use it daily now, though I did not at first.  At first I got it to start the practice of meditating but like most habits I want to establish, I quickly lost my stride and pretty much gave up. But because I often listened to the bedtime stories and used its "Scenes" for white noise to get work done, the app stayed on my radar and kept encouraging me. Eventually I tried the meditation part again, permitting myself to do it while lying down, right before falling asleep, (not the 'right' way). This training wheels method worked for me. Now I do the Daily Calm every morning and another meditation before bed (both sitting upright in a relaxed but alert position). Best of all, when I sense my stress levels rise during the day, I can focus on the breath and return a bit easier to a sense of calm. Much thanks to Tamara Levitt and all at Calm. üôè
title: Amazing! No regrets for the money spent

review:
In a little over a year I have found that ever so gradually I am facing fears, memories and addictions which I didn‚Äôt have the courage to explore. I need to face, explore and find a new path for myself within. It‚Äôs not an easy thing to look and feel within, to face my role in the stories that seem to control me. But day by day I am, and sometimes I can even let things go! Not all the time, but often enough that I am encouraged. The sleep stories are also remarkable. I usually fall asleep before they are over and some I return to over and over for the voices and the stories themselves. Such blessing for an insomniac! 
You are the best therapy for anyone seeking a place of refuge in a world of constant noise and anger. Thank you, Tamara, and all the writers and readers who ‚Äúcalm‚Äù my days and nights. I have a long way to go. And you are great companions.
title: Lifesaver

review: From the get go, I love that it doesn't make you create an account to use it. There are lots of nice nature sounds available with visuals for free and I really appreciate that they will keep playing when I use another app or lock my phone (a setting you can turn off). I also like that the nature sounds starts playing upon opening, the ease of swiping to different sounds, and that I pick what sounds pop up on my screen. I have just been using that feature for a while and have just decided to give their guided meditations a shot. It doesn't seem like they have as many free guided meditations as Simple Habit, but they seem to cover the topics I want, and I'm partial to simple nature sounds anyway. Even when I don't want to meditate it makes wonderful background noise. Really appreciate it.
title: My Favorite Meditation App

review: I'm new to meditation.  I've tried several apps, online sources, etc, and always come back to this app. The narrator's voice is absolutely perfect for this. She's very soothing, clear, and her voice just works for this.  There is just enough instruction to help bring me back on focus.  I also love the various background sounds you can choose from which provides me with a consistency from each session I choose which has helped me get in the swing of things.  I was really hesitant to pay for something like this, but it's been three months and I have no plans on canceling.  Additionally, I did have a problem which turned out to be my fault. I contacted customer service when I was trying to figure out the problem.  They were quick to respond and provided great instructions.  Highly recommend this app.
title: I love this app!

review: This app saved me.  I've been in and out of work for the past few months due to what turned out to be massive panic attacks.  Doctors recommended medication but I chose meditation instead.  3 weeks in and I have been able to control these attacks thus far.  I will update my review in a year's time.  I really love this app.  The guidance is soothing and informative.  Who knew an almost 40 year old blue collar guy could benefit from such practices?!  By the way, I use it while walking, before bed, and after breakfast while the house is still quiet.  I have also been eating better and spending time in the kitchen cooking to keep my mind busy on more important things.  This app has taught me to control my thoughts.  I wish it was around when I was in my 20's!  My life would have been much improved.  Try it.  Buy it!
title: Money well spent

review: This app seems like it WOULD be cool.  Of course, it would only make sense to have ALL the features unlocked for the 7 day trial period before charging $80 for a year subscription.  I mean, let‚Äôs be real.  How can you guys charge that much for something that is predominantly locked throughout the app?  Very disappointing, and frankly, I feel like I‚Äôm getting hustled.  Everyone knows you let the consumer try it first with all the premium features before charging a whopping $80! Honestly, this app should be free with ‚Äúin-app‚Äù purchases.  Is it only for people that have $80 to gamble that most likely have million dollar estates or are the ones riding their Peleton bike overlooking the city lights in their high-rise condos?  Jk Do not get me wrong.  I am looking for the benefits from this app which I am sure it can provide because I see all the great features I love.  Unfortunately, all those features are locked which is dumb.  Please fix this because I‚Äôm sure u guys deserve a 5 star but I guess I will never know.
title: Free trial?

review:
This app is just unbelievable. I am a mom of two, ages 16 & 6, and I am also a special ed teacher, and I use this app both at home snd with my students!! Both of my kids have sensory issues as well as OCD, ADHD, and severe anxiety. My daughter‚Äôs needs are more severe than my sons are, and over this past year, there were some nights where this app was the only thing that got my daughter to sleep. She particularly loves the Disney lullabies and the Matthew 
mcconaughey sleep story... can you blame her?! ü§£üôÉüòâ haha JK...  but seriously, they are so relaxing ... I even enjoy the sleep stories!!

I was fortunate enough to receive a subscription for free when Calm was doing the give away for teachers years ago; however, even if I hadn‚Äôt gotten it for free, I would pay for it in a heartbeat!! One of the best apps we own, even if we don‚Äôt always use it!!
title: Amazing!!

review: Love the app. However, this app is so slow when I need it the most to relax the other day. My Verizon internet and home Wi-Fi is the highest data I have and yet it‚Äôs so slow to load, it was waiting and waiting to load the sounds of the forest and I was so the opposite of calm. Maybe to many folks are on the servers at the same time? I‚Äôve read so many reviews about folks complaining that there is a fee to pay for an app service, my suggestion is to do research on what‚Äôs involved in app and software development. The amount of money Involved creating an app Is expensive, the developer has to pay huge fees every month in addition to the employees they hire to create quality content and research as well. Life is not free! Free apps are not that great, this is a great app but just too many folks on there server is causing lag on my end.
title: SLOW!

review: I love this app and have been using it since 2016. I feel like I know Tamara haha! My only complaint is that the new home screen is way too cluttered. It seems like a small thing, but visually it‚Äôs not very calming. I liked it better when the home screen just showed the Daily Calm and you could find other meditations on a different button. There should be a section for ‚ÄúNew Meditations‚Äù so we can see the updates and new additions, but it‚Äôs my strong personal opinion that the home page now looks way too hectic for a meditation app. It‚Äôs bugged me enough for the past few months that I finally wrote a review. But I recommend this app to everyone, I absolutely can‚Äôt say enough good things about the meditations/backgrounds/music- keep doing awesome things, and please simplify home screen!
title: Please change home screen!

review: I‚Äôm a user for years now and these are some of my reflections. The thing about meditation is that you probably have all the tools without this app. What I appreciate is Tamara‚Äôs voice (the main person doing the guided meditations) and the topics that change everyday. Kind of like a meditation plus someone telling you to be in the present and that your feelings are valid. There is also other things they‚Äôve added over the years like soundscapes and sleep stories and music. Since I‚Äôve been working on my mediation practice I appreciate that it logs your sessions. Also, maybe it‚Äôs just me but it feels satisfying to see the quote and image after you finish your meditation for the day (it feels like a reward,  but it‚Äôs really a reminder of that day‚Äôs lesson).
title: We need this. You need this.

review:
Calm has officially become my favorite app. I never thought I could meditate and develop mindfulness...Calm thankfully proved me wrong.  It has helped me sleep, reduce my anxiety, improve my depression, and reduce impulsive/reactive behavior.  In short, Calm has helped me a calmer person. I‚Äôm excited to see where this journey will go.  If you are in CBT (and definitely if you are in DBT), this will greatly help you overcome negative thought patterns.

For beginners, do the 7 days of calm.  Then do the 21 days of calm.  If you need, repeat the 21 days of calm. This will train you with the ability of basic meditation.  If you commit to improving your mental and spiritual health.  

Final advice, don‚Äôt buy the app right away.  If you wait, you will get an email for 40% off an annual membership.  Then, take advantage of that membership and commit to changing your life.
title: Amazing!  My favorite app.

review:
I have tried a few meditation and sleeping apps, and this is by far my favorite. There are many ways to meditate with this app, with different voices and messages, and I love that. 
There are also many sleep stories that I enjoy and listen to over and over and sometimes I can repeat every word, but that‚Äôs ok; I still seem to fall asleep before the end of the story. Even if I don‚Äôt, I know, there will be another one right behind it to help me fall into slumber.
Another great feature of this app are the soundscapes. My favorite is the crashing waves, and the gently falling rain. 
For any mood you are in, you can find a sound, story, or meditation to help you relax and destress. I highly recommend this app and thinking it‚Äôs worth every penny and I hope you agree.
title: I love this app!

review:
Hello, I‚Äôm Jessica mother of Amy (age 5) and Molly (age 3) now tonight my children decided they wanted to listen to Snow White but when we searched we didn‚Äôt see anything so we made a list of tales you should add! First off, Princess and The Frog, my children love this tale and before calm I read it to them almost every night. Second, Goldie Locks, I remember picking Amy up from Pre-K and her telling me all about this story, she was very happy when I bought the book and read it to her and wants it on calm too! Third, Hansel and Gretel, this sweet book made Molly drool about a candy house, so I knew it must be added to calm which hopefully will! Lastly, The Three Billy Goats Gruff, this Story I told Molly when she wasn‚Äôt even two, but I knew she liked it because as I read she giggled happily in her crib. Anyways hopefully you see this. Stay Safe Stay Home.
          -Jessica
title: Sleep

review:
I love the calm app. I use it primarily for white noise to get my baby to sleep (works like a charm!), and periodically for myself for the same reason. I do wish it had a fade out ability, however, in conjunction with the sleep timers. It would be so nice to have it slowly drop in volume down to nothing. This is my biggest wish - it would make falling asleep to the tracks and STAYING asleep so much easier. 

The app also has issues sometimes where it‚Äôll take a few tries to get it to actually play again, or it‚Äôll freeze on one of the sceneries and rotate, but needs to be quit/relaunched to actually function correctly beyond that. Minor bugs, no biggie. 

The various meditative sounds are wonderful, and I‚Äôve used them on really rough days. I genuinely appreciate having an app that slows my brain down.
title: Great save for two things...

review: i‚Äôve been using calm for about over a year now. I started using it back when i went to therapy. During that time period i was really struggling with sleep and had a really rough time trying to figure out how to fix it, then my therapist suggested this app for me and ever since it has truly turned around my sleep schedule. i use it EVERY SINGLE NIGHT to go to sleep. I listen to the same sound every night (rain sounds), and it‚Äôs just so helpful! I‚Äôve struggled with night terrors and rough sleeping my entire life, and have also been taking melatonin since i was about 5 (14 now), and melatonin truly helped until i reached an older age where it just wouldn‚Äôt help me sleep anymore. So since i‚Äôve had this app, things have truly been amazing for me! thank you so much and i TRULY TRULY reccomend! :)
title: this app is absolutely incredible

review:
I love what you‚Äôve done here, everything you guys had on the unlocked free stuff is amazing until you took that away from me. I used this app for years Before you locked every single thing i use in the sounds and music (thats the only thing i use). Before they were locked off, this app was helping me with panic and anxiety attacks during the day and helping me sleep at night. I was perfectly fine using this free and now when i scroll through the sounds to find something that‚Äôll help me again, no joke every singe thing was locked and I actually had the worst mental breakdown in a long time. This was the only app that ever actually helped me, ive gone through so many apps and websites until I found Calm. Now once again i dont have anything to help me and im having panic attacks without anything for relief
I dont want to pay the $60 whatever dollars a year because im so. Flipping. Broke. And so i think ima just give up and suffer through the pain now
title: Was amazing.. at first

review: I just unsubscribed from my yearly subscription because the constant and unavoidable in app notifications were intrusive and the opposite of calming. They include banners that cannot be dismissed without actually listening to new ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù meditations or sleep stories I have zero interest in and green notification badges on the music and stories tabs that alert you every time there is something new. This should be optional. These sorts of notifications are stressful, Fuel tech addiction and a constant feeling of a need to be doing something rather than just be, and are basically fueling the exact fire the app is supposed to help put out. It got to the point that I couldn‚Äôt stand to open the app. I have no interest in paying $100 a year for more unavoidable notifications. I hope the developers take this feedback into account. The ridiculous amount of stress they place on celebrity over quality of content is also off putting.
title: Unsubscribed because of in app notifications

review:
I have a high-stress job, and at an employee wellness seminar, they suggested mindful meditation. Then I saw an ad for this app on Facebook. So I thought, ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù
This app is wonderful. There are sessions for beginners that are a great introduction to the practice. I used the app for two weeks before deciding to upgrade. It‚Äôs 100% worth the steep price. You can choose from a wide variety of background music or nature sounds to play during your session, or choose silence. The sessions run from fully guided to no guide. You can set a timer. You can just do breathing exercises. As someone with anxiety and depression, I absolutely love the courses on gratitude and self-worth. I have definitely noticed a difference in my ability to handle stress and calm myself in hectic moments. I have recommended this app to all my friends and coworkers.
title: Great for beginners or the experienced

review:
I signed up for Calm in late October 2020 during a particularly difficult bout with anxiety. The Breathing Exercises were what drew me initially, because yoga had taught me the importance of regulating my system through the breath. The exercises helped a lot. I quickly found that the Sleep Stories were another instant salve for me in times of need.

At this point I have done countless meditations and a few masterclasses. I have logged over a thousand hours of mindfulness. My daughter loves her nightly Sleep Stories just as much as I do. We daydream about who we‚Äôd like to hear narrate a story, or if we wrote a really relaxing story, would Anna Acton want to record it? :) I just renewed for another year because I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my experiences with Calm.
title: Came for Breathing Exercises, Stayed for Everything

review: I really appreciate all the daily meditations. Each one is unique to the narrator/author and has its own wisdom and insight. I resonate with Jeff Warren the deepest as he reminds me that it‚Äôs not only okay to be me‚Ä¶.it‚Äôs actually pretty friggin‚Äô awesome. Jay has great stories that really help highlight the point he is making. I‚Äôm a big fan of metaphor type learning and often use them in my private practice; so I dig that style. Tamara has a soothing demeanor that always puts me at ease and helps remind me that staying in the moment is always the right place to be. I‚Äôve been listening to the sleep stories for a couple of years and only recently started practicing meditation. Wow, have I been missing out! Thank you for doing what you do. You‚Äôre changing the world one  one listener at a time.
title: The Daily‚Äôs

review: I saw advertisements with very satisfying videos.  One was a long cube being cut into nine thinner blocks.  The other was kind of like traveling through space in a glowing worm hole.  I am in the seven day free trial of the premium and can‚Äôt find those.  They were so satisfying to watch.  I want to watch them over and over.  I listened to a sleep story last night, it relaxed me but did not put me to sleep.  The guided meditations are nice.  The only way I will possibly pay for this is if you show me what I came for.  Also, hot tip... if you want to pay for a year, cancel the app and you get  a thirty percent off offer immediately. If you go into your iTunes subscriptions, there are several different prices for a one year subscription to premium.  Discount baby!
title: Can‚Äôt find what I came for

review:
From the moment of my first meditation session I‚Äôve been hooked! I have Tourette Syndrome so my mind is constantly stressed and on high-alert. However, I found that during mediating, my motor tics vanished! I admit, I had my doubts about this app. I‚Äôm usually not too good at mediating and it sometimes brought me more stress than relaxation. But the narrator walks you through it and keeps you focused and calm. It‚Äôs like you step outside of your body and go to a sort of spiritual place. You won‚Äôt believe it until you try it and I highly recommend that you do! 

Great for stress, trouble sleeping, sadness, reducing stress from  Tourette Syndrome (and things alike), etc. Basically, if you‚Äôre feeling down, angry, stressed, guilty, grief, lost, or overall just not good‚Äîthen this app is definitely for you!
title: Never been so calm!

review: I‚Äôm deeply in love with this app. I‚Äôm a man with high functioning Autism, ‚ÄúAspergers.‚Äù I am most thankful for it when my panic attacks start up, or when my fears and stressors kick in. But I would love this even more if only I could still use is while my phone screen is locked, and maybe if while I have to respond to a text ect. that it would continue to play in the background, instead of cutting off. Maybe if it played in the background until I decided to close out the app, after satisfying my purpose. It would be an even better experience for me, and maybe some others who might agree. But that would be my only advice and or adjustment to an otherwise perfect app. I‚Äôm a fan for life. God bless.
title: I just wish it could play while my phone is locked.

developerResponse: {'id': 7089746, 'body': 'Hi there, we offer a free version of the app in addition to the free trial and paid subscription. You can see our full list of free content here: https://support.calm.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008536834-What-is-included-in-the-free-version-of-the-app-What-is-included-in-Calm-Premium-. Reach out to support@calm.com with any questions!', 'modified': '2019-01-31T00:01:27Z'}
review: I love the idea of this app, even after downloading and discovering what is available to you. BUT! The options I have are very very limited if I don‚Äôt pay for the premium Calm experience. Just like every other app, I am fully aware you can‚Äôt get the best of it without paying for a premium version, but with this app, your options are SO limited that you barely even have options if you don‚Äôt pay for premium. I can only listen to 1 story if I don‚Äôt pay for the premium version, and every other category options are just the same amount of limited. I was going to give this 3 stars for the regular version and not the premium version, but after further exploration on the app, I found myself even more disappointed with how many options I DONT have because I didn‚Äôt pay for premium. Other apps will let you explore more even without the premium version, but this one does not do that. Thanks for taking the time to read my review.
title: A little disappointed

review: I would rate this app a 3/3.5 because I was very disappointed how it said it was ‚Äúfree‚Äù but you literally almost have to pay to do anything on it. For the free users, I do not recommend this because the lack of variety. If you are purchasing the app it would be a much better experience. I had a difficult time using the app because it was a little hard to navigate because of all the different things that was offered (for the purchasers only). This app did not do much to my sleep. It helps me fall asleep faster because I was focused on the meditation. I got my normal sleep and there was not a massive difference. The appearance of the app was very pleasant at first then it got overwhelming to look at because of all the options it gave the purchasers. Overall, I would not recommend this app if you do not a plan on purchasing the full membership of it that includes all of its best features.
title: Lack of variety for free users

review:
I've had to medicate myself to get to sleep for a very long time. I tried this app and loved the stories. I decided to splurge on the premium features (I rarely spend money on apps) and see how it went. That was a year ago and I just renewed my subscription. I plan on making better use of the meditation portions this year. The sleep stories are wonderful though and I would happily pay for this app for just that! Lots of different story readers to choose from so you know you'll find a voice that relaxes you. I can now sleep without sleeping aids! It's wonderful! Thank you!!!

Edit : I would love a section to track my mood and basically use as a journal. It would be really interesting to see the correlation between days where I meditate and days I don't and how it affects my mood.
title: Worth it for sleep stories alone!

review:
I really love this app. I am a combat veteran who suffers from chronic depression and meditating has really helped me deal with my anger, anxiety and depression. This app has been a big party of my recovery process however, twice now I have been in the middle of a session and the app has locked on me saying I need to upgrade to their yearly subscription. 

This has not been a suggestion the app would not let me access my current meditation sessions and unfortunately in both occasions it has happened when I was at very desperate moment. 

I think it is extremely unprofessional for this service to lock me out of my account when I paying for a service only because you want me to upgrade. In fact I‚Äôm positive it‚Äôs an infringement of a our contract. I will be contacting the app company to further inquire.
title: Amazing app No professionalism

review: The app is great and calming, and it‚Äôs a nice way to track thoughts and sleep patterns. But the one thing I don‚Äôt like is that you need to pay money to do 95% of the stuff. Some of the only things you can do are the quotes and the ‚Äú7 days of happiness.‚Äù But the reason I gave it 4 stars is the check-ins. It‚Äôs a nice way to track your thoughts, sleep patterns and to center yourself. I find it calming to do right before bed because I can get out my thought for a peaceful sleep. It can also track your sleep quality and you can tell them what variables made your sleep good or bad. This is extremely helpful because then you know what to do and what not to do. I am using the free version and getting along fine so far, but it is frustrating how little you can actually do without paying like 70 dollars a year.
title: Great app but

review: I want to rate this app higher, because I use it daily and find it useful, but Tamara Levitt‚Äôs syrupy delivery makes me feel like I‚Äôm a kindergartner, and I have trouble getting through some of her meditations due to the way she speaks. I‚Äôm often so distracted by my annoyance with her that the meditation is worthless. I understand the irony that I‚Äôm supposed to be learning equanimity via meditation to deal with feelings like this, but I guess I‚Äôm just not that advanced yet. She ends every meditation with ‚Äúwiggle your fingers and toes‚Äù as if we‚Äôve been taking a break on our nap mats and it‚Äôs time to get up for our juice boxes. I like the content of her sessions, I just don‚Äôt like her delivery. On the other hand, Jeff Warren is great. I wish he had more sessions on here. I paid the annual fee for the app, which is why I‚Äôm still using it, but I doubt I‚Äôll renew unless they change things up a bit.
title: Needs more narrators

review: I‚Äôm someone who suffers from immense anxiety, insomnia, and just an overall lack of being able to relax. I downloaded the calm app one night when I couldn‚Äôt sleep, yet again, and I turned on one of the sleep stories and was asleep in minutes. Not only that but I stayed asleep the whole night! I woke up in the morning refreshed and so I thought I would try one of the daily meditations. After my first daily meditation, I understood why people make this regular practice. I love that this app keeps me on track and reminds me to check in with myself, complete my meditations, and also has an abundance of sleep stories to chose from. In doing my check-ins, I can actually see how in one week I have gone from overall very anxious, worried, and stressed to calm, happy, and grateful.
title: Could not recommend this more

review:
I gave the app calm a 5 star rateing because it has so many different ways to keep you calm you should definitely download the app calm if you have trouble getting relaxed or calm.

P.s. title: Calm app

review:
Still my favorite meditation app but I have an iPhone and had many downloaded on my phone. Have always paid for the app after realizing how well it worked. Well now it won‚Äôt let me keep the downloaded daily meditations I loved. Before you could download them to the iPhone. Now it doesn‚Äôt which sticks cause spending a lot of time in areas without service (you know nature lol) I‚Äôm not able to access all my favorite daily meditations which before I was able to access and have it downloaded. Please change this back so I and others can access these daily meditations offline and I can switch back to a 5 star review. This was a huge selling point for me and truly unfortunate it has been switched. 
Still a great meditation app and can still download the programmed meditations.

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app now for three years. It was great till about two updates ago where after the sleep meditation then all background sounds of the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù stop when the meditation ended. They said, tech support, I could download the mountain lake and adjust the settings. Well there is no option for that for the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù background sounds. I‚Äôve told them now once a week since this changed. And still no movement on getting this option for the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù background to be set to continuously play throughout the night.

Maybe this review will get a better response.
title: Changed there formate on no option to have the mountain lake continue

review:
When I was looking for a good meditation app last year, I tried out maybe 4-5 of the most popular ones in the app store and found that Calm had the most pleasing audio narrations and visual design out of all of them and was also the most usable. And it works!  Over the course of the past 13 months, Calm has helped me go from just a handful of 10-minute sessions per month initially, to now meditating for 30-45 min each morning for 28 out of the past 30 days. (My only complaint is I hate these prompts for app store reviews, especially at the end of a session! Hopefully they go away now that I've left one?)

Also, as a suggestion, I'd love to see some basic data visualization to track my progress, eg, # of sessions per month or total time per month, graphed over time.
title: Best meditation app, in my opinion

review: I started using the calm app when I was struggling and things were falling apart. Now I start my day off by meditating with the calm app. I listen to Tamar‚Äôs daily calm and it helps me to focus on what I want to concentrate for self improvement. Calm has helped me to make self care a priority which has improved my relationships with my family and friend. I live more in the moment that helps me to respond with kindness and compassion instead of react with anger and hurt. I now enjoy my own company and am learning to treat myself like I would treat my friends. Calm app has gently encouraged me to reflect on myself and the positive changes just followed. I look forward each morning to start my day listening to Tamara and then now also squeeze in Daily Jay and session with Jeff.
title: First Thing First

review: This app helps me break away from many things that are just thoughts going throughout my head. When my mind is filled with nothingness besides my own feeling of my body and sensations, I‚Äôm not only able to make the best judgement and decisions for myself, but for everyone around me. Mediation is tricky, sometimes you think you‚Äôre too busy for it, or that you‚Äôll be, okay, since you had a great, successful day, but those days add up to bigger picture of peacefulness. Able to focus on you and not the superficial things around you, since all you really can control is how you react to certain things. The first month ive ever tried this, it truly brought peace to my mind so much, tears of joy and calmness dripped onto my jaw!  Thank you Calm and Tamara Levitt!!!!
title: Fluidity

review: Every morning, minus just a few days, for more than a year, I begin my day with a guided meditation from CALM, usually with Jeff Warren.  I have spent so much time with him, I feel like I know him.  The experience has truly been transformative.  I began meditating on the advice of a counselor after experiencing a panic attack on an airplane. I have never had mental health issues and at 58 yoa, it came as a shock.  Not only has the meditation practice helped relieve my General Panic Disorder; but it has made me a much better person; and these are the words of my wife of 35 years and my adult children.  This has lead me down a path where I am now taking mindfulness classes in order to hopefully bring these tools to friends and colleagues.  Thank you Jeff and everyone at CALM!
title: Life Changing Experience

review:
Teachers - it‚Äôs free! There is an ENTIRE section for kids of all ages, through college, in addition to the adult courses.

For anyone else, spend the $60 and challenge yourself to listen to just one 12 minute Daily Calm per day. It‚Äôll even remind you at set times.

Before you know it, you will want to go thru all the vast and constantly growing content.

The MasterClasses are fantastic, especially the one on Discovering Happiness. Between meditations on different subjects to short guided yoga segments to OMG the Sleep Stories - this app has honestly changed my life and how I am dealing with every single thing in life, good, bad and ugly. 

There is something for every part of the day. Most segments are a bit over ten minutes but there are longer as well.  There are too many options to list! And even just the sounds (waves to lakes to cat purring) are great to have in the background, especially if like me, you get a little overstimulated and benefit from gentle white noise as a reminder to slow down.

I am so in love with this app!!! Best $60 I‚Äôve spent in ages, although I originally thought it was billed $5/month. At least it prompts me to get as much as I can out of it. 

Make the investment in YOU. I promise you won‚Äôt regret it.
title: Change Your Life

review:
I love Calm, and I love how you‚Äôre continually adding great stuff! But the more you add, the harder it becomes to find what I‚Äôm looking for. Will you please consider added ‚ÄúFavorites‚Äù to the MAIN menu, rather than having to dig for it. What‚Äôs the point of favoriting things if you can never find them?
For example, on the iPad app there is a side menu. Just add it there, so it only takes me ONE click to find what I want. On the iPhone app, place a little ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù box right there under the Daily Calm, alongside the other main menu boxes. 
Please consider this. Your app is becoming way to unwieldy to manage and a favorites option would save us so many clicks. I realize you want people to ‚Äúdiscover‚Äù new stuff, and that‚Äôs fine sometimes. But most of the time, I just want to go directly to my stuff. Thanks.
title: Link to favorites

review:
Calm was my first introduction to meditation, and I‚Äôm still using it one year later. Thank you! Really good guidance for beginners and those growing their practices. A wide variety of themes makes it easy to customize my practice. 

The app is continually improving with new content, more organization, and bug fixes. 

ONE big request: on the Streak stat page, consider highlighting he current streak instead of the overall longest streak. Or hide the longest streak in a menu option that people can look up if they want. The purpose is to stay present feel accomplishment in any current streak, even if it‚Äôs small‚Äîand not be tempted to compare it to my longest past streak and feel bad. It‚Äôs still nice to know the longest, but would prefer on a voluntary basis
title: suggest de-emphasizing longest streak in favor of current streak as part of being present :)

review: I‚Äôve been using this app every night for a week now and I will say that when it comes to the story section, majority of the people they have reading those stories don‚Äôt really have a soothing, soft voice to help put you to sleep and I‚Äôve seen others complain about that feature also so hopefully they can make some changes. I love the nature sounds like rain and campfire especially since I can set a timer and they will continue to play even when I exit the app! Another thing I love is the lullaby section but I‚Äôm so disappointed that there‚Äôs only 4 to choose from and the only one that puts me to bed/makes me tired is lullaby to the stars. PLEASE add more lullabies that are softer and mellow like lullaby to the stars but please more lullabies would be amazing!!! Overall the app is good but considering I paid for the premium I just wish there were more sounds to choose from
title: Love this app but needs improvements

review: I could never recommend this enough. I have adhd and anxiety. Falling asleep some nights seems impossible with all of my racing thoughts and restlessness, and I have used medicinal sleep aids, meditation, reading by nightlight, and every other solution available before I found calm. The sleep stories give me just enough stimulus that I can tune out my thoughts and lull myself to sleep. I would never have dreamed of a solution with such simple effectiveness as the calm app.  I have been using this app for 3 years, and have always listened to the same story, Blue Gold by Phoebe Smith. I can quote the first half word for word, but to this day I have never heard how the story ends. So rarely do I have to resort to medicine anymore. Thank you creators!!
title: I‚Äôve never heard the end of my story once!

review: I‚Äôve been trying to deal with my anxiety and find ways to calm my mind, and my Apple Health app recommended Calm.  The layout is pretty user friendly and I adore the nature sounds. My major complaint is that the majority of the content is locked by the paywall of Calm Premium. They only have one day locked for a couple of sessions, which makes little sense to me.  I wish that they had a couple of full sessions and stories up for free as a better way to get people to subscribe.  Speaking of that, I also wish they had a monthly subscription.  Not everyone can shell out $70 at any time.  Despite these drawbacks, I‚Äôm still making use of the app. The Breathe feature allows me to select a scene and just breathe and focus on myself for a few minutes.  I‚Äôm sure the other features are great, but I have no way of knowing because I can‚Äôt afford that annual fee.  Add a monthly fee and I‚Äôll be a happy lady!
title: A pretty cool app (but for a price)

review: Calm is an absolutely amazing app! I just got it and I can already tell that‚Äôs going to help me immensely with my anxiety! All of my feelings get welled up at night and a meditation is extremely helpful to help release all of that stress that I‚Äôm feeling for the upcoming day! However I would like to note, that without premium Calm, you‚Äôre not really going to get anything out of the app at all. Now there is nothing wrong with this ! But I just wanted to let everyone know! Please buy the premium Calm!!! There are so many stories, meditations, and stretching sessions available! I highly recommend this app! And I‚Äôve just started! I can‚Äôt wait to see what else it has in store! I will write another review if anything changes!

review: I have been using Calm for just over a year and my goodness what a wonderful thing meditation is using Calm. I am a 57 year old male with undiagnosed ADD, I have been dealing with Depression, Anxiety, thoughts of Suicide and just overall mental health issues for ALL of my life. I started Calm and I was skeptical and played around with it for the first few months and didn‚Äôt think it would really help. Well I am here to tell you that the meditation instructors at Calm for the best. Yes, I tried other meditation methods and apps. But, Calm is in my opinion the best. So do yourself a favor and give it time don‚Äôt give up and focus on your Self-Care using Calm and you will reap the benefits of using Calm. I am in such a better place now. I am not sure where I would be without Calm. Thank You !!
title: Give it TIME!

review:
When I say a use calm everyday and night I mean it. It‚Äôs helped me with my anxiety so much. I feel so much more relaxed then before. I have had calm for almost two years now and decided to finally write a review since it‚Äôs so good. Everything about calm makes you feel like everything‚Äôs going to be okay and that your also being wrapped up in a warm hug!

A suggestion: Since I have zero complaints, here‚Äôs a little thing for a sound series since you do some with pop music and such as calm remixes. Try to do some anime songs as a slowed down and calmer version. I bet there are more people out there who would want this as anime can be a sort of relief and break from reality and I find if it were mixed with calm it would be so much better ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Thank you

review:
I just can‚Äôt handle the voice that Tamara uses in her meditations. I wish I had realized how much of the content in the app is with her reading before buying a year. I have no ill will towards Tamara herself, and she seems to be a wonderful person. 

But she puts on this fake voice when she does her readings, and it just sounds like the least genuine thing I‚Äôve ever heard. It completely pulls me out of meditating because it feels so forced and fake. I put on Wind in the Willows for my daughter and Tamara‚Äôs voice sounded borderline inappropriate for kids with how breathy and passionate she tries to sound. 

Tamara, with all respect, PLEASE consider using your normal speaking voice which is already perfectly pleasant! You already have a lovely voice! You don‚Äôt need to go so hard with the breathy false enthusiasm. It genuinely is a deal breaker for so much of the app‚Äôs content and it bums me out.
title: Sorry, Tamara :(

review: I tried Calm because my therapist thinks I can benefit from meditation.  I was skeptical since I tried some meditation tapes and they made my anxiety worse!  I put on one of their meditation and I felt so much more calm and relaxed afterwards, their stories help me fall asleep on nights when I just couldn‚Äôt settle down and they even have music and meditation for every mood.  I even played the baby shh (one of the sounds they have on there) for my fussy 2 month old niece when she, my brother and sister-in-law came to visit and she settled down and fell asleep quickly!  I am glad they have the option to pay for a yearly subscription as there is no way I can pay monthly.  I highly recommend this app for those who suffer from anxiety, depression and any type of mental illness.  This really does work!
title: I love Calm!

review: I love this app for so many reasons. I love the appearance of the app, I love the different backgrounds and music that you can choose. I love that you can choose meditations based on how you are feeling and what you need at the moment. I love how the calendar keeps track of your meditation practice and it's especially nice that it will let you know when you're on a multi day streak (that makes me even more likely to meditate as it's like a reward to see that pop up after a meditation). I love how after any meditation the daily quote pops up. I love the mindfulness reminder that I've set to keep me on track. I love the woman's voice on the meditations (and I can be very sensitive and picky about voices). I love that there are night stories and many to choose from. This is a great app, I highly recommend it.
title: This app is wonderful.

review: I started using the calm app in November 2022. It works very well depending on the reader you choose. I was never able to sleep because of my clustered thoughts that only come up every night. Calm helps me focus on the story and the reader‚Äôs voice. I wish I was able to get the calm app earlier and focus on a good nights rest. The reader‚Äôs voices are wonderful and calm, and the story is just as perfect. I would never be picky on a certain story. Instead, I would pick a random story and feel comfortable. In the morning, I love doing the breathing and meditation sessions. It prepares me right for the day, and helps me focus on work and being able to interact with other people and friends. Thank you calm for this wonderful experience you gave me! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: This is AMAZING ü§©ü§©ü§©

review: It was down to 3 stars at this time last year. Content had taken a nosedive. I was bored and losing value. Understandably, times were and are tough. You stepped it up in the past six months but Jeff Warren has been a game changer. Real, accessible, fun, calm, differentiated and tangible learnings. Scripted, but unscripted in delivery. Not in the perfect lulu gear. Great job‚Äîsomeone who sounds like you, with vulnerabilities AND higher teachings. Now please decrease the random music and enrich the areas of the app that reinforce why we came. 5 stars for the daily trip, but please simplify. The most critical categories under the meditation tab are really thin and stale. Thanks for all you do and for also providing even a few nights where our children can dream in color‚Ä¶
title: Don‚Äôt ever take away Jeff Warren

review: I absolutely LOVE how these 10 mins sessions are designed. So effective and can easily fit in my morning routines, I rarely start my day without it now.  I love the beautiful combination of silence mediation/breath work and the inclusion of a strong moral message of the day at the end of each session. I have been using it for over a  year now, however I am excited to yet explore the other aspects of the app, that are geared to other parts of the day/emotions.  Tamara‚Äôs voice is so calming ( good choice of app name ;) and I really appreciate when she uses her own stories for the listener to resonate with. I salute you Tamara for carefully curating the lessons here and spreading the positivity  we need to love and accept ourselves first in order to give it back to the world. Thank you. Bless you and your beautiful efforts.
title: The best mediation app there is

review: I don‚Äôt ever write reviews on apps, this is the first one that I have ever done, so this app is saying a lot already. I am a 25 y/o male and I‚Äôve been struggling with self esteem & confidence issues for pretty much my whole life. About 3 months ago I started religiously meditating daily, not kidding you, its a boost to my self, everyday. It‚Äôs one of those things that if you don‚Äôt do it for the day, it gives you the consciousness to know that you could feel better by meditating.. when you‚Äôre feeling down, feeling stressed, not worth it, or just literally anything, Calm has a meditation for it. If this is your first time learning to meditate, give this app a shot and stick with it. It‚Äôs literally like an inner super power. Good luck with your self improvement! Much love!
title: Meditation will change your life for the best, I‚Äôm not kidding.

review: A friend at work told me about Calm. I have been experiencing anxiety and wanted to try meditating. I want going to take a class, but this app came along. First, I used the free options: falling asleep to the stories (I love this! Like being a kid.  It is really soothing!) & meditations in the morning. I could feel a difference in how I was feeling in a few days, so I paid for the yearly subscription. Probably the cost of two sessions with a teacher. Now, I meditate every morning (daily calm and one other, depending on how I'm feeling) and it starts my day in new frame of mind. My husband has been doing them with me, too.  He was never interested in anything like this. I recommend this app to anyone looking to try meditation and sleep better. It's a part of my daily life now and it's making my life better!
title: Excellent

developerResponse: {'id': 2393986, 'body': "Sorry for the trouble! Please email support@calm.com and we'd be happy to look into this for you.", 'modified': '2018-01-24T20:03:38Z'}
review:
This has been plagued with bugs for some time now and maybe it would be better if I paid for it, but I agree with others, the price is ridiculous. For a while it wouldn‚Äôt open at all, I‚Äôve reinstalled several times and now I can‚Äôt sign in because another button is on top of the sign in button or the ad to buy a subscription won‚Äôt go away. Completely useless! Here was my original review which moves the rating from 5 stars to 1: Whether you are new to meditation, and have no clue where to start, or are skilled, and simply want timers, this app is perfect...and I have only used the free parts of it so far!
Update: The developer contacted me and for now the app is working, but even the link they sent in my email wouldn‚Äôt work, so apparently there have been a lot of changes and bugs are being worked out, we shall see üòâ Meditation shouldn‚Äôt be so stressful to achieve.
title: Re-testing

review: I arrived in my senior years worn out and discouraged. My life was changing fast and I didn‚Äôt quite know what to do. My head began to spin as it always did at times like these. Then I read somewhere that mindfulness, and staying in the moment where essential for health and adjustment. I googled ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù and the first thing that came up was this app, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù.After a few meditations I knew that I had to you invest in my own health and from the very start I begin relaxing, learning how to stay in a moment, learning how to calm myself down, and learning how to participate in my own life at this age. So I thank ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù so much for this opportunity. I am a senior and my life has changed, slowly and thoroughly, in many details, because of this app called ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù .
title: Calm is a life changer

review: I‚Äôve struggled with falling asleep for most of my life, where it sometimes takes hours. I do have bouts of not being able to sleep at all. I‚Äôm not sure how this will do during those more intense times, BUT the sleep stories have knocked me out twice now and that is a MIRACLE. I love the celebrity stories and how well they tell them. I‚Äôve always been one to hyper focus on my thoughts or get lost in my day dreams or an annoying sounds so I never thought a sleep story would work, but I realized when I started to fall asleep during a lecture (while I was in my bed) that if I try to focus on something kinda boring I might be able to pass out üòÇ helps my mind not hyper focus! I‚Äôm still in the 7 day free trial so it doesn‚Äôt hurt to try!!
title: Sleep stories!!

review: I‚Äôm not happy with the new look of the home page. You‚Äôve tried to cram too much content on that page so that it now looks busy and cluttered, which is exactly the opposite of the name and theory behind calm. It‚Äôs also harder to find past episodes of the Daily Calm. Before the change, if I missed a session w Tamara or Jeff, I could simply scroll down to where their recent episodes‚Ä¶ the ones I hadn‚Äôt listened to yet‚Ä¶ were grouped. Now I have to leave the homepage to search for them. I get that you‚Äôre trying to offer new options to clients, but putting too many options on the home page makes it harder to find the stuff I come here for‚Ä¶ maybe rethink the design of the app? More choices are not necessarily better‚Ä¶
title: New Homepage

review: I have no regret with downloading this app. This app is so helpful when I am doing work or school and I just need a break from it all. I love all the scenes and sounds you can choose from! My favorite one is the fireplace! My recommendations would be to unlock more of the stories and sleep sounds and maybe add more mood check inns? I am not saying this to be critical at all because I love this app! Just a recommendation! My mom was actually the one who told me to download this app! She uses it all the time! Thank you so much for creating this app it helps me so much! I just started listening to the sleep stories on meditating because I have a lot going on in the pandemic and it helps so much! The creators did a great job in putting their best into this app because this app is the best! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: I love this app!

review: I bought this app during a deployment that was not very easy to get some shut eye. Being military, your body is pretty much trained to pass out whenever your not moving, however after the last few years of deploying, time zone changes, shift swaps, inconsiderate wall mates and the lack of understanding of ‚Äò24 hour quite hours‚Äô i needed something to help relax. This app, paired with Bose noise canceling headphones has saved my sanity. Throw on some bob ross or another wonderful sleep story, let the soothing sounds wash over you and drown out all the mindless chatter of the day. I also love that it plays a ‚Äòscene‚Äô afterwords, needing a constant ‚Äòsound‚Äô to over power the noises outside without being too much and this is perfect. Honestly I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôd do without this app, especially overseas
title: CAN NOT LIVE WITHOUT THIS APP

review:
I got a free Headspace account through work, but I ended up paying for Calm because I prefer it and ended up using it way more often. I find the guided meditations better suited for what I want in my meditation time  - A little less talking, more breathing, a choice between a female and male narration (I find the female voice to be less judgmental for some reason) and topic-focused, CBT-based thought reframing. I feel more centered and inspired after each session!

The sleep stories and sleep sound libraries have become a favorite feature I didn‚Äôt know I wanted. I‚Äôve been having some stress-related insomnia here and there, and the bedtime audio options pair really well with a lavender essential oil diffuser for relaxation and creating an enjoyable sleep hygiene routine. 

Keep it up, Calm team! I love this product.
title: Calm > Headspace

review: For the past 4-5 years I have had sleep insomnia, I‚Äôll lay down in bed early, turn everything off, relax and get comfortable, and still my wheels turn for hours. When I do fall asleep I never dream, and I wake up about every hour tossing and turning, even if initially falling asleep on my back. I tried this app by referral, and the first thing I listened to was ‚ÄúWonder‚Äù narrated by Matthew Mcconaughey. I‚Äôm still not exactly sure how, but I must‚Äôve fallen asleep shortly before the story was over. I had a dream that seemed to make up for the past few years because it went on forever. I slept for 7 hours, only waking up twice. Needless to say, I will be using this app regularly. I‚Äôm very grateful for everyone who puts effort into this app. As cheesy as it may sound, it‚Äôs changing my life.
title: Calm changed my life.. literally!

review:
My husband passed away unexpectedly, and I immediately started waking up after being asleep for a couple of hours and not being able to fall back asleep. I became desperate to figure out how to get back to sleep fast.

That‚Äôs when I searched for sleep apps and liked the way Calm sounded.

I don‚Äôt know what I would do without the sleep stories. I put one on when I wake up at night and within 5 to 10 minutes I‚Äôm back asleep. They constantly add new ones,  and I really love the travel ones. They also have sleep meditations that work great too. I don‚Äôt like hokey meditations as I am a Christian. These are straight forward and practical. They have fantastic meditation series for daytime that as a bonus helps me stay focused as well as help to cope with grief and anxiety. 

If I‚Äôm waiting somewhere like a doctors office, they have master classes on different subjects like parenting that I can listen to as well.

This app is a must have if you struggle to go to sleep or stay asleep or simply want to help stay in control more of your emotions. It is truly a God send and a blessing worth every penny.

I‚Äôm so grateful for it as it has changed our lives. My daughter loves the kids bedtime stories too.
title: A lifesaver for going back to sleep

review: Sometimes life sends you a lesson so overwhelming you want to roll up, hide and never come out. This app as part of my morning routine and evening sleep helped to root me in being present and mindful so that I could take the action I needed to make a comeback. I‚Äôm so grateful for this app. I do use a couple of others as well but Calm offers a wide range of what you need. *My only hint to any of you is this ** while you‚Äôre pursuing clam and peace take note that it is present and presence as well as curiosity and acceptance of self that you‚Äôre after. This is what give you the calm before taking action. And, taking action as a centered person who knows who you are and your beliefs, is what will give you more growth and satisfaction in life. I wish you all well. Holly from ComebackMama
title: Helped me make the comeback in ComebackMama

review: This is a well thought out application for meditation and has strong anchors in psychology..  As a psychologist I weekly recommend this app to my patients to use to quell and address anxiety and sleep issues.  The research is sound and the principals realistically discuss that facing and accepting anxiety (however paradioical) works!  I like how the app states to accept the thought and to let it float on by.  Awareness is a strong tool in strengthening our self esteem.  Self care makes us stronger and more compassionate individuals where we can give back and support our families, friends and communities.  This is positive psychology in its truest form.  Keep up the good work.  Now for more programs for kids and teens.   And perhaps setting up meditation centers in schools.  Excellent and well thought out.  Thanks for all of your hard work
title: Excellent app -

review:
Calm app is awesome for when it is thundering outside because I can put sounds on. Calm covers every need I have especially considering I get frustrated easily. My counselor showed me this app, and I loved it. The only thing is that whenever you log in, sometimes it just glitches you right back out of the app. About every year there is also this time, and for about a week calm just freezes and kicks me out of the app. You also have to pay to use calm for a year. If you don‚Äôt pay, it will only give you like 1 soundscape, 1 song, 1 book ETC. So I wish calm could not have the membership part, and I wish calm will one day fix all the glitches that come out. Thanks for reading! 
(I still love this app though!!!)
title: Great but...

review: This app has completely changed my life. Ever since I started using it, I now sleep all night without waking up once. Before I would wake up to battle with thoughts about the day ahead or past mistakes or even excited about the next day and wouldn‚Äôt get the rest I needed to face the day. Also the daily meditations have helped me stay focused at work when I need to and give me boost to finish my day without feeling overwhelmed and super tired. The more you practice the more mindful and present you become and this brings you a sense of peace, joy that I had never experienced before. If you are not sure wether to purchase or not, don‚Äôt think about it any more, give it a try you won‚Äôt regret it!
title: Best purchase you will make all year!
