title: Don‚Äôt get this appüëéüèª

review: I‚Äôve had a few meditation apps before. I like this one a lot. My insurance company gave me a free year of the premium. I have been able to pull myself out of triggering moments. I‚Äôve done group meditation in person before and some chanting as well. Personally, I am unable to sit, so I lie down. I also cannot visualize images in my mind. There are plenty of options in this app for simple mindfulness meditations which focus on breathing. My journey thus far has brought up suppressed emotions and tears as well as reset my emotions to a more joyous state even after ten minutes. The variety of teachers makes it a novel experience, so I haven‚Äôt gotten bored yet. I like the simplicity of 10 minute sessions. Makes it easy to stick to a practice.
title: This is great.

review: I love this app so, so, so much.  It has many sessions and options.  Meditations of varying subjects and lengths.  I love Tamara‚Äôs voice.  She‚Äôs so calm and intelligent in her meditation practices knowledge.  I have a lot of stress (husband of 27 years recently blind sided me with divorce papers), fighting depression and bucketfuls of anxiety.  Eating and sleeping issues.  There are mediations covering all those issues and more.  There are sleep story aids, soothing music.  There‚Äôs a calendar to keep track of your sessions.  I use this app everyday day.  Sometimes multiple sessions a day.  Sometimes I like a session so much I will listen to it more than once.  If you‚Äôre looking for soothing, easy, judgement free guided meditation, you can‚Äôt go wrong with Calm.  WELL worth the nominal fee.  I recommend this app to anyone and everyone.
title: The Calm app is essential to my life.

review:
I was gifted Calm as a gift and really enjoyed it initially. However in these uncertain & stress inducing times, Calm has not addressed it. The Daily Calm hasn‚Äôt address it and seems disconnected from what is happening.  This was my meditation app & it‚Äôs very disappointing that there‚Äôs nothing to address the stress and anxiety and roller coaster of emotions that have come with COVID19. 

Additionally, the meditation options have not changed much in the 3+ months that I‚Äôve had the app. The breath of topics are wonderful but once you completed the available meditations, that‚Äôs it, no more are offered. For example, I stared the kids meditation with my daughters and they loved it but there were only 4 sessions offered for their age group & after awhile they refused to repeat the same meditation they had already done that week.  

 It started out very promising but has fallen short. I was very disappointed that the meditation offerings did not grow over time.
title: No COVID19 topics & little new content

review: I needed something. For years I needed centering. I‚Äôve always tried meditating but just couldn‚Äôt make it happen. I started with the free calm app. Tried the 7 days of Calm. 10 minute timed meditations. I skipped days, on days I did practice my mind wandered. Sometimes weeks went by before I practiced again. But every time I did it, it got better. I got more out of it. My anxiety lessened and then disappeared. Joyfulness snuck into my everyday life. Mindfulness has become a daily necessity for me. I just beat my streak and am progressing happily. Currently on a 140 day mindfulness streak and am so thankful for what I have learned through this app. No, you do not need it to practice mindfulness but the guidance has been so beneficial to my daily practice. I will never give this up and am thankful that I found this app.
title: Changed me

review: Thought I would try out the app? (I have trouble sleeping and been depressed lately) Think Again!!!  Unfortunately you can‚Äôt even get a trial unless you have $70 to give them for a 1 year subscription up front?!?!  My first thought when I heard about this app was that someone coming up with this idea would genuinely care and want to help people?!?!  Boy was I WRONG and disappointed when I found out that,  ‚Äúsurprise surprise surprise‚Äù they‚Äôre just like most everyone else and it‚Äôs all about the $$$MONEY$$$!!!!!  These little things are what end up pushing people over the edge... (because now I‚Äôm REALLY not tired and even MORE DEPRESSED) So, Thank You Calm!!!  Your app had the exact opposite effect that I was hoping for and all I did was want to check out what I thought looked and sounded like a great thing? Unfortunately I‚Äôm not rich and apparently they only offer a 1 year and not a monthly subscription? Hope the people that can afford all the good things in life enjoy this as well...  Did Donald Trump invent this app???
title: Greedy

review:
I have anxiety, depression, and nerve pain (peripheral neuropathy). Plus lots of regular life stress with family, work.  Downloaded this app after trying out another one referred by a friend.  That didn‚Äôt work as well for me. 
Was drawn to Calm because of the soothing background options. Used sporadically at first, now I use it in the morning regularly, and at night if I can.  At night I like inner peace and self-care meditations. 
The sleep stories are the best. I have disturbed sleep and wake up around 3 or 4 am. Instead of staying up overthinking and in pain for hours like I used to do, I listen to the nightly sleep story. Now I fall back to sleep within minutes and don‚Äôt get to finish the whole story. Favorites so far have been Bob Ross and Sleeping Beauty read by Nick Viall from The Bachelor.
title: Love it, has helped me so much

review: I've been using the Calm app daily for nearly a year & it has been life-changing. I feel more centered, thought-full, relaxed & well, calm! Each day brings a new topic for meditation with the same very soothing voice--thank you, Tamira. There are multiple choices of sounds & visualizations if you choose to use one. There are many guided meditations with a wide variety of topics. And just when I thought this app was perfection, I find the introduction of Sleep Stories.  I have told several people about this app & they are also finding it beneficial. One parent uses the app with their anxious child. I am gifting this app to two friends for Christmas. My warmest thanks to the folks at Calm for what I consider to be the Best App Ever!
title: An Integral Part of My Day

review: Today in my gratitude journal I noted I‚Äôm grateful for Tamara, a woman I‚Äôve never met and likely never will meet. When I graduated college 26 years ago I meditated for a while and it helped, but alas, I got out of the habit of making time for myself and 25 years went by before I‚Äôd find this app. It‚Äôs wonderful. Tamara is such an excellent guide with her comforting assurances that it‚Äôs okay to be restless or experience whatever emotions are distracting you, and gently bringing you back to the breath. I could go on, but I‚Äôll just finish by saying that Tamara and the other guides are superb and I am starting to love starting my day with Tamara‚Äôs daily calm. Like any other habit it takes time. Please invest that time in yourself because you‚Äôre worth it and you will benefit.
title: Tamara and Calm are Awesome

review: Unfortunately, I had a 50% off 12 month promo and also had asked for a giftcard for Christmas for the year that would be enough to cover the discounted price, which I received. Well Calm does not honor their giftcards the way most businesses do and would not let me redeem my giftcard to pay for the promo (credit card only). It was a waste of money and I lost out on 6 months of this expensive app because they would not honor their own giftcard as a form of payment. Customer service was no help and would not offer to assist me in correcting the matter. Of course giftcards are also non refundable, so it was just a waste. I‚Äôm not even sure how this is legal‚Ä¶ I doubt it is. Once I reached out, I am just in disbelief that they still would not help me or extend my membership by the remaining time at least. This is all so unfortunate since the app itself is nice. The company does not seem to value their customers.
title: Does not honor their gift cards. Poor customer service

review:
I signed up for CALM quite awhile ago.  There are many times I have not been able to go to sleep... my mind is racing with various lists of tasks, projects, paperwork and everyday life responsibilities that have to be tended to.  CALM is my drug free alternative. It is nights like tonight that it gives me the most for my money.  I have my next chemo treatment tomorrow.  There are times when I am okay and can sleep, but recently it hasn‚Äôt been that easy.   So I turn to the app and I am usually out in 15 minutes.  I have yet to make it thru a story.  

I was recently able to use the kids stories on two of my young god children.  I was babysitting one night and they just could not lay down.  I played one of the stories for them... they were not even a year old yet.  I timed it.  SEVEN MINUTES and they were down and out.   SEVEN MINUTES... what a blessing.

I simply love the app.  If you question the benefits of paying for premium membership just keep in mind the monthly fee wouldn‚Äôt even pay for  a month‚Äôs medication so I am just fine paying for
extra content each month.  Especially since I KNOW it works.

Thank  you,
Christina Obenshain
title: Never Hear the Ending

review:
This app is great, and has a wide variety of music, stories and soundscapes for sleeping. I just wish there were a few things. 1. I wish there was a way to load multiple stories at once, like a playlist so they could just start one after the other. 2. I would love it if when you pulled up a story or at the end of a story they had maybe like 3 other story suggestions that were similar to what you had just picked. (Like if I pick ‚Äúdreams‚Äù read by Harry Styles, they would have 3 additional story suggestions that were similar). 
3. I love the stories with music in the background, I would enjoy having this option on more stories. 

Other then that, this is a great app with so many options.
title: App suggestions

review: I have been using Calm for almost a year now to help focus my energy somewhere else when I have late night panic attacks. Distraction techniques and most breathing techniques I learn from therapists or psychology classes I am currently taking do not work for me personally. My mind is too swarmed by my fear that I can‚Äôt focus on anything but that fear. Although calm does use breathing techniques, I believe it is not the ‚Äútraditional‚Äù techniques taught in classes. These breathing techniques have you focus on certain parts of your body instead of your breathing itself. When I focus on my breathing, I actually start worrying if I am breathing enough and it doesn‚Äôt help, but calming my breathing through focusing on relaxing every part of my body helps me a lot!
title: I love the Calm App!

review:
I‚Äôm getting emotional even writing this review!  This app is everything you could want and more. Between the daily mood check ins, the creative calming stories, the playlists, the sleep aids and the master classes, this app is about so much more than ‚Äújust‚Äù meditation. It‚Äôs a full on mental wellness app, giving you the tools to improve your own life. It prompts important thoughts that you would never think of on your own. If you‚Äôre having trouble in any area of life, this can make a difference. 

Spring for the annual premium package. I never ever buy this kind of stuff but this was so worth it!  I think it was only like $60? And it gives you access to all the things that make this app so special. Plus it‚Äôs much cheaper than therapy lol.
title: Buy the premium version! It‚Äôs so worth it!

review: At 53 I had three strokes and recovered faster than doctors believed. They attributed that to ‚Äúpristine‚Äù arteries due to my whole food plant based diet. What I had not worked on was managing stress and anxiety. I was told I would be on the three stokes meds for life. (BP, Cholesterol and blood thinners) I added Calm in January and daily exercise a month ago. I am beyond thrilled to say that I am down to 20mg - expecting to be off of them at my next doctor visit - of the cholesterol meds and - the biggest thrill - off my BP meds completely. I have survived things like children driving alone to far a way places which in the past would have meant anxiety pills, popcorn and sitting on the couch staring at their location on my phone. Calm helps you realize the importance of stopping and looking inside. Give it a try!
title: Great health benefits

review: I have had Calm for quite some time and they have gotten far too much of my money. The sleep stories are great, but the app is NOT intuitive or user friendly and there are no helps. It crashes at random times in the middle of a story or meditation, shutting off and going back to the home page of my phone or iPad. My daughter and I like the stories for kids the best, but they have added only 1 story in the past 4 months. It‚Äôs well nigh impossible to tell what subscription you have because there is a list of 15 different price renewal options. I found out mine has been auto renewing for $15 per month, making this literally the most expensive app in my life. For that much, there should be way better helps in the app and I should be able to use it for more than 4 mins at a time without it crashing, kicking me out, or freezing up my device.
title: Incredibly expensive and glitchy, months between new stories

review: So i‚Äôve been using calm for a few days, and it is really helping me!! This app is so great, and i feel relaxed and clam when i use it! But i was going to do seven days of sleep, and i had already done the one day. I tried to do the next day, but i needed calm premium in order to do this! So that‚Äôs one of the problems! There is barely anything you can do on there when you don‚Äôt have calm premium! And another thing is that i feel like $70 is a lot for one year! I mean like, get it, like you need to make money, but you should try to lower the price just a bit! But that‚Äôs just my opinion. So i really do think that it‚Äôs a good app and all, those two things just really got me! But as i said before, it‚Äôs a rally great app for meditating and all, like it is calming and relaxing!
title: Fantastic, but.... üòï

review: I‚Äôve had the CALM app for a while now and it‚Äôs been literally sleep-saving! I have terrible anxiety at night I‚Äôll wake up and can‚Äôt get back to sleep because of all my random thoughts however I recently started letting the CALM sleep stories/music/etc. play all night versus the first 30 mins I‚Äôm in bed and I‚Äôm now sleeping through the night even after getting up to use the bathroom I easily fall back to sleep. Lastnight it wasn‚Äôt on (my fault) however once I turned on the thunderstorms I was out within minutes. Love all the features available but nothing more then it‚Äôs ability to help me sleep. Even my husband like to hear it as he‚Äôs falling asleep, and of course my kiddos love the kids sleep stories! Thank you CALM!
title: Love it

review: gratitude I express not until my  for this well developed app but also my appreciation for the spirit of the creators since that spirit is reflected in their work. Although there is no need for apps to meditate or relaxing, it is very impressive how much easier it is with the help of the sounds you created, the EXCELLENT narrator and meditation guide. Also, the other features such as music, story telling, etc. bring more joy and diversity to the tools of relaxing and being in spirit. This app makes a great impact because it guides you gently through the new experience of meditation if you are a beginner and if you are more experienced, it adds to the joy of relaxing and meditation with their creative, well thought of, and diverse mental ambience creator.
title: Positively Impact Living

review:
Like many things, I find that getting started is commonly the biggest barrier, and meditation has not been different. Finding the time, space, or even method to meditate used to deter me from doing it, and I wasn‚Äôt even sure if I was doing it correctly- which discouraged me from continuing the process. 

Calm has helped me enter a headspace which is relaxing, and the guided meditations give me just enough of an outline to lead me into a meditative state in seconds. The app also acknowledges when you get a daily consecutive streak, which I find very encouraging!

I would still consider myself a novice at meditation, but with the help of this app, it no longer feels like an impossible, scary thing. Thanks, Calm!
title: Calm helped me break the barrier to begin meditating

title: Borderline fraudulent.

review: I reached for this app when I was going through a period of feeling really run down and drained. Some other life events were happening and I needed some extra help to get through. The short and long meditations, daily meditations, and sleep stories made a huge difference. Luckily life has come back around, but even though I'm not in a slump I'm still enjoying the daily meditations that I do first thing in the morning and a sleep story at night. Sometimes if I have a break in the day I'll do a guided nap or a quick meditation- especially on a hard day. I love this app and use it almost every day. I highly recommend it to my friends and coworkers, especially if stressed or having trouble sleeping.
title: Essential daily app

review: Calm, has changed my life for the better. This mindfulness practice has helped me deal with anxiety! It has helped me internally, locate how I feel! How to handle emotions, how to accept uncertainty! Self acceptance! Life‚Äôs changes, It has taught me to live in the moment! To really be fully present in the moment! That‚Äôs all we got is our breath and the moment ! Really breathe, listen to my body! Release my need to control and go with the flow! I could go on and on! I love all my teachers! I truly appreciate what they‚Äôve done in my life! Self discovery at its finest! This calm app is one of the best investments I‚Äôve ever made for myself! Tamara, Jeff, Jay! I am grateful for y‚Äôall! Thank you so much! Y‚Äôall are really out here making huge impacts on ppls life‚Äôs!‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Invest in yourself! It‚Äôs worth it!

review: I was feeling awful and stressed out all the time pulling myself everywhere trying to make everyone happy helping everyone and doing everything from work, friends, my mother, family and not saying no because they made me feel selfish if I didn‚Äôt. They constantly made me feel like the bad guy. Even doing this made me feel bad and guilty because I took this moment for myself. Now I feel much better then when I first started. This is such a good app to use I‚Äôm thankful for coming across it. The mind is so important and you can‚Äôt be truly happy unless you let go and breathe. I realize that now. I don‚Äôt let them stress me out anymore I‚Äôm going to start doing for me and be a little selfish and put me first
title: Really helped

title: Bait and Switch

review: I love calm all and of it stories. Also the fact that calm is the only thing that helps me sleep. I had a sleeping problem and I  hated going to sleep and I‚Äôd just stay up to a very late time where I‚Äôd only get a small amount of sleep. But then I found calm where I can just relax and listen to calming stories that I never finish because I‚Äôd already be asleep! When I rely on it, it never fails me. It works every time!! title: I how I go to sleep üí§

review: Would be 5 stars besides the fact that you can‚Äôt ask Siri to play the daily calm.   For example if you can‚Äôt sleep they are asking to open your phone (waking you up more!) to then open the app, select a sleep story, open the air play menu, then finally select a HomePod from the menu.  What‚Äôs even the point?  If I even glance at my fantasy league or some thing because I opened my phone for calm because I can‚Äôt ask my HomePod to just play calm.  The Siri shortcut is no better you have to continue on your iPhone, same thing look at your phone.  The money you pay this should‚Äôve been taken care of by now.  Apple has given the developer the tools with Sirikit media.  This is not unreasonable and for a app claiming to be about mindfulness you‚Äôd figure less screen time would be a top goal.  If this isn‚Äôt resolved by the end of my subscription year I won‚Äôt be renewing.  Content great, falls on app development
title: No real HomePod integration

review: I‚Äôm comparing this app with my favorite meditation app, which is surprisingly Peloton‚Äôs app. I don‚Äôt like the lack of new content on Calm. Also, most of the meditations seem to be led by Tamara Levitt and I find her voice to be more annoying than soothing. She talks like a cinematic actress or a hypnotist and not just a person doing a meditation. What I love about Peloton is that they‚Äôre constantly adding new content and you have 5 different people you can listen to for all sorts of meditations. I think different personalities will speak to you and this app is disappointing, especially considering it‚Äôs $70/yr subscription. I‚Äôm also not into sleep stories. I want a nice 10-15 minute meditation before I go to bed and I want choice and perhaps some New Age music playing in the background. After having it several months I‚Äôve cancelled the subscription since I now favor Peloton to Calm.
title: It should be better

review: Ok, I found the idea of this app excellent! But there‚Äôs one major catch... money. Of course I should never have assumed that this app would be any different from all the others, but I was shocked at how little was provided for those who can‚Äôt afford the subscription... I understand the need to make money to keep the app up and running... but I couldn‚Äôt believe the price and just how many things were not allowed to a free user... I‚Äôm really disappointed in this app to be honest... I think the idea of it is great, but with the hefty price I don‚Äôt think I would ever be able to feel ‚Äúcalm‚Äù I just don‚Äôt really understand how one can feel calm when I would absolutely be thinking the whole time ‚Äúhow could I pay so much for this app?! I already worry about money! Why in the world would I do that?! I should cancel my subscription! I need that money for my rent, my groceries, my LIFE!‚Äù So ya... the idea of an app helping you achieve mindfulness is great. The price and stingy policies, not so great.
title: Would be a great app...but

review:
I have found the calm app to be a daily transcript for peaceful, mindful living. It is so easy to quickly feel overwhelmed,!stressed out and frazzled in today‚Äôs technological minute to minute incessant barrage of information. Our world has become bombarded with uninvited interruptions as if this is the norm. 
The calm helps one to return to that peaceful, blissful place that is so necessary and reminds us that space and peace and calmness are some of the keys to obtaining an inward fulfilling place. The inner space that regulates our interaction with those things outside of us that demand our consciousness whether invited or not. The calm helps us stay in touch with that divine inner spirituality that can be considered a regulator of sorts that provides a strong boundary for successful containment of the the things we choose to be important !
title: The Calm

review:
I never leave reviews, but this app is so good I had to give it 5 stars. Meditation is my passion, and I‚Äôve tried every app; Calm is by far the best. The ability to have and change the background noise is a total game changer! The sound scapes are wonderful falling asleep tools, and the variety of voices keeps things fresh. 
But my favorite feature by far is the ability to manually enter meditation you do off the app- it allows for a better record of your habits. Calm premium is worth every penny, I recommend it to all my students (I‚Äôm a yoga teacher) and my friends and family as well. Calm is the perfect tool for beginners, as well as the perfect tool for intermediate & advanced meditators because it‚Äôs got such a wide variety of topics. I‚Äôd give it more stars if I could.
title: The best meditation app

review: I‚Äôve tried to incorporate meditation into my life so many times over the years, yet only since starting with the Calm app have I succeeded. The app has so much variety ‚Äî from 1-minute to much longer guided meditations, varying approaches and diverse teachers or meditation leaders. There‚Äôs always something helpful there. I‚Äôve gone from just the Daily Jay (Jay Shetty) mindfulness lessons to now turning to the Calm app 3 times most days - a mindful start with the Daily Jay, a midday break with one of the work-related meditations or one of the nap programs, and an evening mindfulness check-in. Everyone around me sees the difference. Most importantly, I see the difference. I‚Äôm coming up on 365 consecutive days of this, and I‚Äôm not going to stop.
title: Literally life changing

review: As adults, we often forget how effective a bedtime story is to help us sleep. I guess that‚Äôs why our parents read them to us as kids to calm us down and get us to drift off to sleep. We perpetuate the practice with our own children and they will with theirs. It‚Äôs a magical formula that seems to work like a charm every time. This app has some of the best sleep stories for grownups and kids alike. The narrators are very skilled at reading softly and slowly and the stories often interjecting sleep suggestions get your mind prepared for sleep. One of my favorites is Harry Styles who‚Äôs soft droning voice has lulled me to sleep many a night. I highly recommend this app for everyone. I got it through my health insurance plan and it‚Äôs one of the best services they‚Äôve ever provided.
title: Great sleep stories

review:
I decided to purchase it primarily for sleep stories. And after my free trial has expired I realised that I am stuck with primarily stories recorded by people that have no business recording sleep stories. At least there should be different voices categories. I realised that I am deeply annoyed by high pitch whispering and the ‚Äú S‚Äù sounds pronounced unnecessarily loud making me jump in bed each few seconds. Calm app makers! Please hire more people with sweet and velvety voices that are ACTUALLY soothing or adjust audio recording to smooth those sounds out. ( or put it as an option for listeners)There is a reason every classical singer out there is trained to smooth their Ts and Ss so the songs are actually enjoyable.
So far the only truly soothing story I found was read by Matthew Mcconaughey. That‚Äôs a lot of money to pay for very little use I am getting.

title: Calm is the best App

review: Hello first of all this is a great app and has so many wonderful ways to help with emotions, meditation and general well being. Thing is I have misophonia which is a neurological condition for hatred of certain sounds. During my free app usage I did not really get use out of the different programs mainly I got it to listen to stories from certain actors whom I love the sound of their voices. I purchased it thinking about what perfect timing with the new stresses of covid-19. But here‚Äôs my issue almost everyone I would like to listen to has only Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice. I‚Äôm sure she is a wonderful person but I have a hard time with the whistle at the end of her sentences and the use of the letter ‚ÄúS‚Äù. So instead of calming me down triggers my misophonia and I end up having to shut it off. Is there any way to have ALL the programs on here have a choice between 2 different voices? Specifically ones without wet mouth and exaggerated ‚ÄúS‚Äù sounds?
title: Misophonia - voice related issue

review: Tamara‚Äôs voice, which is the only option for the majority of sleep meditations, is like listening to an SNL skit of how to be an annoying millennial. Nasal. False bubbly and so very forced. I appreciate she writes the meditations and is responsible for the app, but she needs to step aside and let anyone else (all the other leaders/voices are soothing and relaxing) do the talking. Definitely she needs to cut the singsong nasal California girl ‚ÄúHi! I‚Äôm Tamara‚Äù. Major jolt out of relaxation to start. She has that annoying vocal delivery that makes you mimic her because it‚Äôs so over the top. When she starts tLiimg, I expect  ‚Äúoh my god! Did you SEE what Nadine was wearing yesterday?‚Äù ‚ÄúOh my God, I had the most amaaaazing a√ßa√≠ bowl today! It was like so healthy too because they put like these seed things in it‚Äù ‚ÄúOMG! I am SO over lululemon!‚Äù ‚ÄúOMG she‚Äôs such a boomer!‚Äù ‚ÄúOmg! Is that a wrinkle!?!?!? [SCREAMS]. The app would be great but I bought it for sleep meditation. Yes they offer a 7 day free trial but if you do t continue the subscription the app is basically useless I found 2 things I could access without paying and even if you can download during the free trial once you cancel you only have what you could download and how many time will one want to listen to the same story/ meditation or whatever. I really feel they should explain in their ads that a subscription is needed the they are advertising to people with anxiety sleep issues etc so I feel it‚Äôs terrible business practice to offer people hope of some relief and then say oh but you must pay for it even though we said it‚Äôs free technically the app is free but it‚Äôs useless
title: Bait and Switch

review: I have been dealing with insomnia for years now. I‚Äôve tried herbs, oils, prescription meds, diet, exercise, and bedtime routine. All work for a short period of time, but the night waking with the incessant thoughts never end. I looked into meditation and came across this app. This is the best thing that has ever happened to me! For the first time in years, although I wake up through the night, with the help of the sleep releases and/or the bedtime stories, my mind is quieted and I go back to sleep! I do one meditation through the day and feel it helps me with my focus through the night. I have a ways to go to be an awesome meditator, but this app is awesome! I can‚Äôt stress that enough! I‚Äôve been using it for a month. It has been worth every dollar spent! I highly recommend it!
title: Helps insomnia!

review:
I downloaded this app as I was going through issues with my treatment for depression.  I have never been good at the relaxation portion of yoga, but found I truly was needing to find away to help myself focus and care for myself.  I couldn‚Äôt believe how quickly I fell asleep after doing a body scan & listening to a sleep story. 

I still am not practicing ideally, listening to meditations on walks, while driving, or while doing work, but I am moved by the lessons in the different areas and need these gems of insight.   This practice is getting me closer to catching up on things at work and getting me to that place where I can truly practice meditative moments.  
I look forward to continuing and improving upon my practice and finding some inward quiet and peace.
title: icalm has been life changing!!

review: Hi I am really enjoying the calm app. At first I did not like the sound of Tamra Levitt voice because it wasn‚Äôt relaxing to me. She narrates the majority of the meditations. But I am getting used to her voice and also there are a lot of meditations where you have the option of a male narrator with a more calming voice. I do wish they had a female narrator with a lower tone voice. It‚Äôs important to have a variety of voices and not use one voice for the majority of the meditations because that voice could not soothe some people. I have trouble with high pitched voices while meditating. But so far I am really enjoying the app because it is helping me limit my social media activity and I just feel better being on this app then on Instagram or TickTock etc.
title: Needs more female voice variety

review:
I haven‚Äôt had this app for a while. I haven‚Äôt even paid for the full app yet. (Sorry for any grammar mistakes, I‚Äôm tired but I felt an urge to write a review for this app).

I have anxiety, and that anxiety worsens as I look at the news, experience asthma that causes me to feel like I‚Äôm dying, and just 2020 in general. I‚Äôve had insane family issues (but not as bad as terrible, terrible situations and I am grateful for that).

This app helped me get through that. I‚Äôve been able to get better sleep by turning on a sound from a scene and just listening to it. I look forward to mood check ins. Those mood check ins help me feel relieved. It‚Äôs a place I feel like I can be totally honest. I used to lie a lot because of my anxiety, but I‚Äôve been getting better at that because I‚Äôve begun to see my issue as I exaggerate in these mood check ins.

I can‚Äôt wait to use the features it offers after you pay. It‚Äôs not that high of a price (70 a year) and I think it‚Äôs worth it if you struggle with anything. How to deal with anger, how to be happier in life, how to sleep, how to meditate, there‚Äôs so many interesting and cool things I‚Äôm just mind-blown.
title: Did not expect it to change my life.

review: I‚Äôve found help in the supportive, empowering and healing places in Calm. The practitioners are the real deal, and there is variety for individual preferences. The Poetry Pharmacy, Jeff‚Äôs How to Meditate series, the Master Class on Sleep, sleep stories and sleep meditations were favorites early on. It‚Äôs wonderful to have such a rich healing environment always close at hand. These days I meditate solo with the open-ended timer set to a tropical beach wave for background sounds, with bells set for every five minutes‚Äîone set of choices among many options. I also use the 4-7-8 breath pacemaker (one of several) for falling sleep. I‚Äôm grateful Kaiser pays for my subscription but think this is an app worth paying for. A world of calm is a haven in a crazy time.

review: I started listening as an experiment since I work shift work and swap from days to nights weekly. After the first session, my husband asked, ‚ÄúWill you play me a sleep story before bed?‚Äù! I was in absolute shock! Even when I stay awake past his routine bed time to swap my schedule, I have to play him a story and he is sound asleep within a few minutes (maybe even seconds). I have also noticed our four dogs are enjoying the relaxing voices and sounds. All four are soundly dreaming shortly after the beginning and have started to expect a story as well! They snuggle down in their specific spots and wait with anticipation! I am excited to have found something that finally helps with my insomnia due to shift work!
title: My husband and dogs can‚Äôt get enough!

review:
I know as a college student I'm not the majority population of this app and 30-60$ for a subscription is definitely still steep to me but I can honestly say this app is life changing.

I was diagnosed with severe ADHD and depression which is a wonderful combination of no focus and no sleep. I was recommended to start a mindfulness practice and it took about a month of cutting out my coffee budget to buy my first subscription.

I've been a member for 3 years now and I always make sure to have this in my budget: I finally have a regular sleep cycle, my focus has improved greatly, and I was able to reduce the amount of medication I had to take.

People who have known me for years have noticed I'm happier, kinder, and FAR less stressed. It took about a month or two for me to  really commit myself but I have not regretted it since and I'm actually saving up for the lifetime subscription! 

TD;DR: It looks pricey, it takes time, but it's worth it and it works.

Update: finally saved enough to get the lifetime subscription, it‚Äôs my go to app for sleep and stress relief and was absolutely worth the money. Really hoping they expand more on the breathe bubble and sleep soundscapes!

It‚Äôs so easy to get swept up into the mindset you‚Äôre not enough, and allow that anxiety and stress negatively affect your self love. For the last couple weeks, using calm for 10-20 minutes a day, I feel more relaxed, and areas in my life even outside of the office have had positive impact. I‚Äôm working out harder in the gym, I‚Äôm more open with friends and family, and the gratitude that I‚Äôm feeling right now is immense compared to just a couple of weeks ago. title: Worth Every Penny

review: My husband used headspace and I use Calm, and let me just say that Calm has truly out paced HS by FAR. I have anxiety to the point of panic attacks and this app was suggested by a therapist to me; it has truly helped me learn how to breathe and stay in the moment during difficult reactions. They offer frequent new content that is relevant, master classes, whole topical series, simple bells and a timer, download options, favorite your go-to sessions... it is all here. Track your progress if you like to see that as well. Not only that but the UI is lovely and beautifully simple. This is by far the most value for an annual premium subscription I‚Äôve ever gotten out of an app and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. If you‚Äôre on the fence about which one to try, please try this one.

review:
I have been using CALM for almost two months .  I love it.  What a perfect way to start my day.  I am actually learning to meditate and be mindful.  Not, just mouthing the words.  I'm almost 72 and this it fills me with happiness to have found this wonderful gift to myself.  Thank you, Calm.

I continue to be amazed by the sleep stories.  They put me right back to sleep if I wake up anxious about something in the middle of the night. review: One of the best apps out there. I use it every day and also at night for sleep. Music selections are exceptional. My only issue is the voice of Tamara Levitt, the narrator (and I believe brilliant creator) of Daily Calm. The content is great: it‚Äôs the vocal affectation that I find grating. Like another reviewer, I‚Äôve tried and tried to no avail. My only resort is to turn it down to lowest audible volume. During the didactic part of the meditation, the voice changes to something more authentic, but then, relapses to the vocal fry and breathiness that seems designed to enhance the meditation experience. title: Love the app, but‚Ä¶

review:
First off, this is such an amazing app - great job Calm! This app has morphed into a meditation and relaxation masterpiece. 

It‚Äôs missing a few features that keep it from being 5 stars for me, though. 

1) I‚Äôd like to be able to mix all sounds (both scenes and sleep sounds) with other apps (like you can with the apps White Noise and TaoMix). This would allow me to play sounds in the background whilst listening to an audio book for instance. 
 - It would also be nice to be able to mix sounds & scenes with Calm sleep stories. I find some of the stories too quiet and needing some extra background noise. 

2) If ever able to mix sounds with other apps it would be nice to control volume of the Calm app separately from the phone master volume (TaoMix has this feature currently). 

3) I‚Äôd like to be able to mix or overlap the sleep soundscapes for customer soundscapes. Oh, and more of the soundscapes, please, they‚Äôre great!

4) It‚Äôs time to morph the scenes and sleep soundscapes into one category. I love a couple of the scenes and would be so sad if they were removed (specifically rhythmic waves and gently flowing stream - I could sleep to those any day!), but the others are a little dated and could be replaced with the sleep soundscapes and more of those added
title: AMAZING - but would like some new features

review: This app has amazing, relaxing white noise to listen too, great night stories etc. but people who don‚Äôt pay $60 a year can‚Äôt listen to music or listen to most of the stories plus the week long meditations only have ONE day you can listen to for free. If apple wants more good reviews for this app they should have more choices for people who can‚Äôt or aren‚Äôt allowed to etc pay so much money for this app. It has so many cool features but it should be more accessible to everyone. I hope apple or whoever owns this app changes this for the better because many people who are depressed or anxious might not be able to pay that yearly money on top of everything else and they need to have this app to help so if that is changed this app would be five stars, because money isn‚Äôt everything, how people feel is 100x more important
title: Needs more things for free PLEASE

review:
The app is flawed. Bottom line. Caching and syncing aside the app fails to create a consistent experience regardless of time zone and that is a flaw. Customer service looses credibility when they try to explain it away as if that is just the way it is or has to be. They attempt to talk circles around the average consumer because they don't know the wiser. That non-explination falls flat to me because I am a digital communications major who is well versed in tech.

Instead of trying to explain away this unfortunate product shortcoming they should try and practice service recovery and invest in the app to bring it up to speed w/their competitors.

I am extremely disappointed. I will be deleting the app and moving on. If they knew anything about customer service recovery they would do something or offer a make-good instead of crafting big-word excuses.

Customer service turnaround time is horrible as well. I sent over my original concern on a Saturday and it took them 4 whole business days to respond. So lame. This is how companies get washed out in this digital landscape. Here today, gone tomorrow. I have a decent amount of influence in my social circles and have encouraged friends and family to download and use Calm. I will now, based on this conversation, fire up the App Store and move on to a competitor...and so will they.

Do better. Don't make excuses. Take action.
title: DO NOT BUY if you travel across time zones.

review:
I'm one of these users who bought a lifetime subscription after taking a meditation course that was very promising. Sadly, it was not indicative of the rest of the Calm experience. Issues that require attention:
‚Äì The app is highly un-intuitive: It's hard to find favorite pieces
‚Äì The offline experience is abysmal. I use the app primarily in planes and discover that hardly anything works offline. I'm sure there are ways to download soundscapes but I can't find how and whenever I find a way to play a soundscape offline, it switches off automatically after 10 minutes. Restarting it ‚Ä¶ requires restarting the app. That's a lot of restarts over a 6-hour flight.
Maybe they will fix these issues but after a couple of years of waiting, I'm not holding my breath. If I knew today what I know, I wouldn't have bought the subscription.
title: High promise, but not there yet

title: I Really Really Love this

review:
I wish users can have a choices of narrator voice . The voice of the lead person Tamarra, is too cheerful and has too much emotion in her voice. It is like she is telling a cheerful and colorful story. Many people may prefer such a bubbly character, but for someone who feels anxious, that‚Äôs bad news for a guided meditation. It is not that I don‚Äôt like her voice, it is that the energy and emotion in her voice makes me more anxious. I bought one year subscription and tried to get used to it. But it didn‚Äôt work. As a result, I don‚Äôt use the Apps much at all. 

I would prefer a more traditional, calm and almost emotionless voice. Some of the work offers a choice and I always choose the alternative male voice. But given that her voice accounts for 90% of the guided medications, I will not renew my subscription.
title: Nice collection. But

review:
Content is great, I‚Äôve been using the app for some years now and have a paid subscription, overall I would say it‚Äôs worth it. I use the sleep soundscapes the most, and play them on my HomePod. They helps covering the noise my neighbors do at any time of the night. The Commercial Airliner, and the White Sound Ocean Surf soundscapes are the best IMO for this kind of ‚Äúsound machine‚Äù feel.
However, there are two notable issues I find pretty frustrating:
1. The soundscape tracks are seemingly loops that repeat every X minutes (maybe 20, or 30minutes?). When the track ends, there‚Äôs a gap of a couple seconds before it‚Äôs starts again, which is enough to create this unpleasant ‚Äúwake up‚Äù experience.
2. The playback experience in the app is buggy. It does not really say when it‚Äôs buffering (if at all?) but it does not always starts right away after selecting a soundscape, even though the playback UI shows as playing. Sometimes, playback does not even start until a couple seconds after backgrounding the app. That‚Äôs odd and not user friendly.

If that wasn‚Äôt for these two issues, I would give it 5 stars without hesitation.

Please Calm devs, help me being calmer by fixing these annoyances!
title: Would be 5 stars without some pesky bugs

review: I actually like the app very much, but find that I do not use it.  I got an email notice for an automatic renewal, but I decided to cancel.  About a week ago, I opened the email and went to the renew area.  At the bottom was a  cancel option.  I clicked it and it said I couldn‚Äôt connect.  So, I reopened it and all the options to buy were present, except the cancel option.  Weird.  So, to test the connection I tapped the monthly renewal option and, sure enough, it opened right away and was willing to take my money.  I did not click to pay, but closed out.  Then I send a note to apple about my problem - with no response still.  I then went to my app account and, again, there is no option to cancel this app, only to renew.  That is why I gave a one star on the review.  I guess my next step is to remove my credit card from the App Store, so I don‚Äôt get an automatic renew charge.  How stupid is that?!
title: Trying to cancel auto renewal

review: Applied to get this app to use as an educator in a middle school classroom. It was a constant in my room all year and into our distance learning time. We listened to meditations and music and sounds to calm and inspire. During our independent reading times I would project the fireplace image and sounds, other days the mountains and lake or a summer meadow. It became a fabulous part of our cultural. Now I have ‚Äúbreathing moments‚Äù during our Zoom classes. I share my screen and the students listen and watch. I truly appreciate the Calm app. I hope to continue using it in my classroom and encourage you to try it in your own. The students and I love it. (Their favorite was the Labron James‚Äôs series.) Thank you for this valuable resource!
title: Valuable resource in and out of the classroom

review: Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice is so soothing, I have been listening to the daily calm for almost a year.  When my anxiety spikes, I take a time out and use one of the body scans or meditations.  This app has helped me with night terrors, anxiety attacks, depression, and PTSD for almost a year.  Honestly, I don‚Äôt know if I would have gotten through some of my traumatic hurdles without it.  The children‚Äôs bedtime stories helped soothe my two young grandchildren when they would stay with us, and my friend‚Äôs two small children who recently lost their father.  And let‚Äôs be honest...there‚Äôs nothing better than Matthew McConaughey reading you a bedtime story!  Thank you to the creators of this app.  I promote it and share it constantly.  Tamara is my personal rock. üíúüíú
title: This Calm App has literally saved my life!

review: I downloaded this app because I recently have had a lot of anxiety issues and thought that this app would help me sleep better. I t was pretty good but there where not a whole lot of options if you did not subscribe or pay which I did not do. The ones that where free though where pretty good and helpful I just with that you did not have to pay. I have problems with this kind of stuff a lot when the it‚Äôs self is free to download but the content inside you can not use unless you pay and I don‚Äôt want to pay for an app that you can find the same stuff online for FREE. I also did not see that you had to pay for the stuff in the description. I just think that if your going to make someone pay make sure they know that they are going to have to.
title: Pretty good

review: I cannot day enough wonderful things about using this app!! It‚Äôs been a year now, and this app has allowed me to reach a level of personal care that I have been craving since my teens and 20‚Äôs... and I‚Äôm finally finding it in my 40‚Äôsü•∞.... it has made it more accessible to do these meditations on my breaks from work or and especially during really emotional days, when I seem to need it the most! Thank You Tamara Levitt and the many others involved in creating and contributing to this app!! Your beautiful words and thoughtful care you put into each one is truly life changing! I look forward to my daily calm every morning and evening!! Thank you from one deeply grateful and compassionate heart to your truly compassionate heart!‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞‚ú®~ Shaun from Santa Cruz, Ca.
title: Life changer!!

review:
This is the first time I‚Äôve suffered anxiety because I have always been able to manage my emotions with very little difficulty. But recently it has been triggered and it has thrown me for a loop. 
Insomnia has come with the anxiety which has me up all night and going to sleep üò¥ üí§ on my buses to my Psych Group Therapy, then half way into my group therapy. The medication I was prescribed was making the insomnia worse, along with the anxiety about the insomnia. 
     Smooth Jazz use to help me a lot, but now is to fast and to loud. Calm is just boring enough, no calming enoughüòáto put me to sleep while I‚Äôm writing this reviewüòäLOL!!! 
     I am loving Calm so much, so very very much. Thank you üôèüèæ and may God Bless y‚Äôall and y‚Äôalls staff and Bussiness all the days of y‚Äôalls lives. 
     James A Boston Jr
title: Anxiety and Insomnia

review: I used this app religiously to help me sleep because of my anxiety. It would be so hard for me to fall asleep at night until I found the Calm App and would listen to the soothing sleep music! I used this app for about a year and I wasn‚Äôt charged for anything, which I loved because it was so effective and I didn‚Äôt have to worry about putting a dent in my pocket. I only used the sleep music, so I didn‚Äôt see the point in purchasing a membership. Now, my anxiety is coming back to me before bedtime and I can‚Äôt use this app because ALL of the music is locked!! I understand that money has to be made somehow, but I‚Äôm so truly disappointed every single song was locked. I‚Äôm a college student on a budget that can‚Äôt afford to pay for miscellaneous things so this hurts! Anyway, if you have the money I‚Äôd definitely recommend this app. It works wonders!
title: too expensive now

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for almost 3 years now on an almost daily basis. I think it did help me with a lot of issues and I do begin to notice benefits from using it in my life. The reason why I‚Äôm only giving 4 stars is that the ‚ÄûDaily Calm‚Äù sessions, something I used to look forward to, have been simple replays of previous sessions for a while now. That‚Äôs annoying, especially since they let you save your favorite sessions. So it happened to me a couple of times now that I played one of my favorite sessions and then the following day I listen to the exact same thing as a ‚Äúdaily Calm‚Äù because it‚Äôs being replayed. I think the daily sessions should be new, otherwise I feel a little fooled. Other than that I really like it.
title: Daily Calms out of the can

review:
This app is beyond great. Meditation is such a gift to everyone who allows time for it. I have been an user of Calm for 4 years now and love the accessibility of it. It‚Äôs great for quick sessions when life catches up. I‚Äôve deepened my practice by taking what I learn here and carrying with me. 

I find the nature scapes/sounds to be extremely relaxing, and I love how I can toggle between whatever I am feeling like listening to depending on my mood or the environment. 

All good things, but I would love to see Calm incorporate more options into the mood check-in at the end of the sessions. There are so many different types of emotions that don‚Äôt make it to the choices that are made available.
title: Excellent but recommend more options

review: The app opens up asking the user what they need. They give the options of anxiety relief, meditation, help with getting to sleep, etc. They have sections that allow the user to explore different sessions. These sessions consist of real people coaching one through their use of breathing techniques. They have music, kids, check-in, ‚Äúfor work‚Äù, and a wisdom section. They all work amazingly. It has been studied that people with anxiety can experience mindfulness in order to cope with or eliminate their anxiety. Being mindful of one's experience "in the moment" (also known as meditation) and doing so without passing judgment clarifies one's values, enables acceptance of uncomfortable ideas and feelings, and the use of values to alter behavior.
title: Help with anxiety

review: A year ago, I was still suffering as an insomniac and my anxiety and stress were burning a hole in my chest. I have been on medication for years. I tried Calm on a whim, but gave it my total committement. It worked!! I don't have to use it as often, but I love it so I do. I'm the mother of two special needs boys, my parents need me and have moved in, my brother and his wife are jobless so they are here, too! So my symptoms have been through the roof! I especially use the Daily Trip and Sleep Stories and have been able (with doctor's guidelines) to get off all related medicine. Learning how to meditate and embracing sleep stories have been a cure for me and I will always be a subscriber. Thank you so much!
title: Calm has been a miracle for me!

review: Calm is my favorite app at the moment. My sister and I listen to the sleep stories every night, and we love it! I am asleep in minutes, I don‚Äôt even know what happens at the end of half the stories I listen to. My father came in my room one night and thought the music I was listening to was very relaxing, and I agreed. (The music is also great) I bought Premium and it IS so worth it. You get access to EVERYTHING. I do the breathing exercises every day before school. It definitely calms your mind. Most of the narrators voices are very calming. Another thing is that every time you open the app it greets you with ‚ÄúTake a deep breath‚Äù. You can also change the backround which comes with calming music. Overall GREAT app.
title: AMAZING app!

review: I have been wanting to meditate for a very long time, but never really knew where to start or how to do it. One night I was having an anxiety attack and decided to try and find a meditation app. Calm came up and I decided to look into it. The first thing I saw was the bedtime story ‚ÄúBlue Gold.‚Äù The reader had the most calming voice and the story took my mind back to a trip I had taken to France. I was asleep before the story was finished. In fact, I fall asleep before most of the stories are over and I stay asleep longer. There are so many different offerings, including the meditation I had been wanting. There is limited access to the free portion, so I decided to purchase the yearly subscription, and I am so happy I did. Really worth trying.
title: Lifesaver

review:
Great meditations, but extremely annoying glitches. When searching through the meditations, it doesn‚Äôt show which ones you‚Äôve completed. And there is no way to mark one as completed yourself. So you‚Äôre looking through ones you‚Äôve already done, and you have to just remember every one you‚Äôve done. 
Also for series, when you open the app, there‚Äôs no option to start the next meditation in the series. So I go to last completed my history, thinking there‚Äôs some ‚Äúcontinue to next‚Äù option. Nope, can‚Äôt do that either. And there is no option to search. So every time you want the next meditation in a series, you have to scroll until you can find that series again, and remember which one you‚Äôre on. 
As much as I love the meditations, I probably will not purchase again next year unless changes are made.
title: Glitches

review: I have tried many different meditation apps. There are six currently on my phone. This is the only one I ever made the leap to paid content. I like that there are so many different ways to use the app- the "breathe" part is super helpful when I just need to slow down my racing mind and/or ease an anxiety attack. I like that I can choose just silent meditation or guided. I like that there is a new meditation each day on a different topic. Some topics I like better than others but all in all, I find they give good food for thought for the day. I also enjoy the sleep stories. I still have never made it all the way to the end before falling asleep. (Although avoid the French ASMR one- that one just sounds a serial killer whispering in your ear!)
title: Great app!

review: This app is really nice, I especially like the soundscapes. However, there only seems to be a handful of soundscapes that don‚Äôt have a ton of white noise in the background. Please include more soundscapes that are pure environmental sounds, not sounds on top of a thick layer of white noise. The Campfire soundscape does a great job of that, why can‚Äôt more of the soundscapes be like that? The white noise makes it sound artificial and makes it anxiety inducing, not relaxing and transportive. Sorry to be a critic on this point, I would just really like more non-white noise soundscapes, right now there‚Äôs not many options. Otherwise I appreciate what you guys are doing here and say you earned five stars for my review.
title: One Request (Otherwise great app)

review: Calm has been in the news lately‚Äîgood news, for doing good things‚Äîso when my subscription expired earlier this week, I was only too happy to renew it. I‚Äôve been using the app for a little over a year now, off and on (trying to be more on than off but sometimes keeping good habits is hard), and I find it very useful. It‚Äôs well organized, easy to navigate, lots of variety, and helpful reminders to make it a habit (assuming you respond to the reminders, lol). I also like that I can log in through my browser and play some of the music playlists on my computer while working. All in all, an excellent experience with this.
title: Excellent app, and excellent company to support

review: This app is underlaid with a perfect background blend of sounds from nature: non intrusive birdsong and stream sounds blend together to help you focus on being on your own island of peaceful harmony so you can relax and be mindful of the present moment you are experiencing rather than worrying about ongoing & future fears and dilemmas. The stories are wonderful from gifted voice actors and the daily calm (meditation) from Tamara is a fantastic way to begin your day feeling relaxed and positive. ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù is a true gift for anyone having a tough time with everything challenging this year of 2020 has brought to us all. Thank you to everyone involved in creating this place of sanity in these difficult times.
title: For those who love nature....

review: This is the app I can‚Äôt seem to live without no matter how stable my life seems to get (3 years and counting). My favorite features are listening to the scenes or the music, and of course the daily Calms. I love the sleep stories and Master Classes as well. I‚Äôve listed to the mindful eating and pillars of health master class at least 3 times each now! I have recommended and gifted this to my mom as well as some of my friends. I‚Äôve tried other meditation apps and this one seems to surpass them all in the user friendliness and quality (especially sound quality!). Highly recommend Calm to anyone looking for a great guided meditation app or someone to talk them to sleep at night :)
title: The app I can‚Äôt live without üòå

review: I rarely pay for subscriptions, but the full version of Calm has been one of the best investments I have made in my well-being. As a positive psychology practitioner, I love that Calm content is rooted in positive psychology. Learning to meditate from the ground up has increased my self-awareness, made me less reactive and allowed me to be more present and joyful. The sleep stories have improved the quality of my sleep as well as given me a wonderful way to wind down at night. The master classes cover a broad range of wellness topics with practical takeaways from experts in their field.  And absolutely love the addition of the Spark!  Calm also has music and gentle exercises. It has greatly improved my quality of life, and I am profoundly grateful for this wonderful resource.
title: Life-changing

review:
I was constantly stressed, anxious and flustered. It hit me as I woke up in the morning and stayed with me all day, negatively impacting my daily life.
I was curious about meditation and the apparent (seemingly miraculous) benefits of practice.

It was difficult to find the time or patience to start so I knew a little guidance was needed.
I tried a few popular apps and Calm has by far stood out as the BEST guided meditation I‚Äôve found anywhere.

You have a choice in guide, level of guidance and type of meditation. Help to get to or back to sleep, ambient music to sooth and even short stories read by some very familiar voices.

If you‚Äôre even a little curious I recommend downloading the app and trying the free trial.
It‚Äôs perfectly normal to be fidgety and frustrated with yourself at first, just don‚Äôt give up!
It‚Äôs difficult to describe the change you feel within yourself and everyone is different but I personally feel hopeful, energized and excited about the day ahead again.

I hope meditation can have a beneficial impact on your life too, even if it‚Äôs only to have a few moments to yourself now and then because you deserve it.
title: Through this app, meditation is improving my life

review:
When I have a long day I find it hard to unwind and fall asleep, no matter how tired I am and I usually have night terrors that wake me up throughout the night.  Sleep is hard for me.  Sometimes even the fear of night terrors keeps me from falling asleep.

But this app has helped me so much.  It‚Äôs not like reading a book, because when I read I can‚Äôt help but read fast to find out as much as I can about the story, and it‚Äôs easy for my mind to wander while I‚Äôm reading.  It‚Äôs also not unusual for me to lose myself in a book and accidentally stay up much too late.  

The stories in this app are engaging, but the narrators usually read slowly, with drawn out pauses between sentences, which help ease my mind and allow me to relax and let go of worry.  They keep me grounded and in the moment.  Instead of letting fear or anxiety take over and drive my thoughts, the narrator is in the driver‚Äôs seat, and they are so calming.  I have yet to finish a story because they put me to sleep.  I also sleep through the night almost every time I use this app.

A dependable, good night‚Äôs rest is priceless, so the yearly cost of this app is very much worth it in my book.
title: Worth it.

review: I‚Äôve been on a streak since the pandemic hit. 1 meditation a day-sometimes I only have time for a 3 minute, and others I choose longer. I love the variety of classes to meet my emotional needs for each moment of my day. As a family, we complete a kid meditation and sleep story each night as part of our nightly routine. I have even started to incorporate some meditations from this app in my classes with my students! This app has completely changed my life! I also do gratitude tracking, mood tracking, and sleep tracking, and have seen way better sleep prioritizing, and reflection! I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough! (And I love that they partner with my health insurance company!) ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: 1,000+ days

review: I have been using Calm since the summer of 2018, and it‚Äôs been a game changer for me in terms of dealing with anxiety, stress, and breathing. These past few months my sleep has severely suffered, and the white noise landscape has been a miracle for my sanity. I love the sleep stories but find that they are very short and so are more useful for me to listen to unwind prior to putting on a soundscape to lull me into sleep. I love the daily calm meditations though I wish there were newer meditations added a lil more frequently. Overall, Calm is like a crutch for my sanity. One aspect that has been getting progressively worse is the app crashing upon launching Calm from my phone. Recently I have to relaunch Calm four to five times before it launches properly. I really hope this improves as I‚Äôve grown very fond of this app.
title: App crashing upon loading

review: There seems to be something for everyone. I find something new almost every time I begin my night time rituals. Which is kinda my problem; I don‚Äôt have a set ritual, that allows my mind to shut off. As soon as my head hits the pillows, it starts analyzing my day, and reminding me of all the things I should have done during the day, instead of the things i did do. It‚Äôs frustrating, but I‚Äôm getting a handle on it, sort of. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. But this app helps. Even if I can‚Äôt find sleep, I can find calm, find relaxing, find release of the troublesome thoughts or putting them where I can find them the next day and deal with them properly.
title: Sleep

review: I was recommended this app by my pain management care team. I was having a very hard time getting back into my practice after 8 years recovering from CRPS. Initially meditation was heightening pain level for me. This was a hard thing to navigate for me as I have over 40 years experience with meditation practices.  This app has helped me easy back into a fruitful practice at the pace I needed. After the first three months I was well into recovery for my condition and pain/ anxiety levels are significantly reduced. I really like all the options in the app and have shared this with family and friends. This app is appropriate for all levels from ‚Äú what is meditation‚Äù to ‚Äú life long practice‚Äù. Well done!
title: Well done!

review: This is going to sound extreme, but this app has changed my life. Not only have I been able to fall asleep without any stress, I actually feel lighter every day.  There are so many fun extras in this app as well! You can track how your feeling each day. You can write short gratitude lists, and even go for a deep thinking question.  I‚Äôve had insomnia all my life.  I put on a sleep story and I‚Äôm out without worry or stress.  I tell everyone I know to get the app and subscribe!  My mother and I often joke about how long we can make it through a story.  Run don‚Äôt walk. Get this app and subscribe.   I would give this 100 stars if I could.  Bravo calm and thank you.
title: Everything promised and so much more.

review: When I first got Calm about a year ago, I was really stressed out and couldn‚Äôt get to sleep. I was taking 6-10 mg of melatonin a night which was really unhealthy for my body (I am 13). Calm was truly a life changer because it taught me to meditate and had amazing sleep stories and a good amount of them were free. Then calm switched mostly all of their stuff to premium so I stopped using the app. After a visit to the doctor I was told to try meditation again and I immediately thought of calm. My parents capped the limit at $30 a year and they thought $60 was outrageous. I really think that calm is amazing and of you can pay for premium I definitely think it would be worth it.
title: Life Changing- Premium Overpriced

review:
I‚Äôve been using Calm‚Äîsometimes for meditation but primarily for sleep‚Äîfor about 4 years now. The sleep stories are incredible and I listen to one almost every night. Highly, highly recommended. 

Not only has Calm helped me personally, but I‚Äôve also incorporated a lot of the skills into my job. I work as a public librarian and I have incorporated breathing exercises and mindfulness activities into my story times and elementary school class visits. Plus I‚Äôve done more in depth mindfulness story times for families‚Äîand I wouldn‚Äôt have had the confidence to jump in if I hadn‚Äôt become a regular meditator through this app. I truly rely on Calm to help me maintain my health and general well-being.
title: Absolutely recommended!

review: Since it‚Äôs launch, my son and I use Calm religiously. We love it; however, I am becoming frustrated because every time I open the app at the end of the evening I am bombarded with choices for my child since he was the last user. He constantly on favorites pieces that I have favorite because he thinks he is on his account, and I lose my favorites category to choose from because sessions come and go. Please add the capability for family accounts, or for my son to access his profile so I can access my profile, this would help immensely reduce the frustration of having to filter through content that is not related to either of us when trying to choose a sleep story a soundscape or music at bedtime.
title: Please Add User Profiles within the App

review:
I‚Äôm not gonna write a really long review about how this app changed my life because there are tons here that already describe exactly what I would say.
Also to ppl complaining‚Äîit does NOT NEED TO BE $70 a year!!!
After you signed up for a free trial, go to your subscriptions in your app store, and there are multiple subscription options. I pay $40 a year. More than worth it for something i use daily, with constant new content. (Tbh Id pay $70 too) 

My entire family uses this app every single day. I wake up with my daily calm, and my daughter & I both go to sleep to the sleep stories and have the rain storm sounds going all night.
I have tried many meditation apps before this and none of them clicked. Everybody has a different style or need for meditation, and since I am ADHD, The typical ‚Äújust sit there and let your mind go blank‚Äù apps never worked for me. I need guided meditation to stay focused and well‚Ä¶ For guidance. I swear, Tamara is a wizard, because the daily calm‚Äôs always seem to apply to exactly what I need to hear.  
Ill be a Lifelong paid membership for sure!! üíï
title: Life changing‚Äîif you use it

review: Ok don‚Äôt get me wrong I love this app in all but what really bothers me is that almost all everything in this app is locked because you have unlock calm and it costs money the reason why I don‚Äôt unlock calm is because my parents don‚Äôt know I go through stress,anxiety,depression so I don‚Äôt ask for the money for calm,It really bothers me that I can only listen to a few stories in calm I really think that you shouldn‚Äôt lock almost all of the stories,lullabies,songs,mediations you know all that stuff I really don‚Äôt wanna ask my parents for the money I know there is a 7 day free trial but the 7days will end soon and I don‚Äôt wanna pay for it, this is really helpful for stress anxiety and depression but a lot of the things in this app cost money but other than that this app is amazing and really helpful to the people who pay for it.
title: This is just annoying and bothering

review:
Really love this app. The master classes are my favorite part. Very interesting and easy to listen too. Really wish they would make more of them. I have a year subscription and have listened to almost all of them (finally getting around to finish the rest) and some of them 3-5 times (gratitude, disproving happiness, rethinking depression, the 4 pillars of health and sleep are my favorite) would love to see some new ones. 

The only thing I would change in this app would be to ability to set the meditations like an alarm clock. They do have reminders but if I could set a meditation to start at a certain time I could do it without having to touch my phone (we all know how distracting phones are first thing in the morning)
title: Love it

review: I‚Äôve had this app for a few years now, and while I go through phases in my usage, it never fails me. Traveling and can‚Äôt fall asleep? Lost your job and need some help centering yourself? Babysitting and need something to keep the kids entertained or calm for sleep? Can‚Äôt sleep? Anxious? This app has completely changed my self care routine, and practicing gratitude has honestly, literally, kept me alive. I can‚Äôt afford therapy, but this app truly does help, and has everything you need to work on yourself. I love the sleep stories, and I rely on the nature sounds to calm my mind almost every night. I will have this app on my phone, forever. Best year subscription I‚Äôve ever purchased.
title: EVERYONE needs this!

review: I love parts of the app, but such an overwhelming number of your meditations are voiced by Tamara Levitt, and unfortunately I find her voice too cutesy or perky or something, for meditation. I can‚Äôt put my finger on the quality, I just know it‚Äôs distracting, making a huge number of your meditations unusable for me. I‚Äôd love to subscribe, as there are features I love, but it feels like enough of the app would be useless to me do to this issue, making the price point unjustifiable. What a shame you relied so heavily on one voice! I‚Äôve had two other friends agree, sharing they opted out of your app for the same reason. Maybe others aren‚Äôt reporting back ‚Äî I almost didn‚Äôt, but then I realized perhaps it would be useful feedback. Here‚Äôs hoping you increase the variety, so maybe I can rethink subscribing!
title: Wish You Had More Voices Doing Mediation, So I‚Äôd Feel Good About Subscribing

review: I was attempting to use the app and there is almost no content for me to use other than two sleep stories that are short and the one is a kids story. I wish there was like 5 or 6 free stories for me to use. I don‚Äôt want to pay $70 a year to use an app to help me sleep better. That is just too expensive for me and I don‚Äôt understand why. Why are people expected to pay $70 for help sleeping. I would like to use this app and its many features but I can‚Äôt do so without paying for it. One of the stories that is free is a moshi monster story and I feel as though that won‚Äôt help me fall asleep. I wish you didn‚Äôt have to pay for the stories. Maybe a free trial would work, I just can‚Äôt see myself or anyone else paying to listen to stories. I would love to use and support this app, but I can‚Äôt give a fair review without paying for it.
title: More free content

review:
I first read about Calm in NYT several years ago. I tried it and never stopped! I‚Äôm an ob-gyn physician and by definition sometimes my job requires me to be up all night‚Äî hence I really need to sleep on all the non-work nights. Calm cuts through my stress, anxiety, irregular sleep schedule and brings me to deep sleep. I usually fall asleep within 3-5 minutes. I rarely awaken. If I do I start another story with equal success. I use the ‚Äòscenes‚Äô background sounds as I wind down for sleep and they play again after the story. 

I sometimes use the nap stories as well. They are short and time my naps so that I don‚Äôt sleep too long. 

I highly recommend this app for anyone struggling with sleep.
title: Works every time

review:
The Calm App is beyond helpful. I‚Äôve tried many apps to help with my anxiety disorder, stress, self-esteem difficulties, and multiple other areas I have trouble improving alone in my life. Calm App is THE APP FOR ALL OF MY IMPROVEMENT AREAS! I love the short, simple podcasts, because I‚Äôm able to listen along on my drive to work, and/or during a stressful, anxious, or negative situation. I‚Äôm able to listen to these podcasts and after 10-12 minutes, I feel the most peaceful so I‚Äôm able to return to my previous environment with a positive, peaceful, and helpful attitude and mindset.
If you don‚Äôt have this app, DOWNLOAD THIS APP NOW! It is an investment that is worth much, much more!
title: SO helpful, very short and simple, with actual results!

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for sometime now - several years and I love the thoughtfulness that goes into the selections and I love the depth of what‚Äôs available to me. It‚Äôs allowed me to form great habits like starting my morning with a meditation or calming music rather than checking my email and diving right into the day - it just sets the tone for my entire day. Then I‚Äôll tap into Calm in the afternoon just to take a break and the selections and options are amazing. And then after the long day is over I‚Äôll unwind with their music selection for my whole family to enjoy a dinner or after dinner just sitting on the balcony relaxing. I have a lifetime membership to Calm, and I just love it!
title: Calm just makes life better

review:
I did the trial for one of the sleep stories ‚Ä¶ and discovered something I thought was cool was something I needed.
It‚Äôs not easy to get to a list of all the sleep stories - but once I did - OMG they are amazing. The app wants to suggest content, rather than let you see all the content of a particular type.  I eventually found most of them by filtering on fiction or non-fiction.
My five stars are for content.  The good news is there‚Äôs a lot of content.  The bad news is that content is ‚Äúorganized‚Äù in inconsistent ways.  It made me crazy to see a screen of six or eight suggestions and realize once you picked one - you couldn‚Äôt get back to those initial stories.
title: Surprisingly worth the money

review: I have bad insomnia and other issues so I decided to try this app. I LOVE IT. I am a premium member, I wanted to experience the WHOLE app (I haven‚Äôt used all the features yet LOL)I LOVE the music to sleep and the stories to sleep‚Ä¶ I listen to the kids stories because my mind doesn‚Äôt shut down and the kids stories seem to put me to sleep. I am bad at breathing exercises to relax it‚Äôs NEVER worked on me. They have exercises for kids! To me this app is so worth the money! It‚Äôs help got me thru the pandemic stress‚Ä¶ I put on my favorite music and books and I‚Äôm less stressed, and sleep better! Spend the money it‚Äôs worth! It‚Äôs updated frequently so new things are added all the time! You get  a lot from it!
title: My favorite App

review: I like the Calm app and I pay for the premium subscription, but I find myself returning to the same two or three soundscapes or instrumental songs. I love birdsong but there‚Äôs literally only one soundscape with birds to choose from. The other soundscapes are nice but almost every one has blurry white noise in the background. Sometimes my head just wants peaceful sound without all that extra stuff happening in the back. I get that white noise helps people to sleep but it does the opposite for me; I get a headache with so much sound. Please add some soundscapes with just the intentional foreground sounds and skip the blur. Also more instrumentals please.
title: Need more soundscapes without the background white noise

review: This app has changed my life in so many ways. I now wake up earlier and happier.  I am a better mother Bc I have more patience and a better understanding of my boy. I have a better relationship with my bf Bc I am more tolerant, calmer, and level headed. Tamaras voice is so calming and her messages are so inspirational that I find myself wanting to listen to her all the time.
