It has improved the amount I drink and WHY I drink and I have nearly quit smoking. I have begun to work out and WANT to work now. I‚Äôm so much more down to earth and chill. I am so happy I found this app. I told a friend about it.... I saw him a year later and he said it changed his life as well!!!!  I cannot recommend this enough. I love it
title: Life changing

review: This is a detailed, well organized app that‚Äôs high in content. There is a breathing section that you can customize for your own breath, you can customize your background and sounds that play. There are sleep stories that are constantly updating which I love plus there are so many to choose from and there are so many meditations to choose from, even driving meditations and ones for kids etc. You can even customize the voice to be louder than the music and vice versa. They thought of everything with this app. It‚Äôs extremely comprehensive and I never thought to spend that much before but after hearing a few sample sleep stories I now use it every night. Very impressive.
title: Perfection and worth every penny

review: The app itself is everything. It has music, soundscapes, sleep aids, but the meditations have far too much talking in them. If you are looking to meditate, this app doesn't really give you that. But it does give you a lot (too much sometimes) of tools and information to frame your mind-space. I also don‚Äôt like the negative language, using phrases like ‚Äúdon‚Äôt...‚Äù and ‚Äú avoid...‚Äù or ‚Äútry not to...‚Äù I already have enough of that going on in my head I just need to be told what to do, not what NOT to do, if that makes sense. Also her voice sounds staged and impersonal, it sounds like an audiobook-scripted voice. I don‚Äôt think that part would bother me so much if there wasn't so much rambling on that I get lost in the whole point which was to meditate! All in all, I appreciate the app but cannot say I‚Äôm getting any meditating out of it.
title: Good but too much talking

review:
The app itself is fine. But on the app‚Äôs page it specifically says ‚ÄúSupports Family Sharing: Up to six family members will be able to use this app with Family Sharing enabled.‚Äù 

So I paid 70 bucks for a subscription, since I and my son were both enjoying it. When I went to activate it in his phone, the app did not let me, stating that ‚ÄúCalm subscriptions are not eligible for Family Sharing,‚Äù because it is not allowed by Apple. 

This is hypothetically reasonable, of course, but makes it incredibly unethical to promote specifically as supporting Family Sharing. Of course, the free trial supports it, but who cares? The only value comes in a subscription, which I specifically bought because it explicitly said it supported it. This is an deeply deceptive practice that Apple should investigate and forbid. If it doesn't actually support Family Sharing in any meaningful way it should not be allowed to say it does. ‚ÄúApp of the Year‚Äù indeed.
title: Deceptive practice with Family Sharing

review:
In a busy, chaotic, and extremely stressful world, this app has made it easy for me to find my center while I‚Äôm on the go and in the trenches.

It‚Äôs easy to let your personal well-being fall to the wayside when you‚Äôre trying to be an elite performer at work, mom of the year, supportive wife, and dedicated friend. 

This app has gifted me with the ability to take a moment to myself within the convenience of a busy schedule. If I don‚Äôt have time to meditate, at least I‚Äôll have time to take in a daily Jay or motivational story to clear my head. Calm meets me where I AM ‚Ä¶ and allows me the ability to keep reminding myself that it‚Äôs all going to be OK and I‚Äôve got this.
title: Completely changed my life!

review: If I could I would listen to this always. No more need for toxic noise, sound, and music in my life. When my son was born, I was reborn and this application is helping make that an easier transition in my life. I‚Äôm a Marine veteran of war and at 40 years of age my son was born with VSD. At that moment I was truly humbled. I come face to face with that man in the mirror and realized all the denial, the hurt, pain, suffering and more that I was dragging with me. That toxic behavior we all harbor and some more than others. I was on a path of self destruction and in denial. Healing is a journey of self discovery which takes the will and effort to do so. Today I use the calm application for myself and I share it with my family.
title: Beautiful  Happy Calm

review: Before this app, I used to meditate every now and then...mostly when I feel down and out, stressed, depressed...sort of like when most people pray; when they need something. A friend of mine introduced me to this app. Then I downloaded three other apps to compare. I liked that I could try out this app for 7 days before committing and I‚Äôll be honest, $60 a year was something to think about. Through the 7 days I realized this app has gotten me to meditate every day. It definitely helps me to be more mindful of my emotions and responses to what life throws at me. So I decided to pay for the subscription. I look at it like a gym membership. It‚Äôs a necessity for me. It‚Äôs a good quality app. It won‚Äôt disappoint you. Namaste üôèüèΩ
title: The meditation app I needed

review: This is the first review I‚Äôve ever written on Apple. Never thought of it to be worth my time. This app, however, transcended my previous notIon of time and peace in the mind. After a stressful day at work, I have struggled coming home to my wife and baby girl with a positive attitude. When I‚Äôm in my car on the way home, I tune into Calm. Whether it be a relaxing piano melody, sounds of the rain forest, or listening to Lebron on how to train your mind to master emotions. I‚Äôve also got into meditation and yoga for the end of my days because of this. My new found self-awareness and positivity has become evident to my family and has been profoundly beneficial. Thank you to the devs of this app, you have done a truly fantastic job. Namaste ‚úåÔ∏è
title: Finding control

review:
So much useful content in many of the modules. But will I find it again? The navigation is not only incomplete, counter-intuitive and not comprehensive, but the content that is visible is in a state of constant and extreme flux. Everything is constantly changing, shifting and changing position. Modules are often suggested in batches: choose one, then you‚Äôre done, because there‚Äôs no ‚Äúback‚Äù button. No way to return to where you were to check out the rest. Modules are suggested based on experience, the path I‚Äôve taken through the app, but there‚Äôs no way to replicate that experience to bring those same modules back. They‚Äôre gone. Maybe I‚Äôll see them again. Maybe I won‚Äôt. No way to know.

Should I treat my experience in this app as an allegory of life? A metaphor for the unpredictability of existence? A simile of the not-knowing beginner‚Äôs mind? An exercise in spontaneity, an acceptance of the not-desired, or of gratitude for the what-is?  ‚ÄúLife is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you‚Äôre going to get.‚Äù 

Sorry. I get that every day. I don‚Äôt need an app for that. 

This frustration with the interface is not what I want from an app intended to foster ‚Äúcalm.‚Äù
title: So much good, but will I find it again? Who knows?

review: An amazing app truly helps unwind and learn to be in the moment. I am someone who of recent years have been troubled with mental health issues and this app at times has helped cope with those issues. Some days are harder than others and sometimes I forget to use this wonderful app on a daily basis. I am going to try and continue to get on a daily regiment of mediation. I just want to tell you guys thank you and god bless you because society still doesn‚Äôt seem to speak much on mental health as they should and you guys are truly doing a great job to help people overcome their issues if not at least maintain stability. So from the bottom of my heart I want to say thank you!
title: Thank you

review: Good morning my name is mermaid and I love this app this helps me focus and stay calm I have to stay calm all the time I seem to worry about my emotions I don‚Äôt like to assume things a lot either that‚Äôs what I have been doing lately but I also can tail when my feelings are being hurt so I just be alone but I have to get to know Angela because I‚Äôm always taking care of someone else and worrying about everybody else instead of myself that‚Äôs what I definitely have to work and I am a very kind person with a kind heart and I don‚Äôt like to be taken advantage of and that‚Äôs what most people do out here I like to help people but I have to learn to help myself sometimesAll the time I‚Äôm learning how to love myself put me first put God first then me
title: Peace and love

review: I had sepsis after some surgery and almost died. Over the next two years I suffered from terrible panic attacks to the point that I got very little sleep. I‚Äôm also a caregiver for my husband. He has  a rare cancer and his hands and feet are crippled so he is confined to a wheelchair. I don‚Äôt have much extra money but I bought Calm after trying it for a week. Listening to the Daily Calm helped to give me a feeling of peace and relaxation. I am also participating in the series on how to meditate. I look forward to the time I spend with Calm. I‚Äôve been able to find joy again and I practice meditation because I feel constructive about the changes I‚Äôm experiencing. This is a truly life-affirming app.
title: The Calm app is helping me to change my life

review: I first have to say I do love this app a lot.  I love the stories, the meditations, and the music.  The only issue I have had, and it has happened several times, is that there are often times when the app will not load or is not available.  I tend to fall asleep quite easily however, I do not stay asleep.  This is usually when I will listen to stories or music on Calm.  This morning was a good example.  I woke up around 2am and the app would not load.  I tried turning my phone off and on.  I tried deleting and reinstalling the app and nothing worked.  So now I am not Calm I am annoyed and awake.  Is there something else I should be doing when this happens?  It appears to be working fine now.  This only seems to happen very early hours of the morning.
title: Mostly Calming

review:
I‚Äôve always found it hard to get to sleep. Recently, though, my anxiety got so bad that I was falling asleep two hours after I went to bed and waking up at 2 or 3 in the morning every night. I downloaded Calm, and the sleep stories helped me get to sleep in closer to 30 minutes. 

My only suggestion would be to allow users to create playlists. Right now, you can save stories you like, but they don‚Äôt automatically play one after the other. I understand that not all users would like this feature, but if it were an option that could be enabled and disabled, it would help me stay asleep on those nights when I just need a soothing voice in my ear.
title: Helps Me Fall Asleep Better than Anything

review: Please helicopter me into the central office so I can shake each and every one of your hands.  This new phase of poetic bedtime-story mindfulness adventures is melting my heart, and my heart is muy cold sometimes.  I salute you, ye enchanting literary chosen people of wanderlust.  I want to marry you.  I don‚Äôt care if you‚Äôre a man or a woman or an operating system from the future, I want to merge with you in a religious ceremony.  One time I set myself on fire by accident and I saw the face God.  That experience was better than this one by a lot, but I can confidently say that the two experiences live in the same neighborhood.  God bless you, good people of the digital realm of calmness .  May your days be filled with the the light of the joy of our faces as we resonate this golden sounding life bell.
title: Calm has leveled up!

review:
I left my daily practice while I undergone cataract surgery. I wanted to concentrate on the healing and adjustment to this miraculous event. During the recovery I was overwhelmed by the dramatic difference between my recovering eyesight first in my right eye and then my left eye. Colors became clear then the vision in both eyes cleared. Yesterday I went in for my four month evaluation. Both eyes were back to 20/20! 

My eyes were back! And as I said to the surgeon when I left his office ‚ÄúThank you! Thank you! Thank you! I can see all the way to the other side of the Galaxy!‚Äù All of the other patients laughed as I left the office üòé

I should have kept up with the practice. These miracles should be savored.
title: Coming Back.

review: I was able to get a one year Premium subscription for super cheap with a special deal. After using it for a few days, the meditations are fine. What I find super frustrating is there is NO way to easily filter and search for meditations. For example, in another FREE app, I can filter by time, male vs female voice, key word (e.g. binaural), with or without music, even preview the voice. With Calm, there is no way to do that. You can only pick a category, like sleep or mediation. I prefer sleep meditations with music, but I have to literally play at least 30 seconds of each and every one or ff to see if it has it. I‚Äôve already canceled my subscription to ensure it won‚Äôt renew next year because not at all worth full price at $70 when other apps for way less or free have better navigation and functionality.
title: Frustrating to find what you need

review:
It‚Äôs the #1 app for anyone who uses it infrequently or who is a first-time user. I‚Äôve experimented with a couple meditation apps but have found this one to be the best in many ways. I was introduced to mindfulness and meditation through this app and it was very insightful in the beginning. I‚Äôm a yearly subscriber and am currently on a 370+ day streak (great gamification feature btw)

Frankly, the more I use it the more dull it gets. I haven‚Äôt seen much change since I first used it a few years ago. Even looking through the update history it‚Äôs a copy-paste about the app rather than what the update entails. It does feel like not much has changed. 

I‚Äôd be great to see some bugs fixed, meditation searches more intuitive, a better save library - maybe letting users have their own playlists for different types of meditations, and, in my opinion, adding more variety of meditations and series rather than getting big names as narrators. 

As a genuinely big fan of the app I‚Äôd just love to see some changes to make this app the hub for meditation. Keeping it exciting, challenging, and effective even for people who do it daily
title: Great but complacent

review:
Firstly, this is a great app. It was recommended to me by a health and wellness coach as a tool for strengthening my resiliency. It has definitely helped. After having used this app for over a year now, and through such life changes as losing a parent to cancer, moving houses twice and weathering temporary separation from my partner due to his work projects, well let‚Äôs just say I‚Äôm glad  to have this app in my toolkit.

Amongst other things, I‚Äôve been using the Kids Sleep Stories to help my kiddo sleep at night. The drawback to doing that is that Calm will track this as part of my usage, so it‚Äôs making my Stats and Streaks inaccurate.

I wish there was a way to track my kiddo‚Äôs usage separately without paying for another account. Perhaps a Kids Only Dashboard?

Other than that, I‚Äôm in love with the quality of content and all the different ways this app supports my mental health. I turned on push notifications for ‚ÄòResets‚Äô and love the messages I get from that. The Breathing exercises are well designed, not too busy and with sufficient visual and audio cues. I‚Äôm enjoying the different Masterclasses and Daily content as well.
title: Separate Kid Dashboard Please

review:
There‚Äôs a variety of things I wasn‚Äôt expecting from this app, and I am continually using more aspects of it. I do wish it wasn‚Äôt so expensive to use so I‚Äôm thinking of getting the lifetime subscription option. I really don‚Äôt have extra money but it helps me sleep and helps me to take breaks. The features on it are always a joy to explore. I LOVE the sleep songs that are deconstructed from popular songs. And of course soundscapes and sleep stories, and there‚Äôs more as well. 
        One of my favorite apps ever, honestly. This is one of those apps that makes having a smart phone such a great thing. Please don‚Äôt ever go away Calm App!!!
title: I look forward to using this app every day!

review: I am diagnosed with depression and anxiety. They say I have insomnia. I have problems with disassociation. The whole 9 yards. I‚Äôm also active duty army. They‚Äôve fed me medication after medication to help me get to sleep and also stay asleep. I‚Äôve been using this app for only a few days but I literally haven‚Äôt slept so good for as long as I can remember. It usually takes me around 4 hours to fall asleep. Now before sleep, I do a body scan meditation for 20 min then listen to a story. I‚Äôm out within an hour. Which sets me up to get 7-8 hours of sleep. My motivation and work ethics has returned. My anxiety and depression aren‚Äôt as noticeable. This app has opened my eyes to meditation. Something I laughed at throughout rehab and therapy.
title: Deserves 10 stars

review:
Most of what‚Äôs offered here isn‚Äôt traditional meditation. The focus is definitely on a lot of talking and guidance. The paid plan gives you access to a large number of sessions. But most of these are by one individual. The lack of variety is surprising, especially give the cost. Starting in Jan 2021, the offerings improved, but mostly more of the same. 

To make matters worse, the app supposedly tracks your sessions. Results are inconsistent, with some sessions not logged. There was briefly a display of a weekly goal, in addition to ‚Äústreaks.‚Äù Now I‚Äôm on a new phone and that is gone? Why? A few months ago, sessions weren‚Äôt being logged if the app wasn‚Äôt open when the session ended. <sigh> Again, surprising shortcomings for the price and how long Calm had been around.

I got subscription through Amex, which is nice, but I won‚Äôt be renewing. That‚Äôs for sure.
title: Paid offerings limited; poor logging of sessions

review:
I might delete soon if I can‚Äôt figure out a way around listening to Tamara. This app is amazing in concept. Really great UI and I LOVE the sleep stories and the soothing voices of some of the actors that have made appearances on the app. But the way Tamara speaks GRINDS my gears and is so not soothing. Her phony upbeat cadence actually gives me anxiety and reminds me of a dog food commercial where they‚Äôre playing that whistling upbeat commercial tune. I know, I know... My review is very un-zen. But it‚Äôs because I just excitedly opened this app to get some much needed calming, and heard her very unmeditative voice. I should clarify that I‚Äôm not criticizing her actual voice ‚Äî but rather the method of narration and cadence, which is overall too bright and energetic and phony. Frustrated and wanting to love this app more. 

Recommendation: Let us select the narrator for guided meditations!
title: Tamara Levitt‚Äôs narration ruins my meditations

review:
This is my second year using this app and I will likely purchase it again next year. However, the price does make me hesitate before buying. It is extremely expensive.

The app‚Äôs content, however, is incredible. The main lady‚Äôs voice is wonderful. Extremely soothing. Although I use the app how it should be used to meditate, I do also use it to go to sleep. I put the body scan session on when I‚Äôm lying down in bed and within 5 minutes I‚Äôm sound asleep. The whole app is incredibly soothing.

The health benefits have been fantastic. I just don‚Äôt dwell on things that make me anxious any more. Somehow, within a few months after using this app, I genuinely was able to just move on from things that once I would have ruminated over. This is something that I struggled to do for decades, yet Calm managed to get me to do it within a few months.

I am more able to live in the now and concentrate on what‚Äôs important. The app has helped me ‚Äútidy my mind‚Äù if you will. It‚Äôs helped me to prioritise, order, simplify and appreciate my life. I am honestly truly thankful for this app. My wallet, not so muchüò¨
title: Amazing App Although Expensive

review:
By far the best meditation app on the market! I use it almost everyday. Calm has improved my sense of well-being more than any therapist I‚Äôve seen, and taught me coping mechanisms that saved my life. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôve saved others as well. My favorite feature is Daily Calm and adding favorites, so I have a resource to help myself given a specific situation. Every time I listen to Daily Calm I‚Äôm blown away by the wisdom and amount of original content.  I want to give every member of the team a hug.

I read an article online saying Calm is valued at 1 billion dollars and won several awards. These are incredible milestone. You provide a service that ‚Äòmoney can‚Äôt buy‚Äô.  I can‚Äôt thank your team enough.
title: Excellent app and suggestion for developer

review:
I have been using Calm for about 4 months and Its so worth it to me. I started using Calm because I have always wanted to learn more about meditation. The Daily Calm (which is a meditation every day) made it so easy to bring meditation into my routine. And the difference it makes! I like to do the Daily Calm right before I head to work in the morning, as it helps me to set and carry out the intention to be mindful and present in my work day. 

Before I downloaded Calm I didn‚Äôt know that much about Sleep Stories, but they‚Äôre amazing! I usually don‚Äôt make it to the end of them, I fall asleep so fast. It‚Äôs a nice natural way to stop my mind from racing, helping me sleep. My whole life is better when I sleep better!
title: Cheers to mental health and good sleep!

review:
This app is beautifully designed. And, what I could access for free was excellent quality. HOWEVER, apps are a very personal thing. You want to try it out and decide if it‚Äôs worth the subscription you‚Äôll likely forget you‚Äôre paying for and to decide if it‚Äôs worth the space on your phone. 

The home screen has lock symbols all over it. That is many things, but not calming. It‚Äôs overmonetized, and that overshadows the intended experience. You should charge for quality, but when you lock down experiences and don‚Äôt encourage free (limited is fine to a point) exploration, you discourage use and invite churn. 

You might have great adoption with those less discerning. Who knows. If you‚Äôre ‚Äúlistening,‚Äù open up more experiences, and you might get more loyal customers who have money to spend.
title: Beautiful app. Unrealistic pre-purchase experience

review:
I came to this app skeptical as a lot of people do. I kept an open mind and started poking at the various options... let‚Äôs face it, I need a little help everywhere. I dove in with the sleep stories due to very bad insomnia. Guess who didn‚Äôt make it through The Lavender Valley. This chick! I was excited and I dove more into the meditation. 

One session with the anxiety and I‚Äôm feeling a bit more at ease. I love it. I can‚Äôt wait to check the other options available for free. Even with a skeptical mind I went through the process and took it seriously and feel good for doing it. 

I wish it were cheaper to unlock everything, because I desperately want to, but sadly I lack the funds to do so currently but I absolutely think it can help whoever needs a breather to just sit back and bring them into the now and center the mind more. But they do offer a good variety of freebie sessions which are also super effective. 

Kudos to the developers and thank you for easing some of the things that are currently ruling and trying to ruin my life. I hope with more practice I can be a better person to myself and everyone else.
title: Just what I needed

review:
This app is great! Beautiful content. I‚Äôve only had it for one day but am loving everything it offers so far.

However, I‚Äôd like to report a major bug that is making the experience quite stressful. In the master classes, when I open the app after having navigated away from it to do something else, it starts playing audio automatically, and not only one track, but often two or three different audio files play at once. There is no pause button, so my phone is just shouting multiple audio tracks at once and I have to push play on something, anything, to add another audio track to the cacophony before I can then push pause, which somehow stops all tracks from playing and finally silences the app.

This also happens when going from one segment of a master class to the next. If you let it autoplay the next segment, it works fine. But if you click the play button to play the next segment, it immediately starts playing back the next segment twice (two audio files playing back at the same time but about 5 seconds apart).

Please fix these issues!

Thanks!
title: Great app - NEEDS FIX ON BUG: audio playback in double and triple when app is opened

review: Hi I‚Äôm Ellie and I have a very hard time getting a good amount of sleep that‚Äôs why I use kids stories on calm. Every time I can‚Äôt go to sleep I listen to a story and fall asleep almost immediately. I also sometimes use the breath or the daily move. I use the breath because it helps me relax and calm down. I use that daily move cus it helps my move stretch and it makes me feel tired. My favorite part about calm is the kids stories. My favorite story is raggedy an stories. I like that story because it reminds me of just being calm you know. Anyway this is why I use calm and I think if you have any trouble with breathing falling to sleep exercise and much more. Calm has it. üòä
title: Hood books

review: First off, Tamara‚Äôs voice is so soothing! I have anxiety with random panic attacks, especially in the mornings. I find listening to the guided meditation really helps. Sometimes I listen while staring at the beautiful pictures provided and ‚Äòtrance out‚Äô. I would love to go further with this app but the charge to have all access is ridiculous. I just downloaded two more meditation apps to try because the free portion of this app is restricting me from going further. I really love this app and it does help me but I do not have the kind of money it takes to use this app fully. I did notice there are a lot of other apps out there and I would love to stay loyal to Calm but they charge too much and would create more stress in me trying to afford the app. Tamara has found her calling though-her voice is like mothers milküòÅ
title: Tamara‚Äôs voice is the high point!

review: When I first discovered Calm, I was a little shocked by the price of the premium subscription(thankfully my mom took care of that). The different soundscapes and music has really helped me out when I‚Äôm on a trip somewhere and need some background noise for wherever I‚Äôm staying. The different Sleep Stories are also quite entertaining and I fall asleep in minutes. My personal favorite Sleep Stories are: ‚ÄúThe Glacier Express‚Äù, ‚ÄúSouth Africa‚Äôs Blue Train‚Äù, ‚ÄúHistory of The Transformers‚Äù( big science fiction fan btw), ‚ÄúAn Australian Adventure‚Äù (RIP Steve), and ‚ÄúSacred New Zealand‚Äù (quite fond of LEGO‚Äôs Bionicle franchise). BTW Tamara Levitt, if you‚Äôre reading this, I just want you to know that I really love your app!
title: Worth every dollar (and then some)

review:
I‚Äôve had an iPhone since 2009. This is my first App Store review. I have severe mental illness and the calm app can literally help me stop from having a panic attack. The Panic S.O.S. Series is such an amazing tool. 
I can get overwhelmed quickly but my thoughts return to normal after these sessions. 
I love that I can save my favorites. I particularly love the soundscapes. I‚Äôm listening to Water, Giver of Life. It is just so soothing and when listening to it with my headphones I feel like I‚Äôm on vacation while doing work at the kitchen table. 
It‚Äôs a transformative app and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. 
Thank you Tamra Levitt for you sharing your gift of guiding me through my meditations. ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Don‚Äôt let the subscription stop you

review:
This app is great if you‚Äôre new to mediation, but it used to be better. For some reason, not all of the mediation series will keep track of where you‚Äôre at in the series, only the ones authored by Tamera (not saying anything against her but this is such a pointless drop in app design). 

The streak calendar will only keep track of completed meditations, but at the same time, you can‚Äôt click on a day to see which meditations you completed. On top of that, if calm doesn‚Äôt record a meditation you complete and you enter it manually it will break your ‚Äústreak.‚Äù 

ALL of the meditations have the same flow format (ie, starts with a message, meditate for two minutes, ends with message), which gets corny and old. It‚Äôs time to put some actual GUIDED meditations back on the app where the narrators are just there to guide NOT to LEAD or talk at you
title: They need in-app feedback

review: I downloaded calm on the recommendation of a friend about sleeping. I started with the 30 day introduction to meditation and found it very helpful as a start to meditation. I tried a few daily calms but I found Tamara‚Äôs voice a bit grading at first. Sorry tamara! However I began considering that that was simply a resistance I was having in my mind to embarking on a practice and was then easily able to overcome that thought and I now find Tamara delightful. Many days I find very useful guidance and advice in the daily meditations that I am able to bring my life with my family and particularly in a challenging work environment where I am the leader of many diverse personalities.
title: Incredibly Influential and Worthwhile

review: It has always been a battle to put my eight year old stepdaughter to sleep each night. We have tried reading books, putting a movie on, warm showers before bed, etc and still she would be constantly out of her room making every excuse in the book to not go to sleep. It would typically take between an hour to an hour and a half for her to actually fall asleep from the time we put her to bed. I decided to download calm and give it a try...I played the first story on there for kids and just like that, she was out within 7 minutes!!! Now we use it every night when it‚Äôs bedtime and she is out like a light. I no longer dread bedtime, and she enjoys the stories! Win win!!
title: Great for kids too!

review:
I don‚Äôt understand. The app says it is free but then it says I have to pay freaking 70 dollars a year for this app. 
I am really bummed out with this app because i thought that i was going to be distressed and that i could listen to things such as the city or crickets to help me fall asleep. Or to sleep like a baby. But NOPE! If you even click on it it tells you to pay 70 dollars a year and that is stupid. I mean, it does help me with gratitude check ins and mood check ins but other than that i can‚Äôt listen to the sleep stories or music or asmr that they provide because it is locked. I hope that this will improve over time and that the developer of this app will make it a little more flexible because i am sure others are having this issue too and they just want to be cured of anxiety and depression (that‚Äôs me lol)
title: Everything is locked ü§®

review:
I am a Special Education Teacher and I use this app not only with my students in the classroom but at home to calm myself from a busy day. 
The first time I played a story for the students there was not a sound in the room. The spinning and repetitive noises stopped. They thoroughly enjoyed the calmness and security the story and peacefulness provided. I use it every day after PE class to bring the children back into a space of calmness and ready to learn. 
I also use this app at home when I‚Äôm feeling anxious. I do yoga and mediate to the 7 days of anxiety. It has helped my mental state so much the last month. 
Thank you for allowing teachers to use this app free of charge. I use it every day and I cannot thank you enough.
title: Nothing Better

review:
I recently saw the Calm app commercial on TV and decided to download it because it advertised itself as a ‚Äúfree app.‚Äù I tried the free trial for 1 week and I really enjoyed it. I got a lot of use out of the sleep stories. The Eva Green one is my favorite. 
Based on my free trial, I‚Äôm rating Calm 2 stars. My biggest issue is that it‚Äôs expensive. $70 a year and it doesn‚Äôt seem like there‚Äôs an option to pay it month by month. $70 upfront is a lot at anytime, but especially now since a lot of people are out of work. 
I also wish they offered a student plan option for a lesser price. College students are always stressed and I think this would be a great app to help them reduce stress without breaking the bank.
My final issue is that NOTHING is free. It‚Äôs free to download and create an account, but if you actually want to use the app and it‚Äôs features, you need to subscribe to premium.
title: Nice app, but nothing is free

review:
I love the app. I really do. If you have trouble turning off the old brain at night, please try it. BUT to Calm: all the languages! I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs a wonderful thing to increase your market. I totally get it. But can we have a setting to turn off being able to see the stories in languages that are not our native? It makes it sooo hard to go through the list. The worst is seeing a story being suggested or a new story (yay!) only to turn it on and it‚Äôs in another language (sometimes it‚Äôs hard to tell). Also, a sort by new stories or alpha would be awesome. I could listen to Erik Braa or Alan Sklar read the alphabet....Thanks!
PS - I will say, though, that an occasional story in French, which I don‚Äôt speak, will put me right out.
title: Languages!

review: I thoroughly enjoy this program.   I am just starting to utilize it, but I appreciate the variety and volume of meditative options. I am working on the discipline of carving out time for the truly important things like health, prayer and reflection.  I like most people today struggle with busyness. Let‚Äôs face it we‚Äôre all busy whether your a stay-at-home person or Fortune 500 executive. There‚Äôs always something that needs to be done.  Calm is a tool that reminds you and helps you prioritize talking time for you, your mental health, your spiritual(not necessarily religious) health & and your physical health. To wok at one‚Äôs optimal levels you need balance and anchors that Keep you firing on all cylinders. Calm is one of those anchors.
title: A treasure of an app for each of us

review:
I‚Äôve had this app for about a year now and I used to use it every day. I‚Äôm a college student, so it‚Äôs not always financially feasible for me to have the paid version of this app; which is why I really loved when they used to have a pay-by-the-month option. Now that they have gotten rid of that option, you can either pay $60 for one year or deal with the free version. 
With that said, I feel like more should be added to the free version, since listeners like myself may not be able to pay $60 upfront for an app. I love the sleep stories and would love if they unlocked just a few more than 4 stories for free-version listeners. 
Other than that small complaint, I still recommend this app to all of my friends with anxiety/insomnia issues or those that want to know more about meditation!
title: Please Expand

review: This app is so great for those of us just starting to explore meditation and yoga. I love the guidance; the voice is so soothing and grounding. I have not paid for a subscription yet. I find that right now, I'm only able to practice sporadically, but as my intention grows, I'm so excited to invest the money so that I can explore the paid meditations. I also share this app with many of my counseling clients. With one of my clients dealing with severe anxiety, we start each therapy session with a meditation from this app. I always give her the option, and she always chooses to meditate. I highly recommend this app to a person looking to start meditating. I have a feeling that in the future I will highly recommend this app to seasoned meditators as well.
title: Thankful

review: It took me a year to really get into this app, but it is so versatile and packed with so much resources. I love it! I love the little refresh messages sent to me daily, I really enjoy all the various meditations and talks that they have by so many different people, but sometimes I just want to listen to music that matches my mood of low stress, and they even have a Hawaiian slack key guitar playlist! It has everything that I need for when I‚Äôm in the mood for a specific resource. Comprehensive, and well worth the premium version! I‚Äôm lucky, my healthcare provider pays for it, but now that I know how helpful. and resource rich it is, I totally would pay for the premium version!
title: Comprehensive App

review: What I love: I use this app almost every night for the sleep stories, which are excellent and highly effective. Thank you SO much for providing such high quality scripts and voice talent. I also appreciate the variety of topics - and diversity of voices. My issue: Most of the stories are around 30 minutes, which is long enough to put me to sleep. But then I often awaken when they end and have to manually restart or start a different one, which means more interrupted sleep. My request: Please please please add either a playlist option or continuous play feature and/or more anthologies. Thank you üôèüíó
title: Sleep stories - options for longer play please!

review: This app has been wonderful. It has helped me fall asleep (and back to sleep) so easily. I‚Äôve always wanted to meditate but I have a difficult time sitting still for long so the short, guided meditations are perfect. I‚Äôm happy to pay for it - the cost is much less than a therapy session and gives me a daily dose of mental fitness. My only suggestion would be to have a couple more voices, especially for the sleep meditations. I enjoy one person for the daily meditations, but the rise and fall of her voice doesn‚Äôt work well for me to fall asleep too and she is on many of them so I find myself doing the same few. Not a big deal really, but just a thought.
title: I LOVE this app!

review: In many ways, Calm has been an incredible source of guidance for me throughout my life. It has introduced me to amazing practices from around the world and helped me to navigate along my journey. Over my time using this program, I‚Äôve been able to develop a mindset that has opened me up to the beauty of wellness and because Calm‚Äôs content is always expanding, there‚Äôs always something that I can look forward to. It‚Äôs brilliantly designed and formatted cohesively with many features that can be tailored to any liking. I can say with sincerity that Calm is one of the best experiences of its kind, and I recommend it to anyone wanting to take the time to practice self care.
title: A Wonderful Guide

review: Calm is a great app to us for a lot of thing but what I got calm for the most is my sleep I have trouble sleeping at night and when I got calm I was not so sure if I was going to like it but I loved it and it was amazing. I have one thing though if you could have a mute button for the cricket sounds because when I am trying to put my sleep story on I can‚Äôt without making a bunch of noise and waking people up in my room I share a room and that wakes her up. I also like calm because of all of the sections like they have like meditation, sleep, and music. The meditation helps when I am doing my work. The music helps when I am lying down. And the sleep helps me with sleep.
title: Calm is great

review: I did the trial and really liked the sleep story options so I went ahead with the purchase. Unfortunately the trial may not have been long enough for me to realize that most of the other content is unusable for me because of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice. Like many other reviewers I really can‚Äôt stand it. If you are looking into this app as an option for you for more mindfulness I‚Äôd recommend listening to one of her meditations just to make sure you jive with her voice. If not, she‚Äôs virtually impossible to avoid. I don‚Äôt really feel like I‚Äôm getting my money‚Äôs worth because of it. Also, it would be nice to have more ASMR options. The current offering are ok, but not totally in line with what I would consider ASMR. If the app developers are reading this, please consider ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù options with different voices.
title: New Narrator Options

review: I LOVE this app. I have a lot of trouble sleeping due to anxiety and calm has helped so much. I usually fall asleep within five or ten minutes of a sleep story starting. I also really like how you can keep track of your moods and get recommendations for meditations based on what your mood is. The only reason I gave four stars was because I really think there should be an option to make a playlist or a repeat option of what stories, sounds, etc that you want to listen to. It‚Äôs really annoying for me to have to restart a story or choose a new one because I haven‚Äôt fallen asleep yet. That really wakes me up and stresses me out. Overall this is an amazing app that is totally worth the subscription cost and I have recommended it to many people.
title: Amazing App Just One Request

review:
Perhaps I‚Äôm spoiled by Relax Melodies and Daily Yoga apps, but I feel extremely underwhelmed by Calm. Tamara‚Äôs voice is rather annoying and I can‚Äôt stand the format of the Daily Calm (it‚Äôs not calming, it‚Äôs irritating). The Daily Calm is constantly in your face and there is no way to make it disappear (I asked). Much of the audio is done by celebrities, celebrities that I genuinely don‚Äôt care about and don‚Äôt want to hear, which limits my options.

I tried listening to a Masterclass about Stoic Philosophy, it was clearly written by someone who doesn‚Äôt have a set schedule and is completely unrelatable to me. Just like every other ‚Äúmotivational‚Äù speaker I‚Äôve heard, they only relate to people who work in marketing or similar departments and never relate to those of us that work set schedules, that already wake up early to go to work early, that work alone and have daily deadlines that aren‚Äôt flexible.

I had big hopes for this app, but I just find it irritating.
title: Underwhelming

review: In these uncertain times it‚Äôs so important we remain clearheaded and focused. Ridding ourselves of the constant chatter is, by far, the best we can do for ourselves and those around us. ‚ÄúCalm Down‚Äù is not as easy as it seems. This app is an essential tool in keeping what‚Äôs really important and what is not, separated by simple breathing exercises with sounds of Nature. What relief it brings, especially the sound of the birds in the background. This is the best gift you can give yourself for the relief of stress, anxiety along with all the needless worry over what we cannot control but ourselves. I truly thank and appreciate the developers of this most important app and thank them for the relief it was brought to so many ‚ù§Ô∏è Try it.
title: It only takes a moment...

review:
I applied for and received a free teacher yearly subscription to try out in my classroom. I am a K-5 music teacher who sees my younger students immediately after recess. That is a tough transition. I have been teaching for 13 years and have tried EVERYTHING to get my students ready to learn and sing as soon as they come in. I only see them once a week and my time with them is precious.  

This year I tried this app to use as a way to get my students in a mindset where they are ready and able to learn quickly. So far I have used the meditations meant for kids as well as several of the body ones. 

My students love it!!! I find that even though I am taking time out of instruction to implement this, I am getting the same amount of work done in less time and they are more focused during the instruction. 

I have also tried the chair stretching body movements for my older students who do a lot of testing - giving them a tool to use to get their blood flowing and muscles moving- all from their chair. I‚Äôm going to continue this for the school year and see what happens. 

So far I love it.
title: Perfect with students

review: I love this app and I cannot say that enough. I haven‚Äôt used many of the meditation aspects but the sleep stories alone are worth the subscription price. My anxiety loves to act up when I‚Äôm trying to fall asleep which means I can lay there awake for quite a while before I actually fall asleep. Listening to the sleep stories allows me to focus on something else and my anxiety fades away. A few of my favorites are ‚ÄúThe shipping forecast‚Äù, ‚Äúblue gold‚Äù, ‚Äúthe seventeenth princess‚Äù, and ‚Äústarlight symphony.‚Äù There‚Äôs at least one new sleep story every week so you can try new ones but also rely on your favorites. There are also ASMR options for those who enjoy that. Thank you, Calm, for helping me get more sleep!
title: Highly recommended!

review:
I love this app and am a lifetime access subscription holder.

I love statistics. I love capturing them, analyzing them, and (hopefully) using them to some good end. This is one of the amazing aspects of the iOS sphere of products!

However, because Calm disappoints and puts me in a awkward situation due to the fact it erroneously logs Sleep Stories as Mindfulness Minutes in HealthKit.

I do not want to throw off my daily Mindfulness Minutes by logging long Sleep Stories, so I must disabled HealthKit integration in Calm. This is the lesser of evils though as by not having HealthKit enabled in Calm, I do not capture actual Mindfulness Minutes metrics from actual Calm meditation sessions.

Having the ability to log mediation minutes to HealthKit but NOT Sleep Stories minutes would encourage me to become a better practitioner of meditation using Calm. I‚Äôd be capturing accurate data to help gauge my progress (or lack thereof) of my burgeoning meditation routine.

I put in a feature request for this ages ago and it never came to be, so I‚Äôm re-voicing the request here. I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one with this quandary.
title: Sleep Stories counted a Mindfulness Minutes ‚òπÔ∏è

review: I absolutely love Calm, but because I'm not able to pay for a premium subscription, I can't play and music, listen to a lot of stories, and even don't have access to meditations. It's almost like the normal subscription is just a trial, and that you have to pay for the full service and material. By no means am I implying that there shouldn't be a premium, but those is us without the premium subscription can only access little sources. It would be nice if more was available, like the music. When Calm updated, it made all of the music premium. I used to love listening to the music to fall asleep, but now they've taken away that too. In simple words, I feel that more should be available if you have the normal subscription, otherwise, it's like you're just on a trial for be actual thing.
title: Too much premium content

review: I have been using the Calm app for over 6 months now, and I don‚Äôt know how I lived without it!  Whenever I am feeling stressed, I can choose a meditation from their vast selection to alleviate the stress - and let‚Äôs be honest, we are living in a very stressful time.  I LOVE the sleep stories, which I use nightly to help me relax and ease into sleep.  There are so many to choose from and I have many favorites. It is such a luxury to have someone read me a story, using a calm, peaceful voice.  I am usually asleep before the story is finished, so I have to admit that I don‚Äôt know how most of them end!  I love this app so much that I signed up for a lifetime subscription - and it is worth every penny!  Try it - you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
title: My favorite app

review: My friend introduced me to the Calm app, I had heard about it already and saw ads recommending it but never had the opportunity or need to use it until now.  I am 23 weeks pregnant and all the worries I usually have under control, have come to the surface with this new pregnancy hormones and random pregnancy dreams. The calm app has features to soothe me to sleep, focusing on my peace instead of the unwanted racing thoughts.  I also learned new breathing techniques that actually work fast.  I have not even begin to explore this app to the fullest but just with a couple of options I‚Äôm handling this temporary anxiety in a hopeful way.  Thank you to the creators and innovators from Calm.
title: Excellent tool

review: I‚Äôve used this app every single night for years - it is THE BEST for falling asleep. I‚Äôm always amazed at the sheer volume of content available across all categories. It‚Äôs also super easy to use. None of these confusing subscription levels of access. Calm seriously has content for so many situations - beautiful music to work to, meditations for any occasion/length, background soundscapes/white noise, and of course the amazing library of sleep stories for both us and the kids. I even use the app  as a white noise machine for the baby when we travel. Seriously the best money I spend each year - beyond great value for the very reasonable subscription fee.
title: A Nightly Staple

review:
I‚Äôm going to split this reveiw into 2 parts:
The good:
This app is prettey good at getting you into meditation, better sleep, and can help you calm down in moments of overwhelm and panic.
The bad:
However, this app has its flaws. The first flaw is that too much stuff is premium! I know, i know, people still have to make money. But 76% of stuff is premium! 50% of stuff should be premium in my opinion, but, just know, this is my opinion. I don‚Äôt know what works for people of the app. The second flaw is that, sometimes, when you try to play a FREE masterclass, ( free as in no lock icon wich basically means free), it MAKES you try premium! This is a common marketing ploy that i hate! Finally, the third flaw: this app is WAY too much for a premium! I hope you change some things, Calm.
title: 3 stars for 3 complaints

review: Love the app, but really love the immersive sounds scapes because they help me focus during work. My favorite soundscape by far is The Office because I used to enjoy playing that in the background while I worked, but would get distracted sometimes by the plot. Now I can immerse myself into the environment of The Office with the soundscape and not get distracted. However, I have found that the same content repeats a lot while I work. It would be awesome to expand this. I will be a faithful subscriber if there are routine updates to the office background noise. I just need 7-8 hours to listen to on repeat, but would happily take more than that. Please!!! Thank you
title: More Office soundscape please

review:
I don‚Äôt even know how to fully capture in this review everything this app has done for me. I‚Äôm so grateful to have this in my life because it has helped me contain everything that comes with my anxiety. The physical sensations, the constant worrying, and all of the stress seem to always die down a bit whenever I use this app. From the soundscapes, anxiety release meditations, Tamara‚Äôs voice, and all the Daily Calms, it all adds up to making my life just better. So thank you to all of the people who were a part of making this app a reality, and for making it a safe space for me to release the negative and bring in the positive. THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

-Christian
title: Thank you

review: I really truly find myself when reading and listening, I have not yet but I will write down these quotes and take them with me. Right now I just breath just like lebron said (just breath and let you mind and body find the knowing (calm). Although I do believe I am different from who I was years ago (And I‚Äôm 21 now) I deal with depression. I do believe writing down the quotes and sayings by these people talking will heal my wounded mind. I couldn‚Äôt think of much more to say because I am in my break at work right now, but I love u Calm (your app touches me in levels) and thank you for letting me write this review and thank you to my cousin for putting me on to know about Calm app.
title: Cousins job

review: I feel like this app is really great to help you through some emotional issues but there are a lot of things that are locked. There‚Äôs a lot of trouble going to things that are locked because almost 99% of things there are locked there are a lot of things that locked sometimes you only have very few choices and sometimes you don‚Äôt have a choice at all because all of them are locked although I am glad that you do not have to unlock the premium for the home screen pages but I feel like there‚Äôs just too many things that are locked and they cut down on the locking to ask for premium and they might have added such a higher price.
title: Amazing but locked

review: I first downloaded the app a few weeks after it was launched, many years ago. I remember playing the soft rain sounds and the voice-actress with the soothing voice telling me to breathe. I had the app for a couple years, and I just downloaded it again to see what‚Äôs new. Wow. There‚Äôs a lot new. It‚Äôs a lot of celebrities selling their persona businesses: Suze Orman, so you meditate on money; LeBron so you meditate on pro sports; Ellie Goulding and Harry Styles so you meditate on ... pop music? The list goes on with Disney and more. Mind you there‚Äôs nothing wrong with any of these personality businesses - just ... why are they teaching meditation, over actual Buddhist monks? People whose existence is about meditation. I don‚Äôt recognize this app anymore, but it has an exclusivity and isolationist vibe. 3 stars because you guys have a very pretty designed app, though.
title: Strange Pivot

review: Meditation is so not natural to me. Tried in the past, never worked. Saw an ad for Calm somewhere that struck a note w/ me and decided to give it a try for a week. Whatever it is about the Calm app actually works for me. My mind and body soak up those lovely ten minute sessions like a sponge. After a week I paid for the extended version and it‚Äôs probably the only app I don‚Äôt regret paying for. The short exercise sessions are great too. So happy I gave Calm a try after so many failed meditation attempts in the past. I just did a session, went into it heart literally racing‚Äîevery time I think it‚Äôs not going to work, but it has. Try it. I‚Äôve stuck with it for months now and I really love it.
title: Never could meditate till this app

review: EVERYTHING IS PREMIUM! I don‚Äôt mean to be angered but some people need an app like that for stress and stuff but don‚Äôt have the money to pay üí∞ üí∞ üí∞ üí∞ üí∞ cause I certainly don‚Äôt I know that‚Äôs not your prob and I get it but don‚Äôt you think having only like what? 4 things that are not premium gives people no choice but to buy premium. I mean there is a choice to buy premium for a reason but now it seems like I should get some other app that gives me a choice whether or not to have premium cause you have such a tiny amount of free things I really just get tired of doing the same things over and over and over again! So please at least if you try to improve with more free meditations and calming things cause not everyone has the money to buy premium, and I wasn‚Äôt going to buy premium but there is literally like nothing that‚Äôs free so... I guess I‚Äôm off to another app.
title: Premium

review:
I was going through a rough time personally with a relationship and this app helped me to slow things down, stand back from my thoughts and to re-evaluate my conduct and areas for improvement. It restored calm. 

The app is very well organized and a premium is placed on the quality of the content. There are bite sized sessions that are designed to keep you coming back everyday - it‚Äôs addictive.  There are also longer form sessions and master classes that allow you to delve more deeply into areas of interest. 

Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice is pure velvet and the success of the app owes a lot to her input. This was the best investment in myself I have made in a long time. It literally changed my outlook on life and my place in it.
title: This app saved me!

review: Calm is pretty good. The only thing that is bad is the fact that you have to pay for it. You can only get like, 2 meditations if you don‚Äôt pay $70. Other than that, very soothing and effective. I have fallen asleep  several times during one of these üòÇ. Would definitely do the women‚Äôs voice, because it is more calming and trancelike. Be careful with the sleep stories, because you will find yourself wanting to hear the end of the story, and it keeping you from sleeping. Would recommend to a friend tho, because it helps you manage your anger, relax, and learn to go with the flow. ALSO IF YOU READ THIS DOWNLOAD ROBLOX, SUCH A GOOD APP, IM ADDICTED, AND IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A NEW APP WOULD RECOMMEND.
title: Pretty good, but 1 thing

developerResponse: {'id': 6506454, 'body': "Hi there, I'm sorry to hear your frustration regarding our privacy policy. To clarify, some of your data is collected by nature of you downloading the app onto your phone and using it so we have our privacy policy which explains how your data is used and protected. If you have any questions regarding the policy, please reach out to support@calm.com and we'd be happy to clarify any confusion.", 'modified': '2018-12-21T23:46:26Z'}
review: This app appears to be a barely disguised way of forcing users to agree to having their private information collected for God only knows what use? If the creators are trying to be clever, this really misses the mark! Upon loading the app, one is asked to either agree to one of the most extensive privacy policy memorandums I‚Äôve ever seen...or click on read more (the aforementioned privacy policy to choke a horse)! Once read you are directed back to the opening message where you can either agree to their policy or close the app. NO OPT OUT IS PROVIDED, as would be expected with any other similar application. I have deleted the app and unless the reader wants their privacy invaded, I‚Äôd suggest the same. What adds insult to injury is these people have the unbelievable temerity to request payment for a premium version. In other words, one pays to have their data spread out all over kingdom come! This is pure sh**!!
title: Being forced to accept privacy policy?

review:
I have been using this app for the past year consistently. I love it and it is/was my favorite meditation app. I have recommended it to more people than any other app probably. The meditations that I used it for were the body scan and the loving kindness. 

This morning I went to use it and saw that loving kindness is no longer free and requires the annual $60 subscription. I‚Äôm sorry but even if I used all of the features in the app I think that is pretty expensive. I understand a lot of work and effort goes into this app and that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so great, but for someone like myself Who really only wants to use two of the meditations, why not offer an option to purchase access to those meditations specifically? I would pay a few dollars for each of those to have permanent access. Instead of getting some of my money you don‚Äôt get any now with the current model. Please consider different purchase options.
title: Sad to say goodbye.

review: When I first got calm I could turn on a specific sound or sleep music and it‚Äôd play the same thing on loop every night until I woke up. With current update, it gives the option for how long you can set the specific sound to play, but it doesn‚Äôt do it. For instance I will set the sleep timer for 9 hours (just in case) on the Milky Way sleep music and when I wake up, which is always well before that time or in the middle of the night , it‚Äôs not playing the Milky Way sleep sound. I‚Äôve grown accustomed to falling asleep to this sound and when I get up numerous times throughout my the night it has helped me fall back asleep quickly. So for it to not even be playing an hour to 2 hours after I‚Äôve initially turned it on is frustrating considering the amount I pay for the app.
title: Sounds you listen too

review: Meditation isn‚Äôt something I was super familiar with before I bought this app, but a therapist, in conjunction with some books I read, suggested that I try it. Now, I won‚Äôt go a day without meditating in the morning. It‚Äôs how I start my day, and it‚Äôs an integral part of my well-being. The journaling aspect is invaluable, and I have recommended this app to countless friends and family members. The only thing I would suggest to the developers is to allow the music portion (new music by Keith Urban is üëèüôåüëåüèΩ) to be played outside the app, so that when I‚Äôm checking e-mail, making dinner or using another app, the music still plays in the background.
title: Best Gift I‚Äôve Ever Given Myself

review: This is a worthwhile app, however it has limited fiction stories for adults. Some of the children‚Äôs fables have been interesting and some not. Adult stories like The Time Machine, Gulliver‚Äôs Travels, Gift of the Magi were wonderful. There were interesting, but I was not so engrossed in the story that I could not drift off to sleep. Most of the nonfiction stories do not engage my mind enough and thus my mind starts to wander. One app category is fiction stories but the majority of stories listed in this section are nonfiction. Seems like it would not be hard to keep the categories straight.  I Had not planned to renew because I found another app with more adult stories but I missed the deadline and was already charged. I will keep one more year and hope for more adult fiction.
title: Limited stories for adults

review:
I had to open up to it because I was anxious at first in general. You may know how that goes.. but wow. I‚Äôve been benefiting so much. From the stories and meditations to the reflections and check ins. I could say a lot. But most importantly, I feel a: more relaxed and clear, and b: pleasantly surprised to know more about myself and feel growth. 
and the only reason I would be surprised at all is because I try to have an open mind when it comes to apps. This app is great. I would suggest the free trial and definitely experience it the full way through to see how you like it. I opened up to exploring more after a couple days. And I felt inspired to leave this review. Best.
title: I‚Äôm impressed. Very effective for me.

review: I have had so many problems with life just being life sometimes. It was going entirely too fast and far too often I began to forget to live in the RIGHT now and be present. It‚Äôs actually scary to think about because I was in my body at all times but I got so lost in my thoughts that I begin to wonder ‚Äúwho controlled me when I wasn‚Äôt ‚Äúthere‚Äù fully?‚Äù This is my first day using Calm and I‚Äôm thoroughly impressed off of the trial that I got when initially downloading the app. It is very late at night and you guys magically appeared in ad form on a social network that I was browsing at the time. I will be putting money into this app and recommending to everyone that I speak to. Again I say, thank you.
title: Simply thank you.

review: I owe a LOT to the Calm app. I was struggling heavily with anxiety and depression issues, to the point where I couldn‚Äôt sleep or eat (I lost 5 pounds in like 3 days). I never thought I‚Äôd be able to get over it, but the Calm meditation classes have taught me so much that I never knew about my mind and body and gave me so much strength I didn‚Äôt know I had. Whenever I‚Äôm feeling tense I now know how to handle it, and I know how to fall asleep easily. The soundscapes are so peaceful, and I like that you can choose different ones or use the same one for all courses. I‚Äôve definitely been recommending it to my friends who struggle with similar issues and I‚Äôm just really glad this came into my life when it did. Thank you Calm!
title: Wow...just wow

review: This app is amazing. I live with Borderline Personality Disorder & a big part of living in recovery with it is emotion regulation. I cannot tell you the amount of times this app has helped me walk away & re-ground myself. I can easily step into my office & go thru a quick session without causing disruption to my work day. Just the other day I was having a very intense panic attack at a family Christmas party & I was able to go into a home office, sit down in a chair, & do a 10 minute grounding session followed by a 5 minute breathing session. I do the daily meditation every night before bed. The topics are SO relevant. I rarely purchase apps, let alone do a subscription, but I would recommend this to absolutely anyone.
title: The Real Deal

review:
These people don‚Äôt help you to calm down or relax in fact it‚Äôs just the opposite. I tried the temporary for free method and now oh and then I decided I didn‚Äôt want to use it so I canceled and that was a year and a half ago. I‚Äôm going through my phone today looking for things like a delay and all of a sudden I see that they‚Äôve been charging me 1495 a month for a year and a half and I cannot for the life of me find out how in the world to get rid of it. title: Theives

review: Okay the title is definitely misleading because I just wanted you to look at this review. It is like a normal good review because I love calm and it helps me fall asleep fast. You should definitely get this because it helps a ton. I have one request. I want to be able to listen to multiple different stories but when I look up certain stories they are either different  than they should be or they aren‚Äôt in calm. It is annoying because even though calm is very relaxing it is not great. For example I was listening to a great story that was nice in the beginning but then the narrator started to tell the story in FRENCH!!!!!!!!! Most of all though  calm is good so you should get it.
title: Calm is the worst thing in the world!!!

review:
Every time I listen to the :15 or :30 commercials I just stop what I‚Äôm doing and focus on breathing - something I have to think about - exercising my breathing skills, because I have been told I do not breath enough!!! 
So, in the evenings I enjoy flipping through the catalog and finding the right energy and level of peaceful introspection to process my day and redirect any negativity or over stimulation of energy that could make it difficult to relax into a regenerating rest.
Yes , I do enjoy and look forward to Calm at the beginning, middle and end of the day and night.  It helps to go back to sleep and to wake up!!!
Thank you God for the gift of the people who developed the exceptional app/programming ‚ú®
title: Redirection for the day

review:
When I first found Calm, I was deep in throes of Complex PTSD. I had already been with an excellent therapist for a few years, but Calm helped me take my healing to a level of peace I never thought possible. I am able to manage my stress, acknowledge intrusive thoughts as just thoughts and not facts, and bring myself out anxiety attacks when they arise. 

As I have delved into the world of DBT, I have found many of the meditations and exercises on the app to be very much in like with the skills I am learning in therapy. 

One skill I am currently working on learning is progressive muscle relaxation. I have found the Deep Sleep Relax exercise to be very helpful at bedtime, and it would be so wonderful to have a similar exercise for day use, on the days when my anxiety can be difficult to manage. 

I do not exaggerate when I say this app saved my life. There was a time when my trauma was so overpowering it threatened my safety. The skills I have learned from this app have helped me to manage my trauma in such a way that I can live a life that is full of peace and purpose. Thank you so much, Tamara, for sharing your calling!
title: This App Saved My Life

review: This app has made it easy for me to meditate regularly, and the guided meditations teach me how to become a better meditator! There are so many unique collections and sessions that there is always something new to try. The meditations have helped me in many ways I didn‚Äôt even expect! I‚Äôve been using this app regularly for about six months, and I am much calmer and more at peace than I was before. Stressful situations don‚Äôt rile me up as much as they used to and I feel more present and ready to take on each moment. My sleep has improved significantly as well. I recommend this app to anyone that wants to experience the benefits of meditation but has trouble keeping up with the habit on their own!
title: Changed My Life

review: Says the app is free, and then basically only shows you all the things you can‚Äôt listen to unless you pay. I‚Äôve been listening to podcasts for years to fall asleep, so I was interested in the sleep stories. It took me forever to find the one thing I could listen to, and it wasn‚Äôt even half and hour long. Don‚Äôt most of us insomniacs hit that point where we know what we are listening to is running out of time, making it harder to relax? Sorry, but 20 minutes isn‚Äôt going to cut it. Trying not to be a cynic I started listening to what was offered and it was dry as toast. There has to be something for me to grab onto, or I‚Äôm just going to think about all the things that made me look for a sleep aid in the first place. It looks like they have good narrators, but I won‚Äôt know for sure because I don‚Äôt feel like paying $70 to find out if they have something worth the money.
title: I‚Äôll go back to my podcasts

review:
This is a good meditation app compared to its competitors. It definitely has a decent range of options to listen to from nature sounds to stories. However, for the price it does not have enough variety in each of these categories. There aren‚Äôt enough options so it can be easy to get bored after a couple months which, for the price you pay, isn‚Äôt really right. Also, there‚Äôs no search bar/tab so you can easily find what you want to listen to by title or reader and there‚Äôs no way to save what you enjoy to a playlist or saved tab. 

I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôd recommend this app to a friend because of this. It has the potential to be a really great app but I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs worth the price at the moment.
title: Good but not sure about the price

review:
This app has helped me so much! It has some amazing sessions for anxiety and general meditation,(Tamara‚Äôs breathing technique has changed my life) but the star of this app is the sleep stories. I‚Äôve always struggled with anxiety with manifests in insomnia, and my mom would often tell me boring stories to help. This is that but I can have it on my schedule! It helps distract my mind which helps me sleep. 
My favorite is Stephen Fry‚Äôs lullabies. I mean who doesn‚Äôt want Stephen fry to read you to sleep?! His voice is so calming and comforting. I appreciate that he starts off by having the listeners breath before he starts the stories. 
I do recommend signing up for the paid plan. It‚Äôs a fantastic investment to better sleep and mental health.
title: Insomnia‚Äôs worst nightmare!

review: I absolutely loved this App! I tried making meditation a daily habit with 2 previous Apps! They were great Apps but I was not successful using them. Then I saw Calm in a suggested post on Facebook and I tried it! Wow! I fell in love with the feature of keep a daily record and the Sleep stories!  Soon I was meditating daily! I have meditating now for a whopping total of 112 days! Meditation has now become not just a habit but a lifestyle! I love listening to Tamara daily and the best part of my day is listening to the Sleep Stories at night! My sleep quality as well as quantity has improved so much! Thank you for this amazing App! I also love the improvement that your team continues to do to make it even better!
title: Amoya Lewis

review: I‚Äôm not looking for a meditation app at all. Sometimes I need commercial free background music to help me focus at work, but mostly I want calm stories to help me fall asleep. What I‚Äôve sampled so far is good, but here are two things I would change. 1: put in a sleep timer so it turns off after a few minutes instead of running all night. Also, it should mark where it left off so you can go back there instead of having to start from the beginning over and over again. This programming exists, Podcasts has had it for years. 2: allow the a la carte purchase of stories and/or music (with a free short sampler). I don‚Äôt want to get socked for $12/month or $60/year for something that‚Äôs mostly ignorable and which I‚Äôll probably run for a total of 1 hour per month.
title: The free stuff is good, but the rest is pricey

review:
The app is an excellent tool to add to your toolkit or coping skills so to speak. Incorporated into my daily routine it is a very effective quick way to check in to manage my stress and any other emotion I experience. As a licensed clinician working in the mental health field I have a duty to take care of myself above all things. Calm helps me relieve the stress of the work day and reminds me that I can only help others if I am at my best. Being centered and ready to take on the day with happiness, enthusiasm, and passion is the foundation of my existence. Adding Calm to my tool box, bag of tricks, or coping skills no matter what language you use this is a valuable addition to your self-care routine.
Susan Bergen
title: Calm App

review:
Beyond the artistry of Calm‚Äôs daily meditations is its thoughtful content.  From body movement to nightly calming stories there is something for whatever you need in any particular day. 

I recently attempted the kids meditation with my 11 year old son. He has ADHD and it was a hard sell. Within 3 minutes and Tamara‚Äôs calming voice he was calmed and invested. Tamara mentioned having anxiety over something you might have said and being unsure. My son said, mom! That exactly how I feel!  We finished the meditation and he was calm and ready to talk about his social anxiety. What a great momma and son bonding time! 

Love this thoughtful app. I am so blessed to have it as a tool in my life‚Äôs toolkit.
title: My daily Calm practice

review: I have been using this app to help me sleep and relax. I have severe G.A.D. and this really helps. I would recommend the rain sounds if you want to relax or study, I find them great to help you focus. The app is very easy to work with and use. The prices may be expensive for sounds, but it is helpful. There are many unique features that I adore about this; the check-ins are my favorite of them. You can write about your day and other topics and the app ‚Äòstores‚Äô them if that is the right word, and look at them later. In conclusion, I really support and recommend this app to anyone who is thinking about getting it!
title: Amazing and definitely recommend.

review: I struggle at night to just lay there and go to sleep. I don‚Äôt want to think. So I distract myself with a game or social media only to get sucked in and end up staying up WAY later than I had wanted. Calm has really helped me with this. Instead, I‚Äôll click on the app and try one of the many options to help me sleep. Sometimes a sleep story does the trick, other times it doesn‚Äôt so I try something else. One night the sound of rain is soothing to me, and the next night it bugs me so I try a meditation instead. I love the variety available because of my ever changing moods. But it has been very helpful and I recommend it to everyone.
title: So helpful

review: It‚Äôs a nice app I can tell because I‚Äôve had a subscription for a white but wasn‚Äôt able to pay for it anymore. title: Paying.

review: I downloaded the app on a recommendation from a friend. Overall it seems ok except for the nag screens about enabling notifications and the default background noise that takes a help search to find out how to turn off. I looked for an app like this because my life is already wound too tight, and these two aspects alone just about made me delete the app before I even listened to a second of content. I shouldn‚Äôt be feeling more stressed by an app that‚Äôs supposed to help me be calm. My suggestions‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt make notifications a focal point at initial startup, and give the user a clearly identified choice to turn on background noise or have a silent scene. Not everyone is thrilled by constant noise, especially high pitched crickets.
title: Would be a lot better without the anti-calm defaults

review: I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôm the only one having this issue. My phone or iPad tends to freeze while using the app. I can‚Äôt force shut off my phone or iPad. I‚Äôve tried to see if maybe it‚Äôs because there is a live background with sound for this app, I thought maybe that‚Äôs the reason for the glitch. I tried to see if I can turn it off but there‚Äôs no option to turn it off. I love the app and the stories I just don‚Äôt like that it causes my device to freeze to where I can‚Äôt close the app.
title: Freezes

review: This app is by far the best value I have found yet.  Nature sounds, sleep music, meditations, my favorite..sleep stories.  Fiction and non fiction.  Listen every night.  On a recent visit to visit grandchildren.  Very restless 3 year old even after bedtime reading and prayers she would lay awake talk and get up and just would not settle in peacefully for sleep.  I offered my Calm app and the kids section of sleep stories.  After family time of reading , etc, my daughter put on a kids sleep story and within 10 min granddaughter was sound asleep.  Used every night and every night she was out like a light. Granddaughter loves it my daughter is thrilled and loaded the premium app before I left.  Thank you Calm!
title: Worth every $

review: Calm has some of the greatest sleep stories with a huge range of topics and narrators‚Äô voices. Almost all the stories are 20-30 minutes. There is still no queue feature so if you wake up in the night, you have to go in and choose another story (very poor arrangement in this with Calm‚Äôs Still Awake? Page that blocks access to stories) and hope that looking for another story doesn‚Äôt wake you up more. Some poor design elements, like a virtually hidden Search by Narrator feature, which was hidden more during the last update. Still, it‚Äôs one of the better sleep apps. For the ANNUAL subscription price, though, I‚Äôd expect it to be perfect. 3.5 out of 5 stars.
title: Great sleep stories but no queue feature
