review: This app has great potential, but sadly I can‚Äôt enjoy the full version for 7 days without agreeing to pay for it ahead of time.  So my rating is based off what calm allows me to use.. im not impressed, and the asking price is way to high to even consider putting a credit card up for a app that I did not fully test.. maybe the app can give 3 days free without putting up any financial commitments before asking for that kind of money. But I will be deleting it off my phone today, and move on to something I can actually test and try out without putting up a credit card number.. thanks calm, and no it doesn‚Äôt matter that I can cancelled in 7 days if I ordered it.  Im busy and I don‚Äôt have any room to remember a subscription from calm.
title: Disappointed!

review: I downloaded this on the recommendation of a coworker but never thought I would really use it. With COVID-19 taking over the world and all the stress that has come with it I have had a hard time sleeping and my brain just doesn‚Äôt stop. I started by listening to the Disney piano playlist and it help me fall asleep at night. I then just started to explore the app and all the great things it had that have helped me breath relax and shut my mind off not just at night but during the day just taking a break to recenter has be a nice way to bring some positivity and light in.
title: A little slice of peace

review: I have listened to this app since I think 2015. I have almost consistently ever since I think my current streak is like 520+ days. I find that listening to the daily calm can be highly beneficial whether I meditate to it in the morning or the evening before bed. I have found myself resulting in calmness, for lack of a better term, ultimately remaining at peace through all the annoyances throughout my generally mundane day! I hope that this analysis contributes to the download of this app. I may be a particular case (as I'm sure I am), but I feel the benefits far outweigh the negatives.
title: I have found this app to be perfect!!!!!!!

review: I was rewarded this app because I‚Äôm a k4 teacher and I like to incorporate mindfulness and meditation into out daily schedule. Initially it was a bit pricey so, I kept waiting and eventually they began their school program, which waived the membership fee for teachers!  This has been an amazing addition to our room. The meditations, soundscapes, and sleep stories are some of my students favorite part of the day. It definitely sets the tone and helps aid an open and inviting atmosphere. It‚Äôs an extra treat that after a long days work with 4 and 5 yr olds, I can use the same app to calm down and energy me time at home!
title: Most Used app on my phone!!

review: There needs to be a LIVE customer support system.... I know Tamara is busy rolling in the dough but she needs to offer an actual support system when the app has issues. The automated system is useless. The app Is pretty freakin awesome.... just been having issues with scene volume which is one of the best features that sets this app apart from other guided meditation apps. When I contact ‚Äúcustomer support‚Äù it‚Äôs an endless loop of pre written ‚Äúgeneric‚Äù answers to an otherwise very specific problem. Sometimes these answers seem to cater to older people that may not be familiar with the basic operations of a smart phone. A little pandering. Other than that it is a superb app.
title: Need an option to submit...

review:
I like that there are personal stats like the number of minutes/hours of meditation completed and the longest streak of days in a row.  I have listened to the Calm app for 682 days in a row. My goal is five years in a row. I often listen to the music or the crackling fire or a purring cat. I have the daily new 10 minute meditation for dessert every day after lunch. I will often go to my saved favorites and listen to them again. I also enjoy the 10 minute spark interviews with guests. The interviews are varied and interesting. 
I never regret time spent with Calm. It‚Äôs an investment in myself and I am worth it!!
title: I can count on Calm

review: I am grateful to have this app. This app was recommended to me by my counselor to help me control my emotions and stress. I‚Äôve been using it for 3 months now and people around me are noticing positive changes in my attitude and behavior. I feel like a new person compared to who I was before I had this app. It has taught me so many things to make me a better person and the world around me is so much easier to exist in. I will always keep this app. It‚Äôs the most important thing that I do each day. It has modules on just about every situation that I might need help with. I recommend it to anyone because there is something in it for everyone!!
title: Gratitude

review: I took a chance on Calm‚Äôs premium subscription first with a trial then paid for a year and I will never cancel it unless they totally break it. I will go without groceries before I cancel my subscription because I sleep so well after listening to the sleep stories. It‚Äôs a rare night that I make it more than 5 minutes into one before passing out and there are so many to choose from! The addition of so many guided meditations is great too, but for me the value is in the sleep stories. The interface is very easy to use and new content is constantly being added.
title: On my second year as a premium subscriber

review: I think it was Winston Churchill who said ‚Äúif you‚Äôre going through hell Keep Going!‚Äù Calm has kept me going! Calm is the best gift I‚Äôve ever bought myself! It is a gold mine of mindful meditation instruction and technique and there are master classes taught by professionals in their field. I have tinnitus and now I keep soothing music or nature sounds going in the background during my quiet time and reading. More often than not I fall asleep listening to one of the many beautifully written and exquisitely read fiction or nonfiction bedtime stories. I simply cannot say enough about Calm so I will end by honestly saying, thank you Calm you have changed my life!
title: Keep Calm

review: I work in a profession full of deadlines and have also some significant issues in my life that cause me pain. It‚Äôs very, very hard to clear my mind. I appreciate these lessons and am trying hard to put them into practice‚Äî and see that my impatience about achieving this is part of what I have to learn. The small discipline of doing my lesson first thing in the morning, before I get up, before I turn on the news, before I reach for the iPad and open up the mail is beginning to bear fruit. Or perhaps the leaves are just budding out. The blossoms and fruit are for later. I can begin to grasp the possibility. It gives me hope.
title: A work in progress

review: Mediation isn‚Äôt perfection. Your mind will wonder, your breathing may break. Al of that is okay. It‚Äôs the intention of trying that matters, that sets you up for a great day and leads to strengthened practice, whenever I am getting back into it. My mind wonders often to silly things : I‚Äôll add cinnamon in that. Oops come back. You see Hilary and Julia today. Oops come back. My hair is on my face. Oops come back. The daily calm helps guide you through the moments. It‚Äôs fantastic. I love that I can for 5, 10, 60 minutes! There‚Äôs really no excuse not to add it to the day ‚ù§Ô∏è this little gem makes it easier. I paid for the full thing and haven‚Äôt regretted.
title: A guide that keeps your focus and calm

review: This app has literally changed my life. I am a recovering heroin addict and the lessons that each and every meditation teach me are exactly what I need to hear on each subject. If you are considering making a change in your life, whether sobriety or a divorce or anything else you may have going on, this app will change your life if you apply it. I use it each and everyday sense the day that I purchased it. There is a free edition that you can try, but I promise you if you want this to guide you as it has me then you will want the purchased app. Thank you to everyone who has contributed to my continuing sobriety at calm. You guys are amazing!!
title: A life changer

review: I‚Äôve dealt with general anxiety for many years, have taken courses on meditation in the past, but never stuck with it.  This app has really helped me stick to a daily meditation and the ‚Äúdaily calm‚Äù is what I tend to favor.  I never thought I would listen to sleep stories as an adult, but they are great, and help me fall asleep very quickly.  The only thing I would like to see added, but it‚Äôs certainly not a deal breaker, would be the ability for us to choose a longer length for the daily calm for days when I‚Äôm in the mood to do a 15-20 minute meditation.
title: Very helpful for my anxiety

review:
I truly enjoy this app and it has helped me be more mindful in my day to day. I tend to be an over thinker and have codependent tendencies and am using this app to help calm my mind. I have only been using it for about a month and I can already tell that my reactions to things have switched into responses with a much more clear head space. 

My one piece if feedback would be that the developers add a feature that when using the app your phone automatically goes into ‚Äúdo not disturb‚Äù mode so that texts and phone calls do not distrust your mediation practice.
title: The app I never knew I needed!

review:
Initially I really liked this app. But then I think it‚Äôs because Jeff Warren was such a great teacher. He gave us choices in terms of how we wanted to get into our meditative state. Focus could be on your breath or the refrigerator running or birds chirping.
It was your choice. Then there are other meditative leaders who only give one choice, the breath.  For me focusing on my breath doesn‚Äôt work. After a couple of deep inhales and then slow exhales, my breathing rhythm is now off. I can‚Äôt get it back and end up spending the next 10 minutes on adjusting my breathing. Give me a choice and leave my breathing alone. So unless I can find a leader who foregoes using breath as a homebase I can‚Äôt use this app. And thus do not recommend it.
title: Breath

review:
It‚Äôs been a banner year of stress and worry. I developed anxiety and panic symptoms. At 60 years I‚Äôve never tried mindfulness or meditation but with all that‚Äôs happened ‚Äîquitting a job that I loved, starting over in my own practice dealing with fears of COVID, for our country for my daughter‚Äôs future it‚Äôs no wonder anxiety and panic were the result. My daughter added the Calm app to my mobile. 
I loved 7 Days to happiness series, the panic SOS exercise, and the Grateful ( Gratitude) series.
There‚Äôs always something here for what I‚Äôm thinking and feeling.

The Loving Kindness exercise. I‚Äôve been alone for most of the pandemic. But grateful for this app.
title: I Can Breathe

review: Most mornings I wake up and reach for my phone to scan the latest news. Headlines are often filled with conflict and tension. It helps me to remember to meditate. Calm is an incredible resource full of relaxing guided meditations which help me focus on timeless truths, rather than a world of troubles. At night when I lie in bed mulling a myriad of responsibilities, an endless list of to dos, lamenting the past, fearing an uncertain future, it helps when I pause to breath and listen to one of the many soothing and delightful sleep stories available on Calm. I am grateful to have found this truly wonderful and powerful tool.
title: I Feel Calmer Now

review:
This app isn‚Äôt necessary to do this. However, its organization and design help. Tamara‚Äôs soothing voice (in my opinion) is optimally designed to help you achieve a state of calm and quiet where all the answers are found. 

We all psd way eventually. Do you really want to get to that point in your journey nd look back longingly because you left something dormant that ultimately you wanted to address? This app has helped me single out all the little corners of my psychological closet that needed cleaning or had an article of clothing I really needed to wear (proudly). 

I love the me this app helped me become and continues to help me nurture.
title: Meditate to find your higher purpose

developerResponse: {'id': 11109945, 'body': 'Hi there, I‚Äôm sorry for the confusion! Our support team would be happy to help you navigate these options. Please reach out via email to support@calm.com', 'modified': '2019-10-07T22:41:19Z'}
review: I used to enjoy this very expensive app but the new design makes it impossible to navigate. I can‚Äôt find the table of contents for the life of me. Nothing is labeled except with cryptic images. Instead of calming. It‚Äôs actually agitating and upsetting. Pushing what looks like a Home icon doesn‚Äôt bring you to a home page. All I want is to find the list of sleep story options or the list of background sounds to choose from or the timer to set but none of those can be found anymore. It seems like you‚Äôre given only on option. Unacceptable for the price we‚Äôre paying! FIX THIS APP NOW!!!
title: What the ef have you done to the app?

review: I have years of experience with meditation (even so, I‚Äôm no expert, there is always something new to learn!), so when this app was suggested to me by someone I know, I kind of rolled my eyes and thought ‚Äúwell, they really have an app for everything now!‚Äù Curiosity got me to try the app out. I‚Äôm very glad I did. There are many features on this app, for beginners and for those more experienced with meditation. I especially love that it is fully functional without paying for the membership. That way, those with a tighter budget can still benefit from what this app has to offer. Thank you to the developers for a great app!
title: One of my favorite apps

review:
I have had the free version of this app for some time now and genuinely enjoy it. The stories are nice for someone like me: I have trouble completely shutting my brain off at night, but I don‚Äôt want to listen to an audio book (for fear of losing my place), and I don‚Äôt want to sleep with the television on. The stories are relatively short and meant to get you gently from paying attention, to not really processing, to sleep. 

The only issue I am having is that I can‚Äôt find the monthly auto-renew option in the App Store. I have already signed up for the free trial and I just don‚Äôt know if I want to commit to $60 right this second. Calm - can you offer any help here? 

Thanks so much!
title: Subscription Options?

review: I have been using this app every day for six months and LOVE it. After I did the latest update a couple days ago, none of the meditations will play and none of the meditations will download. When you hit play it just sits there, then when you exit out, the completion pop up appears and the meditation (that never even played) counts towards your meditation streak, rendering the data useless. The only meditation that will play is the Daily Calm from the homepage. I‚Äôm on an iPhone X, all updated. I hope this helps the developers fix it and get it pushed to its playing customers in the next day or else I will have to download a different app. I don‚Äôt want to!
title: Latest update made app useless...HELP!

review: This is by far the best app of any I‚Äôve ever used and I‚Äôve used many. I‚Äôve had my share of ups and downs in life. Though I‚Äôm a successful working professional, I‚Äôve had professional therapy many times. I have significant anxiety issues that have  made me physically ill in the past. I use this app every day and I love it. The meditations are practical, are based on sound professional advice and are so helpful in just about every aspect of life. It has truly helped me stay grounded. I use it all the time and I‚Äôve gifted it to many of my friends. They‚Äôve all loved it. And the sleep stories are the icing on the cake. Well worth every penny!!!!
title: Highly valuable

review:
I have been a CALM app user off and on for a long time. I used it to meditate with a friend going through Cancer treatments and we‚Äôd sit together and do the Daily Meditations. I use it for times when I can‚Äôt sleep to listen to either the Nature Sound Scapes or Sleep Stories. I fall asleep in no time! And if I awaken in the night, I‚Äôll find another Sleep Story to get back to sleep. The music works too! I have been guilty of leaving it on all night! 

If you are a beginner meditation practitioner or just want to explore the things CALM has to offer, I would do the trial. You won‚Äôt regret it! 

Thanks CALM!
title: Love this app!

review: I love all the various ways this app helps you relax and ease anxiety. But they really need to remove the competitive aspect or at lease use fluffy language to hide it. I don‚Äôt want to feel stressed out about not meeting my goals in meditation and mindfulness. When I see options listed that are labeled as ‚Äúcourse‚Äù or ‚Äúmasterclass‚Äù I am immediately stressed about excelling in mindfulness. There must be better language to categorize your playlists. Please üôÇ. Otherwise the app is great! I use it for kids bedtime stories as well (after I read 5 books and they are asking for more).
title: Great app for family

review: Okay, I usually do not leave reviews‚Ä¶. However i felt this deserved a review. The children stories are cute‚Ä¶ however, after listening to a few of them with my 18month old and 3 year old I noticed they like to slip in ‚ÄúWoke‚Äù ideologies‚Ä¶ one story has the main character using They/Them pronouns, one story has Gay badgers‚Ä¶ each story seems to have something slipped in‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm all for the LGBTQ+ community however I believe children should not have to have gender confusion thrown their way. I won‚Äôt be letting my kids listen to these stories anymore because they should be focusing on kid stuff, not gender and other things. Im happy to go back to reading the old fairy tales to my kids myself.
title: 2 1/2 not 3 Children stories?

review:
I really do love what the Calm app does. I have no problem with that. BUT in a recent redesign of the interface, Favorites are shown too far down the screen. I use the app primarily for Sleep Stories. I know several which work like a sleeping pill for me. But I now have to search too long to get one started. 

I assume this has been done to encourage me to preview others? Thanks, but I do that periodically on my own. When I‚Äôm in the mood to taste test. But most of the time I just want to get relaxed and get to sleep, haha. 

Please move Favorites higher on the screen or allow us to drag and drop in the order we prefer.
title: Promote Favorites to top of screen

review:
I grew up with a ton of anxiety and calm helps me a lot whenever I‚Äôm anxious. The voices of the narrators are super relaxing and the scenes and soundscapes too. This app deserves all five stars or even more!
 
  I feel like with all the new daily things calm is easier to use. I listen to sleep stories every night to calm down my nerves. Calm has helped me in various ways and I‚Äôm grateful for the cool activities they have to make you forget about anxious thoughts.

  Overall, calm is an amazing app and a miracle worker. I highly recommend this app to anyone who deals with anxiety or other issues. ‚ò∫Ô∏èüå∫
title: Five stars for a reason

review: I have had the calm app for a few years. Lately the quality of the new sleep stories has been terrific. I recommend trying the app. I love the new Red Rock Country story. I find the sleep stories have regulated my sleep after years of so-so sleeping. I am working on my meditation and so far the calm app has helped although I am struggling to find a meditation program that I can use long term. As a beginner in this area what Calm offers is helpful to build a consistent practice. Overall I am pleased with the content and I hope Calm continues to provide even better content.
title: Few Years

review: When I first purchased this app I was absolutely in love. I enjoy Jeff Warren‚Äôs 30 days of How to Meditate so much that I finished the meditation in consecutive 30 days and was always looking forward to the next day to meditate with him. I was so clam and happy. But after I completed the session, everything changed. For some reason I can‚Äôt bring myself to like the voice and talking style of Tamara Levitt. I tried very hard each day to like it but failed. Unfortunately she is the main narrator of most of the courses so there is almost nothing left for me to enjoy. I would really appreciate if you can include more narrators or allow the user to choose narrators like the course 7 Days of Calm.
title: More Narrators Please

review: I think most people would describe me as a very cost conscious individual, my kids would say tightwad. I promise you this app, if used to it‚Äôs fullest, will be worth it‚Äôs weight in gold to you. There are so many people suffering with stress related or stress induced illnesses and this app is just overflowing with the right kind of help. I have severe RA (genetics + workaholic + southern girl people pleaser) & this app has helped me through some pretty bad flares. It has helped with my insomnia, and the educational series has helped bring about a huge shift in my professional life as well. It‚Äôs money well spent.
title: Nothing Short of Life Changing

review: In all honesty, first time I downloaded the app I dismissed it right away as I didn‚Äôt think listening to someone read a book or hearing the sound of a jungle will actually ‚Äúcalm‚Äù you down and help you sleep but I did keep the app around. Anyways, A couple of days ago after spending 2 hours banging my head trying to sleep with no drowsiness insight I decided to give the app a go. After selecting one of the nature sounds (I still believe someone‚Äôs voice will be too distracting to help) I laid the phone next to me, listened for a couple of minutes then woke up the next day. Thanks you for this app.
title: Didn‚Äôt believe it works.

review: I really enjoy the app in the ambience it starts and with headphones it really is calming. I use this mainly for sleep and I love listening to the stories. The reason why I‚Äôm not continuing my subscription is because the stories are short and I don‚Äôt fall asleep. I know that sounds bad and like (what can you do) but it would be nice if Calm had a queue option where you could put a few sleep stories in line to play. It was less... ‚Äúcalming‚Äù to not fall asleep and then have to struggle with the menu to return back and try to find another sleep story.  I like the quality of the stories and hope there is more fiction like ones in the future so maybe I‚Äôll revisit!
title: Almost works for me!

review: I have been taking Benadryl to sleep every night for years- otherwise I would lie awake with my mind reeling night after night. I asked my doctor for a prescription sleep aid- and she recommended this app. I am so glad she did! I am almost using no sleep aids anymore and the meditation is starting to help in every day life to be mindful. I have less anxiety now too. I love the sleep stories. Just enough interest to get my mind off the stress and listen to the story, but boring and calm enough to put me right to sleep. This is great. It‚Äôs expensive at $60, but averages out around $5/month? and the benefits are totally worth it to me.
title: Less Benadryl to sleep

review: But watch out for the automatic renewal thing, theres no warning for your subscription renewal, only emails you get are if you dont have a card on your account and theres no way for your subscription to renew you only get those right after you purchase your subscription. Ive paid $40 now in 3 months because of the stupid renewal thing. I tried to update my itunes account so i could get the year subscription but when i added my card this app automatically charged me without asking if i wanted to renew or change my subscription and thats pretty crappy if you ask me.
title: The app is fantastic

review: As a law student, this app has been my lifeline. I‚Äôve struggled with anxiety my whole life, and school has me so busy that I don‚Äôt have a chance to see friends, run, or do yoga‚Äîor any other destressers for that matter. I‚Äôve been doing one meditation per lunch break for the last few weeks and I already feel myself able to cope with the constant competition and pressure in a whole new and effective way. The sleep stories are amazing as well, finally a way to fall asleep without dreaming of the lists of things I have to do (and without having to resort to looking at my phone screen/tv before bed to do so). Thank you, Calm üôåüèΩ
title: Peace of Mind

review: I didn't realize it but I've been having anxiety/panic attacks the past year or so.    For some unknown reason I will get incredibly anxious for no obvious reason.   I've been flying as a passenger for 20 years and all the sudden I had an incredible fear to board a flight or to stay on the plane    I've almost jumped off the plane before they close the door 3 or 4 times now.      When I have that feeling start to come over me I find a seat at the airport, but ok my headphones and listen to a session and I'm a whole new person. It forces me to take some time to be still and quiet and calm down.     I'm incredibly thankful for this app.
title: Saves my life

review: Hey üëã, I just wanted to let everyone in the group of creating this site is so Awesome üëè and because my Uncle hasn‚Äôt kept up on my phone bill enough to let me get to hear my best,Amazing Bedtimes stories on time I am seriously having a hard time getting comfortable and falling asleep üí§ at ease, and sleep well üò¥ enough so I‚Äôm gonna get on his case and start explaining how Awesome ü§© I find you guys with such Sweetness and Success to help me and my roommate fall asleep üò¥ peacefully when we hear from your stories!! And I grade you all the A+ team you‚Äôre the Best team ever and Good night üòòüí§üåôüò¥!!
title: My opinion and more

review:
I just could not get to sleep, I tossed and turned for 2 or more hours at a time and was at my wits end, I didn‚Äôt know what to do. I was taking medication to help me sleep and I didn‚Äôt feel that was a good idea for long time help. 
I saw an ad for Calm and I thought it couldn‚Äôt hurt to try it. 
Calm taught me how to breath and relax so I could fall asleep quicker without tossing and turning. I listen every night and look forward to new sessions and have favorite go to stories too.
I would recommend anyone who is having trouble getting to sleep give this a try, it worked wonders for me!

This app used to be amazing until barely anything was free. Personally I struggle with sleep and calm always helped me go back to sleep but that was when I was using my mom‚Äôs premium account. Now I have my own account and I‚Äôm not paying $70 to go to sleep when I could just use headspace! The only reason why I gave this app 3 stars is because of Alan Sklar if you are looking for a good app and don‚Äôt mind paying $70 this app is for you they do have people with very calming voices and it‚Äôs very relaxing. But again personally IN MY OPINION it is not worth a $70 fee. Thank you for reading if you got to this point!
By the way I will put my review back up to 5 stars if you lower the price for premium.
title: Great except for

review: Calm offers myriad avenues to access groundedness these days. I came back to check out out for a graduate class I am taking, and was surprised to see the bedtime stories and poetry added, which is lovely. As a yoga instructor and high school teacher I saw many applications of this app, plus I have a young child and could see the benefits of the stories for children. I completely understand the price for the premium subscription for the app, however at this time it is not something I am willing to add to my budget. There are some beautiful free meditations I hope to use with my high school students to help with their stress!
title: Good variety at a price

review: I like this app and I love the new improvements. I love the mood and the reflection however it‚Äôs no longer sync with my Apple health and I can‚Äôt even see where to make sure it‚Äôs connected from the app.  Used to be easy. Per the Health app it‚Äôs connected but I wouldn‚Äôt be able to tell from the app itself. And the last time it recorded a session on health was October 2.  Not sure what they did in between. Also it should allow you the option to edit an entry for reflection. If you didn‚Äôt finish or wanted to add something after you close the app oh well.
title: I like this app but

review:
Honestly, I am surprised at the exorbitant cost I am paying for this app considering the few times I use it a month. That being said, those few times a month it is totally worth it and definitely puts me to bed. I‚Äôm in a sales role, high stress, corporate job and this app helps me wind down and go to bed. 

Why I hate Tamara Levitt- She has to be one of the most narcissistic persons on the planet. I hate her VOICE, I hate how much she loves her own voice, she sounds scripted, I hate how breathy she is, I hate that she doesn‚Äôt leverage other people for meditations. Here‚Äôs an idea Tamara, not everyone wants to hear you! For the love of God, get over yourself and find other people/ other voices so I can get some better rest and pay $100 to get some rest.
title: Love it but Tamara Levitt has GOT TO GO

review:
I‚Äôve used Calm for several years. However over the past year I have begun a serious daily practice of meditation in my life. Calm makes it easy to meditate with it‚Äôs 10-13 minute guided meditations via educational series on many topics including gratitude, happiness, forgiveness, sleep, etc. I have found that each mediation provides me with a lesson that extends into my day and life. I absolutely love Calm and as a therapist I recommend it to all my patients, friends, and family. Mediation is something I feel that I look forward and enjoy now. I have replaced some unhealthy coping habits with mediation and I will be forever grateful! 

Thank you Calm! Some of my favorite meditation guides on Calm are Tamara Levitt, Jeff Warren (is love to see more stuff from him in the future), and Tara Bach.  Thank you all! I feel connected and comforted by your voices of wisdom and guidance. 

I encourage EVERYONE to commit to a daily practice 30 days! Your life will never be the same. 

With Gratitude,
Jessica
title: Best Meditation App Ever!!

review:
I wanted to get this app because I thought that it would be good for someone struggling with sleep such as myself. It looks good on paper, but when you finally get the darn app. 
Literally. Everything. Is. Locked. All for 70$ a year wow! Such little payment. Here‚Äôs the thing developers, most of these reviews sound stellar and most actually seem happy with this! However for some people who really need this stuff when they are struggling the most, we might not have that 70 dollars. Consider your demographic please. I see many famous people have a part in this app and I know you have to pay them somehow, but try to consider finding another way to pay them out without screwing us all over. 

Thank you for coming to my TED Talk XD
title: Don‚Äôt get this is you expected free, they just need to pay the celebs who collabed for this

review: If you have a hard time managing stress and anxiety, like so many other people, I HIGHLY recommend this app. I use the free version and it‚Äôs excellent. I‚Äôve never been someone who meditates. I have a hard time focusing and after only a couple weeks (albeit inconsistently) I‚Äôve finally come around to the benefits of taking those extra 5, 10, 15 minutes each morning to relax and before bed to ease me into sleep. Give it a try! If you use nothing else, the calming sounds and landscapes they have are beautiful and nice to listen to while falling asleep. :)
title: I rarely come into the App Store to write a review but for calm I felt it was necessary

title: So upset

review: I‚Äôve tried one or two other meditation apps and find Calm the best. I especially like the voice of the woman who directs each meditation and the writing. The pieces are thoughtful and simple to follow at the same time. They don‚Äôt get in the way. Each day there is a new ten-minute meditation that will end with a short takeaway and quote intended to help take the calm of mindfulness off the mat/chair/cushion into the day. I have tried the sleep recordings and they are not for me. They must be intended to bore you to sleep, but they just annoyed me awake. But the daily meditations and meditation series (7 days of managing stress, etc) are very well done.
title: Great balance of guidance and silence

review: I'm a regular blue collar construction worker, so I'm not much for the "whoo-whoo". However, this app has helped me overcome (or should I say accept) many difficult situations, from anxiety to a slump, or even anger towards difficult coworkers, restlessness etc, etc,. If you got five minutes at break time; take a quick mental vacation that will help you restart the day on a good foot! Sometimes, it's not feasible or appropriate to go for a jog, hit the heavy bag, or sit in the lotus position while chanting a mantra. With this app, I simply throw on the head phones at break, relax, reset, and reboot! It's better than drugs, because it's cheaper, lasts longer, and won't get me fired! Powerful!
title: Worth it!

review:
And this app has added an extra layer of happiness/CALMNESS that I've never experienced. The ladies voice is so soothing and calm, i feel as though I've been cleansed by the end of the short sessions. Currently on the 21 days of Calmness and I can say without a doubt, this app is for anyone suffering from traumatic brain injuries, CTE, concussions. All of which I've dealt with while playing football from 6th grade all the way to 5 years in the #NFL. 
I am so happy this is a part of my daily routine to recovery! ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: In treatment for #TBI & #Concussions....

review: I don't ever say that, but it's true. This is the best choice I've ever made. Saw an ad on Facebook and remembered being told how healthy and incredible meditation was for the human body. However I didn't know the first thing about it. From the first session, I was hooked. I've never gotten as good of sleep as when I meditate before bed and my focus has gotten so much better. Plus, I feel better and healthier after just the first day! I love the rain on leaves background. Sometimes I open the app just to listen to it and watch it. This app is incredible and worth whatever amount of money you put into it!
title: Greatest choice ever made in apps

review: I‚Äôm not just saying it‚Äôs amazing because I‚Äôm being paid to say this, I am a 14-year-old boy who desperately cannot sleep or calm down. Sometimes they have meditations and sleep stories for kids adults and all ages. It‚Äôs an amazing app. I really do recommend this try it out and if you don‚Äôt like it, then you don‚Äôt have to use it, but it is one of my favorite apps to listen to stories or meditate or even if you have ADHD and need something to help you calm down while working it has everything you need, hope you read this and hope you enjoy it. All joy
title: Amazing

review: so i‚Äôm in love with harry styles... and honestly this is a BLESSING. i‚Äôve been having trouble sleeping because of my severe anxiety and depression disorder, and panic attacks. thoughts of cutting keep me awake. it‚Äôs very gets bad and i‚Äôm only a teenager. this is helping everything. i‚Äôve never fallen asleep so fast and he tells the perfect story that puts you to sleep in at least 10 minutes. and that‚Äôs never happened to me before! all you have to do is succumb to his voice and do whatever he tells you to. i swear, if you‚Äôre a styler, harrie, or directioner, you will LOVE this because it feels like he‚Äôs in the room. it‚Äôs amazing! totally recommend this!
title: dream with me

review:
Ca has a lot of wonderful tools for mindfulness, grounding, centering.

I, however, subscribed to the premium for help with sleep.  I grew up with my sister reading us to sleep and was thrilled there was an app with stories.  That said, there are no sleep timers embedded in the stories, so they run to the end and nothing.  Further to that, the app doesn‚Äôt play the next track/story!  So if you‚Äôre still awake, or wake up and can‚Äôt get back to sleep, you have to search through kingdom come to get back to stories and pick one you haven‚Äôt heard 6 times already (and they always suggest the same one).  I‚Äôm more awake than ever.  

Please embed sleep timers and consecutive tracks!!!
title: If You Use This App For Sleep

review: Content wise this app is wonderful, however one of the main people whose voice is on many of the guided meditations (one of the primary advantages this app had over others was both the sleep sound/stories and guided meditations) does not work well for me. Unfortunately, through no fault of their own, some voices are grating to certain people. There are a variety of other readers, so I am still happy over all. It is just unfortunate, and had I noticed how frequently this one person was used, I would likely have spent my money elsewhere. Definitely get a thorough sampling before you commit. If you find that this isn‚Äôt an issue for you, Calm is wonderful.
title: Try trial first

review: I very much dislike how everything is for premium hardly will I ever find a story and I can‚Äôt even find music without having to buy a premium pass. This app is overwhelming me instead of calming me, I can‚Äôt find good music, I can barely find any stories, hardly is anything available. What if some people don‚Äôt have money? What if they downloaded this app to calm them because of that reason? People probably get anxiety more from this app than from curing it because they thought that they will have no app that will actually calm them without buying a premium pass. It‚Äôs ridiculously overwhelming me with how much I COULD HAVE read and listened too but I couldn‚Äôt because of you guys going over the line with this premium pass. There‚Äôs no hate I‚Äôm just giving you a word of advice.
title: Dear Calm

review: I‚Äôm about to delete your app. There is so many other apps that can do the same job with more free options or even lower prices. I‚Äôve been a calm user for 5 years or so? I‚Äôm not sure at this point, and I‚Äôve loved the app. It was great to finally get a good nights sleep. But it started getting popular, and I was even fine when the 2-3 free stories would change so one could get a variety even without paying. And you may never listen to the same story again, but I could live with that. Now, you only get one free story and NO free music. That‚Äôs it. Out of the Hundreds of songs and stories you get one. Or else you have to pay a monthly/yearly subscription for the rest. It‚Äôs stupid. I used to love calm, not it‚Äôs just a waste of space on my phone.
title: Angry. So many better apps then this.

review: I‚Äôve been meditating for years and love the Calm app for guided sessions on the go (in waiting rooms, on the subway, even when stopped in traffic). But what really makes this app better than the rest is the Kids section in Sleep Stories. It‚Äôs become part of the kids‚Äô bedtime routine to choose a sleep story, cozy up in their beds, and fall asleep listening to gentle children‚Äôs stories like The Velveteen Rabbit or Rapunzel or The Nutcracker. (Sometimes, if I‚Äôm cuddling with one of the kids, I‚Äôll fall asleep myself and have to force myself out of the nest an hour later.) Such an easy way to get my kiddos to settle down and ready for sleep!
title: Great for kids

review: I've had this app for almost two years. I was hesistant in purchasing an annual subscription since there were several free meditation apps available. However, this was the only app that I felt comfortable with. Prior to this app, I had a nervous breakdown. I had gotten out of an emotionally abusive relationship and I hated being angry of my past and fearful of my future. I wanted to be free of my anxiety. Although, I still struggle with anxiety, doubt and depression, I truly believe this app was one of the best investment I've made for my mental well being. Thank you, Calm for adding value and direction into my life.
title: Amazing app for your overall well-being

review:
Tamara Levitt is a great guider. she is peaceful and calm and gives you time to breathe on your own and meditate on your own and relax on your own and then towards the end she always has just a wonderful little short little lesson sharing true wisdom and peace.

Recently tried Insight Timer after doing Calm and at first I thought I loved it because it had so many options and so many courses but then I haven‚Äôt found an instructor yet that actually gives you time to just be quiet they‚Äôre talking and talking and talking and talking so I‚Äôm back to Tamara and Calm and I‚Äôm calm. :)
title: Truly wonderful

review: My husband suffered a stroke and my whole life crumbled After a short time, I was under tremendous stress And everyone abandoned with the exception of my aunt. When I was at my darkness Matthew McConaugheys voice kept me alive. The more I learned about the app the more I was able to get though yet another day. I now feel this app is just as important as water for me and my kids. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Truly greatful for the app,Matthew and Tamara for who‚Äôs voice is always in my head telling me never to quit. I‚Äôm alive today because of your help and support.
title: Kept me alive literally

review: I have tried medicine and various apps over the years. Saw a commercial for this one and downloaded it. My mind never shuts off‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm always thinking about something, which causes me to lose hours of sleep at night. This app with the brown noise is wonderful. I turn it on and fall to sleep within minutes. The app is also great because it turns off if you have an alarm going, so you can still hear your alarm to wake up in the morning.  I love it!!! I recommend this app to anyone who has trouble shutting off their mind at night.
title: Best sleep aid ever!!!

review: I was hestitant to download this and a friend kept nagging me. I don‚Äôt like audio usually, I really enjoy my silence, my job is on the phone all day. But this app has changed my quality of sleep. I fall asleep faster with less racing thoughts and I wake up less on nights I listen to a sleep story. I also use the nature sounds sometimes and if I‚Äôm having a tough day working from home the nap sleep stories help me maximize my rest on lunch and are the perfect length to do so. I like that it has the option to track moods but I have a separate app for that with more thorough data.
title: Wow

review: I like calm for the mood check in, some sleep stories and the rain sounds, but mostly everything requires premium and i don‚Äôt like that because I dont have premium and its $70 for it, and i just started using this app again. I think you should make not as many things premium, because i find something i like then i realize ‚Äúoh it‚Äôs premium nevermind i cant do it‚Äù and then i get annoyed. Also, can you bring back some of the free music stuff? I really liked those and got annoyed when i found out the stuff got taken away. I hope you reply back to me and have an amazing day!
title: Too much premium stuff

review: I don‚Äôt use most features of this app bc I‚Äôm not in a place financially to pay for them. I do however use the sleep sounds that you can choose to set on a timer on the main page. It‚Äôs kind of annoying bc I‚Äôll go to work and never have opened the app and I‚Äôll pull my phone out of my desk for break and it‚Äôll be blasting my rain sounds and I have to search my phone for the app and open it so I can close it out and make it stop. Why does this happen? It‚Äôs great when you set the timer before bed but why randomly going off during the day??
title: App Opening Sound Plays Loudly and Randomly When App is Closed

review: So, i downloaded this app for the sleep stories, however you don‚Äôt have access to those without the annual fee or 7 day free trial. i tried it the first night and it didn‚Äôt help so naturally i tried to cancel my subscription. however after the 7 days were over the money was still taken out of my account even though i had already canceled my subscription. i just kind of feel stuck with it now because it took the money out of my account even after i canceled my subscription before the trial was over.
title: iffy about it

review:
I disabled the auto-renewal while trying the 7-day trial of the Calm. Somehow I was still charged ~$70 for the annual subscription. I couldn't get a refund and I didn't use the app out of spite for some time.

I don't think it can replace my favorite mediation instructor and App - Waking Up by Sam Harris. Calm is not just for meditation however. I've been exploring the focus, sleep, and "themed" meditations and been enjoying them so far.

I think this App deserves a 5-star review for it's content, but I'm still bothered by the fact they use an opt-out basis for sneakily charging you. It's a bit obnoxious to say the least.
title: Forced to purchase the Annual Subscription

review: I‚Äôve been using the subscription version for almost a year.  I will renew.  The sleep stories are fantastic.  The daily calm messages are helpful.  There is a lot of variety within the app.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because there are 2 things I would change... the white font on light gray background is hard to read.  It would be nice if we could select colors or shades or contrast.  The 2nd would be background music during sleep stories - either let the background scene noise continue to play during the story (as an option) or add an option for sleep music.
title: Worth the price

review:
I have a paid subscription and while I‚Äôd give 5 stars for the content, as it is incredible, I‚Äôm so turned off by Tamara‚Äôs voice and that alone brings down my rating. 

Some meditations do have other speakers and they‚Äôre all wonderful, however too many feature Tamara‚Äôs voice and she‚Äôs pretty difficult to avoid.  Regrettably, I‚Äôm not able to tolerate her voice at all, it cuts into my zen vibe like a needle scratching a record, and instantly brings about levels of anger that all the deep breathing I can muster can‚Äôt extinguish. 

I‚Äôll have to stick with Headspace once my Calm subscription ends. But if voices change at Calm before my subscription ends, I do prefer their programming over Headspace and would be happy to stay.
title: Love the app, not the voices

review: Calm has been such a help for me, I really can‚Äôt say enough.  Especially since they have added the Master Classes, the Sleep Stories and they just continually strive to improve.  It‚Äôs not an app that sells you a ‚Äúgimmick‚Äù and takes your $$, then runs!  The quality is top-notch.  I have especially utilized the function which allows you to pull up your user history, so that I can return to meditations that I found most insightful.  I also find myself sharing with others about my positive experiences with the app and doing mini ‚Äúinfo mercials‚Äù for Calm sessions or features.  LOL- I may as well be on staff.  Thanks, CALM!
title: Lifetime Subscriber!üíû

review:
In my life I was very tense I was very stressed and depressed and I tried calm and for the first time in my life I was still heartbroken from past memories but I was looking forward to the future and starting to love myself and enjoy the present I feel better than I ever was ever in my life i‚Äôm not saying it repairs you of how you feel if it‚Äôs depression or anger but I‚Äôm just saying it helps you Control it and be at peace with yourself and your past and your future and the world I say try Calm and if you don‚Äôt like it you can always delete it but trust me I don‚Äôt think you won‚Äôt 

Make a better today and a better future üòò
title: Thank you

developerResponse: {'id': 7017375, 'body': "I\xa0apologize for the trouble accessing Calm Music! An error was made when these programs were locked for you. These programs should now be unlocked moving forward. Reach out to support@calm.com if you're still having trouble accessing content.", 'modified': '2019-01-25T23:55:48Z'}
review: I‚Äôve been using this app for about a year to help my mind settle during bouts of severe insomnia. Even the limited meditations were beginning to help. I was so disappointed to open the app last night only to find that all of the music is now locked. I understand that app developers need to make money, but I cannot afford to pay for an app that gives me only an hours‚Äô worth of music to relax me at night. I can find full albums of similar music to download for far less money. I hate to give such a negative review, because I honestly really enjoyed this app, even if the free version offered a limited selection. Please bring back the free content, or at least offer a ‚Äúlight‚Äù version of the app for free.
title: Very disappointed that the features important to me are no longer free!

review: I have anxiety, depression, and ptsd. Often I stay awake all night, then can‚Äôt get out of bed all day. It‚Äôs been crippling and ongoing for most of my life. I can honestly say it‚Äôs been over a decade since I‚Äôve had a healthy and sound night of sleep, and I‚Äôve never fallen asleep in less than an hour. Last night was my 5th night of Sleep Stories. I fell asleep deeply each night only minutes into each story. I woke up each morning naturally by 8am feeling refreshed. I never knew what this could feel like. I‚Äôm so impressed. No nightmares/night terrors, no tossing and turning, no constant waking up. I slept soundly. Thank you.
title: A game changer for me

review: I‚Äôm very grateful for becoming a part of the CalmCommunity!! I have incorporated mindful meditation into my nearly daily routine and I am very aware of the vast benefits it brings. I allow myself to make the 10 minutes a way to attain a level of peace I believe I am not only deserving but also capable of attaining within those 10 minutes. It is that powerful and everybody can also attain the same by simply following the guide‚Äôs instructions and be open to the benefits themselves. I highly recommend this app for anyone who wants a respite for themselves. Good fortune to you and thank you Tamara Levit for your powerful guidance. Thank you Calm, too!!
title: Indispensable

review:
Stressed out? - get Calm
Trouble sleeping? - get Calm
Looking for some motivation? - get Calm

I'm currently a student in professional school and Calm has helped me get through some very stressful times. I was new to meditation before getting the Calm app but meditating is now something I look forward to everyday. This app helps me manage my stress and ultimately just makes me feel happier throughout the day. 

I started using this app with just the free version just to check it out. I quickly found the benefits this app provided me in how it made me feel and bought a years subscription. Money well spent! 

Calm has all of its meditations organized so it's easy for the user to focus on exactly what he/she needs. From guided meditations for beginners on various subjects to meditations for kids, this app has everything one could ask for in order to feel calm.

The ambient sounds are extremely relaxing and Calm has an expansive selection to choose from. 

I highly highly recommend this app!!
title: Best app on my devices

review: The app is great, I love the nature sounds and the guided meditation. I was excited to see how many of them were free. I have severe anxiety and depression, I‚Äôm in college and I stay stressed. I have no money and I thought it was nice that these guys are on my side. However, I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed that all of the ones that show as free, only the first day out of the seven is free. So I‚Äôm not going to get nearly as much help from the app as I was hoping, being that I can‚Äôt afford $60 a year for everything else. The collections that show as free should BE FREE. All of the ones marked as premium I know I can‚Äôt get. But when I start a collection not marked as such, I was expecting to be able to finish it. Instead, I feel cheated out of it.
title: I‚Äôm disappointed.

review:
The only reason I gave it three stars instead of five is that the program upgrade to go to the next level is excessive in cost.  That is disappointing because I would like to stay with it but won't for that price. $13/mo., $5.mo for a yr, or $300. Lifetime!!üò≥ Would like to see them reconsider their prices.  
Overall, I have found this guided meditation series very helpful.  The free service is a basic short beginners process.  I enjoy that you can play the nature sounds and music on top of the guided meditation.  It helps with relaxation.  I wish there was a Christian app that would do the same thing. I also really like the sleep stories. In just a weeks time my sleep has significantly improved.
title: Really good base app, but very expensive upgrade

review: I struggle with an anxiety disorder and find that mindfulness meditation helps. But if you're having anxiety, racing thoughts, etc., it's exceedingly difficult to do without a guide. I've taken classes at a local hospital and got recordings from the facilitators. I've also tried several other meditation apps. This is WAY better. The voices are actually pleasant and calming, which is really important. You can adjust the time of several meditations, change background sounds, etc. it's packed with lots of different kinds of meditations for different purposes. And the sleep stories are fantastic!
title: Way better than other meditation apps!

review: This app. Calm is the BEST I have ever place on my iPhone. Two thumbs up üëçüèºüëçüèº!!! It helps me go to sleep knowing I have to wake up early for work, I love üíï this app.!!! I truly think all who reads this and like to be calm should truly get this app. Calm!üòä. I love üíó being calm in bed listening to calm nature or a calm story telling a specially if I have to go to work in the early morning üòù!! Thank you calm App. and keep sending new calmness.  This App. Make me complete and it helps me still when I need a deep sleep.  As long as there no glitches in this Calm App. I will be happy üòä
title: I love being calm and listening to soothing music!!!

review: I‚Äôve only been using the Calm app seriously for a month but I LOVE IT! I practice or listen to discussions three times a day when I can. Daily Calm first thing every morning, some meditation or part of a series in the afternoon and a sleep meditation when I go to bed. It has helped me so much in becoming much more comfortable and relaxed. You can‚Äôt help but feel better after listening to the soothing meditations that are all about goodness. I‚Äôm looking forward to a long journey and becoming better and better at being mindful and grateful and content. It works!
title: Love the Calm app!

review: I love the calm app, and I recommend it to people all the time. I especially enjoyed all the spark interviews which are very inspiring,  I try to do the 3 daily meditations , daily calm, daily trip and daily Jay.  I like the daily movement but often run out of time to squeeze it in, but it is also very good. I love that my health provider has paid for it as an included wellness benefit during the pandemic because it really helped me manage stress. I think all medical providers should include this as a total wellness package to people. Keep up the great work!
title: Calm app is fantastic for well being and managing stress

review: HOLY CRAP!! I am not into this CRAP AT ALL but figured after not sleeping and being super stressed and anxious about nearly everything I wanted to try something new. I‚Äôve tried meditating before but i basically just shut my eyes and pretended, this guided meditation definitely did it for me! I am an absolute believer!! This is AMAZING and I‚Äôm sleeping now I just needed to put things on the shelf for a bit to just relax and take some time to just be in the moment and not in the past or future. Clear everything, take a break and breathe. This really works I‚Äôm shocked!! This is crazy!!
title: New and skeptical‚Ä¶

review: My kiddo has always had a hard time sleeping. We‚Äôve kept a steady routine: bath book, bed. We have tried so many things. Moshi, a night light with sound machine, air purifier, singing, back rubs. I had given up. I downloaded the Calm app because I wanted to start meditating to deal with the crushing stress of being a working parent during a pandemic. I stumbled on the kids stories by accident. My kiddo was asleep within 12 minutes!! I was astonished!! I am so grateful for this app. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for giving an exhausted parent the gift of sleep!
title: Magic for Kids Bedtime Routine

review: This app has every potential to help people and their mental health. It‚Äôs obvious however that it has just been designed by another entrepreneur with the intention of getting rich. I find it shocking that the FIRST thing it tries to get you to do once you‚Äôve finished a meditation is to share a quote to social media. This is encouraging the exact kind of behaviour that meditation is trying to relieve you from. It also does so under the heading ‚Äúthink about how it feels to check in with yourself‚Äù. I find it incredibly exploitative that after meditation, you are directed to ‚Äúcheck in with yourself‚Äù by sharing a quote to social media. Clearly the app‚Äôs primary intention is to grow wealth for the owner. This should be the very last option someone sees, with mood diary, helpful links, etc coming first.
title: Exploitative

review: Calm has made its way into my morning daily routine. It a has also told my children bedtime stories after we do an evening children‚Äôs meditation. It has helped me fall asleep when I am overwhelmed. It has even helped me rest with a nap here and there. Calm was recommended to me over a year ago... after 6 months I become a lifetime member. In just that short amount of time I could feel the wonderful impact it had on my life and my family. So grateful for all the amazing people that work to put together Calm. I recommend it to everyone!
title: Calm has become a part of my life

review: I often had sleep anxiety where my mind would race through thoughts and embarrassing moments from my entire life making it impossible to fall asleep. I wouldn‚Äôt look forward to going to sleep. also would keep the tv on for some irrational fear of the dark. Now I can gladly say all of that is gone thanks to calm‚Äôs bed time stories. I fall asleep in less than 20 minutes and I‚Äôm so excited to go to bed now. This app has been truly life changing. I‚Äôve gotten similar results by listening to podcasts but it‚Äôs just not the same. I highly recommend Calm for the sleep stories alone :)
title: No more sleep anxiety

review: Overall, this is great only on the outside. The app is charming and visually pleasing, but it‚Äôs heavily commercialized as they bring in famous people to attract more customers and the content is so limited and definitely not worth the hefty price of $70 annually! You‚Äôd expect something exceptional for that price, that you‚Äôd otherwise not find on other online sources. But trust me, I found much better content on YT and for free. Podcasts are way too short and limited, sleep stories are fine if you are a fan of a certain celebrity, mood check-in is useless, as it does no personalization of the content for you. Calm body has only about 6 excercises. It‚Äôs unrealistic to charge this much for such limited amount of content. Price should be more reasonable.
title: You can find more quality content on YT and for free
