title: We‚Äôre out

review: I've been using this app for a few days now. Definitely considering putting my money into it! Everything about this is amazing! My body feels soft, relaxed, and almost renewed after each session I've taken so far! I'm a college student and I experience anxiety, stress, and loads of trouble with sleeping. This app is helping me with all of these, including staying focused and to just breathe and relax. The sleep stories are my favorite! I'll lay in bed and turn on a sleep story and close my eyes, next thing you know I'm becoming more relaxed and I always fall asleep soundly right after! Wonderful app for sure!
title: Relaxing after stressful day

review:
I've only been using Calm for about 6 weeks and am already completely amazed by how Tamara and her team's daily suggestions, encouragements and points of focus have so positively impacted my thought process and overall emotional and physical well being.

Four of the fundamental key lessons I've learned (mindfulness, non-judgmental thinking of self/others/thoughts/etc, carrying less "weight" in life, always returning to the breath), among the countless others, are already changing my life for the better day by day by day - just incredible.

There's always more to learn about mindful meditation and yourself every day...
title: There's always more...

review: I have been using this app for more than five years. It has been my sanctuary when I need to meditate or when I have racing thoughts to fall sleep. The sleep stories are very diverse and super effective. I have rarely finished one because I always fall sleep:)). The meditation material is matched with advanced spiritual teachings. The narrators are very nice and share vulnerability and human nature. It is a very down to earth attitude with rich material. I truly hope that they continue their great work. I have recommended this to all my friends and keep doing that.
title: Very deep and advanced level materials

review: I saw the app has added new children sleepy time stories. I clicked to scour through what sort of story for children this app was playing. The entire story is about a fish who always felt different and met an aunt. An aunt who liked to wear pants and was different than all the other fish and the one no one wanted to talk to or about. How her parents never understood her and her friends. How meeting her Aunt Bubb allowed her mind to open into world of imagination she could take wherever she went. And only she and her friends knew about it though her parents never quite understood them. How free she felt being able to be understood by this group of friends. And how forever grateful she was for her aunt Bubb. I listened at how this story emphasized parents never really understanding her or her new friendships.
title: NOT FOR CHILDREN - GROOMING STORIES!!!

review: I‚Äôve always had trouble falling asleep, and I always need some type of noise in the background. But I could never find a great app to help me. Calm is the app for EVERYONE, it not only has sleep stories read to you by your celebrities but it also has many different meditations that can help you with anxiety, depression, stress etc. Plus their graceful and artistic melodies and soundscapes to transport you to a whole other universe. If you need help when it comes to sleeping or relaxing then GET THIS APP!!! üíöüí§üî≠
title: ‚ÄúHas changed my life, and maybe yours too if you get this app right now!‚Äù

review: People who truly have a hard time sleeping need a story to repeat. This is not an option even when paying for this app. I have to restart the story over and over when I‚Äôm having a rough night. The app is not user friendly. I have to search and search for things that might be a good story and I mostly find short half hour stories. I need longer ones and I have to search for them. I am giving it 3 starts because I have found a story I love to listen to and there is a ton to try. We all have our own taste of calming stories but once I found it I wish the app made it easier to find and allowed it to repeat.
title: Not user friendly and no repeat

review: I‚Äôve used other meditation apps in the past‚Äîbut decided to give this a try. The selection that they have for free isnt a true depiction of the app so I decided to pay for the subscription. This will be my first and last year using the app. The moderators are too chatty. You can select a 25 min meditation for deep concentration and they are talking for the bulk of the meditation. How can one concentrate if the moderator keeps breaking concentration by talking. This is probably a bit odd but if you‚Äôve used other apps you‚Äôll understand‚Äîthe voices on this app arent soothing but rather abrasive in my opinion. I think the glitz and glam of this app is the fact that they have celebs on the app like Lebron‚Äîbut you can get what you need from an app that doesn‚Äôt require a subscription or one that doesnt have a hefty price tag.
title: Too chatty

review: I like the sleep stories and use the app primarily to help fall asleep.   They do have a couple 1.5 hr ‚Äúanthology‚Äù stories, but I‚Äôd like to be able to pick 2-4 stories, put them in a cue, and play those three or four till I fall asleep.   Or put one on an infinity repeat etc‚Ä¶.  The way it is set up now, if I‚Äôm still awake at the end of a story I need to turn my phone back on, scroll through to find the next one I want to hear and start again, which really starts over the falling asleep process.  It would be great if I could select four, and have it play all those before turning off.
title: Good sleep stories, but I wish you had the option of cueing multiple stories.

review:
I first tried this app back in 2017 and I remember there being multiple different options for non premium members. Now there‚Äôs almost nothing. Not even an beginners option to see if it‚Äôs a good fit for them. I was hoping to use calm again to help with immense stress and struggles I‚Äôm facing, but alas I will have to find something different until I can afford an extra expense for this. 
 I hope some mental health providers see this: please keep in mind the socioeconomic background of those you recommend this app too. Premium is expensive and there‚Äôs not much point in having the app if you don‚Äôt have premium.
title: Don‚Äôt try this unless you have money to buy premium.

review: Although for years I was a firm believer in the power of meditation, I had drifted from it. Looking at Instagram last night I came across a post from Calm and decided to give their free trial a try. My experience this morning was beyond amazing. As the meditation began, my body was physically hit with an pleasant and exciting energy I can only describe as spiritual lightning. Some people call it chicken skin!  I feel energized, more focused and happier. I can truly say I am more ready to face my day after spending ten minutes in meditation this morning. The Calm app made this experience easily accessible and I look forward to more.
title: ThisStuffWorks

review: This is an absolute MUST have for anyone, even if you do think you have it all together and you don‚Äôt feel stressed, anxious, or depressed. Anyone and everyone can benefit from the power of medication. The Calm app has seriously changed my entire perspective on life and how I cope with stress, confusion, anxiety, and anger. And above all, it has increased my love and happiness with myself and with others. I no longer let every day frustrations get the best of me. Calm has truly helped me become a better human; emotionally and physically, more than any medication or therapist has. I highly recommend this app! 11/10
title: Calm has changed my life

review: First I wanna say that the Daily Calms are so AWESOME. Really love the body scans. Tamara‚Äôs voice is so peaceful and beautiful. Some things that could be improved: the search functionality needs some work: when you type ‚Äú3 minute meditation‚Äù the results shown are meditation for little kids. It‚Äôs a little annoying finding an old meditation that you favorite cuz there‚Äôs no way to organize them in different categories so it feels you are mixing up apples with oranges, and when I wake up and need to play something to help me to go back to sleep I spend so much time trying to find the one I‚Äôm looking for, and it‚Äôs totally the opposite of what I‚Äôm expecting to happen at 3 am in the morning and end up feeling frustrated for something I‚Äôm paying for.
title: Love the meditations and Tamara‚Äôs voice but...

review:
I downloaded this app one day after an extremely stressful day at work. I knew that there were a lot of paywalls, but I wanted to give the free stuff a try. I managed to find a few free 7-day stress relief sessions, and instantly felt better. This app really works!
Then I came home the next day, almost as stressed as the day before. As soon as I got home, I was so excited to continue the sessions I started, only to find out that the rest of the sessions were locked behind a paywall! Forget stress-relief. The app suddenly added stress!  I understand that they want people to subscribe, but then why even bother with having such little free stuff at all? Just stick with the ‚Äú7-day trial‚Äù and leave it at that.
title: Great app, but forget the ‚Äúfree‚Äù version.

review: My little sister had huge problems falling asleep at night, she would lay awake for hours tossing and turning, now that I have calm she falls asleep within one to two sleep stories!!!!! I love the background sounds. I was skeptical of meditation in the beginning, being a Christian and all, but it has greatly helped me in my every day life, my stress level has gone down, and now it even helps with when I‚Äôm in pain I can breath and relax my body and it help lessen the pain and/or dissolve it complete!!!! My focus has improved as well and I‚Äôm learning how too use and take control of my mind!!! Thank you calm!!!!!!
title: Love, love, love!!!!

review: I like this app a lot but they‚Äôve added so many different series to it that now it‚Äôs too much. It‚Äôs like they threw the whole kitchen sink of anything they might slightly deal with mindfulness into the app. I wish they would pare it down and I would also find it useful to mark a whole series as a favorite not just one session. That way if I‚Äôm doing 21 days of calm, it doesn‚Äôt help if I mark day 7 as a favorite when I really just want get to day 8 easily the next day, but if I could make the whole series a favorite that would help. Again, there‚Äôs so much loaded into the app now it‚Äôs hard to find things and it‚Äôs hard to decide which one you should even do or that would be most helpful to you.
title: Option Overload

review: I‚Äôve had horrible panic attacks that wake me in the middle of sleep every night for a long time now. Over the past few months they have gotten worse. In a last ditch effort before going to medication I decided to give meditation a try... this app is amazing!! In the first night using the 7 days of sleep program I actually slept through the night for the first time in months! Now I feel more rested and focused throughout the day, and I feel like I have some control in my life. Anyone who is struggling with sleep or anxiety or stress I HIGHLY recommend using this app!! Thank you Calm!!!
title: Changed my life!!

review:
Calm is a great App that helps me a lot.
The one thing that is SO frustrating is the OVER use of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs  voice for so much of the content.  I‚Äôm sure her voice works for many people,  but it is extremely annoying to me and I am so confused as to why they would only offer her voice on about 75 percent of the content on this App. This App is very expensive and it should offer much more if a selection of narrators. I understand that she writes the content but please her voice on all the meditations is ridiculous. It‚Äôs seems like  a real contradiction to what the App should be promoting.  PLEASE provide a VARIETY of voices CALM!  Let‚Äôs have diversity just like the sleep stories.
title: More Narrators Please!!!!

review: The Calm app is so awesome because each session (like in 21 days of calm) is a learning opportunity as well as a guided meditation. Two in one. So I learn a single concept to focus on that I try to keep in mind the rest of the day. I used to read books about meditation and practice on my own. It was a project!  Time consuming. And I‚Äôd forget things I read too.  Too many concepts at once without time to reflect. With Calm I learn insightful concepts and ways of thinking, but little by little so it works into my way of being and sticks better. Also guided meditation helps pull my wondering mind back much better than I do on my own. And the guide is so forgiving and compassionate about my wondering mind that I find meditation pleasant rather than frustrating like before.
title: Insightful & makes meditating SO easy

review: I discovered this app being advertised on Facebook last year and loved it instantly! Since than I have told multiple people to use it and they are all benefiting from it. Recently, a friend told me she started listening to the story to help her fall asleep. She suffers from chronic migraine and always had difficulty falling asleep. No medication would help her. She would never be able to sleep before 2am and her maximum sleep would be only 4 hours. She started playing the story in the app. And soothing tone is helping her fall asleep instantly! By recommending Calm to her I was able to help change her life. Thank you
title: Brilliant

review: I have found this tool to be of great help in releasing my tension and effort to control. I'm a severe abuse survivor and have Lyme Condition in last stage, stage 3. It has effected my brain, energy, emotions, and at times alert and clear thinking. I'm really a miracle despite this condition. But do find this app more effective than reaching for a medication. It also enhances my spirituality and the learning and growth I am gaining into my spiritual being. Thanks for such a great tool for people to use to find the kind of freedom that letting everything truly "go" brings. That inner peace, joy, belief, and faith, that if one chooses, can draw one closer to the source of all Life.
title: Great tool for me.

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for 4+ years now and it has become an integral part of my life. My mental health has improved since and meditating routinely became possible because of this app. I love the way it is setup for all background levels and has many other useful lifestyle improvement based aspects like better sleep, focus and movement. I would recommend this app to anyone who is looking to work on those things or even just trying to explore the fields of mindfulness and positive psychology and/or appreciate a well made app.
title: Keeps me going.

review: This app we mainly use for the sleep stories though I have used the meditations many times and love them. My two children and I all fall asleep to a sleep story each night. We love that new stories are added periodically. I do wish Keith Morrison would do more! He‚Äôs our favorite and he‚Äôs only got one story. We have to switch it up and listen to different stories or else they don‚Äôt put us to sleep so we often rotate through our favorites. We love his voice and the story! Please make more for him to narrate!! Thank you for an amazing and helpful app!
title: Love it

review: I love calm! first of all I love it because it helps me go to sleep at night. Second of all I love it because it helps me calm down when I get upset I guess that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs called Calm. Third of all I love that‚Äôs free because I really needed it. Fourth of all thank you because if this wasn‚Äôt free I would go to bed at 9 o‚Äôclock every night. And I‚Äôd probably sleep in school. So thanks again. I hope you love my message. And also I have a question for you with a meditation daily do you have to set a time because I might not be able to do it at the same time every day. Bye!
title: Thanks

review: I‚Äôm only ten but there is so much going on in my life and stress invades me and to top it all off I just moved. That is when I started using Calm. It is so amazing and has calmed me down so much. Actually because I have been so calm my parents were surprised when they saw how calm I was when the day state testing started. I also love to meditate and they have some really good lessons. I have only had Calm for a few weeks but I highly recommend it if you are stressed or just like me with anger issues and because of Calm I haven‚Äôt yelled in like a month or so.
title: Please download Calm

review:
One feature that I would really like is if there was a way to have white noise play after completing a sleeping meditation. My body is very relaxed but once it goes silent I get back into my thoughts again and have to get back on my phone to play white noise. I don‚Äôt think this would be hard to incorporate but it would be very beneficial to many others like myself. 

Besides that I love this app and use it every night. The developers constantly come up with new updates with new features. Would recommend to anyone.
title: Improvement idea

review:
Every person in my family has ADHD with sensory processing issues. I really wanted to like this app, but trying to use it to help my kids meditate simply does not work. The sounds that play in the background of every meditation - with our sensory issues - actually inspire extreme sensory overload. It actually does the opposite of what the title suggests. My kids are MORE agitated after trying to do one of the kids‚Äô meditations. They actually prefer to do the meditations from another app that is only for adults that is blissfully silent in the background, allowing the words and calm to actually sink in. 

The brown noise is perfect, otherwise it would be a 1/5 star for me and my family. I wish this app was more inclusive.
title: Not inclusive for Neurodivergent Family

review:
I love most of the stories! The narrator's
have very SOOTHING AND MYSTICAL
VOICES!!  Some of the stories also have very soothing mystical background ‚Ä¶.(some musical and some sounds of nature) I would love for the volume to be elevated because they add to the soothing effects of the stories!! I was so IMPRESSED with Glacier Express that I am SERIOUSLY thinking about visiting The Swiss Alps!! I thought I would have liked A Very Sleepy Burns Night Dennis Lawson ‚Ä¶..has a very soothing voice but he recited the poetry using a VERY HEAVY SCOTTISH ACCENT with singsong tempo that I found RATHER ANNOYING!!
I also wish you could add more hour long stories when I am having a real hard time falling asleep! üí§ 
A reviewer complained about famous celebrities narrating the stories which really didn‚Äôt bother me though I prefer lesser known ones to narrate!! I was Exceptionally impressed that pop singer Shawn Mendes  could narrate a sleep story with such VERVE AND EMOTION
Matt  McConaghy did a decent read and Morgan Freeman is the KING üëë of spoken word!!
Overall I am  IMPRESSED with Calm and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
title: Calming!

review:
This is a life saving app!  It was recommended to me a year ago.  At the time, I had been diagnosed with depression.  Like so many, the trauma of the time was weighing heavily on me.

Calm helped me to begin a new journey.  It touched me with great music.  I learned how to meditate from those who faced the same problems and found a way.  I‚Äôm enjoying guided and unguided meditation.  I feel healthier and I‚Äôm healing.  There‚Äôs a lifetime of meditation ahead.

Thank you to all who made this happen and walk with us.  I‚Äôm grateful.  Try it.  There‚Äôs nothing to lose and a life of equanimity, acceptance and peace to be found.
title: Life saving app

review: It‚Äôs a real shame that almost everything on the app is locked :/ The only thing that I can play are the scenes. Thank goodness I can fall asleep to them still. However, I had a free subscription one time and I listened to this story and it was the BEST story ever. It helped me sleep within 5 minutes whereas the scenes put me to sleep a hour later. Very sad that nowadays everything has a price to it. Even your own sleep. I wish in the future you guys will change your ways and unlock if not most of the stories then just a few. You‚Äôd be surprised how many people actually depend on this app for their own rest and peace of mind. Have a good night üòûü§ç
title: Cost for everything :(

review: I noticed the benefits of the Calm app almost immediately. I usually start self-improve activities and do not feel like continuing with the program or process. With Calm it‚Äôs different: I look forward to the next session. I was feeling very apathetic, negative, and stressed; within 2 minutes, that energy and thoughts transformed. I even went back to journaling.  I highly recommend the app Calm, even if it costed thousands of dollars a year. Life is priceless. Calm is bringing me back to life, a wonderful, positive, Blissful and happy life. Thanks and Blessings to the people that created Calm; it‚Äôs a gift for humanity and the world.
title: Immediate improvement

review:
If anybody has ever had a panic attack they know how debilitating it can be. I was going through one that lasted more than two hours and I was suffering greatly. I tried all the methods I know to get through it but it just kept getting worse. 

I had seen multiple ads on social media for Calm so I decided to try it. I chose a guided 12 minute program for stress and anxiety. Unbelievably my panic attack was gone at the end of the session.

I highly recommend Calm to anyone who has this condition. I can‚Äôt wait to try it out for other purposes like sleep, Focus and meditation
title: Eliminated a panic attack in 12 minutes!

review: Today is a sad day indeed. I have been a premium user of this app for over three years. Somehow my auto-renew got shut off and when I came on today, I saw that it is $70/year now? I have never paid more than maybe $20 or less for the premium service and now suddenly all of the meditations I have come to love are not accessible to me. I‚Äôm having a baby in two months and unfortunately the premium services for this app has become a frivolous expense that I can no longer justify. I‚Äôll keep it around because I truly love this app, but it is sad to see all of my favorite sessions unavailable now. :(
title: Sad day

review: Calm tries very hard to cater to the emotional expectations of someone who doesn't yet understand what mindfulness is. It has ambient nature sounds, lots of voices trying really hard to be soothing, and an impressive hodgepodge of options. Unfortunately it doesn't really seem to teach much. A lot of time is spent on abstract personal anecdotes, celebrity humble brags, and portraying as many different ideas of mindfulness as possible. The very first "How to Meditate" session makes you listen to the teacher's life story and ideas for 3 minutes before actually explaining anything. There's no real structure or sense of progress, so there's not much to commit to. If you want to relax for 20 minutes, Calm may help. If you want to learn and deepen a practice that applies beyond those 20 minutes, look elsewhere.
title: Superficial mindfulness

review: Love the app! So far has helped me get through my life and also helps me fall asleep a lot quicker and faster üí® I also love the backgrounds, music, sleep stories, and meditations!!! Sometimes I do wish that the daily calm was free  for everyone and the other meditations are for only calm premium but I understand that life doesn‚Äôt work that way and you can‚Äôt always get what you want, however I think that it will make people‚Äôs desire to have the app and use it daily increases because they will have a calm relaxing time with daily calm! üòå Other than that I LOVE YOU GUYS APP AND I WISH YALL ALL THE BEST!!! Hope it becomes even more successful in the future than it already is!!!üòòüòÅ
title: WOOHOO ü•≥ I‚Äôm so calm rn!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 8615508, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for reaching out! Our team is continuing to work on improving our voiceover functionality of the app. If there is anything you notice missing, please do reach out to support@calm.com', 'modified': '2019-05-10T22:11:12Z'}
review: I‚Äôll bet that you don‚Äôt get a review like this often, but I am a blind person that has been trying to find an accessible meditation app, and while some of your features are accessible with blind users screen readers, many of them are not, and the buttons are not labeled, and therefore we do not know what it is that we are selecting. With just a little bit of work, and with a few changes, I can tell that your app has much potential to become accessible for blind users, but unfortunately is not quite there yet. If this app does end up becoming more user-friendly for the blind in the future, I will be more than glad to raise my rating on your app at that point when I am able to start using it in its entirety.
title: Wish it was more accessible.

review:
I downloaded this app at the beginning of 2018 when I began refocusing on my overall wellness and stress management. This app isn‚Äôt cheap, but in the short time I‚Äôve owned it, they have added SO much content! There are bedtime stories, guided meditations, music, nature sounds, etc. The Calm App even offers ‚Äúmaster classes‚Äù that are like mini self improvement classes by some of my favorite authors. I have several other meditation/relaxation apps but Calm provides the most value and versatility. 

Shout out to the development team and content creators because this app never gets stale and continues to prove it‚Äôs worth!
title: One of the Best Apps I Own

review:
If you are searching for guided meditations this is the app for you. I have enjoyed adding meditation to my daily schedule. The night stories are wonderful. It‚Äôs become a new routine in our house that I am very thankful for. 
I believe it is fairly priced for all that is offered. I typically meditate to the daily calm but can always go in and find a meditation that helps in moments of anxiety, arguments or just needing a moment. The walking medications are wonderful. There is something for everybody. Whether you meditate everyday or are incorporating something new into your life, Calm can help you center and bring calm to your life.
title: Perfect app for Meditating

developerResponse: {'id': 5981586, 'body': "Hi there, I'm sorry for the trouble! The music feature will be unlocked once you've completed (and canceled) the free trial. Reach out to support@calm.com with any questions!", 'modified': '2018-11-17T01:38:13Z'}
review: I have had Calm for a couple of years now and most of the features music, stories, mindfulness etc now cost?! This was my favorite app until all the unexpected fees. There was one song that would literally bring my spirt up no matter the circumstances and I would listen to it for hours on end. And I for the life of me have been trying to find it! Now you can‚Äôt even just pick a song, just one song for free and it‚Äôs quite upsetting now. I feel as though having the app for the years I‚Äôve had it I could have at least kept my content. I would‚Äôve deleted it but the only reason I haven‚Äôt is because, when you open the app it just plays one random song and you can‚Äôt even view it. This review would normally be receiving a 5 star but this is the reason I feel it deserves 1 star!
title: Unsatisfactory

review:
This app is wonderful. If you are wondering if an app is really appropriate for meditation and releasing stress because it requires the use of your ‚Äúgadgets‚Äù that you may want to put down - I get where you are coming from!

...but think of an elegant app that you can open, and with a click or two get to a daily meditation or a wonderful sleep story and immediately set the phone or iPad down while listening... (and possibly streaming to your speakers). This is what the folks of Calm were thinking when they designed the app, and it works perfectly. 

So worth it! It is truly a joy to use.
title: The best app for meditation

review: I commend the app creators for a stress-free interface, a meditation regime that is anything but regimented but just as effective, and a coach in Tamara Levitt that exudes humble wisdom. I know this review sounds a bit corny, but this is how I honestly feel. Not all answers are found in her guidance, but her gentle voice puts people on the path towards those answers. The compassion for others and the desire to help them thrive pours out from this app. And it‚Äôs okay to fail, to mess up or flub practice! That failure is not only accepted, but used as an excellent teaching tool to coach users on how best to handle failure. I have experienced few things in life that gentle.
title: What a start to a new journey!

review: Tried the free 7 days, then paid for a year subscription. The woman who narrates the teachings has a lovely speaking voice - a big reason why I chose to pay for this app. The visuals, changeable backgrounds, and sounds are beautiful. There are sets of teachings for calming anxiety, focus, more. Also, there is a new meditation for each day, and even stories to help you go to sleep. Although I have Insight Timer, an awesome meditation app that is free, I still paid for a year of this one (cheaper to pay for a year than month by month) and most days just use Calm. Been using the app for several months. It's wonderful.
title: Lovely.

review:
This app is a 5 star because whenever I cannot and I mean CANNOT sleep this always helps me no matter what !! Thank you for this app !!!!!!! Calm is my #1 favorite app ever !!!!!!!! It‚Äôs awesome and even the people voices meditate you too !!! Like 
(Sienna the sleepy sloth) and the Christmas one too !!!!! The voice meditates you always !!! I also love that actually famous people read stories too !!! Like if you like LeBron James he has a sleep story too !!! I love that this app has even meditation for naps !!! You can use this app for anything !!! Even car rides !!! If you consider getting this app , DO GET IT !!!
title: 5 STAR !!!!

review: I was excited to use this app.  I decided to get the premium version and paid $69.  However I was still unable to access all the content.  Yes, I went to the help pages etc. I logged in all the possible ways because Calm inferred that one may have paid for premium with a different log in than you think you did, so to speak. I paid via Apple.  After trying all ways to log in and access content I contacted Calm twice and heard nothing back whatsoever. Also what was annoying was that when logging in the message kept popping up to tell me I could get premium for $49!!!  Anyway I gave up and fortunately I seem to be getting a refund through Apple. Hopefully that comes through.  All in all it was a very stressful experience and not ‚Äúcalming‚Äù at all.
title: Hopeless App

review: I have used this app for years multiple times a day and loved it until today. I have lost all the content of the app and it will not format to the new look and update that was there yesterday. All of the selection buttons are gone, masterclass everything. I have tried uninstalling several times . I have reached out for help and have not gotten any help. I do not mind paying a premium subscription but am disappointed in the fact that I cannot use the app now and do not know what to do. Please help
title: Loved the app until

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm for a few years.  I love the daily meditation as well as others.  I enjoy very much Lebron‚Äôs series.  My son and I listen to a kid‚Äôs story every night.  That is how he goes to sleep.  Recently, we started reading the Bio of the narrators before starting the story.  They are very interesting and my son loves reading them. Those night when I have trouble falling asleep or I wake up in the middle of the night, I use the app to help me getting relaxed and falling back to sleep.  Calm has a lot of stuff for different users.  I really enjoy the application.
title: Love this App!

review: I use headspace often, love it. But I have been curious what Calm is about and I have to say I enjoy this app as well. I am an insomniac and easily anxiety prone and so I wanted to see if this app could provide me something different then headspace. What I like so far is the daily calm and the fact that I can put my mood, gratitude and insights into the software daily, almost like a journal. Helps me to slow down at the end of the day and reflect. I think I like the sleep stories in headspace a bit better, but with both apps I can get the best of both worlds.
title: Just what I needed

review:
Calm has helped me immeasurably - between meditations to relax/get motivated/destress; stretching exercises to energize and reset; sleep stories for bed time; and motivational talks to refocus and reach for goals - so many bases are covered! Sleep stories have helped me rest more easily, resulting in better quality of life when I am awake. 

The only thing Calm has missed the mark on for me is in giving racist trash Camilla Cabello a voice and an income stream. This isn‚Äôt about her music, it‚Äôs about her absolute hurtful & racist behaviors that she only owned up to and apologized for AFTER being called out publicly. Calm, please vet your celebrity guests and remove racist trash like Camilla Cabello from your otherwise delightful app.
title: Life changing app

review: After reading some reviews, I am glad to find that I am not the only person who can‚Äôt stand Tamara Levitt. The content is great and what she‚Äôs produced is amazing, but the way she guides the meditations is so...fake. She says everything in this exaggerated way, dripping with sweetness and condescension, like she‚Äôs forcing herself to be calm and nice and soothing. Nobody talks naturally like that! Unless you are a privileged white new agey woman from California. I cannot listen to her daily meditations, her courses, or her sleep stories. They make me angry! I don‚Äôt love all the narrators but she is the worst! I have never heard anyone with such an annoying voice in my life! Maybe she should narrate Fox News, it would fit the content better. Instead of Tamara I think you should replace her with Eric Braa. His voice is gold.
title: Can‚Äôt stand Tamara

review: I really like this app! I mostly use the sounds it comes with that are free! (You can find these sounds on the home page and in the top left corner you will see mountains and you click on that and you can play different sounds) My only problem is how much costs money. It‚Äôs kinda stupid how much costs because all you can really do is play those free sounds and do some ‚Äúhow do you feel‚Äù questions. I would really like to listen to the sleep stories because I‚Äôm a kid with ADHD and it‚Äôs very difficult to fall asleep at night, and all the stories cost! I don‚Äôt make that much money for a kid. My only request is please make more things free. Other than that this is pretty good! Have a nice day/night!
title: It‚Äôs good but...

review: I've been using the calm app for several years. I started with the seven days of calm, which was free, and once I got into the daily habit, I splurged for the annual subscription which I have been paying for a couple of years. I really enjoy the Daily Calm. I love Tamara's voice and her meditations really make me stop, think, and stay in the moment. My one criticism is that she often mispronounces fairly common words which kind of drives me crazy. Somebody needs to help her with that! It can be jarring. It's the only reason I'm not giving the app five stars.
title: It's saved me on anxious days.

review: After losing both my parents early and going forward through my life like a bullet, my late 30‚Äôs hit and I suffer from relentless night time depression and loneliness. I am not physically lonely I have a family so couldn‚Äôt figure out where this came from but it‚Äôs here. Paying drs, acupuncture, therapy etc no one can help alleviate what I am suffering....until this app. It feels like my mom is here and whispering to my everything is going to be alright. The bedtime stories help me drift off to sleep! No need for meds or expensive copays this app literally saved my life! Please don‚Äôt ever take it away ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: A salve for loneliness

review: I‚Äôve had this app since 2017 and absolutely loved it. I have some nights where it‚Äôs horribly difficult to fall asleep and the different sleep stories allowed me to wind down really well. Now that I‚Äôm in college, my stress has gotten worse and my nights have become way long and calm no longer helps because it‚Äôs the same single sleep story that I have available to me. It‚Äôs really such a shame that this has turned into a money juicer rather than the lovely helpful app that it was. If lowering the cost isn‚Äôt an option, at least make more of the stories, meditations, and plans available. At the very least the daily calm. Love the app, just don‚Äôt have enough use for it now.
title: Remember when it was free ..

review: I‚Äôm 15 and I have pretty bad anxiety and has trouble sleeping. I got this app to help me relax enough to have a good day or to even just sleep through the night. I‚Äôm a teenager and I don‚Äôt have a job, especially not now with the whole corona situation. I can‚Äôt pay over $60 even if it is yearly I don‚Äôt have that money NOW. And the stuff that you are able to do doesn‚Äôt help that much there is no sleep stories nothing to just listen to. The only thing there is, is ‚Äúthe learn how to meditate‚Äù and I already know how I had another app that reached me but I didn‚Äôt have the motivation to just sit there for 30 mins and do nothing. I had hoped this could help me but I can pay for it. It seems like a really good app but just not for me ‚ù§Ô∏è
title: To expensive!

review:
To the developers of calm, I am an individual who has sleep problems and most on the time there is little to fix it, ever sconce I had found calm I have been trying to use it but to no avail, you see pretty much everything is locked behind a paywall which creates a problem, that problem is that I, along with the sleep problems, has other issues in my life, seeing that my sleep is locked behind a membership deeply troubles me, I would sincerely enjoy useing the app to its fullest as I have heard great things, maybe one suggestion if you limit the paywalls is to put ads in unobtrusive places that would generate a revenue from the people now useing calm,That is just a suggestion but thank you.

Sincerely: Ian F.
title: Needs less paywalls

review: This app has been a lifesaver for me over the past month as I am going through hormonal imbalance which has caused a great deal of anxiety and some depression.  I have a dedicated time each day to use the app and work through the different meditations (so many choices!) I have also used this app in what I call my ‚Äúemergency situations‚Äù where I can feel the anxiety setting in and then I know it‚Äôs time to break out Calm and my headphones and breathe right through the anxiety and anxious thoughts to calm my self down. This is a great introduction for anyone interested in starting meditation and I highly recommend it!
title: A lifesaver

review: Wonderful app. I was thisclose to subscribing when an update wrecked my primary use of it. I know there's a sound fetish movement out there that includes a certain singsong vocal quality and whistling S sounds and so on, but the point of "sleep stories" is to fall asleep. The newly re-recorded stories are just awful - especially my former favorite, "The Waterfall." The whistling S's are like nails on a chalkboard. The exaggerated singsong might be good for a children's story but is highly distracting. And I notice the same thing has been done to "Blue Gold" now. Are the previous versions of these stories available to Premium subscribers? Are there any Premium sleep stories that don't have this fetish quality now?
title: Re-recorded "sleep story" content is terribly distracting

review: In the 7.5 years I have had an iPhone, I have probably rated less than 20 apps and have written less than five reviews.  This app, I feel, is one of the best meditation resources out there.  Definitely the best for guided meditation.  I am a licensed therapist and I use this app almost every day, for myself, at the beginning of the day for a sense of calm and peace before the day begins.  I am highly impressed by the newest addition, Calm Masterclass, And am anticipating the upcoming masterclass features.  Overall, I would highly recommend this app for guided meditations and mindfulness practice.  Great work Calm!!
title: Great meditation app, highly recommend

review:
The Calm App has been a daily ritual in my life  for over a year now.
I love it!  So peaceful, the soundscapes are amazing. The daily Jay is my favorite which gives insight on daily life how to realign your thinking to get the most out of living.  I‚Äôve tried different apps and not renewed but this app is part of me now and has brought my breathing and meditation to a higher level.  Used daily and even at bedtime with the wonderful bedtime stories, relaxation meditation and soundscapes, it can propel your life to better sleep and deeper relaxation.
title: Calm App is such a daily inspiration in my life!

review:
Hi - I‚Äôve been using calm close to five years. The app has really grown with so many new features, tools, and content. Compared to earlier versions of the app I now find the app overwhelming. When I need a moment to deescalate or need urgent breathing meditations it is not helpful to have to ‚Äúfind‚Äù my saved sessions. I would like to see a personalized Home Screen‚Ä¶a way to pin meditations like daily calm or Daily Trip or just pin sessions that you want to listen to over and over or when you need to have that session on hand at a moments notice.
My thoughts‚Ä¶.
title: Calm App Overload

review: I‚Äôve been a long time user of the app and it‚Äôs been great! I love the daily trip with Jeff Warren and the music helps me focus. However, the platform feels overwhelming to navigate. I also don‚Äôt like how I have to scroll all the way down to find my Favorites. This should be at the top, followed by For Today and Recently Played. I dont need to see all these rows with suggestions. Also, the music playlists stop after the first song. This seems to be a bug. Would be great if this could be fixed because it‚Äôs annoying to have to manually hit next after each song.
title: Long time user

review:
I have been a long time user of calm, but my streak ended at 665 days due to LOUSY, POOR support. When my subscription came up for renewal I was trying to pay on their website. My credit card kept getting refused. It should not have been. I tried for three days. DID SUPPORT REPLY TO MY INQUIRY? No. It finally got accepted but then my subscription was locked! 

I do not mind if they do not have phone support. But I do like easy access to email support. The app does not have that. The alludes to having it. But it is not there. 

I have lost my streak and my faith in this app. I am going to request a refund. Given the lack of support, I will probably have to cancel my credit card payment and deal with the bank.
title: Good content, lousy support

review: I enjoy using calm.   Lots of interesting programs within the app to help settle your mind and body. I love the masterclasses with a wide range of topics, also spark has speakers who have had something out of the ordinary change their life and that guest speaker  shares their journey.  Meditation lessons also range from a wide variety of topics.   Sleep stories are wonderful too.  Sleep stories have put my grand son to sleep quickly he is age 3.   I use this app a lot and have just started using the exercise guidance routines.   I love this app very beneficial to my health.   Thanks
title: Very good and easy

review: I suffer from many mental issues.  Ever since I began using the noting process, I have released so much anxiety and pressures off of my whole entire body.  I do not even have to take some of the medication prescribed by my Psychiatrist anymore as a result of this.  It is a true blessing.  I believe in this so much, I recommend the lifetime subscription to anyone going through these same mental problems.  It can be a matter of life and death!!!  Thank you Lebron James for introducing me to this APP.  You do not know me, however you saved my life.  God bless you always üíõüíõüíõ
title: Life Saving

review: Thank you for how supportive you‚Äôve been and you help me fall asleep every time nothing doesn‚Äôt stop me from sleeping in your app. My parents separated when I was 3 years old and I miss my dad slit and wouldn‚Äôt be able to fall asleep. At first I used to think calm was for grandmas who have sleep issues but I learned there are different meanings to this app and many of them are helpful to me. Once again thank you so much for this app you have created I‚Äôm only one of the many people you have helped with the same kind of problem.
title: Thank you calm

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for about 3 months. The beginning meditation course is really great and worth taking. Also like the sleep stories. But I will not be renewing. Should have gotten 1-2 months instead of a year. Here‚Äôs why:

TLDR: App is poorly designed; make sure you like Tamara Levits way of speaking before subscribing bc she‚Äôs 90% of the guided meditations:

1) The app is very confusing to navigate, which when half asleep is especially frustrating. I surprised that there is no one clear place to see all of your saved/fav recordings. Also, ever meditation has a huge picture which seems ok for people new to the app, but unnecessary for whose who just want to find what they're looking for. These things can easily be fixed and I hope they do something about it. 

2) After I finished beginning mediation course, I realized 90% of the other guided meditations  are by Tamara Levitt. I understand a lot of people probably like how she speaks (vocal fry, trying too hard to sound soothing), but I find it too distracting. So basically I can‚Äôt listen to 90% of the guided meditations.
title: 1 year subscription not worth it

review: Following the enthusiastic recommendation of a friend, I bought your app. It‚Äôs marvelous! My favorite stories are the train rides or walks in nature. Love the voices of May Charters, Ramon Tickarum, Eric Braa, and Anna Acton. Some of the classic stories, like Treasure Island and Alice in Wonderland are really done well.  This replaced all other meditation or sleep apps.  Over the past week or two, I‚Äôve had to restart the stories up to 4 or 5 times, due to crashing. I‚Äôve not had this problem with other apps, so I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs my iPad.  Can you look into this please! My updates are all current.
title: Love the stories - please fix the crashes

review: Lots of content‚Äîso much, there‚Äôs always something new. I‚Äôm happy to see a variety of voices, but wish there were (1) more voices if color in non-specialty meditations (meaning not just celebrities of color), and (2) more content and a greater variety of voices for Calm Kids, which my kid refuses to use because the voices are ‚Äútoo cutesy‚Äù and she feels condescended to. The biggest negative for me, though, is the rain sounds that come from my phone at totally random times of the day. Sometimes I unlock my phone and the sound is just there, and the app isn‚Äôt even open in the background. You can‚Äôt even just pause from the quick menu‚ÄîI have to find the app, open it, then swipe up to the app selector and swipe again to force quit. That is annoying.
title: Great but glitchy

review: I can‚Äôt say enough about this app.  I was in a very low place early this year.  No confidence, sad, no motivation.  I found this app and the small lectures.  I listened to every lecture and then also started meditating.  I learned so much about living a healthy and happy life from this app.  Through it, successfully ended and got out of a damaging relationship, I started rock climbing, eating healthy, and working out.  I‚Äôm now (what I think) the best and happiest version of myself.  And it all started from this app.  Download it!  Listen to the lectures.  Attempt to meditate (I‚Äôm still attempting a year later!).
title: This app changed my life.

review: Downloaded this app and will be deleting after this review. It took me 10 seconds to realize you can‚Äôt use this app without spending money. EVERYTHING is LOCKED until they get your money and even then, you‚Äôll run out of stories in a couple weeks. So unless you want to waste your money and have VERY limited content, don‚Äôt waste your time with this ‚Äúapp‚Äù. I‚Äôm really surprised at all the good reviews. There‚Äôs hardly any options or content and you run out of stories fast so you‚Äôll have to listen to them over and over. The idea is good but you‚Äôll use up this app and be done with it in 2 weeks. It‚Äôs definitely a cash grab app and could definitely be a whole lot better if they actually put some effort in this app.
title: Don‚Äôt get unless you want to spend $$

review:
This app would be perfect, if only all the narrators had lower pitched, soothing voices. Tamara, in particular seems to have the capability to lower her voice, but for some reason, she reads with a higher pitch. Not soothing or relaxing!!!! Not trying to be mean, but I‚Äôm trying to either relax or sleep. So, I avoid all sessions with her voice for that reason. Please find narrators who can use lower pitches and who have soothing voices.
Aside from that, some of the voices are very soothing, and I listen to them regularly.  The train stories are some of my favorites (Nordland, Orient Express, and Trans Siberian). Love the train sounds in the background.
title: High Pitched Voices NOT Soothing

review:
I really liked the app and got tired of the limited choices. I used the free week and quit. It still told me I could have a free week so I tried to to it again but accidentally bought a year. After a couple weeks (or months) of this the app took a couple times to load. I didn't think anything of it, then I would try to load it and it took more times to fully open it. After a while, no matter how many times I tried it didn‚Äôt open. Lucky it opened on my iPad, but I think it‚Äôs annoying that it doesn‚Äôt load on my phone. I‚Äôm trying to delete and re-download to see if that fixes the problem.

UPDATE: If anyone else has the same problem what I did workedüòä
title: Weird Glitch

review: I have been using calm for YEARS (since 2014). And with the free subscription of it for the simple body scans (which I have relied on since I started using the app to sleep). And for some reason, they decided to make all of the guided meditations (including the previous free ones) exclusive to the paid subscription. I am a broke college student with chronic depression and I have sleeping issues, I‚Äôve relied on that simple body scan for years and I haven‚Äôt been sleeping well without it but I can‚Äôt afford to pay for the subscription. So, I say to the creators of calm, thanks a lot guys I‚Äôm very disappointed.
title: Disappointed

developerResponse: {'id': 6362032, 'body': 'Hi there! We do our best to keep a useful set of content free for users who are unable to subscribe, but ultimately, our subscription prices allow us to continue growing the content (in terms of quantity and quality). Feel free to send any questions or feedback to support@calm.com.', 'modified': '2018-12-12T22:21:19Z'}
review: I‚Äôm willing to change the rating but first some kinks need to be worked out. I have really bad anxiety especially when I‚Äôm home alone trying to go to bed. The sleep stories on calm really calm me down and allow me to sleep 200x better. However, my main problem is there‚Äôs only one sleep story and nothing else no music, asmr, or anything that‚Äôs available to me on the free version, there‚Äôs really only so many times I can listen to the same thing and still fall asleep. I‚Äôd really love to see more available to those that can‚Äôt afford to pay for the premium version of the app but still love the app. Because this really does help with my anxiety it just makes me sad that there‚Äôs so many limits to the app because it helps so much!
title: Love the app but not the limits

review: Hands down the best sleeping aid I‚Äôve ever used! I do not Fall a sleep without listening to a sleep story or a meditation. This app helps quickly bring you to sleep even after the hectic chaos of my day. I use to sit in bed ready and scrolling social media for an hour, wasting so much valuable sleep time. Now I just turn on a sleep story and am asleep before it needs! Worth the $60 annual purchased, for the cost of a pair of shoes a year, I‚Äôm able to sleep 8 hours a night without waking. Also, their customer service is great. I had a billing issue and they went above and beyond to assist.
title: Don‚Äôt sleep without Calm!

review: I absolutely love the CALM app! It has truly transformed my daily life for the better. The soothing meditations and sleep stories help me unwind after a long day, and the mindfulness exercises keep me grounded and focused. The app's user-friendly interface makes it easy to navigate, and the variety of content ensures there's always something to suit my mood. CALM has become an essential part of my self-care routine, and I can't recommend it enough for anyone seeking peace and relaxation in their hectic lives. Thank you, CALM, for making mindfulness and tranquility so accessible!
title: Amazing

review: I was skeptical when I learned about the Calm app. Can technology like this really help people? I needed some calm in my life and wanted to learn to meditate, so I gave it a try. I‚Äôve done the ‚ÄúHow to Meditate in 30 days‚Äùlessons twice now, as well as many of the other daily guided meditations. Jeff Warren has changed my life with this meditation course! I now understand how seek equanimity and clarity so I can be responsive, not reactive, to life‚Äôs ups and downs. What a gift! I‚Äôm forever grateful for the peace these meditation skills have brought to my life. Jeff, you are a hero to me!
title: Positive use of technology

review:
I‚Äôve been using this app for many years now and it‚Äôs helped me so much. I listen to them almost every night and when I have anxiety and put one on  I just think of the story and not my anxiety and it helps because tell me..would you rather sit in darkness and be panicked and upset and worried and tense and AWAKE or would you rather sit there awake and listen to a story to keep you calm and entertained. And mostly I will fall asleep when I can and I just love this app and recommend for anyone with troubles for sleeping. Someone like me! 
Thank you calm üôèüèª‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
title: Best thing ever! ‚ù§Ô∏è

review:
I mainly joined calm for the Sleep Stories and I rely on them to help me fall asleep 4-5 nights a week.  I also enjoy the daily Calm meditations, other directed meditations and the new sleep music. I really enjoyed the chaptered sleep stories ie,  The Pacific Crest Trail.  Please more! 
Lately I‚Äôve been disappointed that there is not enough ‚Äúnew content‚Äù for adult sleep stories.  The new content appears to made for children, ie. fairy tales, cartoonish stories and Thomas the Train. Please more ‚ÄúNew‚Äù adult content with low toned male voices.  I suffer from tinnitus and high pitched women‚Äôs voices are the opposite of relaxing. Thanks Calm for getting me relaxed and asleep!
title: Calm lover for more than 3 years

review:
I use the kid sleep stories for my children every night and it helps them fall asleep nicely. If I wake and can‚Äôt get back to sleep a sleep nature sleep story helps my brain shut down and stop keeping me awake. Not all stories work but there‚Äôs enough variety to find what works. 

The meditations are guided and a nice way to recharge and there‚Äôs music options too. Mostly I use the sleep stories but it‚Äôs nice to know there are so many options so each person can use what they need to either calm their brain, get to sleep, or recharge.
title: Works like a charm

review: I just checked to see how many apps are on my phone right now and it‚Äôs 116. Of all 116, Calm is by far the most important one to me. It has been so impactful in my life, even before the pandemic. It‚Äôs not just hippie-dippy meditation mojo. It‚Äôs mindfulness, healing, laughing, dreaming, calming. Without even trying, I‚Äôve found myself in situations where I react differently simply because I‚Äôve done a few meditations through this app. And there‚Äôs SO much to choose from. So definitely start with Jeff‚Äôs 30 Days of How to Meditate. I‚Äôm not exaggerating when I say: it‚Äôs life-changing.
title: Only One

review:
I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve been wound up tight and said , ‚Äú I really need to meditate ‚Äú. I say this to myself because I Know it helps. Spending a few minutes , maybe even 15 or 20 minutes , has this effect: change in my thinking. All of a sudden , what seemed urgent and irritating , scary or anxiety causing, is not how I‚Äôm viewing it anymore . It‚Äôs not that the situation is gone , but my thinking is now different, and this thinking seems more balanced and rational . 
The Calm App makes attaining this Easy. 
Thank you many times
title: Calm really works

review:
I am paying for a subscription right now and I enjoy the app. My number one biggest problem is that Tamara Levitt narrates what feels like the majority of it and I feel bad saying this but I find her voice to be very irritating. So basically I avoid anything with her and she does *most* of the series :/ I hate myself for being this judgmental. Feels very unmindful but I just can‚Äôt help it.

Seems like a lot of reviewers are having the same issue. I will probably switch to Headspace when my year is up and see if I like that better 

I will say though I LOVE Jeff Warren‚Äôs content. I wouldn‚Äôt use the app every day if it wasn‚Äôt for his daily trip
title: Good but less content than hoped

review: As someone who wants an accessible and easy way to meditate, listen to white or background noise, or just listen to sleep stories, Calm would be a great solution. I have actually downloaded this app once before, but I deleted it because there were too many locked items, meditations, and stories. Other than this significant issue, Calm is still great for if you just want to listen to background noise. I wish there were more things i have access to without having to pay so much.
title: Too many locked items

review:
I‚Äôve been dealing and healing with PTSD and this app has helped me more than anyone can give it credit for. I personally pay for the premium plan because it‚Äôs worth it. When I feel the anxiety coming on I turn to this app for a quick fix. It takes time, but this has become my safe space. The sleep-time stories help more than I‚Äôd ever imagine. Definitely don‚Äôt knock something until you try it. Entirely grateful for the developers, you‚Äôre definitely part of my healing journey.  

Btw I‚Äôd love to read a story to one day!
title: The Staple App in my phone

review:
Well overall I think this app is very nice,simple,calming,and helpful! 
But there is a couple of suggestions that I would love to give you! 

1.You should let us comment on the sessions and let us rate them! I think it would be helpful to know if that session is right for you
and you can also communicate with other people.

2.Lower down the price‚Äôs please? It is very expensive and for someone like me who can barely afford my rent and then when I try to mediate because of my depression, self harm, and my anxiety.. please at least lower them down? I need help with my mental health and I cannot afford this! :(

3. Unlock some sessions? Well when I first downloaded this app I realized that almost EVERYTHING is locked! And I really can‚Äôt spend my money! This is very upsetting for me and others.. think about it? other people may be having it the same as me and really need help and this is their only choice.. and when they can‚Äôt get the mediation, results love, relief they need they maybe going down a very dangerous road!.. please.

Thank you for reading and god bless you! üíûüíû
title: I need help..

review:
This is a great app that until recently our family enjoyed every night. Recently the app will not launch on my daughters iPhone 5s and crashes EVERY TIME. All software updates have been made to the phone and the app but the app always gets stuck on the load screen asking me to ‚Äútake a deep breath‚Äù‚Ä¶before crashing. There are only so many ‚Äúdeep breaths‚Äù a person can take.

Please tell me this is a momentary bug that will be resolved in a forthcoming update. Otherwise please update your app description to reflect the iPhones that are no longer supported.
title: Great app - that stopped working!!!

review: I know this is a long review, but I think it will be worth it!! The app itself is free, but almost all of the stuff is not. You have to pay for a premium thing that will unlock the other stuff. Meditation is partly free but I don‚Äôt use that part so it‚Äôs not helpful to me. I think I would even say that the only free stuff is the background noise, which I quite like, and the breathing exercises. I know a lot of people are saying it‚Äôs worth it, but frankly, some people just can‚Äôt afford it. I believe it is a great app that really could help, that why I gave it at least 3 stars, but the not-free part is not working for meüò¨ so sorry! title: NOT free!

review:
I find Calm to be a extremely awesome program that has so many different choices for a diverse group of people. It has helped me so much in my sleep problems after a massive stroke  suffered a year and half ago. I strongly recommend this to anyone e.g., kids and others who likes sweet, gentle stories, music that is softhearted and can assist anyone wanting to be more grounded. It has a plethora of choices from adult to kid stories including ‚Äúthe little mermaid‚Äù and even a wonderful
Story told by Matthew McConaughey. I am so excited about using the Calm app and hope others feel the same way. Thank you for your APP.
title: Calm review

review: This app is so great. Not only does it offer all the meditative options, but also sleep stories! The stories are great to help me drift off to sleep because they give me something to think about other than worrisome things. I like the nonfiction ones-I learn a few new things! Even in the middle of the night, the sleep stories help me fall back asleep. I‚Äôm giving the app only 4/5 stars because there should be an option to play multiple stories back to back without waking up to turn on another one, like a sleep stories playlist. It‚Äôs the only flaw I‚Äôve found. Add that option, developers, and I‚Äôm giving the app five stars.
title: Insomnia helper!

review: I‚Äôve struggled with sleep since high school‚ÄîI‚Äôve always had racing thoughts and anxiety as I try to fall asleep. It can take hours, and when I wake up in the middle of the night, falling back asleep feels impossible. Calm totally changed that. I put on a sleep story and I‚Äôm out like a light; these days, I‚Äôm asleep within 5-10 minutes max. If I wake up in the middle of the night, I pop a story on and I fall right back asleep. I‚Äôve also used the download feature to help with falling asleep when traveling internationally, which is a flying and jet lag game-changer. Can‚Äôt recommend enough.
title: Life Changing

review:
I‚Äôm gonna start off by saying this is a really great app. And don‚Äôt get me wrong absolutely love it. But it does have some issues. 
        I love this app a lot. And yeah, I will admit, I don‚Äôt use this app as much as I would like to because of how expensive the premium version is. Only a couple are free but the rest you have to pay for it on Premium. But the Premium isn‚Äôt just $20. We‚Äôre talking like at least $70 per year. I know it isn‚Äôt that much but still, $70? And I know that‚Äôs ho should make money, I get that. If it wasn‚Äôt so expensive I would definitely pay for the Premium because I wanna be able to use this app way more than I do now. I get stressed out a lot and always have difficulty sleeping at night and am not able to go to sleep right away (even when I‚Äôm exhausted) like everyone else in my family. 
     Note to Editor: 
Please try to lower the price. I would really love this app if it wasn‚Äôt as expensive. Otherwise you have done a really great job with this app. It‚Äôs great 
Thank you
May the relaxation be with you üôÇüßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüôÇüßò‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüëçüèº
title: It has some issues but is good üòïüòê

review: Has a lot of good relaxing sources all at your fingertips instead of searching them out yourself. Wouldn't reccomend unless you've got cash to burn. But the kinds of sources it offers are genuinely helpful. Turned me on to Brown noise and, as a chronic insomniac, that's been LITERALLY lifechanging. I can finally like actually sleep. It's really the only reason I'm writing this review. Yeah, give this app a try. It's at least worth the download. I only wish there was a monthly subscription option vs a yearly one, bc oof I can't afford that kind of chunk out of my paycheck.
title: Nice if pricey

review: I thought this was a free app and that it would have a good amount of options for free users, but they don‚Äôt. If you have the money to get all of the purchased contact which is about 3/4 of the app then I think you‚Äôre good. I wouldn‚Äôt know the extent to the purchased material and it was good or not, since I couldn‚Äôt afford it. However, if you‚Äôre a poor college student (or any other individual) who can‚Äôt or won‚Äôt pay, I would say get another app. Insight timer has LOADS of free content and I recommend that. The app itself is very pretty and eye appealing but that‚Äôs not going to help me with my anxiety when at least half the meditations are blocked until you pay. They really should advertise that more honestly.
title: If you have the money then get it. If not, don‚Äôt

review:
I‚Äôm not even close to utilizing all that Calm has to offer but it was definitely worth it to subscribe, and then subscribing for life. 

One suggestion: it would be really helpful to see the YEAR on the date stamp on the different check-ins. I like to look over my successes/progress/regression and not knowing the year just makes the entries not useful. I mean I can‚Äôt go back to that date in my journal to see what was going on, or to my calendar, or‚Ä¶ you get the idea. Thanks a lot if you do update the app.
title: Wonderful, I bought a lifetime membership!

review: Amazing app with good content - BUT each section is poorly catalogued. Within each category of content, things are not organized in an approachable manner. Content in each section seems to be listed by release date, NOT length, subject matter, or course. I wish for example, when looking through the ‚ÄúAnxiety‚Äù category under ‚ÄúMeditations‚Äù, I did not have to scroll through two dozen 2-3 minute long random items, before finding the more popular offerings. Doesn‚Äôt seem like a customer-focused way of presenting items, rather just a hap-hazard jumble of whatever their system happens to push into each category.
title: Poorly cataloged

review: I need help sleeping and this just didnt help. Everything costs money and you have to pay just to fricking SLEEP. If it was free my review would be five stars but it costs soooooooo much money! Its stupid and I found something better. It truly stupid how you need to pay TO EXERCISE RELAX OR SLEEP!!!!!!! Some people actually need help to sleep or are so stressed and need something calming and this looks professional so you download it and then see YOU CANT DO ANYTHING CAUSE YOU NEED TO PAY!!!! Conclusion dont make people pay to sleep or relax or you get reviews like these! Have a horrible day calm team!‚ò∫Ô∏è also have a great day to all the people who read this farüòù
title: Horrible

review:
I was on the fence about purchasing this app due to the high price, and the fact that you can obviously get anything on this app, on You Tube or on internet.

The attractive intro rate was enough for me to give it a whirl.

I‚Äôm thoroughly enjoying this app. I‚Äôve not dug in enough to set a meditation schedule, or to use this in the evening to wind down, however, I‚Äôm loving that everything one would need to relax, is at your fingertips.

I‚Äôve listened to the SoundScapes endlessly. They are so beautiful and very decompressing. I use this feature to wind down after work when I‚Äôm alone; feeding the dog, setting meal prep, etc.

Loving the Acoustic Guitar tab as well. Very inspiring if you‚Äôre a guitarist.

Over all, I highly recommend this app.
üåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

title: Enjoying Immensely üòå

review:
Calm is awesome. As someone who has tried every drug on the planet to fall asleep (and usually without success), who would have thought that the quiets and most reliable way to fall asleep was a sleep story. I‚Äôve been using Calm for 2 years now and will likely be a subscriber until the day I die. 

Guided meditations are also great. I really like the Daily Calm. It means that every day there is something new to listen to and each day I learn new things thanks to the theme of the Daily Calm that day. I‚Äôm continually impressed.
title: I rely on this app far more than I ever expected

review:
I suffer from insomnia... This app is great for so many reasons. At first, I only listened to the 'rain' which is automatically on when you open the app. But then I started listening to the music on here for bedtime and I was in love. I'm super excited to listen to the other topics. I've fav'ed a few, including the new solo guitar track. 
Joined when Amex gave me one complimentary year, wanted to try it for multiple reasons and I was intrigued... Never heard of it before. So happy with this app that I think I might just pay for the annual subscriptionüò≥ lol who knew?! Thank you for this app! Was truly neededüíØ
title: Needed it

review:
So I usually don‚Äôt write reviews. Like at all, but I really believe in this app and use it on a daily basis whenever I‚Äôm having trouble sleeping, studying, or just need some background noise. 

I‚Äôve used this product for over a year and it‚Äôs completely worth every penny. They have a plethora of options, from stories, to popular people guest speaking. They have kid stories as well. And it‚Äôs really all about being ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù and relaxing. 

Which in a time like this relaxing and finding our peaceful place is what we need. Support this app it deserves it.
title: It‚Äôs been a great experience and I can‚Äôt complain.

review: I really love the app, the design is perfect  and everything is nicely organized. Also the  content is very useful, you can find all kinds of meditation sessions. However now it seems too expensive, so I'm canceling my subscription. I would like to propose to have a bigger range of subscribtions with different prices where some people can get only what they use or have limited time usage, for example I use only the meditations and no additional things like sleep stories etc. I hope that we could receive some cheaper options as currently even if the app is the best many people will look for alternatives.
title: Best meditation app

review:
I‚Äôm a student and this really helps me, I did it in my classroom once! I wanted to get the app so I could do the same at home, but soon I realized that there is only a little I can do and that COULD get unamusing afterwards..! And my parents would never allow me to get premium and pay about $70 at the end of the year. What would happened if people needed this app but wasn‚Äôt allowed to buy premium. Do you really care about others or are you just doing it for the money!?!?

Basically all I‚Äôm asking is for you to make more stuff available for people who don‚Äôt have premium
title: Best app but..

review:
I love this app! It has so many options and types of meditations. Depending on how I feel or the amount of time I have at the moment I can choose my meditation time. Although many of the guided meditations or 10 min which I can always make time for and they are so effective. 

I listen to the classes while I am cleaning. 

I suffer from insomnia so what I use the most are the bedtime stories and go back to sleep meditations. I love them. They are very effective at keeping my mind at bay and soothing me back to sleep.

I love that I can download anything on the app to listen to offline while I am in a flight and traveling.

When I use this app consistently and meditate everyday I feel a huge shift in my mental state and overall wellbeing. In this app you can also easily track which days you have been using it.

Next to IG this is my most used app and also money spent wisely.
Thank you Calm app for making it so much easier to meditate and be consistent.
title: So versatile and easy

review:
I have a major sleep disorder which is so bad, I am currently on disability. This app has totally turned me around! It not only offers up meditation and breathing sessions which I can use, but most importantly, there are id 
Abedtime stories! Offering a wide variety of topics, voices range from beautiful feminine pitches to comforting male tones. You can choose whispering voices as well. It is so nice to have my own vocal channels to choose from, whatever I need. New stories are added up occasionally to add to the mix. So...I highly recommend this app for anyone who needs help sleeping or just plain relaxing.
title: I Cannot Sleep Without It

review:
I am a small business owner that works with an overwhelming amount of clients each day for very long hours. I have found it extremely difficult to fall asleep at night or even nap during the day because of the inability to turn my brain off from work overload. I‚Äôve struggled to fall asleep quickly and deeply for 10 years. This app changed all of that!

The Calm app is some sort of magical trickery, the bedtime stories are hypnotic and soothing and work so well that I‚Äôve never even been able to get 1/4 of the way into one before completely Passing out. The narrators featured are so comforting in the delivery of each story. 

My 8 year old son has the same reaction to the children‚Äôs stories, he falls asleep instantly.

I‚Äôm so thankful for all the other features this app has that help with my anxiety during the day as well.

Download it and you won‚Äôt regret it! Plus, who doesn‚Äôt want to fall asleep to Matthew McConaughey whispering in your ear?
title: Changed my life!

review:
I have been using this app for two years now and love it. I look forward to doing my daily meditation and love that I can add anxiety and body scans when needed. I have spinal stenosis and on the bad days I do a longer body scan and it helps so much. 

The only problem I have with this app is that when I use on my iPhone it will shut down on start up and it takes three tries to open and get started. I downloaded the latest update and it did not fix the problem. I also cannot get the scenes to open on a horizontal screen. It works perfectly on my iPad.
title: Love this app

review: I really love this app it truly works with my inner self. Every session makes me want another session and there are so many to choose from. However, I did rate the app 4stars because I wish it allows you to make small monthly payments instead of 1 yearly payment. I won‚Äôt be keeping the app after my trial because of the large expected payment. If you have the funds right now I recommend using and keeping the app after your trial. If not I recommend you waiting until you can afford the $70 to start your trial because it is an awesome app and you will want to buy it. Don‚Äôt tease yourself like I have because the app is amazing.
