You can see our full list of free content here: https://support.calm.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008536834-What-is-included-in-the-free-version-of-the-app-What-is-included-in-Calm-Premium-. Reach out to support@calm.com with any questions!', 'modified': '2019-05-29T21:29:03Z'}
review: One would think since there appears to be two versions of Calm, one being Calm Premium, that this one is the free version, especially since it doesn‚Äôt ask for payment upon installing the app. However, as you go thru setup answering a handful of questions about what brought you to Calm and if you‚Äôre interested in and have tried meditation it then asks you for payment info informing you that it‚Äôs a free 7 day trial only before then charging you $70 for a year long subscription, which is the Calm Premium. Bait and switch is what I‚Äôd call this. Disappointing as I thought the app looked lovely and interesting after catching a commercial advertising for it on tv tonight. However, I‚Äôm not about to pay $70 for a subscription for an app when there are plenty of similar free apps and free resources.
title: Bait and Switch-Not Free

review:
I love the way this app runs on my phone. I love that I can have the audio run in the background of other things, and that that's a *choice* rather than a default. I love that I can add in manual sessions to the tracker. I love that there is internal storage control.

The scenes and background music are wonderful and impressively varied, and the guided meditations are very easy to use and easy to follow.

However, while $60/year is not unreasonable (breaking it down to $5/month, that seems very affordable!), I would vastly prefer the ability to pay month by month, and to buy individual meditations for access without a subscription. I don't have $60 up front for this, but I could probably find $5 at a time, and I would be willing to put a couple extra dollars toward particularly helpful ones or ones I wanted to check out when I can't afford a subscription.

So overall, fantastic, and I'm recommending it to everyone I know, but I wish the pricing were more accessible.
title: A++ content and functionality, B- on the pricing

review: I have long been told that mindfulness would help my anxiety and ADHD (51 year old adult here), but every time I tried over the years it was so boring and simply maddening to just sit and try not to be distracted. Calm isn‚Äôt like that at all! I do the walking meditations and the moving meditations, I listen as I lay in bed at night and I‚Äôm doing it often enough I can listen to the meditations while I do other activities such as drive and just focus on listening and breathing. It‚Äôs a game changer and I‚Äôm learning to let go of my anxiety and panic. Thank you!
title: ADHD and anxiety tools

review: I was skeptical at first, I thought this was just another app that was going to bombard me with advertisements. I‚Äôm glad I was wrong, its been a great addition to my self-care routine. I enjoy the daily check-ins, a wide range of meditations, sound scapes and I can add the things I like to my favorites. No cap, I use this every day, some days multiple times a day. I recommend this to anyone and everyone.. I absolutely love this app and could not see my days without it. Thank you so much to whoever created this, its been a life changer for me.
title: Improved my life

review: This app has helped me center and ground myself. I listen to the daily calm every morning and I am always so inspired by each lesson I learn following a meditation. It‚Äôs a wonderful way to start my day and has become a lifestyle routine. People may say ‚Äú$70 is a lot for a meditation app‚Äù. I respond by saying that some people spend that money on a one time restaurant meal. Why not invest the money on something that you get for a whole year to improve your emotional - mental health? It is everything to our vitality, independence, and quality of life. I love this app!
title: Transformational

review:
I wanted to stay with Calm a lot longer than I actually did, but for me it had a fatal flaw that ultimately caused me to stop using it: The Daily Calm meditations don‚Äôt have enough guidance.

What I mean by this is that the gaps between spoken guidance are too long, giving too many opportunities for my thoughts to focus on something else, ruining the experience.  This can be blamed directly on Tamara Levitt ‚Äî yep, naming names ‚Äî who apparently assumes that you have the basics of letting your thoughts go down pat before you listen to her insights.  

Unfortunately Tamara, I have news for you: Some of us need spoken guidance because we‚Äôre incapable of meditating on our own, and your work leaves a lot to be desired.

It‚Äôs too bad, because I found some of the sleep stories actually useful, which would have been a bonanza for people like me who often have nightmares.  But the fact that the Daily Calms are TOO quiet and don‚Äôt have enough guidance meant I was getting nothing out of them, and I had to walk away after that.
title: Does its job well, but‚Ä¶

review:
Overall, I have loved the Calm app for almost 2 years.  I use it for my meditation, for my yoga, and during my stretching activities. 

But there is a rogue bug that that has apparently been in the system for a while according to my Google searches! Most recently, the bug started impacting my experience from my iOS device randomly. When the app is "not on", the soundscapes will activate randomly at various times in the day. In order for me to turn it off, I am forced to open the app and close the app. 

I have found it at times extremely startling and at other times it has come on while I am in the middle of a conference meeting. The first time was comical, but now it just seems unruly, and frustrating especially during my business day where my phone accompanies me into meetings. 

I have owned this app for almost 2 years and may not renew in the coming year unless this bug is fixed. This is the reason I am giving the app a two star rating because without this stressful frustrating bug, I would rate it a five star app.
title: Great app except for random bug!!!

review: After drinking way too much coffee all day, my body was tired but my mind was alive. I tossed and turned for hours. When I noticed the sun rising and the birds beginning to chirp, I had reached full desperation. I recalled a friend raving about Harry Styles‚Äô stories on Calm, so I downloaded it and chose the first free sleep story. Fully expecting to still be awake after the story was done, the next thing I knew I was waking up to the sound of an alarm! It works! I should have used this hours before I reached full desperation, and I‚Äôll probably pay for the premium version.
title: I should have used this way earlier!

review: The app feels so unorganized. The types of meditation on the main page are all over the place: ‚Äúquick and easy‚Äù , ‚Äúrecent daily trips?‚Äù , ‚Äúeating stress‚Äù ‚Ä¶.oh and then random celebrities telling me a story mixed in (I personally DGAF what Matthew McConaughey or Shaun Mendes have to say, but I can see how that would he a nice touch for others) Then if you click into any of those, there are random durations (10 min, 7 days) and/or random people providing the meditations (a professional, an influencer‚Ä¶). I guess I‚Äôm looking for structure and consistency of some sort, even if just a pattern so I know where to look in the app once I find something that works. I‚Äôm coming here for help with help for anxiety afterall, just didn‚Äôt find it here. This was a disappointment given the price, back to headspace for me.
title: ü•¥

review:
The sleep story I tried was effective for helping me fall asleep, however these are only about 30 minutes long.  I woke up several times during the night and restarted the story, which worked, but if the story was longer, or if it could have been configured to repeat, it would be much less disruptive and possibly I may not have actually had to fully wake up.  

Another missing option is to have one of the ambient tracks, or anything, play automatically after the story.

The interface is not good for sleepers.  Controls should be large, obvious and omnipresent.  Mucking around with controls is disruptive for sleep and for those of us who do not sleep with our glasses on, (read everybody) very frustrating.

The subscription model for this is very expensive.  The idea that new stories and content is an important aspect for sleep is flawed.  Good content does not need to be replaced as familiarity only helps with falling asleep.

For now I am going back to using boring Audible audiobooks played at .6 or .7 speed.   These play all night and never need to be touched once started.
title: Limited functionality for sleep

review: Hello but just wanted to say that there was a bug in this app every time I open it it just keeps crashing and crashing and crashing and crashing and I‚Äôve deleted this app a few months ago and that seemed to fix the problem for a little bit then it would just crash for a little bit and then it started having the same problems that it did before I deleted the app a few months ago and I always have to restart my device sometimes the app still crashes then it opens but this app always crashes a lot but other than that I‚Äôll love this app
title: There is a bug in this app

review: I have always had trouble falling asleep. I am not the type of person who can just lay in bed and fall asleep within 5 minutes. I am the type that will lay in bed, read my emails, check my finance apps, check social media, browse netflix, browse something else and then do it all over again until I get sleepy and finally fall asleep after 2 hours of laying in bed. BUT...since I subscribed to calm, I put on my headphones and listen to a session of sleep (which are usually 8-20 mins) and I am asleep before the session even ends! I love it!!
title: Great app for those who have trouble falling asleep

review: I‚Äôve tried different meditation techniques over the years and have had moderate success. This one stands out as the best and even after only a few sessions I have found a great deal of peace. I love the simplicity of this approach. It makes sense to me. It has been so helpful to calm my mind. As a parent of teens and a high school teacher, life has brought me to my knees. This app is helping me cope with the madness that is my life. I eagerly look forward to the sessions. Anxiety is a constant in my everyday experience, but I have a lot of help in managing it with these techniques. It is worth every cent.
title: Simplicity and worth the money

review: I enjoy the app , it‚Äôs amazing definitely help with my anxiety, and meditation. I have referred this app to my husband and friends . However , while using the app on my phone (iPhone XR) , it works perfectly while my screen is lite, and hasn‚Äôt locked. But once my phone screen goes off ( kinda goes to sleep/lock screen) the calm app shuts off and I have to stop relaxing unlock my phone and then the app resume playing . It‚Äôs distracting and a downside . Maybe I don‚Äôt know how to adjust this or what but could someone check into this and fix it or tell me how ????? Thanks !
title: Great App!!! However.....

review: This app is amazing. I‚Äôve had it for about six months and it calms me so much. I love the stories so much that the tone makes me go right to sleep. I don‚Äôt even finish it 80% of the time!! The narrators do great and talk in this soft tone that soothes your anxiety even more. The meditations make you concentrate on your body and let every bad thought slip away. There are no adds (i think) but it does glitch some. So plz fix that. I would definitely recommend this app to anyone who struggles to sleep or has hard work days or lots of homework, etc. TRUST ME you will not regret your choice.
title: I love this. Ty to the creator

review: Calm is wonderful because it focuses on helping you create a new relationship to yourself and to your emotions. It emphasizes recognizing your experience without placing judgment on it, offering me, a self-critical person, a wonderful opportunity to practice self-care. It is particularly good for anyone dealing with an anxiety disorder (although of course talk with your therapist to make sure it fits right for your particular needs) because rather than focus on helping you eliminate anxiety (a thought process that never works) it focuses on helping you create a new relationship to anxiety (which somehow works!). I love this app
title: Great Meditative App

review: This is a wonderful app. I have PTSD, major depressive disorder, and panic disorder. This is the first app that has actually calmed me down and uses some of the same coping and meditation skills that I have learn at some the the top trauma hospitals in the USA. The only bone I have to pick is that the 40% discount coupon they sent me in my email won‚Äôt let me use it. It just send me to the calm app not the place where you pay. It does not however do this on my mom phone so it could just be my phone. I don‚Äôt know but I highly recommend this app to anyone who suffers from trauma or anxiety.
title: Won‚Äôt let me use my coupon

review: In the past year, I have had to deal with many serious, stressful, and sad situations. I never knew from day to day what would come my way. The one thing I knew I could count on, was my CALM app. I began each morning with meditation and the Daily Calm. It brought instant peace and confidence. During the day, if things became overwhelming, I would listen to one of the many excellent meditations on anxiety or stress. My walks would include listening to the excellent Master classes. I have listened Daily now for over a year, and it has had a huge impact on my life. To Tamara and everyone at CALM, thank you!
title: Daily CALM Is a Daily Help

review:
I signed up for Calm about 4 months ago with a free trial positive that I would cancel at the end.  2 nights into using it I knew this app was worth every cent!

Calm has helped me (as someone working in the social work field) fall asleep when my mind is racing.  When my kids are having a hard time calming down we use it to stop and breathe.  I have used this app nearly every day since I downloaded it and have been so impressed by the new content being added (helloooooo Matthew McConaughey)! 

The kids beg for a sleep story every night and I cherish the cuddles while we listen ‚ô•Ô∏è
title: Hesitantly optimistic

review: Calm is a perfect way to relax, morning, afternoon, or night. With amazing stories, music, meditations, this amazing app will sure cure the beating migraines we all get. One really cool thing about Calm is that it keeps track of everything, for example, it would tell you how many days in a row you used Calm or how many hours in total you listen to stories, music, or meditation. You can even download so if you are on the go and don‚Äôt have WiFi, no worries, Calm has your back. They only gave me 5 stars to fill out, but if there were more, I would fill them all out. Out of 5 stars, I rate Calm 999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999,999/ 5
title: Keep CALM and get CALM

review: I love calm so much I can‚Äôt even describe it. I went out on my friend‚Äôs deck, faced towards the ocean, and I was more relaxed than ever it really helps with my anxiety and everything, no other app even comes close to comparing to this. There is so much you can do, and it gives me a second to stop what I‚Äôm doing on my phone, and take a breath. It ends up being so much fun!!! I thought meditation was boring, until I tried this. The voices are so calming, and they have sleep stories, and songs, and so many different meditation choices. I rarely ever write reviews, but I immediately loved this app! Thanks Calm!
title: Calm is the best!!!

developerResponse: {'id': 6506458, 'body': 'Hi there! We do our best to keep a useful set of content free for users who are unable to subscribe, but ultimately, our subscription prices allow us to continue growing the content (in terms of quantity and quality). Feel free to send any questions or feedback to support@calm.com.', 'modified': '2018-12-21T23:47:33Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve been hearing about this app for MONTHS through ads. I struggle with sleeping at night and also anxiety and depression. So finally, i decided to download the app and I can only listen to ONE story???? And the man had a creepy voice. How am i supposed to play around with the app and see if it‚Äôs right for me when everything is locked and it‚Äôs basically FORCING you to spend an enormous amount of money. Yeah i could use the 7 day free trial, but I‚Äôve had bad luck with apps charging me as soon as i accept the free trial. 

 I‚Äôve never done a review but this made me mad enough to write one because I‚Äôve been so curious about the app and was so excited when i downloaded it only to be disappointed. I‚Äôm sorry but $70 for an app is ridiculous. I can‚Äôt believe people actually pay that much. Thanks for nothing!!
title: Are you kidding me?!

review: I have an autistic son who has a hard time settling his emotions. I showed him this app and now when he is having a meltdown he asks to use the app to help sooth him. The sleep stories have helped him calm in the evening before bed as well as the calming visuals and sounds. He likes to follow the breath circle as well. Because he is a visual person he really responds to the visual representation for the breath. He is only 6 years old and has learned some valuable mindfulness tools from this app. I recommend it to everyone. Thank you for developing this app it truest has been a lifesaver so many times.
title: My son asks for it by name

review:
i have been using the calm app for years now thanks to a generous gift from our daughters place of employment during the pandemic. when that ran out i invested in it just because i deserve and depend on it. recently my employer offered it (Southwest Airlines considers mental health important!). i already had a subscription so i couldn‚Äôt use that gift but was able to share it 
i have only scratched the surface of all there is on the app, i don‚Äôt have THAT much time, but it is in my top three of daily am habits.
title: such an important way to start the day

review: I love using the app, and use it everyday.  I had sent in a request to cancel my subscription once it expired and they replied and cancelled it.  I then changed my mind, and I have sent so many messages to their support group and not one of my messages has been answered. They have everything on their website except a link to renew your subscription.  The chat option is useless because it is not a chat just a place to leave a message but no one answers those messages.
title: Disappointed with support

review: I don‚Äôt know what I would do without Calm. I‚Äôve had a paid subscription since it 1st came out. I use the daily meditations and sleep stories every day. I‚Äôve learned with Master Classes and the many ‚Äòhow to meditate‚Äô series. One of the best things is that the meditation teachings are from various people and I have benefited from this. I have my favorites too- my own gurus. I‚Äôm now exploring the huge collection music. TY Calm. I show up differently in the world with more peace and ease. The vast and varied content of the app has been a big part of my journey.
title: Essential

review: I‚Äôve enjoyed the Calm App. I always fall asleep before the story gets to the 1/2 way point and I barely remember what the story was even about. I‚Äôve listened to one story 4 times so I could hear it in it‚Äôs entirety. One small complaint, on occasion the app seems to glitch, rendering it useless. A story or music will appear to be playing, while there is total silence. I‚Äôve had to do a hard reboot of my phone to get it to play. Not sure why this has happened, nor do I know who to contact about this annoying problem.
title: Wonderful Sleep Aid

review:
I have meditated before, but not for quite some time. For the past month or so, I found myself getting only 5 hours of very intermittent sleep, and it‚Äôs exhausting. This despite listening to ‚Äúsleep soundtracks‚Äù on my iPhone. 

Well, last night, I downloaded the Calm app, did the 30 minute Deep Sleep Relax meditation, and set a sleep playlist for 8 hours. I slept the whole night through, no waking up, for the first time in over a month. 

I am going to continue to use this app to meditate daily.
title: First full night‚Äôs sleep in a long time

review: What I love most about Calm, is it is only 10 minutes a day, if you choose, or you can select up an hour meditation. It is guided and you choose the way you meditate, whether lying down, in a nice bubble bath, or sitting in a comfortable spot. Doesn‚Äôt matter how you do it, just as long as you find 10 minutes a day. There are a variety of sleep stories and now the new Daily Trips 10 minute meditation is great because it gives guidance on daily mind situations we encounter and how to be mindful of those moments. Definitely will be a customer for life with Calm.
title: Great for All levels

review: When I  got this app I was expecting it to be free like the commercials on TV said and like the description said however they did not tell you that if you wanted all the meditation stuff anxiety  relief and depression relief  that that you would have to pay $70 a month for it and I was not happy with that so you could really only do the mood check in as many times a day however the only other thing you could get was the background noises and the mood check in not anything else and sometimes in the daily calm thing with Tamara Levitt. That isn‚Äôt always free. If you have kids and they go to sleep with lullabies and stories, you have to pay for those too. I am not very happy with this app.
title: NOT FREE

review: I would use the Calm app from time to time before I had the full access. I always liked it but didn‚Äôt want to spend money on another yearly subscription. Thanks to my Amex card, I was recently able to get a 1 year subscription, courtesy of my credit card company. Probably the best perk of the card so far. Now, I use this app multiple times a week. Sometimes to meditate and 4-5 times a week I use it to help me fall asleep. The nature sound, the stories and the meditation guides are all incredible. I really get so much from this app.
title: 1 year subscription free thanks to Amex Platinum

review: I like how it gives you an option to have unlocked items even if you don‚Äôt have subscription but I think it would be better if more then one thing per section was unlocked. I am not saying take the subscription away just I have found only one sleepcast that is unlocked and when you are testing it out without the seven day trial you need to be able to listen to more than ‚Äúmoshi and the slumber tree‚Äù. Other than that very good app for restless people and when you need to just relax. Also I like how there is options for kids.
title: Very great app but...

review: I‚Äôve had the calm app, with the subscription for over a year.  I use the meditations and have found that I‚Äôm getting better at doing them.  I have also found that I really do feel better during my day.  I also really like the sleep stories and use them frequently, especially when I travel to help me settle into a good night sleep.  If you are thinking about getting the app, it is worth trying.  I have never been sorry that I have it and even if I go through periods where I use it less, knowing it‚Äôs there when I need it, is helpful.
title: Works for me

review: I‚Äôve been using calm for over a year now. Downloaded the app when everything was free and now since it‚Äôs grown in popularity mostly all sounds and stories that were once free are now all locked even just a couple days ago there was one water sound that was still unlocked and now it‚Äôs locked. I‚Äôve been with them for a long time and shouldn‚Äôt be forced to pay I feel and if on my account you see things were unlocked and saved why go and lock them to try to make me pay. That doesn‚Äôt make me want to pay for premium it makes me want to not use this once great app anymore because they no longer have things for free. I‚Äôm saddened honestly.
title: Unfair change!

review:
I have always had a lot of trouble sleeping and a lot of stress problems. I downloaded this app mainly to be able to listen to soundscapes and music and learn to meditate, only to find that the meditation sessions and music and stories almost all require a subscription. I understand that you need to make money, but seriously! I‚Äôm still a minor with not enough money to spend on a 70 dollar subscription to an app! Not to mention that people who actually might need   something like this for a mental illness. If you‚Äôre going to create an app to help people, you should try to help everyone, not just the people who can afford it.

(You could charge less, or ask for donations and not charge at all, or you could make a free account less limited!)

I would give this 0 stars if I could
title: Gee, thanks for, UM, NOTHING!

review:
I‚Äôve used Calm since the first year they came out.  I could not be without this app.  I use several times each day.  I wake up to meditate to awesome guidance, I listen to soothing music when I‚Äôm stressed, I go to sleep listening to wonderful sleep stories.
    It‚Äôs been like going to Disneyland when I discover new things they‚Äôve added.  It gets better and better!
Note to Calm:  Please keep your original people at the same rate, because I know it‚Äôs going to go up.
Can‚Äôt say enough, I even played Cam music for my daughter when she was in labor.
Calm:  Thank you!!
title: You‚Äôve got to get this!

developerResponse: {'id': 10135583, 'body': 'Hi there, it sounds like you need to re-download your scenes (this happens when you reinstall the app). You can do this by going to More -> Scenes. Reach out to support@calm.com with any questions!', 'modified': '2019-08-12T23:43:51Z'}
review:
UPDATED:  previously I had rated this app with one star (and prematurely posted a negative comment) because when I got a new phone I thought the new version had taken away all of the scenes that I had.( I had the free version) However, it turned out to be operator error as I didn‚Äôt realize I had to go back into the app to re-download the scenes again as customer service informed me.

My review of app: I have the free version and I really love the scenes and the music. I‚Äôve used it many times to help me get to sleep or to just simply relax and meditate.
Great app!
title: Updated- my mistake- app was fine

review:
First of all I adore this app and use it every night.  This is the first time in my life I have been able to sleep without medication which is very impressive.

I do most of the sleep stories every night and they are very effective but some nights I could definitely use a longer story. Also a lot of the stories jump straight in where as I could use a brief meditation to get myself physically comfortable. ‚ÄúClose your eyes and settle in‚Äù isn‚Äôt quite long enough for me. One of the options I see would be to stack the stories with a guided meditation preprogrammed to follow with a sleep story.
title: Fantastic app. A few things I would do differently

review: I have experienced panic attacks for 10 years. I will admit I balked at the price but it is well worth it. There are several excellent meditations for when you have a panic attack. I like that they range from a 3 minute emergency calm to a 30 minute session. I have worked through several of the meditation series & each one is excellent‚Äîa great combination of guided breathing with education. The master classes I have done were very informative. I definitely feel listening to a meditation daily has helped me reduce my overall level of anxiety. Outstanding App
title: Best App I have found for dealing with anxiety & panic

review: This app has really helped me with my depression and anxiety. I‚Äôm finally at a point where I can recognize when my emotions are heightened (good or bad) and Calm really helps me to center and focus my feelings. I am a high school dance teacher and my students love this app! They ask to mediate all the time, especially before exams. I recommended it to all of them. It also helps my husband. He is in high stress situations and sometimes can‚Äôt sleep at night. When I feel him tossing and turning I know to put the app on. Within about 10-15 minutes he is calm and falling asleep. I am thankful for this app!
title: Game Changer

developerResponse: {'id': 4396893, 'body': "Hi juan carlos araujo, I'm so sorry for the unintended purchase. Reach out to support@calm.com and we can assist you in getting it canceled!", 'modified': '2018-07-25T19:15:49Z'}
review: I got the trial version and when due without asking or telling me I was billed us$60 for a full the most expensive 1 year subscription. There is nowhere to complain or to ask cancellation, including the App store. Once you agree to get charged you are in for life, no way out. I write this after 1 month if being forced to be subscribed to this scam. Have receive several emails apologizing but still have no refund on an App I did not wanted and was deducted by Apple without alerting me. Make yourself a favor avid this app which locks you forever with them
title: Watch out this is a scam!!!

review: I love Calm! Have been using for years. The iPhone app works great. But the Apple Watch app seems basically useless. When you try to start a daily calm for that day, after you select start it just keeps spinning. I‚Äôve had two iPhones and two watches I‚Äôve tried this on with the same result. And even if it worked, it doesn‚Äôt look like you can select any of the sleep stories or music. Just play the daily calm and that‚Äôs it. Would be nice to have full access to play the other functions especially lying in bed at night I could easily change on my phone. Guess I gotta get the app working first.
title: Love App but watch doesn‚Äôt work

review:
I don‚Äôt ‚Äúmeditate;‚Äù I spend enough time in my head as it is. But for anyone who wants a few moments to ‚Äúcheckout‚Äù of the chaos and ‚Äúcheck in‚Äù with themselves, this is an easy path to take. It helped me process my grief after my father died, and the sleep stories have become part of my bedtime ritual after a major depressive episode.

However, this is NOT a substitute for proper medical care or a support network of family, friends and colleagues. As a healthcare provider, I am well aware of the core pillars of wellness. But this is a tool to add to the box.
title: A Gateway to Calm

review:
I started using Calm 3 years ago during one of the lowest points in my life. What a difference it has made for me!
The sleep stories are amazingly beautiful and effective, the guided meditations perfect for beginners or seasoned meditators and the inspirational bits just what I need when I‚Äôm feeling down. 
My favorite is the Daily Trip with Jeff. Love all his series, especially the beginner ones. He literally teaches the fundamentals of meditation in such an easy and unpretentious way. 
I am very grateful to all the creators and contributors behind this app.
title: First and best thing for my mental health

review:
I look forward to a daily session with Jeff, Tamara, Jay, or Mel. So far so good...

But Calm has added a "feature" that bugs me to no end: there's now a giant widget on the app's main screen to shove in your face some numbers and checkmarks to communicate your adherence/streak (# of times you had a session on the week). And more of the same nonsense when you finish a session. Uh... thanks??

It feels like you're assigning me homework. This clumsy attempt at gamification only serves to raise my anxiety, not lower it. There's a "Show Streaks" option in the app Settings, but turning it off has no effect on this dopey intrusion. It just seems so ill-advised and out-of-sorts with the whole tranquility vibe. I come to Calm because I could use some help chilling-the-eff-out, not to be spurred on to "Close your rings! C'mon lazy guy! DO IT!".

I Calmly beg of you: please make this "feature" optional and opt-IN, or better yet just scrap it. Not every app is suitable for trendy user engagement elixirs.
title: Great, except for "streak" jibba jabba

review: After losing my daughter, one of the harder things to do was to lay down at night and shut my brain off. My mind would constantly go and grief was the worst when everything was quiet. I heard about the calm app and tried the free trial. I was listening to stories while drifting off to sleep or imaging myself outdoors while listening to night sounds or beach waves. It was great!!! Thank you Calm for literally keeping me calm during the worst times. Now, years later, I still use Calm to wind down, relax, and reset.
title: Helped through a loss

review:
If you get stuck in your head, unaware of the source of anxiety, the Calm app can help. 

I grew up without a correct understanding of meditation, therefore avoiding it until I encountered Calm. After attempting to practice self care using other apps and podcasts, I was underwhelmed at the thought of trying again. I believed that I wasn‚Äôt built for meditation and therefore could not benefit from it. 

Calm has helped structure a meditation and reflection routine in my life that has set a path of predictability during panic or any unsettling emotions/feelings. I rely on the content that is released to maintain a sense of self-awareness and stability that I have never been able to trust. 

If you are someone who passes by apps that teach meditative practices and self care techniques with thoughts that this just isn‚Äôt for me, use a free trial and just try it. You may be surprised and enjoy this new coping mechanism.
title: Most cost-effective breath of fresh air

review: Disclosure - I pay for the yearly subscription so I‚Äôm not sure what limitations there are with the free version. Nonetheless, the subscription is beyond worth it for me. Sleep stories have helped on restless nights. Guided collections help target different areas for personal growth. There‚Äôs so much to this app that I have learned which I now apply to myself and others. Compassion, allowing space, learning to be comfortable with the discomfort of emotions. This is an excellent tool no matter where you are in your mindfulness journey. Been using the app since 2017.
title: Great Variety

review: I love this app and use it almost every day. Mostly now I‚Äôm just doing the timed meditation but I still really like the picture and quote that comes up after Tamara‚Äôs Daily calm that had been included after the timed meditation as well. The last couple of times I‚Äôve just finished with some sort of business request and the green screen. Please let me finish my self guided meditation beautifully with the calming picture and quote and without business ‚Äúapp‚Äù options. Thank you!
title: Go back to pictures after timed meditation

review: One of the most used apps on my phone is my Calm app. I meditate daily, always in the morning. I try to record my daily gratitude and in the Hemings I always sleep to soundscapes and occasionally a sleep story. I also use the app from time to time when I am stressed and need to slow down for a few minutes. If you‚Äôre reading this calm, it‚Äôd be great to have an option for a twenty minute daily meditation. You could simply add more quiet periods between the narration. Just a thought! Regardless, I love my calm app.
title: Calm a day keeps the Doctor away

review:
Love this app. I use it daily/nightly. Never thought I would fall asleep to talking as I can‚Äôt focus but I did! 
Only things I wish I could change is that a soundscape counted toward your ‚Äústreak‚Äù, and that you can create your own playlist! I love certain narrators and wish I could mix and match a few. I hate waking up and not hearing something so I‚Äôd love to have a few hours worth stacked up of my choice. (The preset ones are ok but the ability to pick your own would be great) Overall a great app to have. Not a fan of Shetty after his fakeness but hey can‚Äôt win them all!
title: Love‚Ä¶ but wish for a change!

review: I love Calm!  There‚Äôs so many options.  Each day you can listen to a new guided medication, select a specific mediation to fit your emotional needs for the day, or escape the stress of the day with a narrated story that will melt away the stress!  Every night with my kids (10 & 6) we do the daily meditation.  Then, they drift off to sleep listening to a narrated story.  They‚Äôve learned so much over the last two years about how to label, understand, and cope with their emotions.  Every child (and adult!) would benefit from daily practice!
title: Great daily practice

review: I have been using this app for several months , mainly for guided meditation. I like that it has several options with different guides and different approaches. I loved the background music , which used to play as soon as you opened the app and continued through the meditation. Birds chirping and soft waves. But suddenly it‚Äôs gone! Maybe some found it distracting, but it‚Äôs half the reason I chose this app. Tried to find if there is a setting where I could turn it back on, but did not find one. Please bring it back or tell me how to retrieve it!
title: Like the app, but what happened to the music?

review: I‚Äôve been using Calm since 2015 and it is surprising just how much they‚Äôve improved & given you so more when it already was amazing. This app is my #1 must have. I rave to everyone about it all the time bc I wish everyone shared the same joy & peace that this app gives me. I also highly suggest turning the notifications on so you can get reminders throughout the day to check in & take some deep breaths. You can tell that the creator puts a lot of love & care into this app. Thank you Calm for everything that you do!
title: Above & beyond

review: Hello, Calm. I loved your app and the calmness it provided when I was in college‚Ä¶ That being said, coming back to the app, you‚Äôve put almost everything in the app on premium lock. Understandable for the celebrities and music made by creators. Although I believe that sounds such as trains passing by, forest full of crickets at night, & raining background noises shouldn‚Äôt have been on premium lock. I wouldn‚Äôt have minded paying premium but the only subscription available for me to sign up for was the yearly plan, I would‚Äôve been more inclined to pay if there was a monthly payment one. [I didn‚Äôt bother to look as I was done with the app.] You‚Äôre app was great while it lasted before your promotion with celebrities. Good bye.
title: Sad.

review:
I suffer from panic disorder and major anxiety. I was having panic attacks every single day that were so bad I even told my boyfriend to call an ambulance because I thought I was dying. I‚Äôve done everything and been on multiple medications that either haven‚Äôt done anything, or have made it worse. I‚Äôve never tried meditation because for years I always thought it was a waste of time. This was my last resort and I almost rely on it now to calm me down. 
The only bad side is that it costs $70 a year to use it so I will probably look for another app that‚Äôs the same.
title: It really helped

review:
I very much appreciate that I get the premium version of Calm through my healthcare provider (KP). I meditate on a daily basis and find that the 10-15 minutes that I take early in the morning allows for me to be better prepared for the day regardless of what that looks like. 

I especially appreciate the daily meditation that Tamara Leavitt offers. It is a very helpful and thoughtful perspective on something that I can almost always find application for and the deeper I engage in the many parts that are offered, the more I get out of the practice.
title: Appreciation for Tamara

review: In August of 2019, I applied to get Calm for free. The people at calm said that if you worked in education and wanted to try it - let them do it for free! I am a social worker in a low Socioeconomic school district and people in my circle laughed ‚Äú you are going to get these kids to meditate?‚Äù  Let me scream it from the rooftops- THIS APP HAS CHANGED THESE KIDS MINDSET. I love this app and would pay for it every year for the rest of my life!! If I am honest, I don‚Äôt think I could personally live without it in my daily life, either ! Thank you Calm for bringing peace to so many of my patients and to my life, as well!
title: Could not live without

review:
As someone who just started using this app I can definitely recommend it. The content is spot on and it is organized in such a beautiful and helpful manner.
The thing I use the most within the app is the rain sound as it has a huge impact on my mood. I would love if they added more diversity to it though to feel more natural like if it changed the intensity of the rain or add some thunder sounds every now and then. I‚Äôve used other apps before that did just that but I would prefer to use everything within calm.
Please take it into consideration.
title: Add more sounds

review:
Update:   Your newest update repaired the glitch caused by the previous update. No more crashes. Thank you!  I mostly use Calm for the background sounds and sleep stories however I have enjoyed several other features like The Spark.  I would suggest that the Daily Calm be narrated by other voices in case the main narrator‚Äôs voice doesn‚Äôt work for your listeners. A little variety is nice.  Overall a good app. 

Old: I enjoyed Calm until the latest update. Now I get a purple ‚Äútake a deep breath‚Äù screen and then it crashes and closes. No access possible.  FIX THIS PLEASE!
title: It‚Äôs fixed!

review: I have migraines that are caused by (or made worse by) snippets of songs getting stuck in my head on repeat. I have tried listening to music in the past, but if I know the songs, those cause the problem to get worse. I tried Calm on a whim for their sleep stories (which I love), but found their music to be really therapeutic at helping my migraines! Since the music is random and not really ‚Äúsongs‚Äù it can somehow reprogram my brain to get the song loops the hell out of there. I know this is a weird case, but I am so happy this helps and I became a subscriber.
title: Helped My Migraines!

review:
Unfortunately, the main voice on the app is like nails on a chalkboard to me, not soothing at all. So, the daily sessions she offers and many of the specialty sessions, I can‚Äôt listen to. I realize we are all different, but I wish there were more voice options for situations like this, or that she would hire a voice actor with a soothing tone like all of her guests. At this point, I can only enjoy guest sessions so I will be discontinuing my subscription and switching to another similar app that I‚Äôve found. 
I do like this app and find that it helps my child and myself. Let me know if the voice options come about, and I‚Äôll subscribe again. There are some nice exercises and affirmations here.
title: Tamaras Voice

review: This app will literally make you feel like you are younger! I couldn‚Äôt sleep for nearly 2 nights in a row, by the third night I felt almost insane.  I found this app, downloaded it.  Literally a miracle, I did a meditation therapy and then put thunderstorm on, I was asleep within minutes after the thunderstorm music started playing.  I even had a dream I could remember, which has been a year since my last. I will use this app until my final slumber, and hopefully the app will be on so I can die peacefully in my dreams!
title: Having problems sleeping? Want to actually dream again?

review: When you download this app it says that it is free but when you open it up there are two things that are free but they are very good but that is the only thing I can give the app Calm credit for. They just want you to spend money instead of helping you calm down. This app is so frustrating because one night I could not fall asleep so I saw commercial for Calm and downloaded it but when I open the app I could only do one thing and it wasn‚Äôt even the thing I was looking for. So if I give you one suggestion to make them improve their app would be to make more stuff free. You‚Äôll get a lot more people to download the app and probably even more people to pay for premium. Thank you for reading this and I hope you will take into account my suggestion. Thank you
title: Pretty bad app but kind of OK

review: This app may seem great on the outside, but this is probably one of the most money-demanding apps I‚Äôve ever seen. In the summer, I tend to sleep a lot less since it‚Äôs so  hot, which makes me uncomfortable. I‚Äôve been wanting to better my sleep in the summer for years now, and Calm seemed like  the perfect solution. However, when I got the app, I quickly realized that 99% of ALL content is behind a paywall. This app might as well not even have any free audio and force you to get a subscription for access to anything. It is near impossible to find complete and free audio. I am a teenager, I need good sleep to function. Now, I am a few nights further from getting the amount of sleep I need.
title: Probably good, I wouldn‚Äôt know.

review:
A friend told me about Calm. I was pretty skeptical about it, having tried sound machines and white noise machines that didn‚Äôt work. But this is different. I‚Äôve been using it for about 2 months now and I‚Äôve only finished one story. The voices completely calm me and lull me into a deep sleep. 
I find that there are certain narrators who have better voices than others. I‚Äôm sorry, John McEnroe reading the rules of tennis did nothing for me. But others are so beautifully calm and soothing that I barely get more than five minutes of the story. 
I will be recommending this to all my friends.
title: It Really Works

review: After the latest update, I can no longer just go straight to my profile. When I tap ‚Äúprofile‚Äù it shows my nature scene. I have to tap it again to see my profile. When I tap ‚Äúcalendar‚Äù, it goes back to the nature scene and I have to tap it yet again to see the calendar. This is NOT calming. It is annoying. If I tap on something, I want to see that something, not the same scene that I can get just by opening the app. Now my husband, who has a low tolerance for nonsense, is making noises about canceling our subscription and moving to a different meditation app. Congratulations.
title: Make it worse with every update

review: I suffer from anxiety and depression and with my most recent bout I found this app. I had never meditated before but thought I would give it a try. I am almost fully recovered now and I truly believe this app had a lot to do with it!  I am actually kicking myself for not meditating sooner!  It‚Äôs a life changer!  I meditate twice a day, once with the daily calm and another with one of the series.  I also love the master class and the sleep portion!  Tamara‚Äôs voice is very soothing also.  I am definitely happy with this and if nothing changes with the app I will probably re-subscribe for life.
title: Love this app!

review:
If you love language, for the love of God stay away from the travel stories.  A more insipid collection of memoirs don‚Äôt exist. It is 2 am and I just couldn‚Äôt get through the cringe-worthy Yurt story. So I tried Morocco.  Do you people curate this stuff?  Maybe some listeners fall asleep giggling but I am grumpy at 2 am. 

Next most awful are the relaxation and sleep audio offerings that all say exactly the same thing. Get a writer.  Topping the list in this category is one sleep audio that almost put me to sleep until the narrator jumped in after a few minutes of silence and scared the bejeesus out of me.  Dude: once you go silent, shut your pie hole.  

Still, the classic stories are often read well and with grace.  Stick with these and you should be safe.
title: Delightful AND insipid. Just depends

review:
It‚Äôs no surprise that this app has the Editor‚Äôs Choice Award. It‚Äôs fantastic! I decided to try it on a whim after seeing it advertised here in the App Store and reading some reviews.

Since my early teens, I‚Äôve always been in touch with my spirituality and turned to meditation and yoga/exercise for dealing with emotional baggage and anxiety. Lately I‚Äôve hit some roadblocks and plateaus in my personal growth. I couldn‚Äôt be any more grateful for this app. There are so many topics/categories of meditations to choose from. And the meditation guide, Tamara Levitt, is just angelic. I sink almost as soon as I hear her voice. 

Thank you, Calm! üôèüèº
title: Amazing!

review: I especially like the topics of self-help meditation and I am in love with master classes with these master classes I have not only learned more about food cravings subconscious eating and things like that then I think I have ever heard from anybody or read from any other book the people who have given these classes are wonderful I have even gone out and bought their books my daughter and my son have also learned to use this as meditation to keep them selves calm before bed and to use Calm with a heavy or stressful day like testing it has helped my family thank you Calm.
title: Wonderful.

review: I purchased this app because of it‚Äôs high ratings and advertising that it records to Health App for mindfulness.  Initially, I had trouble getting the minutes to transfer to the Health app. Needless to say, I was very disappointed.  I wrote to the support staff and within minutes heard back with suggestions to correct the problem.  Cory was patient and continued to communicate with me several times with suggestions and explanations.  The problem was resolved.  Not only do I love the meditations and features of Calm, I can not say enough about the responsiveness and customer service!
title: Wonderful App and Support Staff!!

review: We use this app far more than anything else I‚Äôve ever paid for (well NYT Cooking excepted). My husband and I both love the daily mediations that are short and approachable. But the sleep stories really take the cake for us AND our toddler. They are a welcome salve in these confusing and challenging times; a place to park your brain long enough to drift off. Our kiddo loves the sleep stories; especially the three available Thomas the Train stories. That would be my only request for improvement: more Thomas please!
title: Love this for everyone in the family

review: Calm app is a great way to learn how to deal with your daily struggles. Everyone has issues and it‚Äôs hard to believe that one app could facilitate you going in a less stressful direction in life. It‚Äôs important to make time for yourself and this app has a 10 min daily meditation that has helped me tremendously. I am so glad I found this hidden treasure. I hope everyone enjoys it as much as I do. Give it a chance and I bet you will be able to accept life and feel better about any negativity coming your way. Excellent app.
title: I was a stressed out mess until I found this app

review:
I was hesitant to drop $70 for the year, but made sure when I started the week trial I was really ready to put it to the test. I have been using Calm for a couple months now and it‚Äôs well worth the less than $6 per month price tag. 

The variety is great, Tamara is awesome, and I love that you can identify meditations as favorites. 

The one thing that I really find myself wanting is the ability to also identify ALL meditations that I have tried. Some I don‚Äôt care to return to, but don‚Äôt have a way to know which they are. With that functionality, Calm would be an easy 5 stars from me.
title: Love Calm, BUT

review: It would literally take me hours to fall asleep because my mind would just wonder, but the sleep stories and soundscapes have put my mind wondering to an end. They‚Äôre interesting enough to keep your mind focused, yet soothing enough to let you fall asleep (not like having the tv on while trying to sleep). I use this app every night when falling asleep and sometimes turn it back on if I wake up in the middle of the night and can‚Äôt get back to sleep. I highly highly highly recommend the Calm app and everything it has to offer.
title: So helpful

review: This is a fantastic app and continually adds new content to and for sleep stories, meditations, classes , music and more. I especially like the daily Calm and the new Daily trip. I love Eric Braa and Jeff Warren‚Äôs soothing and clear voices. Some of the story tellers and speakers have voices that are difficult (for me) to hear or listen to, but these two men have wonderful voices, clear enunciation, and soothing speech. I love the constant updating of new material and variety. If a person is serious about calming their life, he or she will not regret purchasing this wonderful app.
title: Great selection of meditations

review: I wish her cadence had less affectation. A bit too ‚Äúhypnotist‚Äù for me- the sing song vibe becomes repetitive and inauthentic after I heard it a number of times. And you will hear her voice A LOT. The majority of the meditations I‚Äôve listened to have her voice and often the only option. The male voice, while not my preference, has much less affectation. It‚Äôs the neutrality I prefer. The straightforward speaking style. I do love the app though and appreciate the effort they‚Äôve made towards some diversity in voices.
title: Wish Tamara Levitt‚Äôs cadence had less affectation

review: This app has helped me to learn to manage stress and take a much needed break from the busyness of life. It‚Äôs professional and doesn‚Äôt take much time to use. I highly recommend it to friends all the time and even have my 9 and 13 year olds use the sleep stories and guided meditations. I love that there are series that help you to go deeper into a topic and practice mindfulness at the same time. I enjoyed the guided meditations so much, I decided to purchase the full app - definitely a worthy and small investment for the peace of mind and life long stress reducing strats training this app provides.
title: Excellent App

review: If you can afford the $70 a year for Calm Premium, by all means enjoy. That‚Äôs their only price point beyond the now-bare-bones free service. They constantly change the app and remove your favorite features with reckless abandon. In a world of constant pressure and chaotic change, the one thing I would expect from an app whose name is LITERALLY CALM, is some continuity. And I suppose they‚Äôve shown that to an extent‚Äî they continually remove useful features either permanently or place them behind a pay wall. If they had different price points or different payment plans, then I would believe they‚Äôre actually invested in one‚Äôs mental health. Instead they‚Äôve repeatedly shown that they‚Äôre only interested in the health of their bank accounts.
title: Calm is for the Wealthy

review: I have experienced panic attacks since childhood.   A couple of years ago something new started that frightened me.  I didn‚Äôt recognize it as anxiety.  Fours years of doctors, tests...no diagnosis or help.  Finally a neurologist prescribed citalopram.  Just about that time I discovered Calm.  I feel like I have my life back!  The drug helps, but if I let days go by without using Calm, I can feel the anxiety and tension returning.  It seems to ‚Äúreset‚Äù my brain.  It has really trained me to be more cognizant of my anxiety and tension and now I can quickly use some of the techniques I‚Äôve learned.  I am very grateful for it.
title: A life saver

review: I love the app and I‚Äôm so glad that I bought the premium version. Of all the excellent narrators of sleep stories, Eric Bra is the only narrator who can put me to sleep. So please,  please provide us with more of his sleep stories. However, Tamara Levite‚Äôs voice even though nice and sensual,  is not a good voice for relaxation. It is actually very irritating. I was looking for a different voice that does the body scan, but I realized that all the guided meditations that help you sleep are done by her. Please please pick at least one sleep meditation done by another voice. If that doesn‚Äôt happen, I don‚Äôt think I will renew my subscription.
title: Eric Bras‚Äô Sleep Stokes are the Best

review: Calm helps me so much with worries and stuff I need to do and don‚Äôt want to do it relaxes and calms me it has made a big change for my stressing and worrying I have started day one for meditation and it is great I feel like I go somewhere else and it is a great feeling for when you are stressed or worried or anything you should definitely get calm in my opinion because it has helped me so much it is like awesome because when I meditate or go to sleep now I am not stressed or worried or have stressful feeling or thoughts but if you are considering of getting calm you should it is the best thing ever
title: I love itüòç

Use to be a great app for me I‚Äôve recently found another app that‚Äôs exactly the same pretty much except their healing doesn‚Äôt have a price on it.

review: First of all this app is AMAZING! I always get stressed over the tiniest things like a pop quiz I didn‚Äôt study for, getting that one B on my report card, and when I have too much homework. Yeah, I get stressed a lot. I saw this game in my recommendations and I figured I tried it out. I loved it right away. I did the meditating for 7 days of relieving stress and it did help me since I don‚Äôt get as stressed as I usually do, so I tried a few others. Then after doing these meditating sessions I realized how much I changed (in a good way!‚ò∫Ô∏è) and how I became a better person. I definitely recommend this app!ü§ó

review: This app used to be great, I‚Äôm not saying once you make an app to keep it free forever but it went from pretty great with a. Few features for people willing to pay $50+ for all, to needing to buy most to use the app at all. Why not offer a $4.99 one time buy that includes a few standard background noises instead of deciding one day to lock them all and say a persons gotta buy premium now, I must say I hate to move to a different app as your user interface is great but this is just rediculous, you might as well just ask for the money up front when a user downloads the app instead of not allowing anything on a FREE app in the store, that‚Äôs a little misleading if I must say, mainly just because I remember how things used to be.
title: What happened?

review: I have been using the Calm app for nine months now. Are usually find it to be fairly helpful. But given that they almost never put up new meditations I don‚Äôt think it should cost nearly as much as it does. It has good things for coping with anxiety, but nothing for coping with depression, and other mental health issues. But a wonderful device nonetheless, especially if you‚Äôre trying to get in meditation or moment of calm. This will give you five minutes or 30 minutes it‚Äôs whatever is right for you. It does glitch sometimes which I find frustrating, it will randomly turn off.
title: Great app, could use a little help

review: Once upon a time a little boy wanted to go camping but this is mom and dad said no because he can‚Äôt right it is a TV because he broke his arm in a cast So he needs toWait until he gets all the cast then they can go camping go on ATV rides and have fun sports do you so many stuff with his friends Play hide and seek think he should be until he gets all the cast in maybe get a girlfriend and then do it because he likesAubrey and I think she would like to go on a ride with him and enjoy some kind of be like a date for him the end. 12 ‚Äì 16-22
title: By Jacob Smith

review: I have been using this app consistently for 6 months for falling asleep. With this app, I‚Äôm usually asleep within 10 minutes. Without it, my brain spins for up to a couple of hours before I can drift off.  And since using it, I find that my bedtimes and hours of sleep have become more consistent because I actually get drowsy at bedtime now.  I paid for the annual subscription and it is worth every penny. My only gripe is that I wished that released sleep meditations more often.
title: Sleeping Better than I have in Years

review:
Taking time for yourself to be still is important.   But I often forget and this app has helped me focus during meditation and ultimately be a better person during the day hopefully for everyone‚Äôs benefit not just my own. 

I‚Äôve used the sleep parts to help me relax and prepare for sleep.   
Keeping the phone out of the bedroom is best for me but when I‚Äôm really restless I‚Äôll use the Clam app.  
If I wake up in the middle of the night I move the phone out of the bedroom and fall back to sleep quicker.
title: Being still became a priority

review: I came across this app through an Instagram app and decided to try it out. I love the wilderness sounds especially living in the city. Once in a while I can hear birds chirping in the morning but it‚Äôs very minimal so that‚Äôs why I love just hearing the sound of wilderness while using the app. The second time I went on Calm, I decided to try out the sleep cognition sound for about 30min before actually going to sleep and I fell asleep right away. I‚Äôm excited to explore the app a little more. Definitely recommend Calm to anybody!
title: Such a great app

review:
Love the messages that Tamara gives in the conclusion for each of her daily calms, but during the body of the meditation she does way too much guidance. Feels like your being lectured at times. How can you focus on the breath if she‚Äôs constantly talking? Usually saying the same thing repetitively 

There are meditations on the app with less guidance but they don‚Äôt provide the concluding messages that the daily calm does. They should try and offer something that gives the ending message of the daily calm but gives you the option to limit the amount of jargon during the middle 7-8 minutes of the 10 minute session.
title: Too much guidance

review: I won‚Äôt waste your time with a painfully long read so I will simply get to the point. Although this app features a very, very few audio options for sleep but they almost seem impossible to find. It‚Äôs almost as if they are trying to coax you into buying their premium but making it hard to find. Almost 90% of this App is a pay wall and little to no free options but, to add to that the free options are high grade quality -In my opinion-. It is hard to support something that does not keep a good balance of free and paid options. I do not recommend if you are not willing to pay for premium but if you are this app is perfect for you.
title: App is a Giant Pay Wall

review: I was having a horrible time falling asleep about a year ago. I did not want to fall into the sleeping pill habit, so on a whim I downloaded the calm app. The very first night I fell asleep within minutes to one of the sleep stories. Thinking it was beginners luck or wishful thinking, I gave it a full week, and I fell asleep within minutes each night. I happily purchased the yearly subscription and I listen to it every single night. I couldn‚Äôt tell you what a single sleep story is about, AND THAT‚ÄôS THE POINT! I love this app and my youngest child listens to it every night as well. I LOVE THIS APP!!
title: Dream come true

review: I tried it a few years ago and I liked it but I have it free for a year through being in an HR program and I‚Äôm really liking the daily calms and also the sleep meditation but it doesn‚Äôt seem to be a lot of sleep meditations which is kind of bothering me at only looks like there‚Äôs like 10 or 15 so what happens after I do it for a few weeks I thought it would be like hundreds so if the developer is reading this I‚Äôm a little disappointed about that but maybe I‚Äôll find other stuff to listen to at night
title: Doesn‚Äôt seem like it has a lot of sleep meditations

review:
I use this almost exclusively for the sleep stories. I love the Lionwood stories. The developers should add a way to put the series of stories and the chapters of books in the same grouping. It‚Äôs not easy to tell by the title if Lionwood is in the story. Also, wheee is chapter 2 of Alice in Wonderland? I only see 1, 3&4.  And more chapters of The Little Princess please!!! 
I have used some of the other features:  series, music and meditation for self care and self improvement. 
The only reason I‚Äôm not giving five stars is for comments above about how to find sleep stories more easily.
title: Sleep stories are the best on this app!

review: This is easily my fav app. I‚Äôve been using this app for almost two years now. Calm saved me from having a mental breakdown during distance learning. As an educator, this is a must app to have. With all the negativity that‚Äôs been happening in the world, calm makes me calm. I also love listening to other people‚Äôs perspectives on Spark. The daily calm is a part of my morning routine, sleep stories/meditation is a part of my evening routine. Amazing master class topics too. I just love everything about it. Thank you Calm. I appreciate all you do üßòüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
title: Calm makes me calm

review: Recently my P.E teacher sent me a link for calm, I decided to try it, I heard about these relaxing apps, I though this is going to be like the other ones. It says it‚Äôs good but it‚Äôs not. I tried it I started with the LeBron James, it was great, then I moved on to the how are you feeling, I was stressed and I wrote it, then it gave me a stress relieving video after I was so calm. I love calm and will recommend it to all people I know, it gives me just what I need, and really helps me. Nothing I have ever tried before for calming apps worked, but calm is different it helps all my needs, and is the best app ever!
title: I loved calm

review: I love calm, I have used it for years. I went to use it tonight only to find out majority of the sounds were now ‚Äúlocked,‚Äù and I needed to purchase to listen. I never minded that some sounds were locked, however, a lot of sounds if not most are now locked. I find that extremely selfish because there are sounds on calm that have been the only solution to my panic attacks, and currently I‚Äôm wondering what I am going to do when the next one strikes. I recommended this app, I trusted this app, and I am just really shocked that this app turned into another scam.
title: I‚Äôm very upset

review:
I don‚Äôt write reviews often, but I use my Calm app every single day, sometimes three times a day!
I especially love the sleep stories, they really help me get my brain off my to-do list and to relax.
The app is a little pricey, but since I use it several times a day, I believe it is worth the money. 
It has helped me become centered when I felt like I was going to fall apart. The daily messages teach me a better way to go about and think of things clearly. 
Thank you to all the Calm Contributors... you make a difference in this crazy world! üíû
title: Saved my sanity, use it everyday!

review:
Being forced to sign in with Facebook or provide your email is unnecessary. It's just a means to be able to bombard you with spam. I won't do it, I get way too many BS emails & ads already.
  The ONE MINUTE ads from this app are a bit ridiculous also. No one likes ads in the middle of games and other apps but we're forced to put up with them.  99.9% of them are 15-30 seconds or less tho, so they're bearable. Not the ads for this app, they're a full minute of unwanted interruption.
  This app provides something that Im interested in, something I want and actually need. Too bad they have to be so Extra tho, demanding to get into your Fb and/or email, as well as the terrible full minute ads. These 2 things have made me decide to pass on an app that I could really use:(
title: No Thanks.

review:
The concept of this app is great, and I‚Äôm glad to see that they‚Äôre growing. However, I had a few problems. 

The app glitched out. A LOT. I know it wasn‚Äôt my phone or Internet connection. But I could barely get through any of the stories or meditations without the app freezing and closing at least once. I loved the meditations and stories, but it was really annoying when this happened every ten minutes or so. 

Next: the lack of free content. I understand that they need to make money like any other business. However, I am not willing to pay for a subscription. This seemed to affect a lot of different things on the app, as I could barely do anything. As I said, I understand that they have to make money, but they also have to realize that there are users out there who can‚Äôt pay. There‚Äôs not a lot you can do without this, which really saddened me. 

The idea is wonderful. It‚Äôs easy to use and the services are nice. I wouldn‚Äôt call it a five star app, but it‚Äôs okay. I‚Äôd encourage you to still try it out. Judge for yourself!
title: Glitchy but Okay

review: Words can‚Äôt express how much I love Calm. It is easily the best app on my phone. I think I‚Äôm an OG user, I‚Äôve had the paid subscription of Calm since 2014 and I love it to this day. The app is incredibly easy to use, has a TON of meditation options, and helps you easily manage and track your progress.  I liked the old voice of Calm better, but after emailing the team, they reinstated the old set of guided meditations on my app. I hope they don‚Äôt ever get rid of it! This app is better than Headspace and I promise I‚Äôm not affiliated with either company. Thanks for developing this gem!
title: Best App on my phone!

review:
Excellent guided meditation. Easy to use, even as a beginner. And has a positive message. There are also master classes which delve deeper into particular subjects - like anxiety. Sleep stories are very relaxing and help when I‚Äôm traveling and can‚Äôt quiet my mind. There are sounds to choose from too. Basically it‚Äôs one app that offers all you could need to help calm, relax, restore and better your meditation practice.

After years of use since my initial review the app remains excellent and has expanded its offerings. I highly recommend.
title: Excellent App

developerResponse: {'id': 6834447, 'body': 'Hi there, we offer a free version of the app in addition to the free trial and paid subscription. You can see our full list of free content here: https://support.calm.com/hc/en-us/articles/360008536834-What-is-included-in-the-free-version-of-the-app-What-is-included-in-Calm-Premium-. Reach out to support@calm.com with any questions!', 'modified': '2019-01-15T00:32:27Z'}
review:
I‚Äôve downloaded several of these mindfulness type apps and they all follow the same format, IMO. They all kinda-sorta imply something free, but the apps are pretty much unusable in the free status. All of them are then constantly taking you to the upgrade page. Then, I‚Äôm getting email reminders about the program. They all also have the same ‚Äúfeel‚Äù like it‚Äôs the same 4-5 developers behind all the apps. They all try to lure you in with the free 7 day trial - and I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs quite effective as people may forget to cancel. Also these apps are pricy imo. 

My advice to these app developers: open up the full use of the app for 10 days with no risk of payment. If people really like it they will then pay.
title: These apps for iPhone seem all the same

review: I use the thunderstorm sound on the free version of this app every night to help me fall asleep. I used to use the body scans, but Calm recently locked those out to non-subscribing members, which is very disappointing because I can‚Äôt afford to pay for the app and the body scans were extremely soothing. I‚Äôll be using a different app now for body scans. That being said, if you can afford this app, I recommend it, but for those of us who can‚Äôt, all of the nature sounds and meditation music is still free, along with a (now much smaller) collection of free meditations
title: Wonderful meditation sounds and music, but now very limited to non-paying members

review:
I want to start off by saying I absolutely LOVE this app. It has been a tremendous help and I really enjoy the guided meditations.

The only reason I‚Äôm not giving Calm 5 stars is because I prefer to use it at home on AppleTV and the app there is not nearly as organized or user friendly as the app for the phone. 

There‚Äôs no ‚ÄúDiscovery‚Äù (search) option. 

There‚Äôs no ‚ÄúFavorites‚Äù option. 

There‚Äôs basically three categories and you just have to scroll through them until you find what you‚Äôre looking for.  

Also, I enjoy doing the guided series of meditations. I do the majority of them at home, but if I‚Äôm away from home and attempt to do one on my phone I can‚Äôt pick up where I left off, even though my phone and AppleTV are signed into the same account. 

If the AppleTV version of the app was as good as the phone version this would be an easy 5 stars. Hopefully these small fixes can be made.
title: Please Reconfigure For AppleTV

review:
I went from 2-3 hours sleep to 7 average over the last 54 days. Two suggestions tho. I track it and it asks what helped you before sleep and during sleep. Almost all the choices are negative like anxiety, interrupted sleep, etc. they should all be positive choices. 

Also don‚Äôt like the way you put your hours slept in. There should be an option for split sleep. I‚Äôd like to record interrupted sleep as well. Like 10-12 and 2-6. Otherwise great app and love the stories, especially Chike!!
title: This has saved me‚Ä¶

review: Get the subscription for the year, it is more economical. If you want try it for a month, then renew for the year. It is wonderful, the soundscapes, the guided meditation and they are always adding more options. I did this during a time when I was experiencing a lot of stress and anxiety and it was so helpful. My husband even likes to use it. Sometimes we just put on the soundscapes at bedtime and listen to the rain or a crackling campfire and drift off to sleep. Try it and just enjoy the relaxation and personal growth.
title: This is amazing

review: I know it‚Äôs expensive but you can get a free trial! Helps me go to sleep & helps me meditate. This is the best app of all years. I go to sleep in 5 minutes! Please get it now! But wait I have more to say.  I‚Äôve have been using this app for 4 years now! (2017)Ever since I‚Äôve never had any problems. So many things to chose from! Helps me go to sleep in 5 minutes! I don‚Äôt want to be rude but Calm is better than Headspace. (Also instead of paying $50/Year you can get the free trial! I like Kate Winslet I think that‚Äôs how you spell it. Any way thank you for reading! Byeüëã!
title: I love it! Get it now!

review: Every time I start a sleep story it immediately downloads 30 mins of the track, and then stops. WHY NOT DOWNLOAD THE ENTIRE THING?!?! This means that if I lose service or put my phone on airplane mode (which helps to make sure you really don‚Äôt get bothered) the end of the story doesn‚Äôt work. Now you‚Äôd think the download button would work but NO IT DOESNT. Even if I press the download button after starting the story it doesn‚Äôt work unless I stop the story entirely and restart it‚Ä¶only THEN does it have the end downloaded (not what I want to do when trying to go to sleep). One year ago I got this app and thought eh they‚Äôll fix this. STILL HAVENT FIXED IT. I‚Äôm done with Calm, going to headspace if this isn‚Äôt fixed soon.
title: Terrible offline functionality

review: I have used and like the meditations nd talke, but my favorite feature is the sleep stories. I love listening to them and they usually lead me to sleep. If not, they still are calming and engaging. The only issue I have with this app is after a while of using it, it keeps crashing, and you have to delete it and reload it.  It doesn‚Äôt save all your settings, but favorites are saved. I gave this four stars for its great content, but wish they could fix the problem with crashing.
title: Love the sleep stories

review: I am not completely satisfied with the app but it is great and I like the layout. I would definitely recommend this but not as good as other apps I have had in the past. I like listening to the calm music as I do my work at home and it has a great selection of things to listen to. I like the soundscapes the best for falling a sleep because it is the most relaxing to me but I would have liked a few more options to choose from in that category. With all said it is a great app and I would recommend it even though I have a few things I would have done differently for me.
title: Not completely satisfied

review: My mind wanders, as does most, when I try to get to sleep. I‚Äôm also a single mother of four grown kids and a high school teacher. Yoga breathing helps a lot when I try to sleep but sometimes i need more. The Calm app saves me. I love falling asleep to the stories. It takes my mind off life‚Äôs problems. Even when I‚Äôm up during the night I put it right on and it helps me stay calm and able to sleep once again. I‚Äôm so relieved going to bed knowing I‚Äôll hear a calming story. I‚Äôm better during the day as well. I‚Äôm not as agitated. I highly recommend those app.
title: Now I can sleep

review: I took an 8 week course on Mindfulness Meditation five years ago and really benefitted from it. But I drifted away from daily meditation. Since I discovered the Calm app, I have resumed daily meditation and am very happy with the program. I highly recommend trying it for free as I did, but consider subscribing as you get into it. . It is well worth the investment, and provides a large variety of themed meditations. I just started the 30 day program with Jeff for people new to or returning to meditation. It is different and inviting. I am now on the way to reestablishing my daily meditation practice.
title: Mindfulness

review: I love this app. It make it so easy to fall asleep after a busy day or relax and meditate before school or work. I love to listen to the ocean waves or babbling brook while I read. I don‚Äôt like to be angry or upset and this app helps me calm down. It is so easy to find what you are looking for because of its layout. The sleep stories are really nice and they come out with new ones every update (which I think is every week). I just wanted to say thank you to everyone behind Calm and help people trying to decide whether to download it or not. I love this app.
title: Thank you so much for this app!!!

review: This is the very best meditation & relaxation app available. I rarely review anything. I had to for this app. Truly, I am stunned at the results of this app at helping me with my life long insomnia. The deep sleep meditation sessions work. I had the free version for about a year before I finally bought the subscription. Now, I meditate at minimum 4 days a week, fall asleep faster then I ever have & am learning a lot about mindfulness. Plus the music to relax or fall asleep to is my favorite. I use it for my husband & I every night & our baby. Our son loves it! Get this app! You will not regret it.
title: Seriously the Best

review: I have been dealing with some serious health issues, which in turn creates anxiety and sleeplessness. I am not sure what I would have done without the Calm app these last few weeks. I can finally sleep at night. I put my headphones on, listen to a bedtime story, and then the app plays calming background music and sounds for an hour. It‚Äôs also extremely helpful for getting me back to sleep once I have woken in the middle of the night. Anyone with anxiety knows that it‚Äôs really hard to fall back asleep. Calm calms the circus in my head. Worth every penny.
title: I can finally sleep
