review:
I love this app, I really do. But I have experienced on more than one occasion this app causing my iPhone to crash and reset, which gets annoying when you are working on something or trying to watch a class online or in the middle of something. 

I have deleted all apps and added them one at a time to see which app was the culprit and isolated the cause to this app. I don‚Äôt know what it is about this one that is causing the issue, but I know that this app is causing my iPhone to crash and restart unexpectedly. 

I hope this issue gets fixed soon, because it really is awesome when working correctly, and since it has been rated as a 2017 App of the Year, I expect it to work bug-free. Until that issue gets fixed, though, this app is a fail.
title: WARNING - Causes iPhone to Crash

review:
I‚Äôm having a lot of gratitude right now for the Calm app. After a long week, I got up early and just wanted to read a book. My mind was so busy that I couldn‚Äôt focus at all.

Today, I just picked up my phone and opened Calm, which I put on my home screen earlier this week. Almost immediately I could settle my mind and focus again.

I‚Äôve used the calm app as my go to example of a well thought through app for a while. Even though I generally hate subscriptions. This one sparks joy.
title: So grateful for this app

review: I use this app every night and most mornings. I love the sleep stories and now with the Daily Jay and Daily Move, there‚Äôs even more to choose from. The first couple of years there was no way to search and now they‚Äôve had that feature for quite a while. I signed up for a Lifetime membership over four years ago and I‚Äôm so glad I did because I‚Äôve more than paid myself back. The price of lifetime went up since then but it‚Äôs still well worth the money.
title: Best investment in myself ever

review: I fell upon this app as I‚Äôm getting older it‚Äôs hard to sleep at times in addition to the awareness there are outside factors that can stir up negative thoughts, feelings, etc. yes this is normal but sometimes these are two factors as mentioned above that this app has allowed me to bring inner peace, sort through and let go of. I for myself decided to make this a lifetime choice and live my daily calm choices. Never once did I say buying into this content was a bad choice, this helps push a milestone in my life.
title: A year of calm and a lifetime to go

review: First of all most of us don‚Äôt want to have a free trial and then start paying for this stuff. This needs to be free especially for parents who have kids and need some stress relief. Yes, the meditation and breathing stuff is awesome.. but that‚Äôs not enough. Second the stuff you have on the add, yes, it‚Äôs true, but it requires premium and most of the stuff on the app requires premium. So please fix this and I hope you can. Sorry if the review is a little harsh but I‚Äôm just being honest. And for the kids calming section most of the things need to be free truly if you have very energetic children. I hope the people who are reading this heed to this and have a blessed day!‚ù§Ô∏èüòä
title: Needs a lot of improvement üòë

review: Calm app helped keep my newborn happy and me relaxed through quarantine. Whether playing our baby, or myself, a sleep story, or using the soundscapes while working from home, the content is practical: volume doesn‚Äôt fluctuate like on some podcasts, stories are just stories and not ads, and everything is organized well. And it‚Äôs all relaxing. They also add new content often enough to keep it fresh. One request: please keep the train and non-fiction sleep stories coming! Thanks.
title: Worth subscription!

review: I use this app to sleep and everything is great. Only issue is that u should be able to adjust the volume of the sound independently of the phone volume. I use my phone to wake up, and want my alarm at full volume. But I find the apps noise at full volume to loud. So I cant use the app, because if i do my alarm will be to quite to wake me up. There seems to be a feature in the app for the scenes thing, but it doesnt work at all. Would really like to see this added because otherwise the app is great and has a lot of good sounds and stuff.
title: Adjustable volume needed

review: I think this app could and does have great potential. But to grow, you have to let the people that can‚Äôt pay the subscription have a wide variety of things as well. I‚Äôve looked around this app and 99% of everything I saw was locked behind a pay wall. I know it‚Äôs a free app and you still have to make money but don‚Äôt practically force us to buy the subscription to play any of the music, stories etc. I‚Äôm not saying open Everything up for free. You can still have payed stuff but make sure you don‚Äôt have all the content locked. I really hope you take my comment into consideration.
title: Too much locked ._.

review: I‚Äôm nearly through my first month of incorporating the Calm App into my daily life. I was never good at meditation on my own, but find it much easier with the guidance Calm provides. I use it every morning to stretch and meditate, in the afternoon for music and in the evening sometimes for the stories but mostly to meditate before bed. I find my self really noticing when I want to react and then letting it go before I even have a chance to. I‚Äôm a mom of a toddler and even though he is really chill there are still those days where this App is my saving grace.
title: My Favorite App on my Phone

review: I really love the calm app and it has made me see the value of meditation in my daily life. However, if you don‚Äôt have the premium version you can only do about 5 of the meditations, and they have hundreds in their library. This is frustrating to me because I know that not everyone has the financial means to purchase the premium membership, yet apps like these strive the make mental health care accessible to people of all walks of life. I think it would be beneficial for the calm app to unlock at least a few more of the meditations so that the largest number of people can benefit from their great resources.
title: make mental health care more accessible

review:
this app is awesome if ur looking for something to help u sleep or relax! my favorite part about the app is the stories and soundscapes! but theres one thing about the app that i dont like. for one they take a long time to add another new story to the app AND when they do the stories haven't (recently) even been stories. i really like the storie like the snow queen, the velveteen rabbit, and beauty and the beast. and also they came out with the little princess part one like forever ago and they keep putting out stories like australians
coral coast and twilight to moon like... those are documentaries! ik i just ranted but overall i rly love this app and its rly helped me!üòò
title: I LOVE THIS APP!

review: I used Calm for many years. I already meditate, so I didn‚Äôt use many of the meditation programs. I liked the idea of a daily meditation, such as the Daily Calm, but I can‚Äôt abide the speaker‚Äôs voice. It is so affected, I longed for different voices. (Others must have spoken up, because some of the sleep meditation assistance used other voices, but I found those dry and clinical.) The most distressing aspect about the app is its commercialism. I really don‚Äôt care about movie stars and famous people being recruited for sleep story narration and trainings. But that seems to be the direction Calm is headed. I liked it for a long time. I just found far more variation and less commercialization elsewhere.
title: Left Calm for Insight Timer

review:
I have found this app to be the best meditation app of the bunch. I have been using it since 2016. There are two features I would love to see added. 1) show time for all meditation options prior to selecting (view the amount of time before a selection has been made) and 2) allow for a more cohesive sorting option (or something similar; the selections for themes that display above are not categorized well and a sort + filter option would fix both of these issues).

Overall love the app!
title: Love this app. Two suggestions for features.

review: This app is very calming and relaxing. I enjoy listening to the water on the home page, and I recommend you to listen to the 24 minute long relaxation session, Blue Gold, and set a time for every day, unless you‚Äôre like me and want to stay up on the weekends, to be the same so you can get healthy, nice sleep. I highly recommend this app if you‚Äôre someone who has stress, anxiety, trouble focusing, trouble sleeping, or maybe you‚Äôre someone who just wants some space, alone time, or peace and quiet. Whatever it is, this app is sure to help. ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù is a great app. You should get it! üíôüòÅ
title: Calming

review: I‚Äôm a diagnosed insomniac and I have been put on loads of different types of medications, none of them work. I either get a lot of drowsiness or cat seem to fall asleep. This app has taking a perfect mixture and puts me to bed yet still not into a incredibly deep sleep so I can easily wake up in the early hours to work. My one wish is that I didn‚Äôt have to pay to get the good stuff. The subscription is cheap and totally worth. One of my favorite apps today. Alan sklar is super great. And I love phoebe smiths stories. Wonderful all around. I would give it a 4.5 stars but I can‚Äôt. Anyhow great app.
title: Insomniac

review: In addition to implementing good sleep hygiene ( blackout shades, earplugs, going to sleep and getting up at consistent times, yoga, meditation), my Sleep Stories on my Calm App have saved me ! It was worth paying the yearly fee so I can listen to a variety of the sleep stories . They definitely put me to sleep by the end of the story. I bought a special Bluetooth one ear ear Dabs ear bud so I can fall asleep on my side and not hassle with old fashioned wires on my headphones. I was able to kick the Ambien nightly too! Worth a try for those who find the monkey brain keeping you up
title: Solved my insomnia , better than sleeping pills

review: You‚Äôve made Daily Calm available on the watch, Great!  I would probably use this all the time.  The problem is, I used it and when I went back the next day to the phone app discovered the previous days session had not been recorded.  My streak had been broken.  Now, I don‚Äôt live and die by the streak.  It‚Äôs just a little added incentive to keep you going and I simply added the session manually.  I shouldn‚Äôt have to do this though and it seems a glaring oversight on your part not to have IWatch sessions updating our records on the main app when we use it.
title: I love the app and the New IWatch features are nice but........

review: Okay, so I got this app mostly out of curiosity from all the ads about it. Although the ads were annoying, they were promising so I decided to give it a shot. I do not regret doing so. Although you can pay or sign up for more content, the app already provides enough to help you calm down without any extra fuss. As a student with depression and anxiety, this app helps me calm down when I am having a difficult time. Never have I seen an app that sticks to its namesake more than this one. Trust me, get this app. It‚Äôs free, it‚Äôs good, and it‚Äôs worth it.
title: Better than I expected

review: I really enjoy this app. Bought it a year ago and just started using it. I'm pretty sure I bought the expensive one so when I updated my app after 7 days of use I found it extremely frustrating that they locked me out of some of the session I was already using. Luckily I have the app one my iPad and iPhone and will definitely not be updating the one on my iPhone. Shame on you, developers. These sessions should be grandfathered in seeing I already paid for them. Add some new ones and lock those for alll I care!! Don't lock me out of sessions I'm already using. I won't be renewing my subscription. Will look for new apps.
title: Locked features after subscription!???

review: I was miserable at night due to my insomnia. Then I discovered the 25 minute body scan. I either am so awake that I listen to the whole scan, which at least relaxes me, or somehow the sound of her voice lulls me to sleep, or back to sleep. Its so typical of my monkey mind that sometimes I worry that the body scan app will be discontinued or the app won't be around, and then I'd be lost again. Then I'd be  back to Ambien, which I hardly use anymore, and horrible, sleepy, sick-feeling days!!! Time to listen to the app again, right? Thank you for such a great app!
title: The body scan improves my nights!

review:
I actually get headspace for free through work and have tried many others.

I come back to this one because none of them have the daily content Tamara puts out. I have no idea how she comes up with something new every day.

The other features of these apps are pretty comparable - lots of cool stuff to check out like bedtime stories , specific types of meditation, music, etc.  also works on watch, I like to break during a run sometimes.
title: I‚Äôve tried them all - best of the meditation apps

review: Jeff Warren has a very strong but kind way iof teaching. In all my listening to his meditations I have learned something. Sometimes I listen to same message many times because feelings he encourages to feel but doesn‚Äôt insist upon it are feelings I could never say to myself. This message on balance is so helpful. I have always felt unbalanced that is why concentration is so hard but when it is put the way Jeff puts it I don‚Äôt get so angry with myself when I feel my balance is off. I am very greatful. flowerpot
title: Balance

review: I have enjoyed this app for 3 years. My daughter recently moved to attend college and I recommended she try it. I offered to look into getting the Family Plan (since she‚Äôs a broke college student). None of the information on the Help page actually helped me upgrade my subscription to a family plan. Nothing offered on the App Store. And, there appeared to be no way to get a hold of a live person to ask for help. I am greatly disappointed in their lack of customer service.
title: Sucky customer service

review:
Most features are locked if you don‚Äôt have premium, but to be honest I don‚Äôt care because for me the Check-Ins help me take out the stress of the day. You can add a note of all the things that make you stressed, check how well you sleep and why and even help remove those things, helps you reflect on all the things you are thankful for ( which helps so much more that you would think).

The stories however that are unlocked are the most relaxing and nice. The only thing that helps me sleep.

I haven‚Äôt tried many meditations but I do prefer to start my day with those because they help me have a better outlook on the day and help me remember that today is a new day, make it better that your last.

Overall the best app I‚Äôve used to help me sleep, my mood has improved so much is a couple days.

 Thank you!

‚ú®A Friend You Didn‚Äôt Know You Had ‚ú®
title: Best App For Anxiety

review: I got this app thinking that I would get better sleep and not be tired all the time‚Ä¶ I was wrong!! You guys charge way too much for the subscription and I‚Äôm so done because I am going through these reviews and there are tons saying that they can‚Äôt afford it and you respond with,‚Äù email us for any questions or concerns.‚Äù THIS APP MAKES ME SO MAD!!!ü§¨you guys expect people to pay for good sleep?!! I‚Äôm sorry but you guys need to fix this I need better sleep but I don‚Äôt wanna have to pay for it because I can‚Äôt control if I need a sleep app to help me a little bit to fall asleep!! Please at least make half of the stuff available and half of the stuff premium so that you can still listen and do stuff without having to PAY for mental health!!!
title: I‚Äôm D-O-N-E, DONE!!

review:
1.I came to this sight via a friend...my life had been experiencing my first divorce and it was such a painful experience. But the Daily Calm was my wake up daily call.....thank you so much for these moments!

2. Here I am months later still using this wonderful way to Calm as it‚Äôs my way of starting my day! I get the coffee ready sit down for a moment and quiet myself and go through the morning ritual of sitting quiet listening to the news making sure the world is stable and then turning on Calm and taking a moment to meditate!
title: Appreciation.........even months Later!!

review: Whenever the manic pace and daily stress of life pushes my brain into overdrive, careening from all that did not get done today and bouncing off all that must be done tomorrow, the soothing music and simplistic sounds of nature embrace the soul ever so gently.  Somehow my mind  is transported to simpler times and back to a place of Calm.  As stress is gradually replaced with a sense of well-being, my entire spirit is regenerated and healed.  What a wonderful gateway to peace.  In this state of being fully present,  I am once again centered on all that is truly important in this journey of life!   All else falls away... Thanks Calm!  I needed that...
title: Insomnia‚Äôs antedote

review: I battle with my health a lot and in turn am very sleep deprived. So I thought i‚Äôd check this out. When I downloaded it pretty much all if it was locked. I am a minor and can't afford to spend $70 a year on this. I assume that if you actually pay you do get a good experience, though coming from someone that can't, it is very disappointing to be given such few options. I am glad some are getting good sleep from this app, but I just thought I'd warn those that can't spend.
title: I can‚Äôt use it

review: I really love most of the meditations on Calm. I have paid for the premium edition. I have a problem I have read others have. I don‚Äôt want to be be mean, but I can stand the tone and inflection of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice. It seems disingenuously upbeat and fake. It actually makes me cringe and I try to avoid things she narrates. It‚Äôs extremely hard because she seems to be the lead person. Does she have to do the Daily Calm every day? Please get different narrators with soothing voices. I am not sure if I will renew next year if you don‚Äôt. Thanks
title: Mostly good content, but needs more teachers

review: I absolutely love this app & what it is all about, it‚Äôs just so frustrating that EVERYTHING is locked after the first session. You find meditations that you think are for the free version, and you take the first lesson and the rest are locked until you pay for the subscription. Just make your app cost something instead of making people think they can benefit from this without paying. The only thing you can actually do is 7 days of calm, & timed meditations. All the other meditations are locked.
title: I would like to give this app 5 stars...

review:
‚ÄúTake a deep breath‚Äù was the last calm moment. I had to sign up for a free trial to get into the app. It wasn‚Äôt what I wanted. I can‚Äôt listen to videos when my spouse finds noise annoying. There‚Äôs a breathing animation, but I have that for free on my Apple Watch. 

When I tried to cancel the free subscription 5 minutes after downloading, it signed me up for a $84 years subscription, WHICH I CAN‚ÄôT CANCEL!!!  I have spent 2 hours so far and will have many more hours, I predict, from Apple and my bank before I get the charge removed. I am furious, and very far from calm. 

Needless to say, I deleted the app. $89 a year (what‚Äôs on my credit card) for cheap videos of someone reading stories, a breathing video that I have for free elsewhere, and music. I have no idea why it received an ‚ÄúEditors Choice‚Äù.
title: Scam. Expensive scam.

developerResponse: {'id': 2340962, 'body': "Sorry for the trouble! This issue has been resolved. If you're still having trouble, email support@calm.com and we'll look into this for you!", 'modified': '2018-01-19T03:09:14Z'}
review: Calm is broken. Since the latest update, the app will not open on my iPhone 7 Plus or iPad Air, both running iOS 11.2. This morning, I deleted and reinstalled the app on the iPad. Now when I try to log in, Calm tells me to try again when I have a faster Internet connection! Speedtest app shows my speed to be 193 mbps!! Surely that is fast enough for Calm. Now I am screwed because I have an annual subscription to Calm which I am certain cannot be refunded and I cannot use the app. So sorry to see something I really used and enjoyed go bad.
title: A good idea gone wrong

review:
I've been using this app for about 5 months and it has become my drug of choice. It fixes everything. 3:00 stress at work? Daily calm. Too stressed to sleep? Daily calm. In laws in town? Daily calm.
I rarely stick with anything this long, and I recommend it to literally everyone. I'm a type A working mom/weekend warrior/philanthropist/marathon runner/etc who found myself suddenly able to get out of bed. There was so much going on in my head I didn't know which way to move. Once I started Calm I was able to breathe again. I've learned to understand my emotions and calm myself. Flight cancelled and stuck in Miami? It's ok. I've learned how to breathe. Like today's Calm said, it's the tortoise who wins the race.
When I can't find my footing, I listen to a Daily Calm.
The guide's voice is also excellent. Not annoying. It's just right.
The length is just right.
The guidance is just right.
Thank you so very much!
title: Life Saving for Chronic Fatigue and Insomnia

review: It might be hard to get into, but if you commit to this app it will pay you back in many, many ways. Personally, I struggle with anxiety, as well having issues with self-esteem and self-degradation. When my therapist recommended this to me, at first I was skeptical, especially considering the financial commitment. But once I gave this app a chance I was not disappointed. Don't expect immediate results; it will take work to be life-changing. But by putting in the effort you will truly improve yourself with time and patience.
title: An average of 5 stars is too low for this app

review: I lost my husband suddenly last year. Mornings were the worst part of my day for months & months. I found the music on the Calm app helped soothe & settle my racing thoughts & emotions. I wasn‚Äôt sleeping well so I always woke very early, I would sit on my deck with a cup of coffee & stare out at the fields & empty my mind of everything but the soothing music & beautiful scenery. Thank you Calm for helping me through the hardest year of my life! I have used this music on long flights & middle of the night worry sessions to help me find a bit of serenity.
title: Morning Calm

review:
PLEASE allow users to delete unwanted stories!!!!!
i have had this app for a couple of years. I enjoy the non-fiction sleep stories almost exclusively and my sleep has improved since purchasing the app. Many of the narrators are superb! I wish that they would allow you to remove the stories that you don‚Äôt care for from the ‚Äúplaylist‚Äù so you wouldn‚Äôt have to sift through them each time you look for something you want to listen to! This expensive app should be more customizable !!!
title: needs options for customization

review: Calm offers an array of possibilities for transitioning to sleep. My favorite is the sleep story. Stories often take you somewhere else and bring it to life, sometimes back in time. You might learn about an ancient guitar maker or the woman who showed how metamorphosis worked in her botanical drawings - real people you can look up and feel you already know from the story. Some of the meditations are really helpful. I use a headband with earphones in it so I don‚Äôt disturb my husband. A lovely idea well executed.
title: Enjoying the Trip to Dreamland

review:
I‚Äôve been using the Calm app for over two years now, and wouldn‚Äôt want to be without it! 

The ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù is a great meditation training tool and all-around positive influence on my daily life. I love to alternate it with Jeff Warren‚Äôs ‚ÄúDaily Trip‚Äù, for his wonderful, down-to-earth approaches meditation. 

Calm is  continually adding great new content,  making it increasingly valuable. It is an amazing and powerful resource. Sleep stories are great, and when I‚Äôm wired up at bedtime, the sleep meditations help me relax and drift off to sleep. I highly recommend Calm!!
title: Great Meditation App

review: I was introduced to meditation in my teens in India by my father and various other teachers but after moving out of India more than a decade ago I lost touch with my practice with life getting busier and and busier. I was not able to find time and a good instructor( I enjoy guided mediations) but then I came across Calm and Tamara Levitt! I enjoy her 10 min daily calms where she offers great breathing techniques and wisdom in each session. These 10 mins a day have put me back in the habit. You will find good sleep stories,guided mediations and amazing music here!
title: Love it!

review: My experience with calm has been amazing. It‚Äôs great for people like insomniacs and students with busy lives and nights filled with stress and worry. It has helped me a night owl to want to go to sleep and even sleep better!! I love calm but the one thing I really wish was better is the voices and music, there all amazing but sometimes to loud! so loud that I can‚Äôt get it to a point where it‚Äôs just right maybe I just have sensitive ears? Over all calm is a great experience and you should definitely give it a Try.ü§ó‚ò∫Ô∏èüëçüëç‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏èüß∏
title: Calm

review:
The calm app is one of the best resources you will ever come across. There are so many ways to use it. The lessons learned are insightful and encouraging. It‚Äô s like having a new best friend that you can access no matter the time of day. It has definitely helped me learn how to deal with anxiety. My sleep has improved as well. I love the sleep stories, the meditations, the daily meditations, and all of the other applications. It‚Äôs always being updated.
Do yourself a favor and give it a try. You‚Äôll be happy you did!
title: Calm app

review: I only wish that Calm would diversify the  voices and narrators for the daily meditations. Having the same person for all of them is a bummer, especially because her voice is kind of annoying. Some voices just are for some people, and for others they are perfect, which is why I would love it if Calm used different voice actors for that section, they way they do with the sleep stories. Other than that, I love Calm! Highly recommend it! Use it almost everyday. üôÇ
title: Wonderful sleep Stories

review: As a graduate student in law school, stress is a major factor in my everyday life. Meditation has been a game changer for me. I complete a session in the morning to start my day. I have never been happier or more relaxed in my life. Just give meditation a shot, especially with the calm app, and you will be so very glad you did. In today‚Äôs crazy and fast-paced world, taking a few minutes out of your day in mindfulness with provide you with priceless benefits. The Calm app is so easy to use and has a plethora of content. 5/5 recommend!
title: Absolutely incredible. Changed my life.

review:
I would like to know that I have Calm premium now on the app & I was wondering if you have any sleeping noise machine available also on the app.

Now that I have it I will go through of how you‚Äôre feeling, Breathing exercise and Learn the basics of mindfulness medication. I would love to know if you have the sleeping on the app. I can‚Äôt find the sleeping without talking & just sleeping calmly. All it does the narrator talks every time. I don‚Äôt have control over that?? Can someone please explain about this app Calm. I would love to know if you have the noise machine which is sleeping
title: Re: Sleeping

review:
My first review of this app was filled with praise for its well-designed interface and content. That still rings true! Total
You‚Äôll be impressed from the start! The bigger, more important, picture is how transformative the content of the app can be for your life and for the lives around you! Not only do I benefit greatly from the mediations, music selections, and master classes, but the students benefit from having a teacher with a more mindful outlook on life.  I cannot thank you enough for this experience!
title: Life changing!

review: I‚Äôm a critical care nurse. I work long hours often punctuated by adrenaline and stress. I‚Äôve also struggled on and off with insomnia since I was a kid. The app is a fantastic resource to have in my pocket, both at work & after. I always go to bed with my phone, often using it in ways that make rest harder as I try to will myself into being tired. This is the perfect replacement behavior‚Äî bad sleep hygiene habits naturally swapped out with better ones through the same medium I‚Äôve been using at bedtime for years. Totally worth the premium subscription.
title: Worth it.

review: I love this app, I never thought I would actually try and meditate because I never thought it would have an impact on my life. I was wrong, it changed everything for the best. But for sleep I light to listen to ‚ÄúThunderstorm‚Äù, only thing I don‚Äôt like about it is the thunder isn‚Äôt loud enough. I like to listen to loud thunder or sudden sounds when I sleep but it‚Äôs hard to find this kind of stuff when there isn‚Äôt a search bar. I would love this app even more if there was one. I hope I‚Äôm not the only one. Thanks for such a great app!
title: I love it, just a request

review: I recently hurt the feelings of someone I was close to by being mindless and not upholding my end of responsibility. In apologizing I asked what I could do. It was asked that I work on getting better. I took this to heart. Another friend told me his therapist recommended this app. It has been worth the price as I am feeling myself becoming less chaotic and more stable. It‚Äôs nice to have something to do to work on bettering my life. It‚Äôs nice to be guided and kept on a schedule. I especially like the mindfulness class on relationships with others. It‚Äôs worth it. You are worth it. üçÉ
title: Recomended by a friend

developerResponse: {'id': 6506485, 'body': 'Hi there, thanks for the message and I‚Äôm sorry to hear you did not enjoy the app. If you have any additional feedback to help us improve, please send us an email to support@calm.com.', 'modified': '2018-12-21T23:51:27Z'}
review: I want to love this app; but I don‚Äôt. I like aspects of it but I don‚Äôt love it. Anything by Tamara Levitt I have to skip. Unfortunately, her voice is grating, nasal and it sounds flippant, often too perky‚Äîespecially in the sleep meditations or sleep stories‚Äîand cloying. I wish there were options to choose different voices on a particular meditation. I primarily got this app for the sleep meditations‚Ä¶ And all but one seems to be lead by Tamara. I enjoy some of the sleep stories, but it‚Äôs the same there as well,  these narrators need to mellow out...we‚Äôre trying to wind-down. I may not keep my subscription if they don‚Äôt expand to provide voice/speed choices, especially with the hefty price tag!
title: Mixed bag

review: I love the sleep stories. They usually put me right to sleep, and if I don‚Äôt fall sleep within the story, I‚Äôm so relaxed that I fall asleep soon after. The only reason I gave this app a 4 and not a 5 is because you can‚Äôt just purchase single sleep stories; you have to get a monthly subscription. So, I‚Äôve been listening to the same 2 free stories since I found this app. Now it‚Äôs just 1 free story. I don‚Äôt need a monthly subscription, but if you need this to help fall asleep every night, then I guess the subscription might be worth it. Message to the Calm app people: Let us purchase single stories. Please!
title: Sleep Stories

review: Here is a excerpt from my meditation journal ‚ÄúI like to meditate and relax to a slower state and before the calm app, I was not able to do this on my own. The calm app was recommended by my counselor and had definitely helped in aiding me to begin my journey of self. For that I am grateful, for the awakening. Happiness is in the now. I have a great life worth living. And oh, there is magic if you are in the moment, you only need to concentrate‚Äù. <- I would not even be able to relate to this person a couple months ago. Thank you Calm for breaking chains and binding up hearts! I love this app!!!
title: Essential for Anxiety

review: The Calm app is one I try to use daily. It's incredibly user-friendly and gives me all I need to destress for my day. There are plenty of free meditation sessions but it also offers other more advanced guided sessions for a fee. My children LOVED the bedtime stories sessions - it really helped them to calm down before bed. My favorite feature is the ability to change out the sensory-style home screen to whichever "live-action" scene you choose with the associated relaxing sound. They have now added music as another great option to help meditate.
title: Everyone should have Calm

review: This app is amazing. The sleep stories are super helpful when I‚Äôm trying to drift off to sleep but need something to focus on for a little to keep my mind from wandering. While I love the app for its wonderful calming music and the sleep stories, I wish it has a timer for the music/sounds you can choose on the main page. I want nothing more than to fall asleep to the calming music or the cracking fire, but I always end up waking up later on in the night and eventually turning it off. I wish there were a timer for it so I could set the soothing sounds and have it turn off on its own.
title: Please add a timer!

developerResponse: {'id': 3900067, 'body': 'Hi there, we do offer a free version of the app in addition to our premium subscription. If you are having trouble finding the free content, please reach out to support@calm.com so we can help you out!', 'modified': '2018-06-19T22:34:59Z'}
review: The sheer amount of apps now that are ‚Äúfree‚Äù but to access them you need to pay for a subscription is ridiculous and this is just one more to add to the list. I can‚Äôt access a single thing without doing the free week trial. It‚Äôs so frustrating to find a half decent app but to not be able to afford such a large subscription rate. If it was more accessible I would absolutely purchase certain things as I had money for them but I can‚Äôt dedicate so much money to year long subscriptions. I would still keep this app if even only the daily calm was the only thing you could freely access and limiting it to once per day. If I want to keep a specific one and be able to purchase them individually that would be an app I‚Äôd be happy to keep.
title: Useless without money.

review: As someone who used to struggle with, and occasionally still does, emotional regulation, intrusive thoughts, and so much else, this app has changed my life. I look forward to each meditation, listening to the soundscapes at bedtime, and all the other little treats that this app has in store for us. It‚Äôs great. I feel like I‚Äôm actually making a change in my life through the practices this app has help me put in place in my life. Thank you devs - so much - for coming up with something so life changing.
title: Life changer

review: I have depression and anxiety. I have been seeing a therapist, studying up on self help books, and trying to watch meditation videos online. This app was recommended to me on Facebook and I'm so glad. I've only been using it for a few days, but the guidance in the sessions makes me feel not so alone on this journey. The guidance and varieties of meditation on the app is lovely. I also listened to one of their sleep stories and didn't even realize I had fallen asleep until I woke up the next morning. I'd really recommend this to anyone new to meditation or looking for some self help and/or self love.
title: Something new, different, and helpful

review: I use Calm in the morning for meditation, daily Jay for inspiration and Mel for movement which gives me energy and gets me ready for the day. Using my Calm app every day keeps me in alignment with my goals and finding my peace early in the day. I look forward toUsing my Calm app each morning. I use the sleep stories and meditations for sleep when I go to bed and if I wake up in the night I turn them on again and it definitely leads to peace and allows for better sleep. Highly recommend calm app
title: Great start to my day

review: I started using this app because my psychiatrist highly recommended it I am extremely grateful to her. The guided meditations have changed my life, you‚Äôll hear comforting words that you need, that those around you may not be able to offer. I 100% believe this should be a part of everyday life and it so easy to use everything is perfectly titled. Even when baby sitting I put the kids calm on and they actually like it! Thanks calm!
title: This is a must for every family member to have

review:
First off the app makes it look like you must sign in using email, google, Facebook, apple but as soon as you click the X it bypasses. Why not just have an option to say ‚ÄúI‚Äôd rather not create a profile right now‚Äù? Instead you are using what feels like a ‚ÄúDark Pattern‚Äù to collect user data before letting users into the app. 

Second, once you get passed the sign-up it wants you to subscribe with a seven day free trial. Really, let me look at the app first. And your pricing?!? 

Third, once I‚Äôm in there‚Äôs really nothing that I can find to try out that‚Äôs actually free. Clicking everything on the screen takes me to the Sign Up for Subscription. And on top of that the subscription isn‚Äôt really cheap, I mean it‚Äôs super pricy for what this app is supposed to do. 

Overall the app feels like it‚Äôs out to collect your data and take your cash but for what? The pricing is way too high for what this app is supposed to do. At one time it may have been a good app, it won an award like five years ago but since then it must have gone down hill. 

I‚Äôll have to pass on this one people‚Ä¶
title: Kinda Sleezy

review:
I‚Äôm obsessed. I opened this app months ago and couldn‚Äôt commit to the yearly payment; however, I thought to myself that my therapy sessions are $10 less than this app and if I‚Äôm willing to pay some guy to talk to me each month, then certainly I can pay for this app that will help me on my journey to self clarity and gratefulness. I wasn‚Äôt quite ready before, but happy to be here now!

Best app ever- I promise I‚Äôm a reallll regular person. This app is the top notch app of our time.
title: Cool App. Truly unlike any other. Kudos to the design team!

review:
I used the free version of Calm for a year before I got the paid version. I wanted to make sure I was going to consistently use it. During that first year I used it almost every night!

And I still do. It has proven to be the most consistent method of helping me fall asleep. The stories are engaging (well the part I hear before I doze off), the variety of narrators is excellent, and there are always new stories being added.

If you have any trouble sleeping, do yourself a favor and get Calm.
title: Do yourself a favor

review:
Add your commercials to the app ‚Ä¶. Even if I have to play the 30seconds one on loop ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs so relaxing to try to relax for sleep ‚Ä¶. I love actually looking at rain flowing down and hearing it ‚Ä¶. Ocean too ‚Ä¶ lately I‚Äôve not been going to my app but more on your Instagram so I can see those videos again ‚Ä¶ even the sand one with the poking sticks going inside while it‚Äôs going in circles 

Please add those videos and make it a wonderful one stop shop for relaxation ‚Ä¶ u can make a tab ‚Äúquick on the go relax‚Äù ‚Ä¶ I love the app already and this will make it phenomenal
title: Wonderful app but add one thing

review:
Relax as you calmly drift off to a peaceful sleep with Calm...it works wonders! I have been sleeping much better lately since I downloaded Calm. And I need beauty sleep! Anyway, listen to stories that are so serene, they make you fall asleep in a sentence of them. The Calm songs have a relaxing beat to them that you can just lie there, listening to music, or just drift off to a relaxing sleep! 
Calm, thank you for everything you do, we love you, always, and hope you keep updates going. You have my moral support. ‚ò∫Ô∏è
title: Calm For All

review:
For an app that is supposed to create calmness this app sure does cause a lot of stress and annoyances. 

First songs do not always load when clicked on. Often times I‚Äôm having to close out the app and reopen it in order to play the song/sounds I want. Second. The UI is way too cluttered after the UI change. No quick access to my favorites and way too many categories and too much going on. 

Clean up the interface. Simple is better especially for a calmness app. Fix your ongoing problem of songs not loading. That should be a basic operation of a music playing app.
title: App continues its decline

review: I love this app. Some nights I drift away to the gentle sound of the ocean, mesmerized as each wave invites me to enter uninterrupted sleep. My favorite is the crickets and meadow stream; I feel like I am camping and the song of the crickets shut out every stressful thought that tries to infringe on much needed rest. The purring cat is soothing during the day, and comforting when I am alone grading papers. I pass on the washing machine and do not find it relaxing. Anyone that enjoys the sounds of nature or struggles with insomnia needs this app. I am sleeping better than I have for years.
title: Amazing sleep every night!

review: I love this app. The only thing that would improve is being able to have a que for listening.  So I could do a short meditation, that immediately goes into a sleep story, then  turn on one of the sound scapes.  If I‚Äôm on the edge of sleeping but the story ends and I realize it,  I will wake up to put another one on.  I use the sound scapes a lot to drown out noise that wakes me up, but that doesn‚Äôt work if I fall asleep listening to a sleep story.  So makers please add this feature.  I can‚Äôt be the only one that would like this.
title: Awesome app, needs one improvement

review:
I tired maybe 10 different meditations apps and after nearly a whole year of searching, I decided on this one. Even got the lifetime subscription for it since I personally hate to add to my monthly expenses and feel a lot more relaxed knowing that I‚Äôm not wasting my money by not using it ‚Äúenough‚Äù in a month.

It has bells, nature sounds, music, stories, pretty backgrounds, it looks nice and it‚Äôs quite polished for an app. And yes, it has a good meditation collection as well as new daily ones. 

Some suggestions for future updates:

More nature sounds and higher resolution backgrounds.  Casting this app on tv would be great too. And I definitely would not complain if you would add binaural sounds option for those of us with headphones.

Overall, if anyone out there is still hesitating on which meditation/calming app to get, I would say: just get this one. It‚Äôs good and it gets updated regularly.
title: Best of them all

review: Last night my kids were bouncing of the walls, crying, arguing and complaining and doing anything not to sleep.  I had read to them and let them listen to their audible book, but they refused to relax into sleep. I sat down in their room, told them to lay down, but they were incapable of quieting, so I turned on the meditation gently to sleep and within 10 mins we were all falling asleep. Haha! I tried to leave then and my 9 year old said she was still awake calmly and half asleep. 5 more minutes and she was out.
title: My kids went to sleep!

review: I have found great calm and concentration from meditating, although, it often is helpful to have a guiding voice. I download calm and am inundated with ‚Äúyou NEED to turn on push notifications‚Äù, ‚Äúset a mindful reminder‚Äù, ‚Äúrate us now‚Äù, ‚Äúdo a daily check-in‚Äù AHHHHHH! All I‚Äôd like to see is good content and not a junk app which breeds anxiety with trying to hug you to death. I love this concept. I don‚Äôt like the main individual, I find the daily calm to be almost pontificating how to sit, think, and be. It‚Äôs more instructive and for some dude who just wants to relax it‚Äôs frustrating being told how to be. I know it‚Äôs all in good faith but cmon ppl this is like a drugstore selling cigarettes.
title: Great concept now commercialized!

review:
This app seems to make me feel better so far. It‚Äôs calming. I wish that there was more free things. I would pay for the subscription but that‚Äôs a lot of money every year, and your not getting much. I‚Äôll stick with the free stuff, though it‚Äôs not much. I wish that you could listen to free sounds and listen to more free meditations. Over all this app is set up really well and is stress reliving. I love the mood check in‚Äôs. It‚Äôs nice to write what your feeling. I also like to use the breath bubble. Please make more free things, I would enjoy this app %100 if you did. ü•∫ü•∫ü•∫ 

Update:

This app is making me happier!!! I LOVE IT.
title: üôÇ

review: Hi I have anxiety and I recently downloaded this app for sudden anxiety attacks,meditations,and for easy sleep. I honestly thought that calm would be like any other meditation app. But I was proven wrong. Calm really connects with their consumers. One day I was on a road trip and I remember having a anxiety attack about something I just simply taped on a meditation and it worked so well I‚Äôm so soososososoosos happy I downloaded calm. And paying every month for exclusive meditations, sleep stories, and soothing sounds is SO worth it. Thank you developers at calm for making life easy!ü§óüíúüëç
title: Amazing and works great

review: I absolutely am obsessed with this app. OBSESSED. I have ADHD, high anxiety and insomnia. The story ‚ÄúWonder‚Äù told by Matthew McConaughey is a GAME CHANGER! I was blown away and could of sworn he hypnotized me or something because I have never been able to ever fall asleep as fast and as sound as I did. I listen to it every single night. I couldn‚Äôt tell you what the story is really about or the end of it because I am OUT by at least half way through. I love this app so much and I am very pleased with the purchase and even the cost. Love love love love love!!!!!
title: GAME CHANGER!!!!!!!

review:
The Calm app is one of my favorite apps. I like the 10 minute meditations. It‚Äôs like hitting ‚Äúrefresh‚Äù for the mind. It‚Äôs easy for my mind to go down the rabbit hole of negativity. I reset it with a short meditation. 
     It also offers other features like sleep meditations or stories, focused meditations for anxiety, relationships, personal growth, and more. It allows you to select what you need. That maybe music or nature sounds or longer meditations.
     The app is designed well, is easy to use, and functions without crashes or problems.
     Enjoy Calm.
title: Reset your mind

review:
So, I‚Äôve seen the ads for this app, and I‚Äôm deeply disappointed üòî. I love that you can personalize it and stuff, it even gives you a Q&A beforehand, so they know what‚Äôs right for you. I get done with the questions, and open it up, before I look at ANY of the stories, it asked me to get a subscription..... and I thought that subscriptions were optional (that‚Äôs were I was wrong), I started looking at all the stories and I see that EVERY SINGLE ONE is locked until you subscribe. Not a single story is free.
And I was really excited to get this app, and it was a complete disappointment. I just feel like there needs to be a ‚Äúfree stories ‚Äù section for the people (like myself) who can‚Äôt afford a subscription.
title: I didn‚Äôt even get to try it......

review: I love this app and recommend it to anyone who need some calm in their life. However, I‚Äôm very displeased with all the name dropping of famous people. Today‚Äôs meditation quoted Taylor Swift and a few before quoted LeBron James. This seems very commercial and unnecessary. I use this app to help get away from the world and find myself being extremely irritated by the included quotes, which I can only assume are included merely because they are famous and perhaps giving money to the company. If I wanted nuggets of wisdom from famous people I would follow them on Instagram or Twitter. In my opinion, this app is just becoming another platform for rich and influential people. It makes me sad.
title: I love, but... name dropping... ugh

review: I used to have a sound machine as a kid that I almost found it impossible to sleep without it. To this day I have to have some kind of background noise in order to sleep. I just downloaded the app today and I was absolutely amazed by it. It is exactly what I have been looking for. The very first time I opened the app, I got this deep warmth within my soul that I just couldn‚Äôt shake. It made me more relaxed within 5 minutes than I could do on my own. The sounds seem to be endless and I am going to enjoy this app for years to come.
title: What happened to me???

review: So I was looking into apps that help make relaxing noise to study to, and this app is a gem. Little did I know that it had free meditation lectures as well. Harvard did a study and linked meditation sessions like these to a long list of positive results. For the list, check it out (for free) meditation day 1 of 7 in a 10 minute audio session. It literally brought tears to my eyes the first time I meditated successfully with it's help. Awesome app. Special shout out to all involved in the making of this app. Thank you! I hope more positivity is to come. :D
title: Great app. It just gets better and better!

review: This app has been life changing. I‚Äôve dealt with anxiety all my life and I‚Äôve always known meditation could help me handle it. But, for me, meditation has always been this elusive practice that I could never get in to. Until now. This app has made developing a realistic meditation practice a reality. I do a 10-minute session every morning, and spend several one-minute chunks breathing throughout my day while watching one of the landscapes. Finally, I end my day with a sleep story, some music, or another meditation. It‚Äôs been simply awesome. Thanks so much for this app!!
title: Life Changing!!

review: This is one of those classic apps where you can‚Äôt really do anything with the app‚Äôs features unless you ‚Äúunlock‚Äù them or pay for them. BUUUUUT on the other hand‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..if you‚Äôre going through a difficult time, this may help. It has many great features to help with your mental health like breathing routines (üí°gr8 b4 bedüîç), quizzes, noises to fall asleep to, podcasts and more. An easy to use app like this is a great way to start getting into habit of taking care of your mental health.
title: Worth it if you‚Äôre willing to pay

review: I think you should have more options for people who can afford your app. Anxiety and mental health is a real thing! I would love using the app if there more options then me having to pay for. Most people who having mental health don‚Äôt have the option or the means to pay for little things like this that could help more than you could image. Start sponsoring ads and have us watch some ads to unlock some features (like most apps do) stop trying to earn money off of people‚Äôs mental health problems!
title: For us poor people with anxiety

review: I really like this app. It allows you to be able to meditate, practice mindfulness, listen to sounds when trying to fall asleep, and practice techniques to work on anxiety and stress. Not only that, it is very aesthectically pleaasing to the eye. This app is easy to navigate through. I also like that this app is availavle for people of all ages to use. I suggest using the 7-day free trial to see if you want to pay for it, or if you just want to stick with the free app.
title: Great App!

review:
Largely, I love this app and it has saved my sleep! That said, the new way sleep stories are categorized is a miss. I just want fiction, nonfiction, travel, trains, nature etc.. 
Also, and I really hate saying this because I‚Äôm sure Tamara is a lovely person, but a lot of us (check Reddit) find her voice irritating and she narrates a large majority of the meditations offered. I use a different app because her approach is like a Disney caricature of the ‚Äúyoga voice‚Äù. I‚Äôd love to hear just normal, down to earth, grounded, real voices by instructors who aren‚Äôt performative.
title: Simple catalogues and less Tamara please! (Sorry Tamara)

review: The Calm app has been incredibly helpful for me to develop a mediation practice. I had tried off and on for over 20 years to try to Set aside time and develop a meditation practice, but it has never been very consistent for me until I started using the Calm app. Having the ability to turn into a daily meditation and set goals to complete the meditation programs has given me the framework to develop a consistent practice. If you are struggling with motivation, dedication, or education about beginning a meditation practice, I highly recommend the Calm app.
title: immensely helpful

review: I can‚Äôt even start with how bad this app is. I will not pay for something that is supposed to be given once you download the app. It is one thing for maybe half the content to be locked unless you  buy it but it is another thing for 99% of the content to be locked. I found three sleep stories that were unlocked and they would put you to sleep not because they were calming and relaxing it boring and dull. There was literally a story called the rules of tennis. I would love this app if I didn‚Äôt have to pay for most of the things I should get for free. I do not recommend this app if you are not willing to pay for the content. This app was more trouble that it was worth.
title: This app is not worth the hassle

review: My teacher had my classmates and I try this out whenever the class was getting rowdy and they were ruining there experience by talking over one of the meditation sessions and so I decided to try this app out on my own. Everything I tapped on literally came up with this thing talking about getting calm premium and there was barely anything free and at this point, I just felt like this whole calm premium thing was getting shoved down my throat. Despite that problem, I love the concept of this app and if anyone is reading this review, you should totally get this app if you plan on spending money on itüíñ
title: Meh..

review: I was quite skeptical of all meditation therapy until a close friend said we should look into it as we have similar problems with anxiety and/or panic attacks. I‚Äôm going to honestly say I downloaded this and barely remember but after I did a few sessions it‚Äôs something that is detrimental to me getting through the week with positive mental health. Calm has been one of the larger catalysts to me slowing my attacks and anxiety to almost zero. If I‚Äôm unable to meditate I can still pull Tamara‚Äôs voice from my head and focus on my breath! Def reccomend!
title: Calm helps me through the week

review: So, I got this app for sleep. My teacher mentioned the sleep stories.  The sleep stories have totally helped me get to sleep faster. Once you get into the mind frame to listen it is my experience within 10-20 min you‚Äôre asleep. I actually now have explored the app more and the mediation part is awesome.  I used to use another app that used a lot of cartoons to convey ideas but this app is more my style where people talk and you listen.  Also, there‚Äôs a section for moving the body with videos.  This is definitely the best app out there.

review: So far I‚Äôve done 114 sessions of the evening sleep process. Although I don‚Äôt do it exactly as prescribed where it says you should do your 10 minute meditation in a chair I actually do you mine lying in bed.  It‚Äôs the first thing I do before I go to sleep. After the 10 minute meditation I roll over on my side and listen to the sleep story. I rarely hear the entire sleep story before I‚Äôm fast asleep. Spoiler alert, I do take a sleeping pill and this practice seems to make it more effective. Looking forward to investigating more that the App has to offer.
title: Beginners View

review:
This app is amazing.  Tamara had the most soothing voice and she is a great guide for meditation.  Whether you want to do just the daily calms or do one of the 7 day programs, they will all change you in some way shape or form.  I live in NYC and take the train every day to work, which tends to be very stressful.  Ever since I started using this app to meditate, I‚Äôve noticed that I don‚Äôt get angry or frustrated anymore when the train is delayed.  I just listen to my music and go about my day :)

If you‚Äôre looking for some calm in your life, Tamara can help you get it!
title: Finally at Peace

review:
I was resisting meditation for a very long time. I can‚Äôt get enough of it now with this app! I tell everyone about it. You‚Äôre doing yourself an injustice by not subscribing to the full features. The 21 days of calm got me hooked. The guide and the lessons are well thought out and really work. My only wish is that they were a little longer :)
The app has so many features with the subscription that I haven‚Äôt even discovered all of them yet!
Enjoy your day and I hope this review helped you make a good choice for yourself and your wellbeing. üòä
title: A MUST HAVE

review: I have the free sessions that Calm provides with the download of the app and I like it so far. I like that there are series to stay caught up with and that it tells you how long you meditated, how many sessions you‚Äôve completed and your daily streak. It allows me to focus on trying to meditate at least once a day. I also enjoy the fact that you can set a reminder to meditate at the same time each day. The voices that guide you through are also very enjoyable. If I continue to enjoy the app I plan on purchasing a subscription.

If you want to learn how to meditate, I assume you have to pay but I am not going to spend money to find out it is no better than the free. And, I did like the scenes and sounds I thought were relaxing and could help if I learn to meditate somewhere else. But, now I have access to only 3 of them.  Do I have to pay to get the others? No thanks. The master classes seemed interesting, but you have to pay (once again). You could probably find some things on-line to read or in video for free. Did not pay a penny and so glad I did not. These seems like it is the biggest rip-off. What I want to know is how much Calm paid to get such a high rating.
title: Awful

review:
I‚Äôve loved Calm for years, but the latest update broke the app on my iPad. Now when I go to play a sleep story and close the lid on my iPad, within 10 seconds the story stops playing. If I leave the cover open, when the screen timeout goes to sleep, the story stops playing. I can tell you this frustration is the opposite of Calmness. Please fix it soon and I‚Äôll change my rating to 5 stars.

Update: They fixed the bug I reported to their support team.
title: Latest update broke my iPad

review: So handy and so helpful. I love the sound of rain and they‚Äôre are many different options for just rain. But not only for rain. There‚Äôs also wind, rivers and all other kinds of senses that can be defined. The apps free and very many options for the free stuff within the app. NO ADDS EITHER!!! Which is the best part. The subscription to calm is very impressive. Many kinds of ways to relax your mind and your body. To release stress and tension. This app hits the spot and is also very great to fall asleep too.
title: Very convenient

review: I was paralyzed due to a autoimmune disorder , and I had to relearn how to walk  again , and that caused a lot of anxiety and depression and I was put on  medication for it ! , I was reluctant to try an app lol but I was desperate for a release from my torment , so I gave it a shot! And honestly it's been the best decision I have ever made , my depression is gone , my anxiety is gone and I'm no longer need any anxiety medication! This stuff really works ! I promise If you stick with it for a at least a week , you will see the amazing results of meditation!
title: Best decision ever

review: I have used Calm for a few years for help during menopausal related insomnia. It‚Äôs really been helpful and a comfort. I specifically enjoy the ‚ÄòDailies‚Äô, the meditations, the music and the sleep stories. I not only play them at night, but sometimes do a quick ‚ÄòDaily Calm‚Äô in the afternoon, which sometimes leads to dropping off to sleep or in the least, a refreshed feeling. I recommend it. Calm is a complimentary subscription through my medical provider.
title: Have used Calm for a few years‚Äîit‚Äôs a help and comfort for insomnia.

review: This app saved my life. Other apps are nice and help a bit but this one is a completely different level. So happy with this! Yes I did have to pay, but it was worth it. From my crippling anxiety, ptsd and insomnia, this is everything. Helped with mindfulness while falling asleep, very effortlessly. Other apps it feels like I have to try harder, but this just lulls you into getting better. This app is the equivalent of a hug and makes me feel like a kid again, being comforted. Puts me in the best headspace ever I love it.
title: The BEST meditation and calm app

review: I am extremely lucky that I can take advantage of this FREE 7-Day Premium Trial, offered by Calm from the Apple App Store. I just downloaded it and already can‚Äôt wait to see all I‚Äôve accomplished at the end of the trial. I am confident that I will be continuing my journey of Self happiness, better sleeping, reducing my anxiety and Etc. If your able and willing  to try the App, I promise you will not regret this experience. I used to be the biggest doubter and now I have become the biggest believer!
title: 5 Stars, over and over again!

review:
For a while, me and my family loved this app. It was great for sleep and stress and there were a lot of options. 
But then Calm decided to what all apps just CANT RESIST.
Welcome to Calm Premium.
Now there aren't hardly any options at all. All the sound loops are locked without premium except for one. It gives you about 1 meditation per category and that‚Äôs it. I liked this app so much better before. Now the only way to make it worth it is to pay $15 a month. And all of the things that are locked always come up in your recommended. I am EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. I would not recommend this app to my worst enemy.
title: It was better

review: I have been using the free version for almost a year now. Money is tight with COVID-19 and today I went into to the sessions where they have the free sessions to listen to and practice meditation where locked and I now had to pay. It hurts that they would take things like this away. I had been hoping that when money wasn‚Äôt so tight I‚Äôd be able to get a paid membership, but I don‚Äôt know if I can trust them right now and feel they aren‚Äôt really trying to help people become less stressed and more mindful if they are practically forcing people to start paying to use their app when there is so much negative stuff still hanging around.
title: Feeling Hurt

review: As much publicity meditation gets from Hollywood and the people you will see in the app. I can't help but be bothered that there's nothing I can click on that doesn't require me signing up for premium. Yes there's a 7 day free trial but how annoying I'm sorry. I don't mean to sound so ungreaful yall but people are in so much pain!! I myself almost lost my leg a month ago and I'm in excruciating pain! But I just think this is a time when people who tend to stick to certain agendas actually go above and beyond to not be so superficial actually be the change for once. I'll probably end up signing up but not before I get this off my chest.
title: I'm sorry yall I'm just bothered üòî

review: I absolutely love this app, I can‚Äôt sleep without it. The nights that I toss and turn or my mind won‚Äôt turn off, I put a story on and fall asleep in minutes. I use the free version but I have heard the same story so many times I end up reciting it to myself instead of falling asleep. I would love to subscribe to it but it is just TOO EXPENSIVE. I only use the stories and not the other features. I would love if I could subscribe only to the stories or certain features. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE consider a cheaper option. Or purchasing certain stories or features without the subscription.
title: CAN‚ÄôT sleep without it BUT CAN‚ÄôT afford it.

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for a few weeks now. I decided that I wanted to start meditation and needed some guidance and I heard this app was good for beginners. The free trial was so awesome that for the first time I subscribed to a lifestyle app. I literally look forward to meditating everyday because of this app. The narrator is so calming and relaxing. Every feeling that I‚Äôve had during the meditation she acknowledges and calms me down, it almost feels like she‚Äôs right next to me. Everything is just so approachable. I can‚Äôt wait to try out the sleep features.
title: Really great so far

review: My daughter and I both have anxiety and busy routines. She is a high school student. I am a middle school teacher. I started meditating with my students through Calm Schools. Meditation is a great way for me to either start my day or reconnect with my home life after a busy day at school. I teach math which can be frustrating for students. Meditation helps my students focus and have more control over their emotions during a turbulent phase of their development. Kids ask for meditation and prepare themselves for a session like experts.

review: I needed something to quiet my thoughts and help me wind down so I downloaded the free version that was recommended by a co-worker. I got tired of listening to just "Blue Gold" and "rain on leaves" but I enjoyed it enough to want to hear more stories and explore the app further. I planned on canceling the subscription once the free trial was over but to be honest it's worth the $$ once a year. The sleep stories always put me in a relaxed mental space and although the guided meditation is short is has made a positive impact on my practice. Definitely glad I didn't cancel.
title: Happy Accident

review: I NEVER take time to write reviews OR pay for apps haha... this app..  has been a complete game changer.  I‚Äôm only a week down and the control of my thoughts and feelings have changed so much.  I feel lighter, happier, stronger.  I battle bad depression and my job is high stress.  This app is helping me learn how to manage stress. I thought that was impossible but I have a completely different outlook now.  And it gives you tools to help you throughout your day...  if you don‚Äôt buy apps.. this is worth saving money for.  #lifechanger
title: Never write reviews.. but had to this time

review: The money, fr I can‚Äôt. It has great potential, the rates are looking splendid, however the problem for me is I want to do the 1 week trial but I have to pay which I ain‚Äôt probably going to be doing for a year. I understand you guys have to get paid but that‚Äôs just too much of a amount for a year. What should be fair is that people should always be able to have more options of testing the boundaries to see if it‚Äôs to their liking. My question is that what happens if I try all of the options of what is on the app and it hasn‚Äôt helped and I‚Äôm still not satisfied? All my money would‚Äôve been wasted and for nothing.
title: My problem... well concern.

review:
Great quality sound and video clips and I'm amazed at how effective stories are at getting me to fall asleep. The developers have also taken care to add lots of good content. I cannot tell where audio files loop but I can for some of the video content, but it's more important they got the audio right than the video.

Only complaint I have about using the app is that I wish I could set one of the sleep sounds to come on after a sleep story. For some reason, even though I fall asleep while listening to a sleep story, I wake up when it stops. I then have to open the app,
 select a sleep sound e. g. waves and then resume my sleep. Should be possible to have a sleep sound come on when a story ends.

My biggest complaint about this is that the developers are a bit greedy. I could swallow the $ 60 price tag, but I can't share it with a family member. Not even a spouse? At this price, not being able to share it seems a bit greedy and destroys the goodwill generated from using the app.
title: Great but overpriced

review: I have tried and failed to achieve a regular meditation practice with two other very popular apps. I had given up completely but for some reason the relaxed natural imagery of this app appealed to me. I tried the 7 day free trial and immediately afterwards paid the yearly fee. I have continued to meditate almost every day since. This app is incredible and the guided meditations hit the sweet spot between too much instruction, and not enough. If you have tried and failed with other meditation apps/books, definitely give this one a go!
title: The best meditation app out there

review:
Have been a subscriber for about a year and a half. Tried some other meditation apps but find myself coming back to this one. I like that I can simply follow the meditation of the day or can select one or more sessions addressing a specific issue. There is no religious/based agenda. Regular use helps me to be more patient, compassionate and focused. And also productive strategies to deal with situations
when I'm none of those things. It's such a good value at the annual subscription price and right there on my phone when I need it.
title: Simple to use, and it works!

review:
After installing I was able to use one time for around 15 minutes. The next time I went in and selected the beach theme the app displayed spinning wheel then shut down. After that I could no longer open and use any app as the same thing occurred for all apps. Rebooting did not help. I had to utilize apple support and install an update via connecting to my computer, which ended up taking several attempts before I could finally get the phone to stay on and able to accept the update. I had not downloaded any other apps or installations or updates at all. After the iOS update I was able to remove the app and have had no issues with the phone since.

Beware!I would not even try this app again.
title: Beware: Crashed And Disabled iPhone

review: I have used the Calm app daily for 6 years. I love doing the 3 Dailys every morning first thing, getting life advice from 3 great teachers of mindfulness and meditation. The app is well organized and maintained, the content is extensive yet manageable, and it is easy to navigate and not overwhelming. It sets me on my course every morning, understanding, accepting, and loving the beautiful symphony of the body, mind, heart, and consciousness. It has taught me that life is as complicated as you make it, and as easy as you let it.
title: Calm is the best meditation app

review: Calm app has given me a safe haven to allow my past pains to flow through me. My clenched body can release pinned up emotions. I remember crying as a kid and being told ‚ÄúI have to be strong‚Äù imagine, a 10 year being told to be strong and stop crying after being touched to soon. Black girls aren‚Äôt allowed to express our emotions but this app has opened me up to information and resources unimaginable. Breathing exercises, sleep stories and guided meditation. I‚Äôm blessed to have found an app that truly has kept me CALM.
title: Keeping Calm

review: This app allows me to take a few minutes out of every day to center myself and to realize I'm not so crazy and the world is not so crazy.  Taking these few moments to be still and breathe catapults me with confidence and focus into the rest of the day.  The hardest thing to do is to stop and take time to do those things that help us the most.  Calm is there to allow me to take care of myself in an effortless way.  I am so grateful after each session that I did this.
title: Saves my life every day

review: If I could give zero stars, that is exactly what this app deserves. I NEVER used the app and when I saw that I was charged for it, I tried corresponding with them SEVERAL times immediately, to no avail of a simple response, let alone the refund for $35 I desperately need at this time of year. If they would look, they would see I NEVER used their services past the first day I received the free trial. Even then, I was on the app for ~5 minutes before I closed it out, forgot about it with everything else going on, and never opened it back up. They got me to sign up stating they were helping people during the pandemic‚Ä¶this is NOT helping; only hurting this single mother while we‚Äôre still experiencing Covid-19 effects!
title: DO NOT accept ‚Äúfree‚Äù trial

review:
As an educator, I‚Äôve been using Calm for years to help my students unwind after standardized testing and to help me fall asleep. I love this app. I have favorite narrators, and if I have a hard time falling asleep, I know if I put on anything by Bhav, Alan, or Eric, I‚Äôll be asleep in minutes. 

HOWEVER

This newest update has made Calm stay on the opening screen, and not move beyond ‚Äútake a deep breath.‚Äù I can‚Äôt get to the sleep stories! And having gone through an interstate move and starting a new job in the past two weeks, my stress is at an all time high. Please, Calm, fix your app! Thank you!
title: I just wish they‚Äôd patch it!

review: This is the first app I‚Äôve ever reviewed, i usually feel it‚Äôs useless to do but I had to submit one for Calm. I suffer from depression and major anxiety, to the point where I can‚Äôt breath and think. Everyone of my therapists have tried getting me to meditate but I could never make it work. Calm was the first app that helped me settle (calm) my mind. It taught me to be able to meditate even when Im not using the app. There‚Äôs also tons of other great uses as well. The sleeping aids help tremendously as well. I recommend this app completely!
title: Expensive..... but worth every penny!

review: I learned of Calm through a course I enrolled in on how to manage stress as a PHD student. Extremely effective for focus and relaxation-what I didn‚Äôt realize was how crucial it would be to my whole family. My daughter has anxiety and listens to nature sounds at night to fall asleep. My young sons have suffered broken bones and sports injuries, where the sleep stories helped eased their fears and fall asleep despite being in pain. I have recommended to so many, and feel that this tool has become a necessity for my family. Thank you Calm!
userName: carly Phd student and mom of 3
title: Therapy for the whole family

review: Please update this app to let the user put sleep stories in a queue. I don‚Äôt understand why this isn‚Äôt a thing. I listen to a sleep story then wake up when it‚Äôs silent and playing another story requires I get my glasses and choose one and select it - thus waking me up fully. Also, please let us sort stories by length! I also wish I knew which narrators had a British accent and which ones don‚Äôt. I find the British accent to be not as relaxing some nights and I‚Äôd love to be able to sort by this. These are the things that will prevent me from renewing my subscription come 9/20 if they aren‚Äôt resolved - at least the queue issue.
title: Please let us create a queue!

review: This app, man, I can tell you has guided me through some of the toughest times in my life this past year. It‚Äôs taught me how to breathe. Yeah actually take full breaths, even when my anxiety wants to clench my breaths in. I love the streak system, it makes me keep on top of my game. Longest streak‚Äî25 days and counting! I‚Äôve made Calm App a part of my morning routine. Definitely recommend the premium subscription. Definitely worth the 1 time a year cost and you get access to anything you want. I still have things to explore on this app!
title: Best App to keep you on Track!

review: Just taking a few minutes a day to breathe and let go has brought so much mindfulness into my life.  One of the biggest benefits I have receive is self awareness, specifically being aware of the ways my body manifests stress and how that in turn causes more stress. When I am stressed I hold my mouth tight and clasp my hands. Then I feel more stressed. By recognizing this I have been able to breathe that stress away unclench my hands and relax my jaw. I run a charity for suicide prevention so there is a lot of stress in my life and this app is helping me through that.
title: Mindfulness

review: You have to pay for everything... there‚Äôs only around 2 things you don‚Äôt have to pay for... I recommend another app... I loved it when I had my free trial where I got a free story every night for a few weeks but after that it kinda just was just me listening to the things my souls machine would make... however it‚Äôs awesome for a portable sound machine because if you just pick which background sound (you will understand if you purchase) you like, and then go to the meditation part and it will just play that sound for however long you set it... but that‚Äôs really all you can do if you don‚Äôt do the whole subscription thing and all the monthly payments
title: Expensive

review:
Currently good, love the scenes and sounds that are offered for free. I often use ‚Äúhealing piano‚Äù to help me fall asleep. However, I would prefer one-time purchases for content instead of the one subscription. There is content I won‚Äôt use included in the subscription, but I would love to purchase individual sounds/music/meditations. I personally don‚Äôt like subscriptions/re-occurring fees in general and don‚Äôt plan on using it. Would like one-time purchases to be considered if possible. 
Otherwise, great relaxing sounds and nature sounds.
title: Paid content

review: They let you download it for free but there is basically nothing available unless you upgrade to the very expensive $60+/year pro version. None of the music is available free. There were just two ‚Äúmeditations‚Äù available for free but the one I listened to was not even a meditation. The first session explained what anxiety is, said it‚Äôs common and talked about how the woman would give tools to help overcome anxiety. That‚Äôs all fine, but it‚Äôs not a typical guided meditation with breathwork, relaxing encouragement, etc. I understand I‚Äôve judged the app critically pretty quickly and without fully experiencing what it had to offer in the pro version. But I found it frustrating that it is advertised as free but it really isn‚Äôt. I wish it were more affordable.
title: Free version is worthless
