Wish me luck on my new career pathway maybe someday I‚Äôll direct one of your favorite movies!!üòä
title: ~My Career pathway~

review: I‚Äôve been using this app for almost 7 years. It was great to start my meditation journey, and really helped with depression and anxiety. For me I think it just got too into fads and ‚Äúin‚Äù pseudo therapists and focused on commodification of certain aspects of the app. Stick with what your good at, people come for the interesting variety of sessions not just because a self help guru is attached to it, at least I don‚Äôt. Also I was a big fan of the daily meditation (daily calm) but turned off when they just kept repeating at a certain point, I find it hard to believe you couldn‚Äôt actually create new meditations for daily use.
title: Loved this app until I didn‚Äôt

review: I love the calm app it helps me fall asleep so easily before the calm app I was constantly waking up in the middle of the night and couldn‚Äôt sleep but now with just a few minutes with the calm app medallion on I fall right to sleep! I I‚Äôve this app if you need your improv your sleep or not. It will also work really good on plans when you are tired and have trouble sleeping on plans. And it‚Äôs all free you don‚Äôt hav to bye any of the meditations! So start calm to day to start improving on sleep!
title: So amazing

review: From help falling asleep, soothing anxiety, finding peace, to prioritizing gratitude, the Calm app covers so many bases and helps build a foundation of improved mental health and wellness‚Ä¶something for the whole family.  Highly recommend!  The categories prompt you to address areas that you may not otherwise think to focus in on- but once you do, with consistency, you develop the tools for resilience, better coping, and the ability to find joy and light in your day.
title: Meets so many needs

review: So I love this app an am considering buying a premium membership BUT it has a seriously annoying problem. Even when the app is completely closed it will start playing when I either plug my phone into the car stereo or when I used my AirPods. This is seriously annoying because there‚Äôs no way to shut it off when the app isn‚Äôt even open. It even overrides the music. You then you have to reopen the app and shut it again to get it to stop! Please fix this. This app should not work when it‚Äôs completely closed.
title: Great but has an annoying bug

review: I‚Äôm a life long night owl who has trouble winding down to sleep . Calm app helps with that . After having been a paying subscriber for a year and a half , I can recommend this app , it does what it advertises. It helps me go to sleep. My grandchildren listen to the sleep stories when they are at my house. I love the variety of stories and narrators and music. Look forward to seeing the new stories that are added each week.  Didn‚Äôt give 5 stars because I would like some sleep stories narrated by Fox News hosts.
title: Well Worth It

review: This app has been a tremendous help for my anxiety. I struggle with anxiety on an almost daily basis, along with semi-frequent panic attacks. I have been using the Calm app to meditate daily. There are several series on managing stress and anxiety. I started off with the free version and then quickly purchased the full version. My husband and I enjoy listening to the soundscapes at night as well. The price seems steep, but if you break it down to what it would be per month, it‚Äôs not bad at all. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this app. Thank you, Calm!
title: Miracle App

review: I use this app every night for meditation. It‚Äôs very useful, but there is one thing holding it back a bit. A few of the scenes that you can play in the background are less than 15 minutes long. Usually, that wouldn‚Äôt be a problem, but the shortest time you can play the sounds out of the app is 15 minutes. This creates a very obvious and distracting fade out that loops back to the beginning and breaks concentration. Otherwise, I highly recommend the app even for the limited free content.
title: Great Free Version With Only One Flaw

review: I adore Calm! I‚Äôve been using it for about a year now, almost daily. My favorites are the sleep stories, especially the ones that take place on a train or in another country. And I love how the narrator is usually from that country! I can‚Äôt imagine my life without Calm now. I even had to email their costumer service to ask a complicated question and they were fast to reply, very respectful, and very helpful. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this company. I‚Äôm so impressed.
title: Love Calm!

review:
I have yet to find a similar app that resonates with me as much as this one. I use it everyday. As someone with GAD and Bipolar 2, it helps to have an app like this...

PROS: setup reminder notifications, ever-changing daily meditations, learning opportunities, soothing music, daily check-ins, a couple nice sleep stories (the Harry Styles one is ridiculously affective).

CONS: High cost (I think it‚Äôs worth it but money is tight and I almost didn‚Äôt get the app), mostly just 1 voice/meditation guide to listen to (I like Tamara, but I do wish I could hear other voices and different meditation styles), few sleep stories to choose from.

I would also suggest expanding upon the capacity of the calendar. The calendar only remembers 1 check in per day. Sometimes I do multiple check-ins per day, but the calendar doesn‚Äôt reflect that. 

All in all, I LOVE this app and highly recommend it. Thank you!!!
title: A life changer

review: The Calm app has become my way of attending church. These meditations, sleep stores and soundscapes have helped me to connect to myself and curate discipline and self love. Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice brings me to the present moment time after time. I am eternally grateful for the effort and care that goes into every aspect of Calm. Plus the Instagram story addition has allowed me to share some of my lessons and blessings with my network and I hope it has helped at least one person in turn. Thank you.
title: My respite

review:
When I first got there calm app I had no idea that my partner of 30 years, who has never been a meditator, would begin joining me each day for a meditation before we got out of bed and started our day. What a gift to us both‚Äîindividually and as a couple! 

I run my own business, Women‚Äôs aha! Camp, and I often share the daily quotes with past campers in our private fb group or with the world on my fb page.

So much goodness comes to my life and the lives of those I touch. Thank you!
title: Great way our family starts our day

review: I do like this app but the main problem is that you can‚Äôt access 75% of the sounds/stories without paying for them. There‚Äôs a total of 4 sleep stories available in the entire list that is unlocked without paying. Two of which I don‚Äôt use since the narrators voice is not soothing to me. I literally switch between two sleep stories at night which seems a little ridiculous but it still has been helping me fall asleep much faster. I don‚Äôt use it for meditation yet so I can‚Äôt say much for that, I only use it for sleep. I would even be okay if some of the sleep sounds would be unlocked ie rain/ocean ect but nope. Gotta pay for those too.
title: Great app too expensive

review: I would love to see the scenery in full size on my phone like I used to without your trying to get me to enroll in other apps that cost money that I can‚Äôt afford. I was actually going to text my daughter to download this app to help her through some hard times she‚Äôs enduring now, but with my frustration tonight, I‚Äôm not sure I will. I merely wanted to see mountains, the lake and snow as I‚Äôm homesick for them but the ads made me frustrated and disappointed because I‚Äôve told everyone I know how wonderful this app has been.üôÅ
title: Calm scenes

review:
I was really excited to start Calm. I tried the free book and it was great! I fell asleep so well. I can't believe how well it worked.
   
   Me...I stupidly didn‚Äôt see there was a trial. I know that 70$ a year...but for most people that is way to much money. It is an AMAZING DEAL for one year. However, it is too much money for me and I can‚Äôt afford it. Even though the book was amazing...it wasn‚Äôt worth a trial/subscription. I also can‚Äôt do this because my family can‚Äôt put down 70$ in a week. 

        I found this app on a commercial and I thought this would be a great app for me because I have so much stress and anxiety and I am almost never positive. This is a big bummer for me because I need it.

      I asked my parents for extra allowance. They said no. Especially cause my mom just lost her job I can't pay at least 70$ in one week. After you are finished in a week, you must pay for the subscription. 

     I really wish I could do this app, but I can't and that makes me upset.

     Either lose the subscription or downsize it to 10$-20$.
title: Well...

developerResponse: {'id': 8561447, 'body': "Hi there, we do offer a 7 day free trial which will charge your account at the end if not canceled. If you need assistance with this charge, please reach out to support@calm.com and we'd be happy to help you out.", 'modified': '2019-05-07T22:23:26Z'}
review: The app itself is fine. The problem is when you download it thinking it‚Äôs free it‚Äôs actually not. I got a $90 something charge on my card and after embarrassing myself by calling my bank and reporting fraud I found out it was actually this app. I never thought I had selected such an expensive option for the app, and there are other cheaper options so I am not sure how the most expensive one is the default. I think it‚Äôs only fair that the app warn you that your free trial is ending and your about to be charged. Honestly very scammy of them to just have the most expensive option as the default and there is no warning you‚Äôre about to be charged. I am not the only person this happened to either.
title: NOT FREE (sneaky charge such a scam)

review: I have been diagnosed with pfd and IC and just got this app to help me relax my too tight pelvic floor and decrease my pelvic pain. It is starting to work as I have a lot of stress in my life. I am starting to feel a little better thank God. My pelvic pain was so bad I could hardly walk at times. I am planning on continuing doing this app for me for the rest of my life.I do too much for everyone else in my life and not enough for me. I want to get better and be able to live my life 100% with my husband once again.
title: Pelvic floor dysfunction and INterstitial cystitis

review:
Thank you developers of Calm!üôèüèº I‚Äôve felt heard. I appreciate the implementation of guest passes! I‚Äôve shared this with my family & people close to me. 
I would also greatly appreciate the idea of building a social tab within the app, I suggest calling it ‚ÄúCalm Sangha/Community‚Äù. 
Something simple to only encourage others to continue with their awareness practices like the ‚ÄúActivity‚Äù app, maybe something to help others share their realizations from their practice or just daily life struggles. 
Bring Dharma sharing to the internetüôèüèºüßòüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è‚ô•Ô∏èüïä May you be safe, may you be ever calm.
title: LOVE that they‚Äôve added guest passes

review: Amazing isn't descriptive enough to give the Calm app it's rightful due. It has so many features on the paid version, I'm kicking myself for having waited to buy it. From meditation to sleep, stories to calming anxiety, this truly has it all. It has helped me in ways that I could not even have imagined in the beginning. The only changes I would make is being able to see my scenic screen in its entirety, not having my "Daily Calm," and or new slew story taking up half the screen. Other than that, I love it!
title: Soothing

review: It took me several months to bite the bullet and just purchase this app. I am now kicking myself wondering what I went all those months without it. I did the 7 day free trial and after the first session of Day 1, I felt so much personal value and growth from this that I immediately knew I was going to purchase the full version of this app and that I would gladly pay double what they are charging for it. It‚Äôs billed up front but it works out to only $5 per month if you break it down that way. WELL WORTH IT.
title: Just do it.

developerResponse: {'id': 5667146, 'body': 'Hi SilverStarLovrGirl, we do have a free version of the app in addition to the paid premium subscription. A lot of factors go into our pricing, and we do not take the decision of how much to charge lightly. We do our best to keep a useful set of content free for users who are unable to subscribe, but ultimately, our subscription prices allow us to continue growing the content (in terms of quantity and quality). If you have any additional feedback, feel free to send us a message to support@calm.com.', 'modified': '2018-10-25T22:28:23Z'}
review: This isn‚Äôt a good app. They say it‚Äôs free but only like 1 story is free that you can‚Äôt even choose! Not to mention that the free stories are something like blue and gold and lavender fields? This is a scam. Don‚Äôt say it‚Äôs free, then have me enter the app for ‚ÄúHundreds of calming stories for free‚Äù like you didn‚Äôt finish saying ‚Äúafter you pay $60 a year!‚Äù Wow now i can really take a deep breath upon entering the app. (sarcasm) Don‚Äôt forget you can do 7 or 21 days of happiness and stress relieving (and so on) Oh but the ones that are actually unlocked only really unlock one day of it. Like don‚Äôt you think that ruins the point of it? Because all of the 7-21 days link together to ‚Äúrelieve and calm you‚Äù This app is horible false advertisement. What a bunch of frauds for playing innocent people.
title: Highly Disappointed

review: This app was "prescribed" to me with my discharge papers after a long g hospital stay and it has been with me for the last 6 months. It has many meditation options to choose from and her voice is very reassuring. I particularly enjoy the sleep stories. I know a sleep story is good when I have to listen to it several times before getting the end. To me it means the story is doing its job - helping me fall asleep. It has never crashed and it doesn't take much storage. It's a must have during chaotic times.
title: Medicine and Meditation

review: I‚Äôm an assistant principal, so one can imagine that there are many things coming at me. The Calm App has so many great resources that help me manage all of the challenges that come with the role, especially the Daily Calm. It‚Äôs time for me just to be every morning before I leave for work. And I‚Äôve learned quotations and bits of wisdom that have helped me frame my thinking. I received some feedback on a particularly hectic day, ‚ÄúHow are you so chill?‚Äù I responded that the Calm App plays a big role. Thanks, Calm App Team!
title: Great App!

review: Love this app but I got a scare when I got a new phone. There‚Äôs an assortment of free soundscapes that I‚Äôve been using for years, but when I opened it for the first time on my new phone everything was gone. I tried searching for my soundscapes under the ‚Äúdiscover‚Äù tab and it told me everything was a premium feature. I was super mad that stuff I had for free for years was suddenly gone! Then I clicked the little mountains icon in the top left and found my stuff for free. Weird that they say free stuff is behind a paywall when you try to use the üîésearch tab‚Ä¶
title: Love this app but I got a scare

review: I used to use Calm many years ago when it was not nearly as well known as it is now. I also paid for a year of premium back in the day, which I think at the time was only $40. I‚Äôve been having trouble sleeping lately and so I redownloaded the app but wow. I could barely find one meditation as a free user. At this point, it shouldn‚Äôt even be called Calm premium, it should just be called Calm because it‚Äôs really hard to say that this app really exists at all for free users. I appreciate that the company needs to grow itself and subscriptions are a great model for that but let users get some use out of the app before you ask them to spend $70 on an annual subscription.
title: Nothing for Free Users

review: I started off with calm on my Apple Watch, with limited options, but they are good options. Then I decided to get Calm on my phone. As for someone with really bad anxiety and stress, this is an app that just having helps. But there is very few, and I mean very few, options that are not locked that I have found so far. I would love to try the daily calm, but in-app purchases  are blocked on my device. So there are very limited options for me. I have only found 3 options so far. However, I love the background noise and I love that there are no adds.
title: Very limited options

review: Got this app free as a company benefit. I don‚Äôt care about all the new age meditation stuff and 99% of the content but really enjoy a couple of the sleep soundtracks- right up to the point of a large volume increase in the middle of the night waking me up. Exhausted again, I‚Äôll find a decent sound machine app. Keep the volume level, and I would have loved sleeping to the sound of the forrest. All the water apps sound like white noise anyway, even on iPhone 13 (it isn‚Äôt my speaker or Wi-Fi) WTH have big volume increases in the middle of the night??? That defeats the purpose of something that is supposed to help you SLEEP. Now I‚Äôm NOT calm- I‚Äôm starting my day irritated and exhausted.
title: Horrible sleep app for 1 reason- volume fluntuation

review: I love the daily check-in especially since it allows you to let all of your emotions flow freely and it's private so only you can see it. I like the emojis that can represent moods, but please add more like "Passionate", "Powerful", and "Scared". The stories are mostly premium, but you can get by with what you have alone! Please add the daily check-in to ads because I think people will want to let their emotions free by writing down what they  think. Thank you! 100% recommend!
title: Excellent!

review: I‚Äôm sure she‚Äôs a wonderful person but her voice is NOT CALMING. So many nasal women used as the voice for meditations. If the app is intended for use to calm you. And you have countless celebrities then why are all the meditations by the same person? Just record the same thing with a variety of people. It‚Äôs such an expensive app that provides a very narrow scope. Sleep stories are awesome. Your meditations are trash and could be DRASTICALLY improved. Variety of voices please! Like 5 meditations to help you sleep from the same annoying voice? I guess I‚Äôm not sleeping. More male voices for meditation, more diversity in accents and tone, more diversity in general! Enough white lady wellness.
title: Enough Tamara already!

developerResponse: {'id': 6187895, 'body': 'Hi there, it sounds like you may have encountered a bug. A quick reinstall should fix this! You can learn more about our background sound settings here: https://support.calm.com/hc/en-us/articles/115002474307-How-do-I-change-my-background-scene-and-scene-settings-\n\nSend any further inquiries to support@calm.com and we are happy to help you out!', 'modified': '2018-12-01T00:41:56Z'}
review: The sleep stories are amazing! The readers and the stories put my right to sleep. But the main reason for my rating is that I expect when I tap on something it should actually do something. For example when the session rating pops up at the end of a story I cannot rate, close the rating pop up or even close the story. I have to close the app and reopen to continue using the app. Also I cannot turn off the background sounds when the app is open. I‚Äôm sure some folks like the clam sounds that play when navigating around the app but it‚Äôs kinda a distraction from getting to what I want and there is no option to turn it off.
title: Content is amazing, app is slow or not responsive

review: I took the first opportunity when there was a discounted offer, to purchase a lifetime subscription. This app has literally kept me afloat during this pandemic. I have suffered from chronic insomnia and anxiety and my mental health has benefited SO much from the check-in meditations and body scans, especially at bedtime. The sleep stories are great. I fall asleep every single night to softly falling rain and Tamara reminding me to focus on my breath and not my worries. This app has really been a lifesaver for me. Tamara is a national treasure!
title: Lifetime Member

review: Going through peri menopause has me experiencing many emotions which isn‚Äôt connected to any specific stressors of life. The only thing I can attribute this stress to are the hormones which are a little unbalanced at this time in my life. The Calm app keeps my mind relaxed, it gives me a break from thinking or over thinking things and during the times that my body is tight and stressed from head to toe the Calm app is there to remind my mind how to  ‚Äùbreathe‚Äù and ‚Äútake a mind break‚Äù. I highly recommend it!
title: Stress reliever for those raging hormones!

review: The application design is good. The app works nearly flawlessly. However the service is expensive, and most of the content is blah at best, such as a person in a soothing voice telling you how to relieve anxiety with suggestions you could get from a google search. Some of the content is good, such as the music selection but overall you could probably do better elsewhere. I joined through a special offer through my AmEx card. I cancelled the 1/2 price auto renewal since I find I am not using it anywhere near enough to justify the expense.
title: Technically outstanding.  Content is meh.

review: I really love this App. It has helped me learn how to meditate and I can see how meditation helps me. I look forward to meditating every day. I would give this app 5 stars except for Tamara Levitt, her voice is on almost every guided meditation and there are no other options or very few options. For someone who is supposed to be guiding people though a meditation, she talks a lot. Just when I am getting into the meditation, she interrupts repeatedly. It is very frustrating and I have stopped my practice before the program is finished because of this. I will probably not renew my subscription when it comes due if this continues.
title: Meditation

review: I‚Äôm using Calm today whilst in the terrible California fire season. I listened (and am listening as I write this) to the background ‚Äúscene‚Äù I chose of gentle rain falling on leaves, and over that the excellent session with Tamara Levitt on Procrastination, an avoidance behavior that has for years undermined my aspirations. I feel both soothed and motivated! Yesterday I listened to a hypnotic description of the Bodelian library. I have also listened to the beautiful deep voice of LeBron James describing his approach to success, and felt motivated and uplifted. Calm is an excellent resource for surviving this crazy 2020.
title: Gentle Rain

review: This app really changed my life. I‚Äôm prone to panic attacks and listening to this app is the only thing I‚Äôve found to really get them under control so I don‚Äôt live in fear. Highly recommended for anyone struggling with panic and anxiety! And the background scenes and sleep stories are so soothing to listen to at night. Only one silly complaint: Tamara, please, PLEASE stop saying ‚Äúwiggle your fingers and toes‚Äù at the end of your meditations. Something about it is so irksome. I can‚Äôt be the only one who‚Äôs bothered by it! üòÇ But other than that, AMAZING!
title: Amazing for panic attacks

review: I absolutely love this app!  I originally didn‚Äôt pay for the upgrade and listened to the same sleep story every night for about 2 months. Then I realized how much the Calm app was helping me sleep. Now I don‚Äôt go to bed without it!!  I love being an adult who falls asleep to someone reading to me!!  It‚Äôs fantastic!!!  The only thing I wish it had was a thing (a star or check mark) telling me I‚Äôve listened to a story already. Otherwise, I have absolutely nothing bad to say. I can‚Äôt remember sleep so good before the app. Thank you Calm!!
title: Love it!!

review:
I loooove this app but I‚Äôm begging for a feature.
Pleeeeease add the function to create a personalized playlist. It will help prevent me from seeing what time it is on my phone when I need to start a new story or some music or meditations. 
On my worst insomnia nights, nothing is more anxiety inducing that a sleep story coming to an end. 
I‚Äôd love to create a lineup of stories and meditations to get me through without having to scroll, look at bright light, and accidentally see the time. 
Xoxoxo
title: Kudos and request

review:
I, first off, want to say that I‚Äôm 17 and I use this app almost every night. It works so well and puts me to sleep within 5 minutes of the story. But, my only complaint is that there is only 1 sleep story that‚Äôs free and listening about lavender every night gets kind of annoying. The premium subscription costs $70 per year and as a 17 year old, I don‚Äôt have enough money to pay for that myself and my parents don‚Äôt either. So, editors, please please add more free sleep stories. 

Sincerely,
Someone who probably has insomnia
title: Love!

review:
I have been meditating and practicing mindfulness off and on for several years now. I have used Headspace and love it and still have it but found I needed a change of pace. 
Calm is just that - it brings a sense of peace to my busy unfocused mind and I have been enjoying the 7 day free trial and plan to keep and continue after. The programs available offer the kind of guidance and reflection I have been wanting. The woman who narrates has a very nice, soft and relaxing voice. Highly recommend doing the trial to test it out.
title: Tuning In

review:
I love this app so much! I‚Äôm a student and Calm has really helped me find peace and happiness. I really would like to continue to meditate with this app, but I find that the yearly fee is very expensive. I would definitely spend money on this app if each session cost about $2 each. I feel like I would consider buying the full subscription more if I could continue to try out the session. Please consider this. Even if you can pay for sessions individually for one or two programs. Please 
‚ù§Ô∏è too much $ for me
title: Please read

review: No problem. I can deal with the free thing. But, I wonder why should I not be able to listen to, let's say, 5-6 tracks that are going to be free forever, and I have to pay for them? I mean, I got them free, yay, but as I entered the app the second time, I couldn't help but notice that, although I downloaded them, the tracks were blocked because I needed to pay a monthly subscription. This is mind- boggling to me. All the apps that rely on meditation have the exact same thing. You can stay free as long as tou have very little content. Open up more, it's a great app, maybe some don't pay so they see if they like it!
title: Why does this cost

review: I had been trying to meditate by myself but I found it was hard for me to concentrate. With this app I can concentrate completely and has helped me with my anxiety problems sooo much!!! The guidance is amazing I am totally addicted to this. Would recommend 100%. About the price... all money invested in health is money well spent. This is not a nice pair of shoes you can show off to your friends (it costs about the same) this app is for your soul, and health, you will be showing off your happiness, your mental health to everybody with the help of this app. LOVE IT
title: Love It!!!

review: I‚Äôve been using this app forever and it‚Äôs honestly a game changer, those nights I find it hard to relax I go on the app and do their breathing exercises for it and I‚Äôm practically falling asleep doing it. One thing that‚Äôs extremely helpful to me that I use almost every night is the sleep noises, I set the scene to whatever I‚Äôm feeling but normally it‚Äôs any of the rain ones and I set the off app timer and I‚Äôm sleeping in no time. Honestly idk what I‚Äôd do without this app.
title: Genuinely very helpful

review: I got this app around last week and when I got it I didn‚Äôt really get on it that much yet. And So today I found out that $65 dollars was charged to my account and I had to look into it to figure out what was charging me that when I didn‚Äôt buy anything. I went through my settings and found that this app had charged me almost $70 and I didn‚Äôt do anything on there that gave them permission to purchase anything or even look at the option of buying something. I would really like to know how they managed to get that money on my account and I am not going to be getting this app back. Thankfully I got the money back but this is seriously concerning because there is nothing I did to allow this app to do this.
title: Charged me $65 dollars

review: I cannot express how much this app means to me. I start off my mornings with a meditation and end it with a sleep story (my insomnia has improved dramatically). I consider myself a beginner and hope to always consider myself a beginner in my practice of meditation. The difference meditation has made in my life is extraordinary. I feel it and those around me see it. I know there are other apps and some I‚Äôve utilized now and again, but Calm will always be THE one I will utilize infinitely.
title: Life saver!

review: With anxiety disorder, PNES, sleeping disorder, and epilepsy, I need to take time out of my day to remove the stress and calm the anxiety. This helps with that. Meditative breathing and meditation takes time, but with practice I have been able to reduce my anxiety attacks and even stopped a few. The soundscapes and meditation to relax before bedtime is showing improvement in my quality of sleep. I recommend it to everyone because we all need a little self care and relaxation.
title: Everyone needs mindfulness

review: I found CALM listening to Colleen Ballinger and Erik Stocklin‚Äôs RELAX podcasts and  Rachel Ballinger‚Äôs All Things Internet and Rachel Uncensored podcasts and it‚Äôs been life changing! With so much going on in the üåèaround us, sometimes it can be difficult to CALM you body, mind, and spirit. With a myriad of meditations to help you with sleep hygiene, anxiety, gratitude, forgiveness, intentionality, self-confidence, love, and so much more, CALM will be the perfect addition to your mindfulness and meditation practices.
title: Download This App, You‚Äôll Be So Grateful You Did‚Ä¶.You Have My Word

review: This app introduced me to meditation and the mindfulness practice. I have tried quite a few of the meditations and they are all great. Mindfulness helps center me but this app aids in getting through certain difficult situations (eg stress, anxiety etc). It has been extremely well developed, it keeps improving and is well worth the subscription if used regularly. I would highly recommend this app to anyone who is interested in learning about mindfulness. Stay present. - AA
title: Amazing app

review: We love the calm app! It has helped us to transition our 2 1/2 year old from our bed into her big girl bed. She loves picking her music or story and has learned how to control her breathing by using the app. I‚Äôve even been able to use it during the day for rest time or to get her refocused after a meltdown. She has learned which app it is and often asks to ‚Äúplay a song‚Äù to which I gladly concede! A big shout out to an app that makes my life with a toddler a bit calmer!!
title: Sleepy girl

review:
This is definitely the best app on the market and even with the free version it is extremely helpful. I have recommended this app to all of my friends and family as well as Facebook groups I‚Äôm in to help people who struggle with mental health or just struggling with stress. I used this app to help me navigate my emotions and heal through my divorce. I went from struggling with depression to being able to let go and heal through medication.
I love that you have options of who you prefer to speak on a lot of the medications.
I prefer the female voices myself.

The app is so easy to navigate through and has different categories for what you need. I love the sleep category and use this for my kids as well!
I‚Äôve used this app for them since they were 18 months and 3 years old. 

I struggled with sleep before this app.., now I‚Äôm able to find inner pease.

My one annoyance, and the reason I only gave four stars, is because they only allow you to choose a female voice for most of the meditations. In my personal experience, I find I do better with a male voice, and I wish they give that option more often. Some of the meditations allow you to choose between a male and a female voice, and I think all of the meditations should do that.
title: More voice choices

review: I‚Äôve wanted to subscribe for a long time and recently found a subscription discount.  So glad that I finally joined.  The app layout is simply elegant  and well designed.  Easy to explore the many features  and content of the app and find what might interest you next.  Graphics are fantastic.  I think the sleep time stories are probably great, but I really don‚Äôt know since I‚Äôve fallen asleep fast, and that is the point to the story.

review:
This app has been a savior to me this year. The sleep stories help me fall asleep soundly and stay asleep. This has made a huge improvement in my ability to rest during the night and my alertness and outlook during the day. I had previously tried Headspace but it didn‚Äôt work for me at all; for whatever reason Calm does the trick. 

My only request is to increase the diversity of narrators, and enable some of the sorting features other reviewers have suggested. 

There is just one narrator (Tamara Levitt) who has an extremely affected way of speaking that I find off-putting. She is unfortunately the same person who narrates most of the meditations which has kept me from exploring that part of the app. 

Aside from that, I am a big fan of Calm and think it‚Äôs well worth a subscription.
title: Amazingly effective for sleep

review: For the most part it‚Äôs a pretty good app and has helped as I‚Äôve traversed this crazy year we‚Äôre having but the daily check-ins are driving me nuts. To have to choose only one emotion during check-in is unrealistic. I‚Äôm a far more complex individual than what can be relegated to only one emotion and the emotions listed don‚Äôt cover all of what a person may be going through. I like the check-in as a means of reminding me to pause and think but the details of the interaction are seriously lacking.

review: It takes me ages to fall asleep but now I can go to sleep earlier! I love it! Also I fall asleep in 3 mins! It‚Äôs great! This app is recommended for everyone who needs to fall asleep faster! title: Raggedy Ann

review:
I received a calm subscription as a school initiative, and have definitely taken advantage of all things Calm! I have now been practicing for about 6 months and have noticed myself being able to identify emotions as they arise, sleep better/earlier, and a sense of inner peace when I practice more than once a day. 
The app also has a great way to track your progress, see streaks, and check in with yourself each time you practice to notice any changes. 
I really enjoy this app!
title: 6 months practice... AMAZING results!

review:

I was on a bunch of meds at the time for sleep and anxiety and with the daily practices I was able to come off sleep meds all together. It was amazing to see how fast I was able to learn how to relax again and sleep. 

Go ahead and download it, your probably curious from seeing the ads everywhere anyway.

review: Listening to ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù stories never fails to bring peaceful sleep, at any hour of the day or night.  I‚Äôve been a loyal customer for over 3 years. review: The marginal cost of providing a digital app to a new user is low, especially given how large the user base is. While I appreciate that this app was created, I was appalled by the price point - $70/year! This creates so many equity issues and forces me to question the intentions of its creators. At first, I was excited to pay a bit of money to support creators that were addressing a true social issue. After I saw the price point, I realized that this was actually a way to profit off of people‚Äôs mental instability. I suggest the creators reconsider the costs and benefits on this price point‚Ä¶
title: What‚Äôs the profit margin on this thing??

review: I began using this app several years ago and liked it because it offered several free programs within each category like the confidence series but over the last year they have all disappeared. Although it was limited it was helping me manage my stress.  But There is no longer any free programs.  I liked the few they used to offer but I can‚Äôt afford to pay for the premium service which is now the entire apps programs.  So don‚Äôt be misled by the description. You need a premium account to access all the programs.  It‚Äôs hard because I lost my job due to covid and my new job pays so much less I can‚Äôt pay the bills I have.  So looking for a new free app.

review: I never thought I‚Äôd actually download this app. I see advertisements for it all the time but I was unwilling to pay for it. I‚Äôve done DBT therapy before where we meditate and this app facilitated the kind of meditation my therapist used to do. This was the first time I used it but I can see myself meditating in the mornings and/or evenings with this app.
title: Free premium with my job

review: I am new to Calm and am loving it. My son is a very active child and has difficulty unwinding and falling asleep. We tried the kids sleep stories and the first time he didn‚Äôt fall asleep before the story ended but was very relaxed and then we did a soundscapes and that did the trick. After that night, he asks for a sleep story and has fallen asleep before they finished several days in a row now. We are loving the app and can‚Äôt wait to explore more features.
title: Use it daily

review:
Calm has helped me find sleep when I was so stressed out. I have had relationship trouble throughout this Covid crisis and that transferred to troubles at work. I am having financial hardship right now and cannot afford the Calm App , but I listen to as much as I can and I listen to them again and again. Calm has also helped me with anxiety and leads me to a place of quietness inside. It reminds me that I have more control over worry, stress, anxiety, and anger. It brings me an awareness and makes me happy. Thanks. 
My birthday is Nov. 21 ü§†
title: My experience with Calm

review:
This is a helpful tool for the day-to-day challenges of life. It brings awareness to the importance of applying mindfulness to all we do, however mundane it may appear to be at that moment. It raises consciousness and makes living be intentional. Every aspect of our life on Earth becomes equally precious by eliminating the boring and the unimportant. 
I find myself no longer trying to avoid what I used to view as uncomfortable or even wasteful. Everything and everyone has a purpose and it‚Äôs up to the individual to acknowledge that.
title: Helpful

review: I was never a kind of person who can meditate , at least thats what I thought. Realizing my mind wanders pretty easily I wanted to act on it and when I read online I found meditation is best way to control your mind. Searching for sources to learn how to Meditate I felt that something like an app that can help me to start meditating and here I am now. I recommend this app. I started 30 day meditation course and I am hoping to achieve better results.
title: If you can invest ten mins a day for your mind, then this app is for you

review: I own a sleep number bed and had been getting horrible numbers at night when I slept. I started using this app and my sleep has improved by over 15 numbers per night. I have less tossing, less getting up, and less stress. I listen to music at least 30 min before sleep to help relax. One thing I like the most so far, is that it keeps playing all night until I turn it off. Very happy with it. I purchased the yearly program. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.
title: Works amazing

review: I have had uncontrollable epilepsy for the last 6 years after being seizure free for 30. A friend recommended that I try the Calm app and I have physical proof that it works; at least for me. A recent weeklong study of my seizures was really causing me a lot of stress. The doctor asked me if I could calm down. I closed my eyes and took three deep breaths and then followed my breath. The doctor was shocked! My read out completely changed to a steady calm rhythm. It became my ‚Äútrick‚Äù that I had to repeat when anyone came into my room!
title: Instant calming effect

review: Ok I love this app, everything on here is so calming, and when I‚Äôm done with a meditation, I feel amazing! But.... before I unlocked premium, there were to many things that cost. If you‚Äôre not going to go premium, then you can‚Äôt do that much at all really. But other than that, this app is so cool and calming. And also, ads rarely pop up! So that‚Äôs nice. But I think that not only me, but other people would like it if you unlocked a few more things. But everyone out there, if you‚Äôre willing to go premium, this app is totally worth it!
title: Developers, please read!

review:
Hello human brethren! Because I‚Äôm definitely not an alien that came from mars. Ever since coming to this Kanye, I have been thinking about how I can take over the world and doing experiments and things like that... that puts A LOT of strain on my body. This app helps me to remember to be grateful and to breath (I have a hard time remembering sometimes). So this helps. The second thing is that the colors are calming and very soothing to my foreign eye... it helps a lot with calming me down. So in the end this app helps my body and my mind. GET THIS APP!!! 

-Invader Zimm
title: It‚Äôs Real!!!!

review: This app is excellent for beginners. It helps me feel like I CAN meditate, when before I used to get frustrated with not doing it ‚Äúright.‚Äù I love the series on specific issues like sleep problems and managing anxiety. I also love the bedtime meditations and stories. Quality programs cost money, but this one was a SO worth the price. Plus, having paid for it gives me extra motivation to stay on track and use it often so I get my money‚Äôs worth. This is the second year I bought it. I love it!
title: Worth the price

review:
Fantastic app!!  

I began using this app in the classroom to allow the students some time to calm themselves and refocus their energy.  The students often tell me it is their favorite part of the day.   We also use the music throughout the day while students are working independently.   

I began using it at home as well.  I do the daily meditations as well as the bedtime stories to help me shut down my brain ...I sleep a lot better and am able to manage stress a bit more effectively.
title: Perfect in many ways.

review: This app was recommended by my psychologist after I experienced high anxiety following some traumatic events and high stress at work. I am not sure what guided me that very day to do it, but it is an essential component to getting better. Tamara is my favorite. And Dr. Chatterjee is so knowledgeable and his views are based on logic and common sense. It is a part of my new daily routine, and I recommend it most highly. It is at my fingertips at any time I need it. More companies should offer & encourage this as an integral part of a wellness program.
title: You are worth it!üíú

review: Great content, but it seems that if you don‚Äôt fully close their pages after a session (rate this session page, quote page, practice history page) it continues to draw down your battery. My phone gets physically warm and currently reports that the Calm app has used more than twice as much battery life as any other app on my phone. This is especially problematic if you use the app to fall asleep because then it is left in this high power draw state all night.
title: Fix battery drain

review: So I downloaded calm a year ago and absolutely fell in love. I would use a story time every night and loved the streak to hold myself accountable. I stopped using the app for a month or two. I am completely devastated. While originally there were only 5 or 6 sleep stories, now there are two (one that is targeted for younger children). The meditations have been cut down by an extreme amount. I feel guilty because I‚Äôve been recommending this app to people like crazy and they came back asking why I would recommend something with such a high membership fee. I just wish it still allowed a healthy place for those who can‚Äôt afford to pay such high prices for an app
title: I use to love it

review:
The IPhone and iPad apps are great, however, there needs to be an easier way to organize your favorites. 

The new watch update has tremendous potential, but the execution is not there as the sound effects are out of sync with both the vibrations and the on screen animation. This results in an unpleasant experience, worse than not meditating at all. In addition, the watch meditations don‚Äôt appear to upload to the health app as mindful minutes. 

With a functioning watch app, this could be transformational, but the kinks need to be worked out.
title: Watch Issues

title: What happened??

review: This app has saved me a many restless nights. The guided meditations are well spoken, calming, and soothing. As a firefighter, sometimes it‚Äôs hard for me to fall back asleep when running calls throughout the evening, so I‚Äôll turn on Calm and it truly helps me relax and drift to sleep. Now that I‚Äôve been using the app for over a year, there is only one complaint. The sleep meditations never change. They have become predictable and not as effective. I wish they would update or add to the collection once a month at least. It‚Äôs the only reason for my 4 stars.
title: Love this app, but...

review:
I have a fairly severe panic disorder and generalized anxiety disorder. I‚Äôve been struggling because I would rather not use medication if possible. This app is helping me feel like I /can/ regain control‚Äîhope that I haven‚Äôt had when battling anxiety thus far. The emergency calm meditation is a lifesaver for me during a panic attack. 

My psychologist recommended this to me after our last session. I highly recommend anyone who is on the fence to use this app. 

I upgraded to the monthly package not even a week into it.

I can see how this would be counter intuitive, but for me as a multitasker, this will aid in my use of the app. Other than that, so far so good! UPDATE : I spoke too soon, there is an outside of app function. . . 5 stars it is !!
title: JUST DOWNLOADED

review: I was diagnosed with anxiety and I have a lot of stress. I was trying to study for geometry today and just noticed my mind blank out, my head started to hurt. Which was probably the effect of stress. I‚Äôm in 9th grade and I have so much stress, I didn‚Äôt even notice I was meditating for 15 minutes. It calmed me down, I did the 7 days of stress. I don‚Äôt usually write reviews but today I felt the need to. This app offers you free meditations because as a high schooler I cannot purchase any of them but the free ones are good enough.
title: Helpful app! Get it.

review: I have been using this app since early spring. It's a wonderful practice. It helps to turn off the mental chatter that goes on, at the very least, it makes you aware of it. This way, you don't miss your life! I've been using the Daily Calm, but have tried some of the others.  I have enjoyed all that I have listened to. The price is very reasonable. Oh yes, the sleep stories are great, my favorites are the John Muir notes about the national parks. The truth is that I have rarely heard the whole story. I fall asleep! Calm is habit forming, a good habit!
title: An excellent app

review:
I rated this app in June/July and said I liked it.  I have upgraded my like to love.  It is so handy.  If I'm in a long line at the grocery store, and everyone else is freaking out about how long it is taking.  I pull out my phone and take a controlled mindfulness relaxation break. 
I leave the store more relaxed and in a much better mood than the people I'm in line with.  Two(2) thumbs up!

Middle of the afternoon, a hectic day, I know I can get away from it all for a few minutes and get some sanity back in my life.
title: I really love this app

review: I‚Äôve downloaded this app and tried the trial multiple times, but I‚Äôve never been successful in sitting quietly or meditating so I didn‚Äôt keep the subscription. They are having a Mental Health Awareness Month sale so I looked again and they finally have more content for people who struggle with sitting still. Between Jeff Warren‚Äôs series and the Daily Move videos with Mel Mah, I finally find myself using the app every day.
title: They‚Äôve Finally Added ADHD-Friendly Content

review: But y‚Äôall‚Ä¶.As a person that was diagnosed with generalized anxiety in 2017‚Ä¶ This is the first centralized self-help app that is made a huge difference. I don‚Äôt know what it is‚Ä¶ Especially because i am no stranger to music therapy but after a day or two (paired with other self-help techniques) I‚Äôve noticed a major difference in my temperament and nervousness. I am so happy and more than satisfied. Can‚Äôt wait to see what else the app has to offer!
title: I don‚Äôt usually write app reviews

review: We have loved Calm Kids sleep stories for years and our kids loved it too. However, tonight I was listening to my daughter‚Äôs story and was surprised to hear that the main character had they/them pronouns. Im totally fine with that story being there if they had indicated what type of content was in the story and we could listen to it when ready, but the fact that they don‚Äôt mention it anywhere is a deal breaker. My kids are very young and we are not ready to talk with them about this subject yet. If a parent wishes to talk to their kids about that, no problem. I just don‚Äôt appreciate a sleep app slipping it in behind the parents‚Äô back.
title: Kids Sleep Stories Sneak in LGBTQ+ Content

review: If you like sleeping soundly this is the perfect app for you this is helped me with my anxiety and depression and for all of the stress I feel and it helps me fall sleep at night and you can write reviews on stories and ask them to do more things that you like or maybe stealing them to stop doing stuff that you don‚Äôt like and if you need a calming app that is for therapy or something that can help this is the app for you I know it cost money but it‚Äôs worth it!!
title: The best

review: Loving this in all its layers from music to checkins to meditations and beyond. I have used the app for a couple of months now and as I grow my mindfulness practice, I‚Äôd like this to grow with me, so-to-speak. For example, my daily checkins have 12 options to describe my emotions. It seemed like a fair amount until I started to really go deeper and pinpoint feelings not represented. Are frustrated and angry truly the same? No, hardly. So just a thought as this app has been a blessing in so many ways and I know I‚Äôll keep using it. Consider this though when making updates! Thanks!
title: Hmmm

review:
I hope I can explain this well. And hoping someone out there has a suggestion. 
I‚Äôve been using Calm off and on for a month now. I paid for the yearly subscription. I believe it can help me learn to meditate better, center myself and fall asleep faster. 
However; when I do the daily meditations with Tara , there are long periods of her not talking and just water running in the background. But then she starts talking again and I am so startled, that it takes a while to get my heart to stop racing. I actually just end up turning off the app at that point.  Not good for anxiety. 
I have had the same issue with the sleep stories. I am falling asleep or dozing off and the voice will scare me back awake. I think some of its due to headphone and the noise/voices being right in my ear. 
Does this happen to anyone else? Have you found success by sticking to a certain theme within the app or a certain narrator? 
Thank you!
title: Startling Me

review: I may have missed something.  Here at home it has been an exquisitely beautiful day.  Cool in the morning and perfect in the afternoon.  I spend most of the day outdoors.  Walking my sweet dog (so he will have a good night‚Äôs sleep) and so will the rest of us. Pulling weeds from the flower beds. Watching as the crew at our local college put up the Little Barn with the Baby Jesus in the manger.  Mary ,Joseph and the little animals looking on in awe.  Our neighbors have already begun to decorate for Christmas and why not?  I think I will too. How about you?
title: Whoops

review: As an educator I have valued this app all year. But now as a work at home educator, teacher mom to five kids, and do-er of all the things I am beyond grateful for Calm! I use the daily check ins for myself and my children; the meditation options have been so valuable for my kids as well as myself. We all also enjoy the music. And the sleep stories have changed my nightly routine for the better! Overall I am honestly grateful for this app now more than ever. I use it every day and sincerely thank you.
title: Thank you

review:
I love the idea behind this. The sleep stories are the best part, especially since you have a wide variety of voices to choose from.  Unfortunately, they almost always use the same two or three female voices for all of the meditation and daily calms, so if those voices and speaking patterns (like drawn out ‚Äús‚Äù sounds, over enunciated consonants and odd tone/inflections) grate on your nerves rather than soothe, there are entirely large chunks of the app that won‚Äôt work for you and absolutely no where but here in a review to comment on it. . . 
The master classes are nice too, but there are not as many of those.
title: Some parts are better than others

review: About two weeks ago the Daily Calm started appearing halfway off to the left of my iPhone screen. I am a subscriber, and my wife uses the app on her iPhone too via Family Sharing, and today the app stopped working on her iPhone altogether. I have a 12 Pro and she has an 11 Pro. Not sure if this problem came with recent iOS updates or new phone model, but it needs to be fixed. Tried deleting and reinstalling-downloading the app on her phone‚Äîsame problem. Calm, please fix these bugs!
title: Bugs

review: I do really like calm. It is a little frustrating how they keep minimizing the lite version of it. There used to be five stories you could listen to without premium, but now there is only one. I mainly use it for background noise (rain, water, etc.) but sometimes I like to hear a story and now it‚Äôs just the same one on repeat. I don‚Äôt use it enough to activate a premium account. So if you use it often and really delve into it, I would recommend a premium account. It is still a nice app to have however just for once in a while uses!
title: Honest Review

review: Tamara hit home with me when she shared her reflection on looking inward when we find ourselves in judgment or being irritated. I identify with always wondering why others aren‚Äôt working as hard as I am, but the reality is, I‚Äôm not giving myself the time to have self care like they are, rather I‚Äôm pushing myself to achieve that ‚Äúsomething‚Äù. I could allow that something to be more self Love. Not a new concept, yet Progress, not perfection have always been my words to live by. Back to the breathe üôè
title: Progress, not perfection

review: Certainly not worth the price. I deleted it during the trial period but didn‚Äôt know I still had to ‚Äúunsubscribe‚Äù, to not get charged. So I got stuck with it. The stories and most of the features are well done, but there‚Äôs no timer to turn it off if I should fall asleep which is the point right? So rather that than use this expensive app I continue to use free podcasts for free because that does have a convenient timer.
title: Disappointed

review: I like this app. It‚Äôs calming, stress relief, but the one problem is that there I too many locks for premium. I got this app, thinking about how I‚Äôm going to end the day, when I saw something that I really needed. But it was premium. ùòñùò¨. ùòïùò∞ùòµ ùòµùò©ùò¢ùòµ ùòÆùò∂ùò§ùò© I said to myself, when I scroll down and EVERYTHING IS PREMIUM! I was upset. I was going to use this app and use it for its meaning. I would recommend this app if you would get premium, but for each type of meditation you only have three or four things that you can use. If they could lower the rate of premium, I would recommend this 100%
title: Nice, calming, but too much premium!

review:
Every morning this year I have begun my day with the daily calm. I have only missed a few days. I truly believe it is working out for my mind every day. Outside of practice it has significantly deepened my ability to focus, to accept, to be calm and to be fully in the present moment.
Some people think the app is pricey. I have to say it is worth every penny. That‚Äôs half the price of a one time 1 hour counseling session.
Thank you for sharing your passion, gifts and beautiful heart with the world Tamara Leavitt!!
- Jodee Huish Art
title: Every Morning

review: I have been a huge fan of calm since I downloaded it months ago but this last week has made me love it even more. I came down with a cold about a week ago. Like a bad one. Coughing uncontrollably, can‚Äôt sleep, tossing and turning, waking up every hour. Then I would turn on calm and I‚Äôd be asleep for the rest of the night!! I have only been able to get sleep during this sickness because of calm. It is the most amazing app and totally worth paying for the upgraded version. Thank you calm!!!!
title: Game changer

review: This is a beautiful app and I think it‚Äôs really well done. However, it‚Äôs been a long time since I have done mindfulness meditations. I‚Äôm currently exploring the possibility of picking it back up regularly but 98% of the features on this app are locked unless you buy the subscription. A trial period with all or more of the features available to decide if this is really something I want to invest in would be really nice. (In all fairness, they have emailed me an offer for a discount but I still have to see if this is something I‚Äôm able to consistently do before I‚Äôm willing to spend that much money on it.)
title: Maybe a trial period?

review:
Trying to set aside time to meditate was a huge challenge before I discovered Calm. Now it is part of my nightly routine. 

What I love is the versatility of this program. There‚Äôs so much from which to choose. Not only can the user practice mindfulness, she can also explore healthy eating tips, exercise routines, and other interesting subjects for children, teens, and adults of all ages. 

Lately I‚Äôve been enjoying the sleep stories to help me ease into sleep. Calm is one of the best self-improvement purchases I‚Äôve ever made.
title: Calm is a Versatile App

review: I have thoroughly searched for another meditation app.  I thought, ‚Äúif this one is my first, and as amazing as it is, what else is there?‚Äù  Nothing.  There‚Äôs no app this amazing!  Calm has changed my life, introduced me to meditation, and taught me how to meditate and self-direct my own meditation.  It‚Äôs a true teacher with gradual release.  When you need guidance, it gives you guidance.  When you need to be alone, it allows you time with yourself for self-guided meditation.  This is the BEST meditation app you will find and rivals that of meditation classes.
title: Best Meditation App

review: New to meditation? Get this app. I downloaded this app (and a few others) as a last ditch effort to help ease my anxiety, depression, and PTSD. WOW! This app blew the competition away and is the only app I use daily now. My mind used to get so busy at night, but this app has helped me learn to slow down and focus on grounding. There are a lot of free options to try out, but I did end up purchasing a subscription because the daily calm + sleep stories are lifesavers (the emergency calm is as well!). Thank you Calm! You rock.
title: Helped Me Through so Mucj

developerResponse: {'id': 5750167, 'body': "Hi Nekole16, I'm sorry for the trouble! For a student discount, please check out www.calm.com/studentdiscount.", 'modified': '2018-10-31T22:55:26Z'}
review: This app has really helped me with the stress and anxiety that comes with being a student. When considering the upgraded version I was almost certain I would purchase it.... until seeing the price of course. But the price isn‚Äôt the worst thing, it‚Äôs the fact that this app is demanding it all at once which can be rough for college students. We are filled with stress and anxiety about economics and finances until we find a simple remedy, but are quickly reminded again about these hardships when that remedy is posed as an arm and a leg to some of us. Yes of course it is worth it, but accessible monthly subscriptions may be a better price to advertise than yearly.
title: Upfront Subscription Cost

developerResponse: {'id': 3558492, 'body': "Hi there, I'm so sorry to hear you've had trouble with the app! We definitely hear your feedback regarding resetting the multi-day series and we are working on implementing this feature. Reach out to support@calm.com and we'd love to hear more of your feedback!", 'modified': '2018-05-22T21:57:02Z'}
review:
Once you have finished a session, it is impossible to go back and repeat unless you manually keep track of what day you are on. It should be a simple thing to just reset the session but no. This appears to be beyond the capabilities of the Calm app people. If you don't remember you are in day 16 of the 21 days of calm, too bad. It's up to you to keep track of what session you are on. Ridiculous.

UPDATE

These app guys could screw up a two car parade. They can't do a simple reset on a completed program and now they have to gussie it up so the whole thing is a confusing mess, assuming you are even able to get it to work. Best advice is to listen to a headspace session before trying to wrestle with the Calm app.

UPDATE

Get the free OAK app from Kevin Rose. It is free and the breathing exercises are great. I like the voiceover in calm because it explains a lot but that‚Äôs headwork not meditation. They should start with a five minute intro followed by 10 minutes of meditation without the incessant talking.

Wait. A year later i just heard back from Calm Support. They are sorry (true). Great customer support. Great.
title: The App is for C**p

review: I've been using this app for about a year now and it was everything I was searching for when I first downloaded it. I plan to use this app for years to come, it's truly helped me make permanent changes in my life even for a simple 15 minutes a day. Plus they have sleep stories, which are fun and a great ways for me to find my center when I'm sleeping in new places or out on the road! I would and have already recommended this app to most of my friends and family!
title: Perfect for first timers

review: For years I had been searching for some form of teaching tool to help me learn how to meditate successfully without any luck.  I happened to learn about CALM quite accidentally and gave it a try not expecting much.  Thankfully I was very wrong. There are a wide variety of sessions to choose from depending on what you need or want to focus on on any given day and I find them to be very helpful in giving me insight and yes, a sense of daily calm.  I highly recommend trying this app.
title: The meditation guide I have been searching for

review: I have had this app for a couple years and I use this app everyday, at least once. There are great meditations to learn, to start my day (with Jay, Tamera, Jeff Warren, and probably others). There are also aids to sleep: sleep stories and sleep meditations (my latest life hack). The content in this app is deeper than wherever I am at. Oh, and also, there is even a portion on body movement (yoga-type) by Mel Mah. Totally worth what I pay. It changes me for the better when I do this.
title: Life Changer

review: I have been using the Calm app for several years and purchased a lifetime membership. It is the best gift I‚Äôve given myself. Rarely a day goes by without doing the Daily Calm, which feels like a good friend. There is so much fantastic content from meditations to movement to sleep stories to music. I use the app several times through the day. It is helping me learn to be more present, navigate emotions, weather difficult situations, and transform old habits.
title: Constant companion

review: This has truly become arguably my favorite app and I cannot express it enough. I never write reviews but in a time that you may need help and don‚Äôt know where to go, I personally feel like I have someone out there who is listening and actively helping my mind get to a better state. Thank you to whoever first decided the app should exist, and to all the creators who‚Äôs work is truly helping people live a better life.
title: Calm really has improved my life.

review: I have been using this app for several years and loved it but in the last few months there have been changes that have brought this app down.   There are way too many children‚Äôs stories that have been added and more than a few excellent adult stories taken away.   More than a few favorites are no longer available.  Also gone is the helpful feature of searching stories by favorite speakers which made finding a favorite quick and easy.   Needless to say, after regularly using this app at night for several years, I will not be renewing.
title: Used to be a great app

review: I‚Äôve battled anxiety & depression for over 30 yrs. I‚Äôve been to doctors, therapists, read books, listened to self help cd‚Äôs, tried several medications and done procedures such as biofeedback. Nothing has calmed me as quickly as this app!!! I heard about it watching Netflix ‚Äúexplained‚Äù series, the episode on mindfulness. I‚Äôve only done 2 sessions and I‚Äôm just amazed how quickly it works! Wonderful!!! My only complaint is it‚Äôs taken me so long to discover!
title: Where has this been all my life?!

review: I love the Harry Styles Dream with me sleepcast. His voice is warm and calming. His story is relaxing and feels like he‚Äôs there for you and with you in a happy and soothing place. Like you‚Äôre strolling peacefully on the shore under the stars holding his hand.  The mention of the stars always being above you is a meditative place you can always go to. The waves on the shore keep you asleep. I have yet to hear the inbetween part since I always fall asleep. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs wonderful.
title: Harry styles dream with me sleepcast review

review: I work in a very busy emergency room and I am now taking care of the mass influx of critically ill patients during the COVID pandemic.  This  has made me so anxious.  I started having trouble sleeping and my stress has lead to an increase in weight.   This app had helped me tremendously!!!  I have learned how to meditate and relax.  The masterclasses are wonderful and I use the music to help me sleep.   Thank you, thank you, thank you.   I plan on renewing my subscription every year!!!!
title: This Has Changed My Outlook

review:
I woke up this morning earlier than usual.  I had recently re-discovered a book that seemed to appear out of nowhere. It‚Äôs called ‚ÄúRediscover Jesus‚Äù.  I began to read it last night, being directed to read 1 chapter a day.
I listened to my Calm this am and then read another chapter.  I feel more relaxed than I normally do .  I usually work up each morning filled with fear and severe depression.  I hope that today is the beginning of something better for me
title: Peace

review:
While I‚Äôm very grateful to have added Calm to my daily routine, for the money, I wish there weren‚Äôt so many repeats.  It‚Äôs one of the more expensive apps and, as I near my third year of membership and if original content is added, then I will definitely cancel.  

I‚Äôm giving it Four Stars, because I do appreciate the Calm it provides, the daily intentions and the quality of content is excellent.
title: Glad I‚Äôve added Calm to my life, but it needs new content

review:
But I can assuredly say that because of this app my life has markedly improved in sleep, motivation, focus, and happiness. Been using for a week. 
I love the utility and variability of the kinds of features for meditating, sleeping, lowering anxiety, etc. The stories are excellent with lovely voices and takes. Cillian Murphy on a train in Ireland. Tamika Brown in an apple orchard. The ability to sleep  the phone while using the app is probably it‚Äôs best feature. 
5 out of 5 (so far)
title: I usually don‚Äôt write reviews

review: I‚Äôve heard many great things about this app and was excited to try it. The one free meditation I tried was great, and when I saw they were offering 60% off the lifetime subscription I decided to go for it. Unfortunately the payment would not process. I talked to my bank who assured me something wasn‚Äôt set up right on Calm‚Äôs end. Calm assured me it was my bank. The app was good, but not so much so that the run around is worth it. App deleted.
title: Unable to process payment

review:
I have been having a lot of night struggles when I saw this app which my aunt recommended for me and then after all the reading after bedtime I open up the app and feel relaxed when it doesn‚Äôt help I listen to two or three song every time I wake up I feel so fresh that I never ever sleep through out the day I tried lavender in my room but it did not work if your having night struggles I highly recommend this for you and sleep well remember:SLEEP IS IMPORTANT BECAUSE OF COVID-19
Bye
title: Totally worth it

review: This app is amazing, I‚Äôve enjoyed it for the past couple weeks, but.. I‚Äôve hated the fact they‚Äôve put every single calming song or sleep or anything else locked. It‚Äôs been on my nerves for awhile and I hope for some to get unlocked. Almost everything is locked, I wanna reduce my stress and anxiety, but half of the anxiety plains that I believe that will help me is locked. I do think there is too much Tamara & she talks too much in the Daily Calm & the 7 day series she writes & narrates. I prefer longer periods of silence when I meditate & pull out my earbuds if she‚Äôs interrupting too much.

I know that it's all well and good for you because you are profiting from it, but I'm too young to pay for it and it really is annoying. Please please please please please please please please please please please please please please can you make more of it not premium? title: Unfair
